Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistani media passes off photo of Indian ‘rape jihad’ accused as Afghan teen rapist
Body: Several renowned Pakistani news outlets published a photo of a middle-aged man to claim that an Indian tourist named Deep Desai raped a 15-year-old Afghan girl in Kabul on December 28, 2020. The reports termed Desai as Indian ringleader of a group involved in raping and filming of minor Afghan girl. He has been arrested by Afghan police, reports stated. Among those reporting this include 24NewsHD, Dunya News, TVI.com.PK, etc. Several videos on YouTube also made the same claim using the same photo of the man.

Header: FACT CHECK: Man passed off as ‘bhakt’ for waving Indian flag at Capitol Hill found to be Shashi Tharoor fan
Body: One of the men who waved Indian flag at the Capitol Hill siege by pro-Trump mob on Wednesday, has been passed off as 'bhakt' (a pejorative term used by anti-BJP people to describe those who support Prime Minister Narendra Modi) by a section of social media users. A Twitter handle by the name of âHindutva Watchâ put out three images, two of which showed the same guy with Indian flag apparently posing outside Capitol Hill, and the third image showed a man waving both the saffron flag and the US flag. The tweet elicited a lot of responses, with many passing off the men in the pictures as âbhaktsâ. I can safely say these people are Modi bhakts too https://t.co/XWoCJqAbDx— Abhinaw Khatiwara (@hueren_abhi) 1610070845000Another user described the men as âbloody casteist Indiansâ, âbrahmin savarana casteistsâ, âwannabe whitesâ, etc. One user referred to the men as â Hindutva riotersâ An handle by the name of India Resists, referred to the men holding Indian and saffron flag as â RSS thugsâ

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral National Geographic cover on farmers' protest is fake
Body: An image of a turban-welding Sikh man on a magazine cover is being circulated on social media with a claim that it is the official cover of the 'Winter 2020' edition of the National Geographic magazine. This magazine cover is being used to claim that National Geographicâs cover story features the ongoing farmersâ protests in North India. The cover bears headlines like 'Farmers feed the poor at Delhi borders', 'Experts say Punjab will be a desert in 15-20 years', 'When injustice becomes law resistance becomes duty', etc. It is being shared with a tagline that reads 'The largest protest in history is happening now and it is not being televised'. Some are using the cover to attack BJP and its supporters. Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo viral as Pakistanis running ‘Mandir Banao’ campaign in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
Body: A photo of some men showcasing banners and posters with âMandir Banaoâ written on it is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that Muslims in Pakistan are demanding reconstruction of the temple recently destroyed by bigots in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) province. The photo shows a man posing behind a âMandir Banaoâ banner holding a placard displaying Mohammad Ali Jinnahâs photo in his hands.   The photo has been posted by many on Facebook with this claim.   It has also been shared on microblogging platform Twitter. The photo is being used to claim that there is no Hinduphobia in Pakistan. We need to understand the difference between "Mandir wahi banega" and "Mandir banao". Header: FAKE ALERT: Morphed 'CNN bulletin' shared to claim Covid-19 vaccine making patients eat each other
Body: A news bulletin graphic carrying the logo of US-based media company CNN is being circulated on social media to claim that coronavirus patients are eating each other after being administered Covid-19 vaccine. The bulletin image carries a 'Breaking News' ticker that reads âHospitals on lockdown as first covid vaccine patients start eating other patients (sic)â. This ticker is accompanied by visuals of a hospital ward in complete disarray with blood scattered everywhere on the floor. Header: FAKE ALERT: Dubai’s Palm Jumeirah passed off as Varanasi’s riverside
Body: Aerial photo of what appears to be a posh island with highrises and lavish roads is being shared with the claim that it is the âbeautiful viewâ of Varanasi on the banks of river Ganga.   Some Facebook users posted the photo to claim that anti-nationals would call it some foreign country and not Varanasi.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Accidental firing passed off as Muslim woman shot by Delhi cop
Body: A video of what appears to be a street brawl is being shared with a claim that a Delhi Police official shot a Muslim woman after her son grazed his car. In the video, one can see a man in police uniform engaged in a heated argument with a group of people, when he suddenly fires his pistol that hits a woman on her foot. The woman immediately starts screaming in pain, as the men accompanying her start dealing blows to the cop. Later, the injured woman is taken away on a two-wheeler by two men. AIMIM worker Rifat Zaidi posted the video on Facebook accusing Delhi police of dispalying cruelty towards Muslim woman.   Many other Facebook users shared the video with the same claim.

Body: Video of a Sikh family praising PM Narendra Modi is being shared in context of ongoing farmer protests in the country. "We may not have the power of China and the US. We may not have medical expertise like Italy. Header: FAKE ALERT: 2017 photo of Punjab CM meeting Ambani shared amid farmer protests
Body: An image of Punjab CM Captain Amrinder Singh meeting Reliance Industries chairperson Mukesh Ambani is being widely circulated on social media, in the backdrop of ongoing farmer protests in India. The photo is being used to allege that Singh met Ambani just a day before Bharat Bandh was held. The purpose of the meet was to seek investment for developmental work in Punjab.   A video of Singhâs meeting with Ambani is also being shared to claim that the Punjab CM sought investment in farming projects from the Reliance chief, while Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is opposing farm bills in Delhi. So CM @capt_amarinder met #Ambani to develop and investment in farming for punjab but now @RahulGandhi is opposingâ¦ https://t.co/uKbZheGMS5— Dev Gaur (@devkrgaur) 160759019500

Body: A photo of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau, sitting with a congregation of Sikhs, is being shared across social media platforms with the claim that he is supporting Indian farmers by sitting on protests against the recently passed farm bill. In this photo, Trudeau can be seen sporting a red patka (sacred head covering worn by Sikh men). The photo is being shared by several influential Facebook pages and groups. Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress uses photo from Bangladesh to accuse BJP of 'increasing poverty'
Body: The official social media profiles of Congress put out a graphic card to attack the BJP government on economic issues in India. The graphic had an image of a poor young boy working in what appeared to be a brick factory. The text superimposed on this image had Congress claiming that over seven crore kids were under financial duress due to the impact Covid-19 is having on Indian economy. Header: FAKE ALERT: Kamala Harris hasn't attacked Indian government on farmers’ stir, fake tweet viral
Body: Screengrab of a tweet purportedly from United States Vice President-elect Kamala Harris is being shared to claim that she is the latest world leader to show her support for the farmersâ stir in India. âWe are shocked to see the Indian governmentâs suppression of farmers protesting new laws which will endanger their livelihood. Instead of using water cannons and tear gas, the Indian government needs to engage in open dialogue with farmers,â reads the tweet attributed to Harris. The screengrab is going viral on Facebook with several influential pages sharing it.

Header: FACT CHECK: Is Joe Biden kneeling before George Floyd’s daughter in this viral photo?
Body: Photo of US President-elect Joe Biden kneeling in front of a kid is being shared with a claim that he publicly apologized to the daughter of George Floyd, a 46-year-old black man, who was killed on May 25, 2020 in Minneapolis, Minnesota by a white police officer Derek Chauvin. Nigerian senator Dino Melaye posted this picture calling Chauvin a racist white American. Header: FACT CHECK: Youth Congress uses old photos to tweet on farmers protest
Body: The official Twitter account of the youth wing of the Indian National Congress (IYC) tweeted four images to attack Indian government for mistreating farmers agitating on streets. India can never forgive the govt who treats those who feed this nation like terrorists.#FarmersProtest https://t.co/uMObiNtYgh— Youth Congress (@IYC) 1606374256000Two of the photos used by IYC showed water cannons and barricades being deployed by the police to disperse protesters from gathering. The third photo showed an unidentified dead man, while the fourth one showed a large number of people on the streets.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared to claim ‘Muslims not allowed to pray in France’
Body: An over four-minute-long video is being shared on social media with a claim that Muslims in France were hindered from praying by locals. In the video, one can see thousands of Muslims blocking and occupying streets to pray while locals around them protest with placards and French flags.   The video infuriated Muslims in India, who complained that disturbing Muslims while they are praying is not freedom of expression. Another user said that Allah will eventually punish those who obstruct Muslims.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared to claim Muslims in Chechnya protested against France
Body: After French teacher Samuel Paty was beheaded by an extremist Muslim for showing cartoons of Muhammad (founder of Islam) in class, France president Emmanuel Macron described it an act of Islamic terrorism. These remarks by Macron irked many fanatic Muslims across the world, who took to social media to demand a boycott of France and its products. Amidst all this, Princess Hend Al Qassimi, a member of the royal family of United Arab Emirates, tweeted a video via her verified handle, that showed aerial view of a huge crowd. She used that video to claim that Muslims in Chechnya (Russia) united to sing in defense of Muhammad. Labelling Macron as an âIslamophobeâ, she claimed that Muslims protested against him and he'll be sent to hell for what he said. Header: FACT CHECK: Are all top 5 rank holders of 2020 NEET exam Muslims?
Body: Last week, the National Testing Agency (NTA) declared NEET (UG) 2020 exam results. Odisha's Soyeb Aftab scored a perfect 720/720 and was ranked as the topper. After this, a message started doing the rounds on social media platforms that all top five rank holders of the exam are Muslims. As per the message posted by Facebook page Andhra Muslims, the top five rankers are Soyeb Aftab, Zeeshan Ashraf, Yasir Hameed, Sajid Mehmood and Sana Mir. The insinuation (based on the names) being that all top five rank holders were Muslims. Body: A graphic card featuring actor-turned BJP MP Kirron Kher is being shared to claim that she said ârape is part of Indian culture and traditionâ and that it canât be stopped. Facebook user Saqib Ghias Khan shared the graphic card attributing the aforementioned remark to Kher.   The graphic card carries the logo of serial fake news peddling Facebook page âViral in Indiaâ busted by Times Fact Check in 2018. Fake alert: Beware of serial faker âViral in Indiaâ

Header: FAKE ALERT: Woman kicked by police in this video is not Hathras victim's mother
Body: A disturbing video is getting circulated on instant messaging platform WhatsApp with a claim that mother of young Dalit woman, who was allegedly gangraped and murdered in Uttar Pradesh's (UP) Hathras, was mercilessly kicked by a police official. In the video, one can see a woman begging with folded hands when a cop suddenly kicks her. The video-message is being shared in Malayalam language. Using Google Translate, we translated the text in the message, according to which, Hathras victim's family was taken into custody by police before her cremation and when the mother of the victim protested this move and pleaded with authorities to let her see her daughter for the one last time, she was brutally thrashed by cops. We found the video was being shared on Facebook with similar claims in English.

Header: FACT CHECK: Video from Greece shared as cruise service started by PM in Gujarat
Body: Twitter user Renuka Jain put out a video showing a huge cruiser ship sailing through a narrow canal to claim that it is from Gujarat's Bhavnagar. She claimed that this service was started by PM to reduce the travel distance between Bhavnagar and Bharuch Road from 350 km to 32 km. "Distance between Bhavnagar and Bharuch road is 350 km. But while traversing through sea, it is 32 km. Therefore, PM has started a cruise service on this sea route. The cruise has a huge capacity and can carry 50 trucks, 60 buses, 200 cars, 350 motorbikes and 600 people in one and go and covers the entire distance in just half an hour," reads the tweet by Jain. à¤­à¤¾à¤µà¤¨à¤à¤° à¤¸à¥ à¤­à¤°à¥à¤ à¤°à¥à¤¡ à¤à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥ à¤¹à¥ 350 à¤à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤®à¥à¤à¤° , à¤à¤° à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥ à¤¹à¥ 32 à¤à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤®à¥à¤à¤°, à¤à¤° à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/sHUEV3KgNP— #RenukaJain (@RenukaJain6) 160126841100

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old, unrelated images passed off as recent farmer protests
Body: Several images are being circulated on social media to claim that they show the recent protests held by farmers against the new agriculture bills passed by voice vote in Rajya Sabha. These images are being posted on several social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Images 1 &2This is cruelð¡BJP & its pro-corporate agenda is treating Indian farmers like terrorists ð¤¦ð¾ââï¸I've no hesitationâ¦ https://t.co/QbSxU41cbU— É±á´á´ÉªÊð¹ (@ComradeMukil) 1601017126000These images are being used to attack the BJP government and shared with hashtags #AntiFarmerBJP and #BharatBandh. TRUTH, VERIFICATION AND METHODOLOGYBoth the images are old and from 2018. Running reverse-image search on both the images, we found a post from Countercurrents.org dated October 2, 2018 carrying both of them. Titled âPolice Brutally Stop Farmerâs March To Delhi; Many Injuredâ, the images showed police using tear gas and water cannons to disperse a farmersâ march led by Bhartiya Kisan Union on the outskirts of Delhi. Many farmers were injured as a result. The protesting farmers were coming to the capital with several demands including farm loan-waiver, friendly crop insurance and support for small and marginal farmers and to implement recommendations of the Swaminathan Commission. Image 3This image shows some sikh men blocking railway tracks. TRUTH, VERIFICATION AND METHODOLOGYThe image is from 2015. Using reverse-image search, we found a Hindi news post from NaiDunia dated October 7, 2015 carrying the same photo. The photo shows unhappy farmers in Punjab blocking railway-tracks due to pesticide procurement scam and non-compensation for the wasted crop. Image 4The image is being shared with a claim that farmers in Delhi are occupying highways.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo from Myanmar shared to claim every Rohingya couple in Jammu has 10 kids
Body: Screengrab of a tweet is being circulated on instant messaging app WhatsApp to claim that every couple in Rohingya colonies in Jammu is producing 10-12 kids. The tweet carries a photo that shows a number of kids surrounding a man with a stick in hand. A Times Fact Check reader sent the screengrab to us on our WhatsApp number to know if the claim in it was authentic. Some Facebook pages also posted the same screenshot.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, CM Yogi never said ‘rape dead Muslim women’, TMC’s Abhishek Banerjee lied
Body: A video has been doing the rounds where West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjeeâs nephew Abhishek Banerjee claims than Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that he would take dead bodies of Muslim women out from their graves and rape them. We can see Bollywood actor Swara Bhaskar sitting in the panel and applauding Banerjee. The TMC leader makes those remarks in his bid to attack Kashmiri activist Sushil Pandit, who is also in the panel. Banerjeeâs clip is being shared by social media users. Video can be watched here. Several news portals like The London Post too claimed that Yogi made that remark.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leaders circulate 2013 image to claim farmers agitating over farm bills
Body: Several Congress leaders and affiliated accounts posted an image that showed an old man, armed with a stick and aiming a brick at a gun-wielding policeman. Using hashtags like #kishanVirodhiNarendraModi, these leaders implied that the photo was clicked recently during a farmerâs protest. These posts were tweeted after there was an uproar in parliament while passing three agriculture related bills. The three bills that were passed are the Farmers' Produce Trade and Commerce (Promotion and Facilitation) Bill, Farmers (Empowerment and Protection) Agreement on Price Assurance and Farm Services Bill and Essential Commodities (Amendment) Bill. Congress leaders Archana Dalmia and Satveer Choudhary, official handle of Mumbai Youth Congress, etc were among those who tweeted this photo with the same caption. à¤®à¤¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¯à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤®à¥à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤..!à¤®à¥à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤à¤¹ à¤¯à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤¶à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤..! https://t.co/4M4oL6sGvd— Archana Dalmia (@ArchanaDalmia) 1600579466000à¤®à¤¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¯à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤®à¥à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤..!à¤®à¥à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤à¤¹ à¤¯à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤¶à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤..!â¦ https://t.co/yLZBVFN9Wd— Satveer Choudhary (@SatveerINC) 1600596337000à¤®à¤¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¯à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤®à¥à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤,à¤®à¥à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤µà¤à¤¹ à¤¯à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤¿ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤¶à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤.â¦ https://t.co/Xj76uzt1l6— MumbaiYouthCongress (@IYC_Mumbai) 160058242100

Body: The official Twitter account of Madhya Pradesh (MP) Congress put out a video clip to claim that the general public of the state cheered for former CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath in presence of current CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. à¤®à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤¶ à¤à¤ªà¤à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤µ à¤à¤¾ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤£à¤¾à¤® à¤à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤:à¤®à¤à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤° à¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤°à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¹à¥à¤à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ à¤¶à¤¿à¤µà¤°à¤¾à¤ à¤¸à¤¿à¤à¤¹ à¤à¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¨à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¿ à¤®à¥â¦ https://t.co/NOZCggJ2KM— MP Congress (@INCMP) 1600615478000As per the audio of this clip tweeted by MP Congress, when Chouhan asks the crowd in a rally as to who they prefer as state CM, the crowd says âKamal Nathâ. âMP bypoll results out. In Mandsaur's Suwasra, when CM Chouhan asked people in a rally who they prefer more as the state CM, they all relied in unison "Kamal Nath". People in MP are with Nath,â read the tweet of MP Congress accompanying this video clip.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Journalists use old Amul cartoon on Urmila to accuse it of working for BJP IT cell
Body: War of words ensued between Bollywood actresses Kangana Ranaut and Urmila Matondkar after the latter referred to Manikarnika star as a ârudaaliâ, a word used to describe lower caste women in Rajasthan, who are hired as professional mourners upon the death of upper-caste males. Following this, Kangana called the now Congress leader Urmila a âsoft porn starâ in an interview with Navika Kumar on Times Now. Amidst all of this, many Twitter users, including some prominent journalists shared an Amul cartoon on Urmila to accuse the dairy giant of working for the BJP IT cell. In the cartoon, Urmila can be seen in a red dress with a plunging neckline. The cartoon is captioned as âNot MASOOM anymore?â and âÃmul Rangeela Makhanâ in a direct reference to Urmilaâs blockbuster Hindi film Rangeela. She also featured as a child artiste in critically-acclaimed Masoom. Columnist Swati Chaturvedi, who writes for NDTV and Gulf News, posted the cartoon, calling it disgusting. She further alleged that Amul works for BJP IT cell. Another journalist Mrinal Pande quoted Chaturvediâs tweet to shame brand Amul. à¤¥à¥à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤­à¥ à¤¶à¤°à¥à¤® à¤¬à¤à¥ à¤¹à¥, à¤¤à¥ à¤¡à¥à¤¬ à¤®à¤°à¥ à¤à¤®à¥à¤² ! à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤®à¤¦à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤à¥ à¤®à¤¹à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤ à¤à¥ à¤®à¤¦à¤¦ à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¤¹à¤à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤à¥à¤§à¤à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤¤à¤¿ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¨à¤â¦ https://t.co/97JHrGyazR— Mrinal Pande (@MrinalPande1) 160041141900

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Indian Army’s ‘Muslim regiment’ refuse to fight against Pakistan in 1965 war?
Body: Several social media users are sharing posts claiming that Indian Army had a âMuslim regimentâ, which refused to fight against Pakistan during the 1965 war. Users are making this claim to drive home their point that Muslims cannot serve India with neutrality after becoming IAS and IPS officers.

Body: A photo of actress Kangana Ranaut posing with a man in a bar is being shared on social media with a claim that the man seen with her is underworld don and 1993 Mumbai bombings convict Abu Salem. Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistanis share photo of 2018 IAF helicopter crash as recent one
Body: Zaid Hamid, famous in Pakistan for Anti-Hindu and Anti-Jewish commentary, put out photo of a crashed chopper on Twitter to claim that an Indian Air Force (IAF) MI-17 helicopter crashed in Ladakh. Habitual fake news peddling account Irmak Idoya too tweeted the same photo to claim the same. Today, Indian MI 17 Helicopter has crashed in Ladakh. https://t.co/p4dQSCwZ8u— Irmak Idoya à¤à¤°à¤®à¤ à¤à¤¡à¥à¤¯à¤¾ð³ðµ (@Irmaknepal) 1600015131000Pakistani journalist Mubasher Lucman also posted the same photo showing wreckage of a MI-17 chopper to imply that an IAF helicopter crashed recently in Ladakh. Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral video of missile exploding on a soldier’s shoulder is from Russia, not China
Body: A video going viral on social media shows a man in army uniform failing to launch a rocket as it unexpectedly changes its direction and explodes on his shoulder. The video is being shared with a claim that it shows a Chinese soldier in action. Facebook page ModiNama posted the video taking a dig at the âinferiorâ quality of Chinese weapons.   Other Facebook users too posted the same video with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photos shared to claim ‘China has attacked India and injured 158 soldiers’
Body: Amid growing military tensions between India and China in Ladakh region, screengrab of a Facebook post is being circulated on WhatsApp. The Facebook post contains three photos shared with a caption that claims that China has attacked India and injured 158 of our soldiers. Two of these photos show military vehicles that have caught fire, while the third photo shows some armymen carrying injured soldiers. Times Fact Check also received this message as a forward from a reader on its WhatsApp number. The reader wanted to know its authenticity.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Ministry of Defence calls media reports of villages being vacated in Arunachal Pradesh fake
Body: Amid growing tension between Indian and Chinese forces at Ladakh, several media portals reported that villagers near the McMohan Line in Tawang, Arunachal Pradesh have vacated their village. Among those making this claims are news portals East Mojo and HW English. As per their reports, Taksang village, situated almost 30-km away from Zemithang circle in Tawang district of Arunachal Pradesh, was vacated by the villagers recently.

Header: FACT CHECK: This mosque in the middle of a road is from MP and not Mumbai
Body: Angry over BMC bulldozing actor Kangana Ranautâs office, many social media users are sharing photos of âillegally constructedâ structures lamenting lack of action against them. One such Facebook user âVirat Hinduâ posted an image of a mosque situated bang in the middle of the road to claim that there were over 200 illegal mosques in Mumbai. âThere are thousands of Islamic shrines right in the middle of a road but BMC found only Kanganaâs office illegally constructed,â the user wrote.   Same image of the mosque was shared on Twitter as well by users who claimed that it was located in Mumbaiâs Bandra. à¤¬à¤¾à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤®à¥ à¤°à¥à¤¡ à¤ªà¤° à¤¬à¤¨à¥ à¤¯à¤¹ à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¦ à¤à¥à¤°à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¥ à¤¨à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥??ð¡ à¤ªà¥à¤à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ @rautsanjay61 @OfficeofUT @CMOMaharashtraâ¦ https://t.co/h4ZtKK2Ymk— à¤µà¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤² à¤¦à¥à¤¸à¤¾à¤ (à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥)#à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¤ à¤¸à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ð©ð© (@VipulRabari19) 159970321700

Header: FAKE ALERT: This is not the actual visual of Gulshan Kumar’s assassination
Body: A Facebook user posted an image of a man being assaulted by two gun-wielding men to claim it is the actual visual of the music baron and founder of music label T-Series, Gulshan Kumar, being murdered in broad daylight on August 12, 1997 in Mumbai. The user claimed that he was murdered while he was praying in a temple.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from AP shared to claim Hindu woman molested in Kerala
Body: Facebook user by the name of Dipti Sahu posted a video in which a woman can be seen getting sexually molested by a group of men. The woman can be heard screaming as her clothes get torn off by men. The user has claimed that the video is from Kerala where Hindu women are regularly targeted. The same video was posted on Twitter as well by many with the similar claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared as Indian soldiers celebrating after entering 4 km across LAC
Body: Video of a group of soldiers dancing is being shared with the claim that Indian soldiers erupted in celebrations after entering 4 km into LAC at India-China border. Several Facebook pages and users shared the same video with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 10-year-old girl’s marriage to 40-year-old Tariq in Pakistan shared to attack Hinduism
Body: Twitter user Mahtab Raza posted a photo of a minor girl sitting in a bridal outfit with a much older man to claim that the 10-year-old girl was forcefully married to 40-year-old Shivnath Chaturvedi, cousin of her late father Ashok Chaturvedi. âShame on Hindus. Shame on the pandit who presided over the marriage rituals. Shame on those people who attended and ate at this ceremony. Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of former Congress MLA shared to claim Hindu woman beaten by her Muslim husband
Body: Facebook user Dinesh Singh posted an image to claim that a Hindu woman in Assam left her husband to marry and elope with a Muslim man Zakir Hussain and now she was being beaten by him. The photo shared by Singh is divided into two halves. The first half shows a happy-looking couple posing together, while the second half shows the same woman with bruises on her face.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Muslims did not conduct last rites of a 'Hindu doctor' who died due to covid-19
Body: Several Facebook users posted a photo that shows a group of Muslims taking out funeral procession of a Hindu. Sharing that photo, users claimed Muslims in Pune performed last rites of a Hindu doctor Ramakant Joshi who died after contracting coronavirus. Users claimed that these Muslims belonged to Tablighi Jamaat. They immediately stopped their work of Islamic preaching and arranged for the funeral of Hindu doctor, a post by Mohd Jilani stated.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photos falsely passed off as flooded NEET/JEE exam centers
Body: A Twitter user called Janvi, in reply to a tweet by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, posted four images of flooded areas to claim that this is the condition of examination centers where the government wishes to conduct NEET/JEE exams. Janviâs tweet was in reply to a tweet, where Gandhi put out a video and alleged that âfailures of governmentâ were compromising safety of NEET/JEE aspirants. @RahulGandhi This is the condition of examination centres and govt. wants to conduct exam'sâ¦ https://t.co/tWU7nCdQs4— janvi 1234 (@chandrikaLpate1) 159860148700

Accusing the BJP government at the centre of taking student lives, Lamba claimed that 5371 students who took part in the COMEDK exam tested positive for coronavirus whereas 8456 students were quarantined. Header: FAKE ALERT: 2016 image of slit-wrist shared to claim students are committing suicide over NEET, JEE exams
Body: A Twitter user by the name of Ananya Singh posted an image of a slit-wrist with blood oozing out of it to insinuate she has harmed herself because of non-postponement of upcoming NEET and JEE exams dates. Tagging actor Sonu Sood, she sought help using hashtag #PostponeJEE_NEETinCOVID.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2013 photo of PM Modi shared to target him for chilling amidst pandemic
Body: Singer Caralisa Monteiro posted a photo of PM Narendra Modi in which he can be seen sitting calmly in a lawn, reading a newspaper, with white pekin ducks in the background. Monteiro used that photo to attack the PM for relaxing and posing during a pandemic. âThe talent to read two books, a newspaper and the laptop simultaneously while posing for the perfect photograph. And that poise during a Pandemic. Impressed. (sic),â Monteiro tweeted. The talent to read two books, a newspaper and the laptop simultaneously while posing for the perfect photograph.â¦ https://t.co/ZMxmxMLz6K— Caralisa Monteiro (@runcaralisarun) 159838817500

Header: FAKE ALERT: Indian model Zoya Shaikh’s photo shared as teacher suspended in Lahore for ‘sexy-figure’
Body: A dubious news website by the name of âRepublic of Buzzâ published a report titled âTeacher suspended for having âsexy-figureâ: Lahoreâ to claim that a 30-year-old woman working as a teacher in a Lahore school lost her for being âtoo sexyâ. As per the report, Aasia Zubair, a married woman with two children was fired from her teaching position on August 11, 2020 as the administration accused her of being âtoo sexyâ to teach students of secondary education. The report posted an image of a woman in salwar-kameez insinuating her to be Aasia Zubair. The report also posted a screengrab of a tweet purportedly from Zubairâs account, where she highlights her plight. âSo Apparently I received a termination letter from my school administrator stating that my body is too âfitâ or âeroticâ for me to teach classes of the secondary education students. We usually We wear decent shalwar kameez with dupatta at our school & Iâve know idea what else they wanted from me? Ridiculous #TooSexyToWorkSoFired (sic),â reads the screengrab of the tweet from handle @Aasiazubair908. Many Twitter users posted screengrabs and links to this report. Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of sewage-laden road in Delhi passed off as that from BJP-ruled Varanasi
Body: Photo of a poorly dug, sewage-laden road is being circulated on social media platform Facebook with a claim that it is from Varanasi. The photo is being shared in an attempt to take a dig at BJPâs governance in Varanasi. âVaranasi being turned into London by BJP,â reads the caption on this photo. It should be noted that Varanasi is PM Modiâs Lok Sabha constituency, besides coming under the BJP-ruled Uttar Pradesh state.

Header: FAKE ALERT: ‘Fighting BJP agents in court’, tweet from Prashant Bhushan’s fake account goes viral
Body: After activist-advocate Prashant Bhushan refused to apologize to the Supreme Court (SC) to avert punishment for his conviction for contempt or court, a controversial tweet has surfaced in his name on the micro-blogging platform. A loose translation of this tweet made from an account in the name of âPrashant Bhushanâ reads, âMy fight is not with the SC. It is with the BJP agents inside the court. Need your support in this fight, are you with me?â. This account @p_bhushan11 is followed by many Congress leaders. Many followers of this account believe it to be the official handle of Bhushan.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Punya Prasun Bajpai makes false claim of SC altering its motto, realizes mistake later
Body: Journalist Punya Prasun Bajpai put out a tweet claiming that the Supreme Court (SC) of India has changed its motto from âSatyameva Jayateâ (truth alone triumphs) to âYato Dharma Tato Jayaâ (where there is dharma, there will be victory). Bajpai posted two photos to make this claim. These photos were picked up by several other Twitter users who used them to make the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Modi bowing in front of Nehru’s statue is doctored
Body: Photo of PM Narendra Modi bowing in front of Indiaâs first PM Jawaharlal Nehruâs statue is doing the rounds on social networking platform Facebook. Congress-supporting pages and other users are posting this photo to take a dig at PM Modi by claiming that he has finally realized the greatness of Nehru.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Mahesh Bhatt shared to claim he’s angry over dislikes on Sadak 2 trailer
Body: A Twitter handle by the name of @iArmySupporter posted a video of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt in which he is screaming with anger. The user tweeted that video to claim that Bhatt was miffed over one crore plus dislikes his newly directed film Sadak 2 received on YouTube. Header: FAKE ALERT: Soldier who passed away due to cancer falsely linked to Galwan Valley clash
Body: Several leading media outlets published news reports linking the death of army soldier Late Havaldar Bishan Singh to the Galwan Valley clash between Indian and Chinese forces. The reports claimed that Singh was injured during the clash that happened on June 15, 2020 and he recently succumbed to his injuries. Based on these media reports, several social media users too posted about Singh, paying respects to the soldier.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored image of CM Yogi with a plate of meat goes viral
Body: Photo of Uttar Pradesh (UP) CM Yogi Adityanath sitting with a plate full of meat on his side is being circulated on social media platform Facebook. The photo is being used to insinuate that Yogi consumes meat. A Facebook user by the name of âJamiaFatema RlilBanatâ posted the image to take a dig at Yogi. The photo-post has received over 2500 shares so far.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photos from Delhi riots passed off as that from Bengaluru violence
Body: A Facebook group by the name of âKASHMIR NEWS FASTâ posted two images of rioting mob to claim they were from Bengaluru where Muslim mob recently unleashed violence on the streets angered over an allegedly inflammable post against Islam's Prophet Muhammad. The images were posted with a text that reads, âVoilent Clashes erupted in Bangaluru Over Post Of BJp MLA's Son insulting Prophet Muhammad (Saw) 60 Cops Injured 2 Civillians MarTyred Section 144 Imposed (sic)â. Similar claims were made using the same photos by several other Facebook pages.

Body: Twitter handle @BorisUKJohnson shared a photo of United Kingdom (UK) PM Boris Johnson offering water to a small sculpture with a claim that he did âShri Ram Abhishekâ on the day Ram Mandir bhoomi pujan was held in Ayodhya. âI'm a big fan of Indian Culture So I Did "SHRI RAM ABHISHEK" With Our Home minister at my Residence On 5th of August (sic),â the tweet read. I'm a big fan of Indian Culture So I Did "SHRI RAM ABHISHEK" With Our Home minister at my Residence On 5th of Augusâ¦ https://t.co/EphZqwZxst— Boris Johnson (@BorisUKJohnson) 159680143000

Header: FACT CHECK: Did NZ PM pray at Hindu temple after defeating coronavirus?
Body: Video of New Zealand (NZ) PM Jacinda Ardern visiting a Hindu temple is being shared with a claim that she prayed there after defeating coronavirus. The video is being shared across social media platforms with a text that reads, âafter defeating coronavirus, the first place NZ PM visited was a Hindu templeâ.

Header: FAKE ALERT: PM Modi did not laud CM Yogi for creating Hindu Rashtra, fake letter viral
Body: Screengrab of a letter purportedly addressed by PM Narendra Modi to Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on the recent Ram Temple bhoomi pujan in Ayodhya is doing the rounds on social media. The letter has Modi lauding Yogi and his team for their âprecious contribution to Hindu Rashtra by accomplishing the milestone in the shape of Ram Mandirâ. The letter reads, "Dear Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, Let me begin congratulating you and your team for your precious contribution to the Hindu Rashtra. Hindus will always be grateful to you and your team for your honest and steady hard work to accomplish the mile stone in the shape of Ram Mandir, which will make a new history for Hindu Rashtra. I wish you and your team the very best for your future Elections 2022 and once again congratulate you for this remarkable achievement. Thank you for the wonderful support at this cirica time and from the Prime Minister's office I am also sending 50 crore rupees for early construction of Ram temple." The letter bears a purported signature of PM Modi and is dated August 7, 2020. @RahulGandhi Why Modi Anounced 50 Crore fund for #RamMandir Construction.Ye Janta ka Paisa hai Mandir ka nahi https://t.co/1QQfku8Ieb— Akbar Ansari (@Akbar__ansari) 159680643300

Header: FAKE ALERT: No IPS officer Vinay Tiwari has not joined CBI to probe Sushant Singh Rajput’s death
Body: Several social media posts are claiming that the Bihar IPS officer Vinay Om Tiwari, who was quarantined a few days back by the Municipal corporation of Greater Mumbai, after he landed in financial capital to probe actor Sushant Singh Rajputâs death has now been transferred to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI). The posts claim that he will now join the team probing Rajputâs death.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Israel PM did not take responsibility for Beirut blasts
Body: Screengrab of tweets from verified handle of Israel PM is being shared across social media platforms with a claim that PM Benjamin Netanyahu took responsibility for the recent blasts in Beirut, Lebanon. #BREAKINGOfficially, Israel admitted that It was behind the latest attack in #Beirut, #Lebanon. #PrayForLebanon https://t.co/hncIeBxLXD— The War Report (@TheWarReport2) 1596647612000The screengrab was posted on Facebook by a user with a text that reads, âIsrael's PM Netanyahu just admitted to bombing Beirut by Israel Defence Forces, an act of terror by the state of Israel. I'm just speechless at the level of atrocity this is and how so many innocent people in Lebanon are now dead.â #Israel's PM #Netanyahu just admitted the bombing of #Beirut was #IDF and an act of terror by the State of Israel.â¦ https://t.co/8nPUHbfir5— Sheryar ð (@shyyyboyyyy) 1596610701000the explosion in lebanon is not a coincidence. idc what anyone says the israel pm tweets âWe hit a cell and now weâ¦ https://t.co/WqARZY6Cyh— aya (@ayashahrourr) 1596567049000The tweet from the verified handle of Israel PM quotes Netanyahu as saying, âWe hit a cell and now we hit the dispatchers. We will do what is necessary in order to defend ourselves. I suggest to all of them, including Hezbollah, to consider this.â âThese are not vain words; they have the weight of the State of Israel and the IDF behind them and this should be taken seriously,â reads the second tweet quoting Israel PM.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No coronavirus angle in the arrest of Delhi’s serial killer doctor
Body: Screengrab of a Facebook post carrying link of a Times of India news report is being circulated across social media platforms with a claim that Delhi police arrested a doctor for killing 125 covid-19 patients and trading their kidneys. The Times of India report in the screengrab shows a mask-wearing man with a yellow t-shirt. As per the caption given to the post, when probed about the whereabouts of the dead bodies of those 125 covid-19 patients, the doctor said he fed them off to crocodiles. Along with this post, another screengrab of a Hindi news clipping is being circulated carrying the photo of the same man. A loose translation of the headline reads âKidney racket accused doctor Devendra Sharma arrested, more than 100 murderedâ. The text accompanying this news clipping claims that 125 perfectly healthy people were treated by the doctor under the guise of coronavirus. He lied to them about their covid-19 status, murdered them and then traded their kidneys. The post advises that family members of dead covid-19 patients should thoroughly check their bodies while being handed over by hospitals.

Body: Photo of a temple is doing the rounds on social media with a claim that Ayodhyaâs Ram Mandir when constructed will look like this. A Facebook page posted the image with this claim. Archived version of this post can be viewed here.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leader falsely passes off lavish Boeing-787 jet as PM Modi’s aircraft
Body: Madhya Pradesh Congress president and MLA Jitu Patwari shared a photo of a plane with expensive and luxurious interiors to claim that it was PM Narendra Modiâs private plane. Patwari mocked Modiâs humble origins as a tea-seller to sarcastically claim that India would become a superpower only if Modi gets to enjoy all luxuries of life.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Brazilian Air Force footage falsely shared as mid-air refuelling of Indian Rafale jets
Body: Footage of a jet being fueled mid-air is being shared with the claims it is one of the Rafale jets purchased by India. A Facebook page by the name of Indian Aviation Jobs shared the video on Facebook with a caption that reads, âAnd That Is How The Refuelling Was Done Mid-Air Of Rafale Jet (sic)â. The video post has been viewed over 88000 times so far. It can be viewed here. Another Facebook post by Naresh Shenoy that made a similar claim using the same video has so far received over 56000 views. It can be viewed here. The caption given to the video post reads, âAnd that is how the refuelling is done mid-air #ThankYouPmModiForRafale #RafaleJets (sic)â. The same claim is being made on other social media platforms like Instagram, Twitter with the same footage. Instagram           View this post on Instagram           Few shots from 30,000 feet! Mid air refuelling of #RafaleJets on their way to #India A post shared by  Viral Bhayani (@viralbhayani) on Jul 29, 2020 at 6:19am PDT  Twitter Mid-air refueling. #Rafale means âgust of windâ and âburst of fireâ https://t.co/J08Xs5wc9z— Porinju Veliyath (@porinju) 159602650700

Header: FAKE ALERT: Rafale tweets from parody handle of France President Macron go viral
Body: Congratulatory tweets from an account named after France President Emmanuel Macron are going viral among Indian users of the micro-blogging platform. The tweets revolve around five Rafale fighter jets that recently landed at Indian Air Force airbase in Ambala from France. In one of the tweets, the handle can be seen informing India that Rafale jets are on their way. In another tweet, the account congratulates India and says âwe delivered the first batch of Rafale jets to youâ. Both these seemingly harmless tweets received a huge number of retweets and likes. The handle @MacronEmmauel is not verified by a blue tick.

Header: FAKE ALERT: SP’s Azam Khan hasn’t taken vow to drown in water if not invited to Ayodhya
Body: BJPâs national spokesperson Sambit Patra tweeted a news report from a portal called newstracklive.com, which carried a photo of Samajwadi Partyâs (SP) leader Azam Khan. The headline of the report read, âAzam Khan says he is a Ram bhakt, if not invited to Ram Mandir bhumi pujan, he will take âjal samadhiââ. Tweeting this report, Patra said, âAzam Khan says if he is not invited to Ayodhya, then he will immerse himself in water. He should do so in a handful of water.â

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo from Libya shared as Indian jet shot down by Nepal
Body: Habitual fake news peddling Twitter handle Irmak Idoya posted two images to claim that an Indian jet was shot down by Nepal after âIndian Airforce crossed the border to conduct airstrike in Nepal territoriesâ. The images tweeted by Idoyo are of a burning jet and some wreckage in some farmland. Idoya used those images to claim that India conducted an airstrike in Kot Kharak Singh Pernawan near India-Nepal border, in response to which Nepal shot down an Indian jet and killed two Indian pilots. Indian airforce had crossed the border to conduct airstrike on the Nepal territories today. Header: FAKE ALERT: Photos of boy rescuing fawn from drowning are not from Assam floods
Body: Photos of a boy rescuing a fawn from drowning in a river are being shared with a claim that the boy is a âbahubaliâ from Assam who saved the fawnâs life during floods. The boy apparently struck the âBahubaliâ pose while rescuing the fawn. The images are being shared on Facebook as well with the same claim  Real "Bahubali" of #Assam who saved a fawn from drowningPosted by Vishal Dube on Tuesday, July 21, 2020

Header: FAKE ALERT: Helicopter-truck crash video from Brazil shared as one from Amritsar
Body: A video is doing the rounds on social media platforms with a claim that a helicopter and a truck collided in Ratan Singh Chowk area of Amritsar. The video shows a lorry driving into the turning rotors of a helicopter standing on a road, smashing the blades, sending debris from both the vehicles flying and spilling on to the road. *It's Happen Only in India ...* Amritsar Ratan Singh Chowk.. Header: FACT CHECK: Did Amul target Gandhis over corruption?
Body: Image of an Amul billboard featuring caricatures of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Rahul Gandhi along with the iconic Amul girl is being circulated on instant messaging platform WhatsApp. In the billboard, Amul appears to be taking a dig at Gandhi family accusing it of indulging in corruption for many generations. The billboard bears a text in Hindi, a loose translation of which reads, âMaternal grandfather ate, Paternal grandmother ate, father ate, mother ate. Come sister, you too eat and call brother-in-law as well.â A Times Fact Check reader WhatsApped the image to use asking if it was authentic.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Vikas Dubey’s father alive, claim of him dying of heart-attack false
Body: In an encounter last week, UP police killed gangster Vikas Dubey. His parents refused to accept his dead body for last rites. Now it is being claimed that his father Ram Kumar Dubey has died of heart attack post his sonâs death. It is being claimed that senior Dubey was in shock and inconsolable since his son was killed by UP police. Photo of a bedridden interviewed by news agency ANI is being shared to make this claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Japanese Nobel Prize winner did not claim coronavirus was manufactured in China
Body: A WhatsApp message attributed to Japanese Nobel Prize winner Tasuku Honjo claims that coronavirus is not natural but man-made in China. The message doing the rounds on the instant messaging platform quotes Honjo to claim that China is lying about its origins. It didnât originate from bats. It is also being claimed that Honjo arrived at this conclusion based on his knowledge, research and experience of having worked in Wuhan laboratory for four years.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Hardik Patel tweet Congress will form next government in Gujarat with 1/3rd majority?
Body: Screengrab of a tweet purportedly from Congress leader Hardik Patel is being shared across social media platforms. The tweet has Patel saying that come next state elections in Gujarat, Congress will form the government with 1/3rd majority vote. A loose translation of the tweet dated July 12 2020 reads, âI am indebted to Sonia and Rahul Gandhi. Congress party will continue its fight to save democracy and constitution in the country. All issues pertaining to Gujarat will be addressed. And Congress will storm back into power with 1/3rd majority vote in the 2022 assembly elections.â Screengrab of this tweet started doing the rounds after Patel was appointed as working president of the Congressâ Gujarat state unit recently. A Times Fact Check reader WhatsApped the screengrab to us to know if it was authentic or doctored.

Header: FAKE ALERT: UP police saves Muslim kid, gets falsely blamed for his arrest
Body: Facebook page by the name of Owaisi Supporter posted an image of a Muslim kid with a claim that he was arrested by police for the âcrime of wearing a skull cap and being born in a Muslim familyâ. In the photo, the kid can be seen with a police official and a jeep. One leg of the kid is tied with a chain. A loose translation of the sarcastic Hindi text accompanying the photo reads, âHe is even a bigger criminal than Vikash Dubey. He is so dangerous that he openly dons skull cap and was born in a Muslim family. Brave cops arrested him.â Md Saqib Abid and many others shared the image with the same claim on Twitter.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video from Bangladesh falsely shared as RSS men molesting Muslim woman in India
Body: Twitter user by the name of Shaba Saikh posted a video in which a burqa-clad Muslim woman is being harrassed by a group of men with a claim that sanghi (RSS members) men are molesting Muslim woman in India. The men in the video are conversing in Bengali and the Muslim woman seems spooked by their presence around her. Saikh posted the video with a text full of vile and abusive language for RSS and its members. Hereâs the screenshot of the tweet (with abusive words masked). The entire tweet can be viewed here. A loose translation (minus the abuses) of the text in Hindi posted by Saikh reads, âBecause of these sanghi men, daughters are not safe in India. This is the reality of the same sanghis who raise âBeti Bacho Beti Padhaoâ slogan. Keep retweeting till these men get arrested.â Another Twitter user Shahjhan Malik shared the same video claiming that it is for the same reason that India is ranked the world's most dangerous country for women. This is one of the reasons why poll ranks #India the worldâs most dangerous country for #women. https://t.co/mLmI6kETKq— Shahjhan Malik | #StayHomeSaveLives (@shahjhan_malikk) 159412167900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Hindi news reporter Ashraf Wani makes false claim of Indian Army killing Kashmiri woman
Body: Ashraf Wani, a reporter with a leading Hindi news channel, put out a tweet claiming that bullets fired by Indian armed forces ended up killing a Kashmiri woman (civilian) in the Pampore area of South Kashmir on Thursday. Wani tweeted that after some youth pelted stones at an Army convoy, the Army fired back bullets and in retaliation, a Kashmiri woman was killed. Wan's Twitter profile can be accessed here.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Injured soldier seen with PM Modi in this photo is not BJP leader Tajinder Bagga
Body: After the India-China faceoff at Galwan Valley, PM Narendra Modi made a surprise visit to Ladakh to boost the morale of Indian security forces. During his visit, he met with Indian soldiers who were injured during the clash that claimed the lives of 20 soldiers. Now a photo from that visit is being shared with the claim that the injured Sikh soldier seen with PM Modi is actually BJP leader Tajinder Bagga, whoâs faking injuries and wearing a mask to hide his identity. Delhi Youth Congress activist Manju Massey tweeted the photo tagging official handle of Bagga. The photo compares the kada (bangle) worn by the sikh man in the photo with the one that Bagga wears to conclude that the man in the photo with PM Modi is the BJP leader Tajinder Bagga. On Facebook, one Md Hazrat Ali posted this photo with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Yogi government didn’t levy a fine of Rs 21 lakh on this Muslim rickshaw-puller over anti-CAA protests
Body: Controversial actor Ajaz Khan posted an image of a poor rickshaw-puller to claim that his name is Kaleem and he was fined Rs 21 lakh,76 thousand by Yogi government in Uttar Pradesh (UP) for ferrying anti-CAA protesters. When he failed to cough up the fine, he was arrested by UP police, Khan alleges. Same picture was posted on Facebook by a page called âHusanaraâ. The claim made by the page was more or less similar. In the text accompanying the picture, the page accused CM Yogi of arresting those who were peacefully protesting against CAA. Facebook user Mohd Salauddin too shared this photo with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old unrelated images used to falsely claim Nepal killed 7 Indian soldiers at border
Body: A Twitter account by the name of Irmak Idoya posted two images to claim that in an unprovoked âceasefire violationâ initiated by Indian Army at the Indo-Nepal border, three civilians got injured. In response Nepali soldiers killed seven Indian soldiers, the tweet mentioned. As per the tweet, the incident happened at Behaliya area of India-Nepal border. One of the images posted by Idoya to make the claim shows a number of dead soldiers lying on the floor.

Header: FAKE ALERT: ‘Cycle girl’ Jyoti Paswan has not been raped and murdered by ex-armyman
Body: Several Facebook posts doing the rounds on social media platform claim that âcycle girlâ Jyoti Paswan was raped and murdered by an ex-armyman in Darbhanga, Bihar. Graphic image of a dead girl is being circulated to make this claim. For the uninitiated, Jyotiâs gruelling journey from the outskirts of New Delhi to their village 1,200 km away with her jobless father on a cycle made headlines around the world recently and threw a spotlight on the plight of Indiaâs unemployed migrant workers. Now claims are being made that she was raped and murdered. Quoting some Shahab Alam, verified Facebook user Arvind Rajbhar claimed that Jyoti was raped and murdered by a retired army man.

Header: FACT CHECK: Rahul Gandhi passes off Congress functionaries as ordinary Ladakhis to slam PM Modi
Body: Congress leader and Wayanad MP today posted a video on his official Twitter handle accusing PM Narendra Modi of lying to India. The video included a number of people claiming that China has occupied and taken away substantial land from India in Ladakh region. Gandhi said that those making these claims were Ladakhis. Ladakhis say:China took our land. PM says:Nobody took our land. Obviously, someone is lying. https://t.co/kWNQQhjlY7— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) 1593763277000The video received over 13k retweets and 34k likes at the time of filing this report.

Header: FACT CHECK: Person seen in this viral photo with CM Yogi is not gangster Vikas Dubey
Body: Photo of Uttar Pradesh (UP) CM Yogi Adityanath with another leader is being shared on social media with a claim that the leader in question is gangster Vikas Dubey. It is being claimed that he is affiliated to the BJP. The photo is being shared with the same claim on Facebook as well. It should be noted that 8 UP police officials lost their lives on Thursday night when they were shot at by gangster Vikas Dubeyâs men. The cops had gone to conduct a raid at history sheeter Dubeyâs place.

Header: FACT CHECK: Were Indira Gandhi’s last rites held as per Islamic rituals?
Body: A Twitter handle by the name of @Montybisht_ posted a photo showing former PM Rajiv Gandhi and son Rahul standing besides a corpse. Looking at their hands it seems both are reading namaz. The handle shared the photo with a claim that both Rajiv and Rahul offered namaz in front of Indira Gandhiâs dead body and still Indians think theyâre Brahmins. The text shared along with the photo reads, âWhat is happening there. Are they both janeudhari (sacred thread worn by Brahmins) #FirozKhan #AntoniaMainoâ. The user tagged the official handle of Indian National Congress in the tweet.

Header: FACT CHECK: Is government giving Rs 2,000 per person as relief fund?
Body: A WhatsApp message doing the rounds on the instant messaging platform claims that the government has approved a free Rs 2,000 relief fund for every citizen. The message comes with a website url â https://bit.ly/india-reliefâ. It asks readers to click on this link to claim the amount. âThe Government has finally approved and have started giving out free Rs.2,000 Relief Funds to each citizen. Below is how to claim and get yours credit Instantly as I have just did now https://bit.ly/india-relief Note : You can only claim and get credited once and it's also limited so get your now Instantly (sic),â reads the entire message. A concerned reader shared the message with Times Fact Check on our WhatsApp number wanting to know its authenticity.

This is not a news in Kashmir but became a routine of Indian occupied army to kill someone somewhere in the state of Jammu and Kashmir. Silence of international community is a big question mark (sic).â Another Twitter user used a funeral procession video of the same boy to pray that Allah annihilates those Indian soldiers who are "martyring innocent Kashmiri". Body: Twitter user by the name of Devasena posted an image in which Congress president Sonia Gandhi, former PM Manmohan Singh and Wayanad MP Rahul Gandhi can be seen sitting with former Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe. Header: FAKE ALERT: 2015 photo from Nigeria shared as bodies of Indian soldiers killed in Galwan clash
Body: A Facebook page by the name of âKASHMIR THE NEWSâ posted an image of dead soldiers linking it Indian soldiers killed in Galwan Valley skirmish with China.   Another Uttar Pradesh based Facebook user Akhlak Khan posted the image and wondered how many Indian soldiers would China kill in a war if it can kill so many in just a localized clash. He accused the BJP government of being ârobbersâ, who made Indian public unconscious through âintoxication of religionâ.   A Times Fact Check reader too shared the photo with a claim that the Modi government is hiding the actual number of Indian casualties. The reader wanted to know if the picture was authentic.

Header: FACT CHECK: Can barcodes detect ‘made in china’ products?
Body: A graphic card going viral across social media platforms claims that barcodes on the goods can be used to identify âMade in Chinaâ products, thereby making it easy to boycott Chinese products. âBarcode starting with number 690 to 699 is country code of China. Barcode starting with number 890 is country code of India (sic),â read the quote on the viral image.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Picture from Venezuela falsely shared as Indian Army killing Muslims in Kashmir
Body: Facebook user Aj Asif shared a graphic image that shows dead bodies with a claim that Indian Army is killing Muslims in Kashmir. âHow the Indian Army is killing our Muslims. Our Muslim brothers and sisters are being tortured in Kashmir,â read the text posted along with the photo. Asifâ post has been shared over one thousand times. In a Facebook group by the name of âAL JAZEERA - ENGLSHâ, Abdeen Hameed shared the same post, which received over 70 shares in the group.

Body: Verified Twitter user Dr Anand Rai posted a graphic image of a man with a badly bruised back to claim that he was one of the Indian soldiers who faced barbarity of Chinese Army in the Galwan Valley faceoff. Tagging the official Twitter handle of PMO India, Rai wrote, âThis is one of the soldiers who survived the barbaric attack by Chinese forces on galwan valley. He has nail injuries all over his body. They were completely unarmed and yet they fought back the Chinese army. (sic)â This is one of the soldiers who survived the barbaric attack by Chinese forces on galwan valley. He has nail injurâ¦ https://t.co/Ov2fJs6MLi— Dr.ANAND RAI (@anandrai177) 159263317300

Body: A Twitter handle by the name of @_manmohan_singh put out a tweet on June 17, 2020 with a photo of former PM Manmohan Singh in it and a text that reads, âFinally Joined Twitter (sic)â. The handle insinuated that it was the original account of Singh, although it is not verified with blue tick by Twitter. Manmohan Singh Fansclubâ. The handle at close to 18 thousand followers at the time of filing this report.

Body: Days after 20 Indian soldiers attained martyrdom at Galwan Valley while clashing with Chinese Army, Congress leader Randeep Surjewala posted a video to claim that Indian government sent soldiers unarmed when their lives were at stake. Let us not muddle facts @DrSJaishankar Pl see the video on social media & tell why no firearms are being carried(sâ¦ https://t.co/BA2E9eU0ev— Randeep Singh Surjewala (@rssurjewala) 1592490511000Tagging foreign minister S Jaishankar, Surjewala said, âLet us not muddle facts @DrSJaishankar Pl see the video on social media & tell why no firearms are being carried(see 34th sec for Galwan) And Stop quoting Agreement on Border Management to justify sending Soldiers Unarmed in tactical military situation with lives at stake.â The archived version of the tweet can be viewed here.

Back then, she or any of her children werenât holding any public office, then on what basis did they accept Chinese hospitality? Why is the familyâs interest, from Doklam to Ladakh, above national interest?â Sonia Gandhi and her entire familyâs China visit in 2008 is significant. Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored video of MP CM Shivraj circulated to claim he wants people to become addicted to alcohol
Body: A video of Madhya Pradesh (MP) chief minister (CM) Shivraj Singh Chouhan going viral on social media shows him asking his subordinates to increase the sale of liquor in the state to such an extent that more and more people consume it and remain in inebriated condition. In the video Chouhan can be heard saying, â What is this excise department up to? Why are they sitting idle? Increase the distribution of liquor in the state to such an extent that people of the state get addicted and remain intoxicated. Header: FACT CHECK: Is Covid-19 a bacterial infection and not a virus?
Body: A video doing the rounds on instant messaging platform WhatsApp claims that Covid-19 is just a bacterial infection and not a virus, as widely claimed by the World Health Organization (WHO). Times Fact Check received the video from a reader who wanted us to verify if the claims made by it were authentic. âFinally W.H.O. cheated the world ,Corona is not a Virus but a bacterial infection and patients can cure only in one day. See this video and make it viral send to many as possible (sic),â reads the text shared along with the video.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Morphed screenshot of Dawn news used to claim PAF F-16 missing
Body: Screengrab of a report from Pakistan news website Dawn is being circulated on social media claiming a F-16 fighter plane of Pakistan Air Force (PAF) has gone missing. Titled âAmid panic situation occurred last night at Karachi , one Pakistan Air Force PAF F-16 is reportedly gone missingâ, the report is dated June 10, 2020. It is credited to author Junaid Ali. The screengrab began circulating after reports of a blackout in Karachi on Tuesday night started doing the rounds, triggering fear on Pakistani social media. Amid panic situation occurred last night at Karachi , one Pakistan Air Force PAF F-16 is reportedly gone missing .â¦ https://t.co/yAylTfcSGx— Nambo.nrj Neeraj Mishra (@NrjNambo) 1591786506000Residents expressed their fear on Twitter, saying that the Indian fighter planes have entered Karachi and it led to black out in the city. A Paksitani citizen wrote on Twitter that the authorities put Karachi under black out after IAF planes were seen flying in the city.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2011 image from UP used to falsely claim Indian army atrocity on Kashmiris
Body: A photo-collage is being shared across social media platforms with an intent to draw parallels between US police brutality on George Floyd and alleged atrocities on Kashmiri locals in India. The collage uses three different images to make the claim that an Indian soldier knelt on a Kashmiri youthâs neck just like ex-Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin asphyxiated Floyd to death by kneeling on him. Another photo used in the collage is being claimed to be that of an Israel soldier kneeling on a Palestiniansâs neck Here are few Facebook users sharing the collage with hashtag #StandWithKashmir   Twitter user Ismayil Faisal shared the collage with a text that reads, âRacism everywhere in the name of Religion,Cast,Colour, Language, Ethnicity etc etc when we will change this brutal mentality #300DaysOfKashmirSiege #georgesfloyd #protests #Kashmir #chicagoprotest sometimes I feel that Humans are the most dangerous creatures Iâve ever seen. (sic)â Racism everywhere in the name of Religion,Cast,Colour, Language, Ethnicity etc etc when we will change this brutalâ¦ https://t.co/xC4tDsHT5P— Ismayil Faisal (@faisalsheelath) 159084869800

Header: FACT CHECK: Are Hindus being fed biryani laced with contraceptives in Coimbatore
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Pankaj Ahir posted four photos claiming that in Tamil Naduâs Coimbatore city, a Muslim man is selling biryani to Hindus by injecting impotency drugs in their serving.The user used this claim to make an appeal to people to not buy any goods from the Muslims. A loose translation of the Hindi text Ahir posted along with four photos read, âIn Coimbatore, a Muslim owned fast food joint "Masha Allah" cooked biriyani in two separate utensils, one was reserved for Muslims and the other for Hindus. In the utensil for Hindus, the Muslim cook would add tablets of impotency so that the Hindu boys and girls consuming it would become impotent and are not able to have progenies, thus reducing the overall Hindu population. This is just a trailer, the original film is even bigger. Think how badly the jihadis have surrounded you. I have no clue how jihad is being carried out to eradicate Hindus, and the Hindus are oblivious of it and are sleeping. People who try to wake Hindus up are eliminated. There is still time to boycott them completely. Take a pledge that from today you will not buy any goods from them.â   Among the photos shared with this post, the first has a man wearing a skull cap with biryani, in the second photo some men can be seen getting apprehended by police, the third photo has police addressing media with the same people in background, while the fourth photo shows some tablets.

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant

FAKE ALERT: Magic act video falsely shared as '4 Muslim men burnt alive in India'
Body: A YouTube video is being shared with a claim that Muslim men who slaughter cows are burnt alive in India. Titled â4 Muslim men are burnt alive in Indiaâ, the video shows four men being tied to chains and then put in a cage. The cage is then airlifted and dropped inside a bush which is then set on fire. The description given to the video reads, âCanât believe eyes, in the supervision of police & massive crowd. They slaughtered a cow, meagre a cow. Extremists who have taken over #Endia believe that cows are holier than a human being. World is quiet for the sake of business. Your tongues & hands arenât tightened, please boycott this beastly nation. #BoycottIndia (sic).â Twitter user Imad shared the video with same claim. @MJALSHRIKA @NitishKumar @hrw @OIC_OCI 4 muslims men burnt alive in indiahttps://t.co/x2lHYpGuau— imad salar (@imadsalar) 159126908800

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leader passes off 2017 image of a poor dead woman as recent one from lockdown
Body: Congress leader Archana Dalmia posted a distressing image of an infant trying to breastfeed on his mother, who lays dead. She posted the image insinuating that it was a recent one from lockdown in Madhya Pradesh (MP). âWoman lay dead by railway tracks in MP's Damoh, infant son tied to breastfeed. Distressing images and footages showing an infant trying to breastfeed on his mother, oblivious to her death. The woman's body was spotted by people in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh,â read the text Dalmia tweeted along with the image. The tweet now stands deleted. Times Fact Check found many other Twitter users sharing the image to make the same claim. Woman lay dead by railway tracks in MP's Damoh, infant son tries to breastfeed ð¢ https://t.co/E09uhExi1V— Vidyapati Yadav (@KumarVidyapati2) 159128221900

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Brahmins in UP didn’t chop off girl’s tongue to offer it in temple
Body: A Twitter user by the name of Kamran put out a tweet claiming that in Uttar Pradesh (UP), the tongue of a class 8th girl was slashed by Brahmins to offer it as a sacrifice at Shiv temple. Kamran shared a graphic image of a woman with a severed tongue to claim that Brahmins did so in order to save the village from coronavirus. âThere is limit of hypocrisy & superstition In order to save the village from corona in Bundelkhand, UP, a 8th class girl's tongue was cut off by bharhmis and offer as sacrifice and climbed into Shivji's temple. But neither mainstream media nor celebrities will outrage on this. (sic),â tweeted Kamran. Note: Due to the disturbing nature of the picture, we have attached a blurred screenshot of the tweet here.The tweet can be viewed by clicking here. Aam Aadmi Party MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj alerted Times Fact Check by tag-quoting Kamran's tweet to us.

Header: FAKE ALERT: SC has not ordered to rename India as Bharat from June 15
Body: Several social media users across platforms such as Facebook and Twitter are claiming that the Supreme Court (SC) of India has ordered to rename India as âBharatâ from June 15, 2020. Facebook user Ragini Pandit made the claim with a text in Hindi which loosely translates to, âFrom June 15, India will be called âBharatâ across all languagesâ. She attributes the claim to SC. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of personal enmity shared with false claim of Muslim man forced to lick Hindu’s spit
Body: A disturbing video doing the rounds on social media shows a man confronting and repeatedly slapping another man, forcing him to lick his spit and making him do sit-ups. The video is being shared with the claim that a Hindu man beat up a Muslim man and then forced him to lick his spit. It is being claimed that the Hindu man forced the Muslim man to break his Ramzan fast.   Facebook user Shaikh Azizur Rahman posted the video with a text that reads, âIt appears, this incident took place in Surat, Gujarat, a few days ago, during the month of Ramadaan. In this video, a youth is found beating a Muslim man and forcing him to do sit-ups, holding his ears. The young man appears to be a Hindu. Itâs not clear why exactly the Hindu youth attacked the Muslim man. But, we can figure out from the video that the moment the youth finds that the man is Muslim and is on Ramadaan fast, he turns more violent. The youth spits on the bonnet of a car and forces the Muslim man to lick it, apparently to humiliate and force him to break his Ramadaan fast halfway. (sic)â A Times Fact Check reader also shared the video with us on our WhatsApp number.

Header: FACT CHECK: This man kicking tennis ball in this viral clip is not Diego Maradona
Body: A video in which an overweight man can be seen kicking a tennis ball is being shared on social media with the claim that he is Argentina's legendary footballer Diego Maradona. The video is being shared with similar claims across different social media platforms. Many social media users are expressing shock over the weight Maradona seems to have gained.

Body: A video showing a number of vehicles moving methodically on a mountain range is being shared with a claim that Indian Army troop is being deployed at Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Ladakh amidst the ongoing military standoff between Indian and Chinese forces. The video is being shared with this claim on YouTube as well as Twitter. Body: A photo showing dugged-out idols surrounded by a large number of people is being shared on Facebook with a claim that they were unearthed in Ayodhya during recent excavations. A loose translation of the Hindi text posted along with the photo reads, âThousand years old idols of Lord Rama, Lakshmana and Goddess Sita were excavated in Ayodhya.â   The claim was made on Twitter as well. #à¤à¤¯à¥à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤¾_à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤² à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¥¤#à¤à¤¯_à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥_à¤°à¤¾à¤® https://t.co/eWdpYpK50K— à¤¸à¤à¤¦à¥à¤ª à¤ à¤¾à¤à¥à¤° (@Dlsandeepthakur) 159025074400

Header: FACT CHECK: Viral video showing corpses lying among patients is from Mumbai and not Delhi
Body: Facebook user Rajender Sharma posted a video to show misconduct of a hospital. In the video, corpses of some patients are kept near those patients who are being treated. Some patients can be seen lying on the ground with garbage on their side. The user has claimed that this video is from Delhi.   The user has shared the video with a caption that reads, âKejriwal, have some shame. This has crossed all limits. If you canât handle the situation, then let the president's rule be imposed in Delhi.â Here's the archived link to the Facebook post.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Tweet of Police killing children in mosques and schools in Varanasi is fake
Body: Twitter user @Dalal_alajmi tweeted a video showing a child bleeding from his head and crying continuously. When the child is asked who did this to him, he answers 'police'. The Twitter user posted the video to claim that it is from Varanasi where the âYogi policeâ is entering mosques and schools and killing all Muslim children present there. Using hashtags such as #Indian_Muslims_in_danger #UNHCR #islamophobia_in_india #Kashmir, the user wrote, âThis shocking video of the Yogi Police in Varanasi (UP), how the children of the mosque and school were killed mercilessly, and showed the entire world what is happening in India * * Share please * (sic)â. #Indian_Muslims_in_danger #UNHCR #islamophobia_in_india #Kashmir * This shocking video of the Yogi Police iâ¦ https://t.co/FrviWGMLkp— ð¹Ø§ÙÙØ­Ø§ÙÙÙ / Ø¯ÙØ§Ù Ø§ÙØ¹Ø¬ÙÙ-Ø¨Ø§Ø­Ø« Ø¯ÙØªÙØ±Ø§Ù Ø¨Ø§ÙÙØ§ÙÙÙ âï¸ (@Dalal_alajmi_) 1590347108000Hereâs the archived link to the tweet

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo from California shared in the name of fire in Uttarakhand forests
Body: Arushi Nishank, daughter of Union Human Resource and Development Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal, shared two pictures describing the fire in the forests of Uttarakhand. She shared the photos with a text that reads, âIt's a moment of utter grief for the entire nation as our devbhoomi Uttarakhand faces the forest fire crisis, and the wildlife specifies that reside in the forest are in grave danger. Please #PrayForUttarakhand that this catastrophy stops with no more loss of our flora & fauna." It's a moment of utter grief for the entire nation as our devbhoomi Uttarakhand faces the forest fire crisis, and tâ¦ https://t.co/si4ueg7m4b— Arushi Nishank (@ArushiNishank) 1590506570000Although this Twitter account is not verified, many other verified handles like Namami Gange in the past have tagged this account in their tweets.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Shashi Tharoor retweets old video to target BJP over migrant workers
Body: Senior congress leader Shashi Tharoor retweeted a video that shows a poor woman lying on a roadside while two kids try to wake her up. The kids sprinkle water on the woman's head who appears to have fainted. The tweet Tharoor retweeted was made by Congress leader Archana Dalmia. Tagging BJPâs official Twitter handle, Dalmia posted the video along with a text in Hindi. A loose translation of what she wrote in Hindi reads, âWhat makes life so cheap. I appeal to every mother in the world to see this. It does not belong to any film. Migrants are wandering on the streets. Can BJP not wake up?â Dalmia used several hashtags like #MigrantCrisis, #SpeakUpIndia, #SPEAKFORTHEDEAD implying that the woman in the video was a migrant worker who died during the coronavirus lockdown in the country. Hereâs the screengrab of the tweet that now stands deleted

Header: FAKE ALERT: Rahul Gandhi did not tweet odd-even scheme for reopening schools
Body: Screengrab of a tweet purportedly put out by Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is doing the rounds on social media platforms where he proposes an odd-even scheme for reopening schools. âSchools and colleges should reopen from 1st June on odd/even basis. Odd days teachers will come and even days, students will come,â reads the tweet. Times Fact Check received the tweet screengrab from a reader who wanted to know if it was authentic.
