Header: Fact Check: Has the Ministry of Home Affairs approved opening of schools in all states?
Body: A âbreaking newsâ bulletin of a Hindi news channel named 'India News' is being circulated on WhatsApp claiming that the Ministry of Home Affairs has given permission to open all schools across the country.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral message claiming 10 days military lockdown in Mumbai-Pune is fake
Body: A message doing the rounds on instant messaging app WhatsApp claims that there will be a military lockdown across Mumbai and Pune from Saturday. This lockdown will last for 10 days, it says. The message appeals readers to stock as much vegetables and ration as they can as only milk and medicines would be available during the military lockdown. The message also claims that the Maharashtra government meeting is going on and the lockdown can be announced anytime.

Header: FACT CHECK: Bus accident CCTV footage shared as last visuals of passengers before PIA plane crash
Body: A Facebook page by the name of JK News 18 shared a short video clip and claimed it to be the inside footage of Pakistani plane that crashed in Karachi last week. The footage shows passengers panicking moments before the vehicle in which they are moving apparently crashes. âJust before the PIA Plane crash in Karachi,Pakistan,â read the caption given to the video.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Incident of domestic violence in UP falsely shared as oppression of Muslims in India
Body: Twitter user Ali Keskin posted a video that showed some men beating up a woman on a street. The woman can be heard screaming in pain while people around her stand in witness, watching the spectacle unfold. The beating of the woman goes on unabated even as a police van passes by. The video is being shared with a text that makes it look like that the women being beaten is Muslim, while those who are beating her belong to Hindu community. The caption given by Ali to the video reads, "Muslims are oppressed in India and will continue to be oppressed if we do not protect them. It's time to be unity. The Indian government will account! (sic)â. He tweeted the video with hashtag called #ModiResignation. Muslims are oppressed in India and will continue to be oppressed if we do not protect them. It's time to be unity.â¦ https://t.co/jnKRBJFNe5— Ali Keskin (@alikeskin_tr) 1590193331000Another Twitter user Hassan khan also shared this video calling RSS and the India police force as terrorist organizations. He said, âTerrorism in India is being monitored by the police. A woman is being beaten. Modi government's RRS is oppressing Muslims as well as the rest of the minority. Modi has handed over the whole of India to a terrorist organization. Knows that India is a terrorist country. (sic)â Terrorism in India is being monitored by the police. A woman is being beaten. Modi government's RRS is oppressing Mâ¦ https://t.co/Z0dtNHbfdf— Hassan khan (@hassan_khan_78) 159020062600

Header: FAKE ALERT: Visual from plane crash simulation video passed off as PIA flight 8303’s engine on fire
Body: Minutes after the news of the PIA plane crash near Karachi airport broke across news outlets, several social media users started posting images of a PIA plane about to land, with both engines on fire. While some used it as a representative image, many others passed it off as the image of the plane moments before it crashed. Just 5km away from the runway, both engines were got fire in time of crash, #planecrash https://t.co/piMLG6squ0— Sadaam خان👑 (@SadaamKhaan) 1590149321000Runway so close yet so far for those who in plane. Rest in peace all those who died . 💔#planecrash #Karachi… https://t.co/CBDHmeec2Z— Corona ( Negative ) (@Ibrahimkhan0317) 1590167587000Leading news channels too ran the same image in various news segments, claiming it to be an exclusive image of the plane, whose engines caught fire, just before it was about to land

Header: FAKE ALERT: Bihar video shared with false claim of Upper castes refusing food from Dalits
Body: Twitter user Alex Ambedkar tweeted a video in which a man can be seen angrily kicking food kept at a table and yelling at the woman standing in front. This video is being shared with a claim that the 'meritorious people' at a covid-19 quarantine center refused to eat food cooked by a Dalit woman. Word âmeritoriousâ is often used in left-political discourse derisively to take a swipe at upper caste Hindus. Merit Dhari refusing to eat food cooked by a Dalit women at a quarantine center.What arrogance..... https://t.co/UnETG9g9KB— Alex Ambedkar (@ganikapudi_) 1589994195000At the time of writing this report, the video had already been retweeted more than six thousand times and viewed more than four lakh twenty five thousand times. The same video is being shared on Facebook with the claim that two people named Shiraz Ahmed and Bhujoli Kurd refused to eat food cooked by Dalit women at a quarantine center.   TRUTHBoth claims made with the video are false. The video is from Madhubani district of Bihar where a school in Madhwapur block has been turned into a quarantine center. The migrant laborers living there were unhappy with following the rules of social distancing while being served food and wanted them to be fed food in the usual way. Failing this, they created a ruckus and an FIR has also been registered against them.

Body: A video showing a huge crowd barging into what appears to be a store is being shared with a claim that it shows a mall in Saudi Arabia after the lockdown was relaxed there. The video is being shared with this claim across social media platforms. Facebook user Sobia Ashraf shared the video with a caption that reads, âSaudi Arab shopping mall after lock down.â She posted the video on May 15, 2020   The video shows staff lifting shutters of a store, while a large number of patrons wait outside to get in. The moment shutters are liften, the customers barge in. Antisocial elements burned 300 Muslim homes in West Bengal to ashes. The incident occurred at 7 am on Tuesday in Telinipara district of West Bengal. India is burning with Hindu-Muslim hatred. How long will this continue to happen?â read the caption given to the video, alongwith hashtags #Islamophobia_In_India, #Islamophobia and #StopTargetingMuslim. Header: FAKE ALERT: Randeep Surjewala shares photo from Nepal calling it ‘New India’s truth’
Body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala tweeted an image of a woman carrying a small child on her back while cycling and captioned it as âNew Indiaâs truthâ. Hereâs a screenshot of the tweet which now stands deleted

Header: FAKE ALERT: Poet Imran Pratapgarhi uses old photo of Rohingya girl to criticize PM Modi
Body: Urdu poet Imran Pratapgarhi shared a photo of a young, teary-eyed girl carrying luggage on her head to take a jibe at PM Narendra Modiâs Rs 20 lakh crore economic package. à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¥à¤°à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤° à¤²à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤²à¤¹à¥ à¤°à¤¹ à¤à¤¯à¤¾à¤à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¿à¤à¤°à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤¸à¥ à¤°à¤¹ à¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¥¤à¤à¤¨à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤à¥à¤ à¤«à¤¼à¤à¤¼à¤¾à¤à¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¥à¤® à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤à¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¹ à¤¤à¤à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¬à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤°â¦ https://t.co/iaR7Ao9K97— Imran Pratapgarhi (@ShayarImran) 1589307905000Turning to poetry and addressing Modi as âsahebâ, Imran shared the photo and wrote, âBlood is left on the stones. The blood was left scattered. Their screams were lost in the whims. The daughters were left in the way! Is there anything for these poor people in that multi-million relief package or not?â The same photo is also used by Congress leader Alka Lamba as her display picture on Twitter.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video showing Muslims offering namaz shared claiming lockdown rules flouted
Body: A 1.04-minute video showing Muslims offering namaz on road is being shared by many social media users with a claim that the video was filmed after the nationwide lockdown to combat coronavirus pandemic was imposed. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Modinama' shared the video today with a title and caption is Hindi claiming the video was recorded in Delhi's Patparganj area, and that Muslims flouted the lockdown rules. We found the same video uploaded to a YouTube channel that goes by the name 'Sirf News' with title 'Muslims violate social distancing again, now at Patparganj, Delhi' and a caption saying, "Hundreds of Muslims offered namaz (salah) together near a mosque at the Patparganj Industrial Area in east Delhi on 13 May 2020, exposing themselves and others to the risk of contracting the highly infectious coronavirus disease (COVID). Innumerable instances of group prayers have been reported from across India in the course of the nationwide lockdown (sic)."

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old, unverifiable photos from 2018 shared to claim pellet injuries to civilians in recent Kashmir operation
Body: Pictures of men, seemingly suffering from pellet injuries, are being shared on social media platform Twitter with the claim that they were protestors injured by Indian forces in south Kashmir district of Kulgam. Pics from Qaimoh village of #Kulgam (South #Kashmir) Indian Govt & brutal forces fire pellets indiscriminately atâ¦ https://t.co/ImNUzWIvQ3— Usman Abdul Qayyum âðµð° ( #StayAtHomeSaveLives ) (@UsmanAQayyum) 1589414137000The insinuation being that civilian protestors were injured during the Cordon and Search Operation (CASO) launched by Indian security forces against terrorists in Kulgam on Thursday morning. âPics from Qaimoh village of #Kulgam (South #Kashmir) Indian Govt & brutal forces fire pellets indiscriminately at protestors injuring many, hitting eyes and other vital organs (sic)â read a tweet from a user named Usman Qayyum.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No communal angle in assault of Hindu priest in Vrindavan
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle 'RituRathaur' shared an image with a screenshot of a Facebook post and a photo showing an injured Hindu priest saying, "Another Hindu Sadhu brutally lynched allegedly by illegal Bangladeshis in Vrindavan! What r these desert barbrians doing in holy towns of Hindus? This is just shocking! These criminals have spread everywhere," and accused Mathura Police of trying to brush the matter under the carpet saying, "Sir @myogiadityanath, locals saying Mathura Police is trying to hush case (sic)." The same image is being shared on WhatsApp as well with captions giving the incident a communal angle. The captions claim that the priest was lynched/murdered. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'The Sarcastic Woman' posted three photos of the injured priest saying, "Brutal assault on Vrindavan priest: Tamal Krishna Das, an elderly Vaishnav saint & one of the main priests of Imlitala Temple in Vrindavan, UP, mercilessly thrashed by goons. Two of the assailants are told to be Bangladeshis, while others are outsiders. All the attackers are absconding. Mathura Police trying to hush up the case. People are requested to share this as widely as possible (sic)."

Body: BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra tweeted a 6-second-long video of Congress leader and Wayanad MP Rahul Gandhi. In the video, Gandhi can be heard saying, âThose Red Zones are actually Green Zones and Green Zones are actually Red Zones.â Patra captioned the video as, âAfter turning potato into gold, now RED is GREEN, GREEN is RED. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of passengers outraging against airline staff is not from Air India plane
Body: A video showing passengers confronting airline staff for flouting social distancing norms inside a plane and overcharging them for tickets is being shared with a claim that it was shot inside an Air India plane. A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Praveen Kumar Prabhakar' shared the video saying, "Air India charged 3 times the fare, in the name of "social distancing". But the passengers didn't get even a single seat empty between them. Looting the public continues unabated." Here is the post:  Air India charged 3 times the fare, in the name of "social distancing". But the passengers didn't get even a single seat empty between them.Looting the public continues unabated.Posted by Praveen Kumar Prabhakar on Thursday, May 7, 2020 Several Twitter users shared the same video making similar claims. For instance: Air india is charging thrice the amount of ticket on the assurance that social distancing will be maintained and onâ¦ https://t.co/pnvh4RAIcH— Asad Hameed Khan (@AsadHameedKha10) 1589003361000Some users claimed the video was shot inside an Air India flight from Chicago to Delhi. Air India flight from their Chicago-Delhi flight â¦ passengers were charged 3x Fares to âcoverâ social-distancing anâ¦ https://t.co/o0i3B9B6uc— Ardent Traveller (@TravellerArdent) 158896013400

Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake tweet in which Amit Shah says he has ‘bone cancer’ goes viral
Body: A tweet attributed to Home Minister Amit Shahâs verified Twitter handle, in which he says that he has bone cancer is being circulated across social media platforms. In the tweet, Shah can be seen imploring Muslims to pray for his good health during Ramzan. A loose translation of the tweet originally done in Hindi reads, âPeople of my country, every step taken by me has been in the interest of the country, I have no enmity with any person of any caste or religion, I have not been able to serve the people of the country due to deteriorating health for a few days. It is sad to say that I have contracted bone cancer in the back portion of the throat, I hope that in this happy month of Ramadan, people of Muslim society will also pray for my health and I will serve them as soon as I am healthy again. (sic)â A Times Fact Check reader shared a screengrab of this tweet with us on our WhatsApp number asking us to verify its authenticity.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Rakul Preet Singh passed off as Deepika Padukone buying liquor
Body: Video of a tall woman, wearing a mask and walking with some stuff in her hands is being circulated on social media platform Twitter, with a claim that it is Bollywood actress Deepika Padukone. The claim being made is that she was seen purchasing liquor. A Twitter user shared the video with a text that reads, âSocialist Deepika Padukone contributing to the States Treasury in lockdown, I think such people can't survive without liquor. (sic)â Socialist Deepika Padukone contributing to the States Treasury in lockdown, I think such people can't survive withoâ¦ https://t.co/QqUPRk1xbC— Ravindra Vishnu Laxmi Sankpal (@v_sankpal) 1588836563000It is also circulating on instant-messaging platform WhatsApp with same claim

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral message misinforms readers about boosting pH levels to beat coronavirus
Body: A message doing the rounds on instant-messaging platform WhatsApp claims that coronavirus can be defeated if people start consuming certain foods as per pH-levels. The message claims that pH levels for coronavirus varies between 5.5 and 8.5. Therefore in order to beat coronavirus, one needs to consume alkaline-rich foods that are above the pH levels of the virus. The message mentions lemon, lime, avocado, tangerine, dandelion, etc among the many high pH level foods that have pH levels higher than coronavirus. The message is being circulated in both English and Hindi. Hereâs the screengrab of the WhatsApp message in English

Header: FAKE ALERT: Twitter accounts under the name of Nobel Prize winner Abhijit Banerjee are fake
Body: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee on Tuesday discussed economic issues with Congress leader and MP Rahul Gandhi. After the discussion got over, two Twitter accounts surfaced under the name of Abhijit Banerjee. Just when they were becoming a topic of discussion, these accounts got suspended. A photo of Banerjee with his wife and Nobel laureate Esther Duflo was tweeted on the very first day by the handle @AbhijitBanerj. It was shared with a text that read, âA little while but finally on Twitter today.â The bio of the account read, âAn economist, Nobel Laureate. Official Twitter handle. Profile managed by me. Email - banerjee@mit.eduâ giving an impression that it was the official handle of Banerjee. The handle gained around 27k followers on the first day itself. Hereâs the screengrab of the account The other account posing as Banerjeeâs also managed few followers.

Header: FAKE ALERT: News of Hindu monk infecting 300 people with coronavirus is fake
Body: Screengrab of a Hindi news clipping doing rounds on social media platform Twitter claims that a Hindu saintâs chillum made 300 people âCovid-19 positiveâ in Jaipur. According to the news report, a Hindu priest living in a temple with other priests in the Transport Nagar area of Jaipur created an entire chain of coronavirus cases in the city. "One of the Covid-positive monks in Jaipur's temple spread coronavirus to devotees visiting the temple and others through his habit of smoking chillum,â states the news report. According to the report published on April 25, 2020, the Hindu priest was habitual of smoking and used to sell milk. The report also says that after he tested positive for coronavirus, priests living with him and families who bought milk from him have been quarantined. Header: FAKE ALERT: No, a Hindu woman was not attacked by RSS workers for cooking sehri for a Muslim woman
Body: A collage of two photos is being circulated on social media platforms with a claim that RSS men attacked an old Hindu woman because she prepared the early morning sehri for a young Muslim woman recently. The first image in the collage shows a woman standing beside a girl eating food and the second image shows a woman with a wounded nose. The claim insinuates that the woman standing in the first photo is the one with a wounded nose. Twitter user Ali Raza Hashmi made the claim with a text that reads, âTHE RSS Terrorist has attacked on a Hindu woman who attempt sehri for a muslim Kashmiri girl in recent days. India is occupied by RSS.they have full control over media,judiciary,law enforcement & national securitie.(sic)â THE RSS Terrorist has attacked on a Hindu woman who attempt sehri for a muslim Kashmiri girl in recent days.Indiaâ¦ https://t.co/XdFoHcd0Qa— Ali Raza Hashmi ð¿Ø¹ÙÛ Ø±Ø¶Ø§ ÛØ§Ø´ÙÛ (@Ali_Raza_Hashmi) 1588059271000Another user by the name of Aga Syed Arshad Hussain shared the collage with similar claim. The RSS goons has attacked on a Hindu woman who attempt sehri for a muslim #Kashmiri_girl in recent days.â¦ https://t.co/zCFDtf2Yjo— Aga Syed Arshad Hussain (@AgaSyedArshad1) 1588069699000Congress activist Priyanka Jha had made the same claim on Twitter. Her tweet now stands deleted.

Header: FAKE ALERT: TISS professors falsely blamed for rescuing Palghar lynching accused
Body: Photo of a woman and a man is being shared on social networking platforms Facebook and Twitter with the claim that these two "husband-wife duo" are trying to secure bail for those accused of lynching the Hindu saints in Palghar. As per the claim made by several social media users, the name of the duo is Pradeep Prabhu alias Peter Dimelo and Siraj Balsara, and both of them are trying to ensure that the police doesnât torture the criminals involved.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did this female Indian doctor die because of coronavirus?
Body: Photo of a woman is being circulated on social networking platform Facebook with a claim that she is a 28-year-old doctor named Manisha Patil, who died of coronavirus in Maharashtra. Some posts are claiming that Patil examined and cured a total of 188 coronavirus patients, but when it came to our own health, she could not save herself. The two photos being shared with the posts show a female doctor and a hospital room in which two mask-wearing people are seen.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Letter claiming closure of hotels till October 15, 2020 not from Tourism Ministry
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are circulating a letter which claims that all the hotels, restaurants and resorts across India will remain closed till October 15, 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic. The letter which claims that the directive has come from the 'Indian tourism department' also carries the logo of Ministry of Tourism to make the letter look like one issued by the ministry. The first sentence of the the letter doesn't make any sense. It says, "As order by the tourism govt. of India the information came that all tourism department of India (sic)." The second sentence says, "Hotels, restaurants, resorts all over India will remain closed till 15-October 2020 due to coronavirus disease spread all over the world," and "The order directly came from Indian tourism department." Here is the letter: An alert Times Fact Check reader sent us the letter on our WhatsApp number asking if the claims made in it are correct, and forwarded a message, written in Hindi, he received along with the letter.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Attack on sanitation workers falsely passed off as BJP men beating Muslim youth
Body: A disturbing video of a man being attacked is being shared with a claim that BJP âgoonsâ are torturing Muslim youth in Madhya Pradesh (MP) during lockdown. The 20-second-long video shows a group of men beating a man with lathis, pulling his hair, while he cries in pain. The Nadia district Congress media coordinator who goes by the name of Safi Mallick on Facebook shared the video with a caption that reads, âSee how the BJP goons are torturing a Muslim youth in the name of lock down in Madhya Pradesh.â

Header: FAKE ALERT: Still from Parzania movie shared to falsely claim ‘RSS men are terrorists’
Body: An image is being circulated across social media platforms and instant messaging app WhatsApp with a claim that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) is a terrorist organisation. The photo shows a mob of saffron-clothed men wielding swords and attacking an unarmed man. The image is being shared with a caption that reads, âThe RSS are terrorists. Now they control govt of India (sic)â. A Times Fact Check reader sent the same image to us on our WhatsApp number. She wanted to know if the claim made with it was true. A verified Twitter handle by the name of Khaled Beydoun posted the same image with a similar claim. His tweet now stands deleted.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did a Pakistan Navy ship intercept, damage an Indian ship recently?
Body: Pakistani journalist Moeed Peerzada, who has over 2 million followers on Twitter, shared a video showing a navy ship coming dangerously close to another, the former ramming into the latter and sailing past, saying, "Pakistan Navy intercepts and rams Indian ship in Arabian Sea?" CAUTION: VIDEO CONTAINS EXPLETIVESPakistan Navy intercepts and rams Indian ship in Arabian Sea? https://t.co/nkNHnV7aw2— Moeed Pirzada (@MoeedNj) 1586804122000The same video is being circulated widely on WhatsApp with a message saying, "A rare incident: Close encounter today of Pakistan Naval Ship (PNS - 182) with Indian Naval Ship (INS - Talwar) off Gujarat Coast." An alert Times Fact Check reader sent the video to us asking if the claims made are true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Libya shared claiming bodies of Covid-19 patients are thrown into sea
Body: A graphic video of multiple bodies floating ashore is being circulated on WhatsApp with a claim that bodies of those who died due to Covid-19 infection are being thrown into the sea. The text shared with the video warns people against consuming fish or any other seafood as the consumer may end up contracting coronavirus. A loose translation of the Hindi text shared with the video reads, âDo not eat any seafood because the corpses of corona patients have been thrown into the sea. The same bodies will be eaten by fish so when you consume the same fish, think what will happen to you.â Hereâs the screengrab of the query Times Fact Check received on its WhatsApp number. The reader wanted to know if the claim was true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leader shares photo from Pakistan to criticize lockdown in India
Body: Congress leader and spokesperson Americai V Narayanan tweeted a photo of kids with severely cracked feet to criticize the ongoing nationwide lockdown in India to combat the spread of Covid-19. His tweet implied that the photo is a recent one from India. A loose translation (as per Twitter auto-translate) of the text in Tamil that Narayanan tweeted along with the image reads, âBringing in people who were on the plane. Because they are not handled properly. People's feet are hard to beat. Not in the word! (sic)â. Narayanan tweeted this with hashtags #unplannedlockdown #LockdownWithoutPlan. à®µà®¿à®®à®¾à®©à®¤à¯à®¤à®¿à®²à¯ à®µà®¨à¯à®¤à®µà®°à¯à®à®³à¯ à®à¯à®£à¯à®à¯ à®µà®¨à¯à®¤ #à®à¯à®°à¯à®©à®¾à®µà¯à®°à®¸à¯ à®à®°à®¿à®¯à®¾à® à®à¯à®¯à®¾à®³à®ªà¯à®ªà®à®¾à®¤à®¤à®¾à®²à¯à®à®à®¿à®¤à¯à®¤à®à¯à®à¯ à®®à®à¯à®à®³à®¿à®©à¯ à®à®¾à®²à¯à®à®³à¯ à®ªà®à¯à®®à¯ à®à®·à¯à®à®®à¯ à®à¯â¦ https://t.co/PknaPXqVmy— Americai V Narayanan 'à®à®®à¯à®°à®¿à®à¯à®à¯' à®µà®¿ à®¨à®¾à®°à®¾à®¯à®£à®©à¯ (@americai) 158702571700

Header: FAKE ALERT: Still from TV series viral saying it shows doctors, nurses dead in Italy
Body: A photo showing nurses and doctors dead inside an ICU is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp along with a message that claims that over 200 doctors and nurses died in Italy due to Covid-19 pandemic. The message that is being shared along with the photo says, "Over 200 doctor's and nurse's dead in Italy ðGod please protect the world from this COVID-19 virus (sic)." The image has been in circulation since March 2020 itself. Here's an example:An alert Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us over WhatsApp with the same image and same caption asking if the image is indeed from Italy.

In A Shocking Incident, Mother In UP Throws 5 Children Into River. She said that she had no food for her children & that she was a daily wage earner & her work stopped during lockdown (sic),â tweeted Bhushan.
