She was unable to feed the children due to the lock down. @cpimlliberation Looked at the pictures and videos on the handle of the poor today, playing a plate against hunger in the village settlements of the country, expressing outrage (sic).â UP à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¤ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¹à¤¾à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤®à¤à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤®à¤¾à¤ à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ 5 à¤¬à¤à¥à¤à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¨à¤¦à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤«à¥à¤à¤à¤à¤° à¤à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¹à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤¶à¤¿à¤¶ à¤à¥. à¤²à¥à¤ à¤¡à¤¾à¤à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤µà¤à¤¼à¤¹ à¤¸à¥ à¤µà¤¹ à¤¬à¤à¥à¤à¥à¤â¦ https://t.co/KXDozyIZDa— Kavita Krishnan (@kavita_krishnan) 1586703541000While putting out her views in the video, Krishnan did not share link of any news report to back her claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Social media abuzz with a post falsely attributed to Ratan Tata
Body: A 'motivational' post is being circulated on social media with the claim that Tata Group's former chairman Ratan Tata has penned it. Titled 'Very motivational at this hour', the content in the post revolves around coronavirus, warning people against predicting economic doom amidst the pandemic. It bears the name of Ratan Tata and also carries his photo. Here's the post: Actor Arshad Warsi too shared the post and tweeted, "After all the depressing news, came across something so true and motivating. My level of respect for Mr Ratan Tata is inexplicable..." After all the depressing news, came across something so true and motivating. My level of respect for Mr Ratan Tataâ¦ https://t.co/NGXQiyrKCf— Arshad Warsi (@ArshadWarsi) 1586568999000The same post is doing the rounds across other social media platforms like WhatsApp, Facebook and Reddit.

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FAKE ALERT: Video of Hindu saint beating policeman is fake
Body: Video of a man wearing a saffron robe attacking a man in a police uniform is being shared claiming that this is what is happening with Indian police personnel. In the video, the man who comes across as a âsaadhuâ (saint) can be seen strangulating the man in police uniform until the latter falls unconscious. The video was sent to Times Fact Check on its WhatsApp number by a reader, who wanted to know if such an incident indeed happened.

Header: FACT CHECK: Was this poem about ‘staying at home’ written in 1869?
Body: A poem that talks about self-isolation and staying at home is being circulated on social media platforms with a claim that it was a prophetic poem written way back in 1869 and was reprinted during 1919 pandemic. The poem is being reshared in context of Covid-19 pandemic emphasizing on how it is a timeless poem that taught everyone the value of âstaying at homeâ. This poem written in 1869, reprinted during 1919 Pandemic. https://t.co/G9B0D9W9eH— Jitendra K Biswal â¿ (@JBiswal) 1586325804000The postâs caption reads, âHistory repeats itself. Came across this poem written in 1869, reprinted during 1919 Pandemic. This is timeless.â

Header: FAKE ALERT: No Supreme Court order prohibiting citizens from sharing Covid-19 updates
Body: A message that is going viral on WhatsApp claims that the Supreme Court of India has made an order saying sharing updates on Covid-19 on social media and WhatsApp is a punishable offence and that WhatsApp admins should watch out for police action. The message is being shared across regions and languages along with a link to a report published on Live Law website about the Centre seeking the Supreme Court to direct media to avoid publishing Covid-19 information 'without first ascertaining facts with the government'. Here's what the message says: "Group admin is requested to close group for 2days as police can take action against admin & group members vide section 68, 140 & 188 if anyone even by mistake post joke on corona. Everyone could be in trouble. Hence I draw the attention of group admin to take necessary steps. Dear All, Mandate for All: Tonight 12 ( midnight) onwards Disaster Management Act has been implemented across the country. According to this update, apart from the Govt department no other citizen is allowed to post any update or share any forward related to Corona virus and it being punishable offence. Group Admins are requested to post the above update and inform the groups. Please adhere this strictly." The above message is being circulated on WhatsApp along with the link to  this report on Live Law. Many Times Fact Check readers sent the above message to us on our WhatsApp number asking if the many claims made in the message are true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Two month old visuals of fire at Solapur Airport tweeted after 9 pm candlelight vigil
Body: Several media portals, Congress worker and influencers including fact checkers and celebrated TV anchors, among many others, tweeted and retweeted visuals of a fire incident claiming they were from a fire accident caused due to burning of firecrackers in Solapur after PM Modiâs call for 9 pm candlelight vigil on Sunday. Some of the screengrabs and tweets of the media outlets sharing these visuals Fire breaks out at Solapur Airport in Maharashtra, local media blames firecrackers during #9pm9minutes campaign. https://t.co/UJKlxRGa3h— Janta Ka Reporter (@JantaKaReporter) 1586110711000A celebrated journalist tweeted one of the videos above and said, âNow fire breaks out in Solapur tooâ. After the tweet went viral, he deleted it. Congress worker Srivatsa too was caught by an alert Twitter user quote-tweeting same visuals with similar claim. Congree IT cell @srivatsayb shares video from march 3rd to spread fake news https://t.co/j4Sgovh9cU— Shreeharsha Perla (@harshaperla) 1586110145000Hereâs the tweet from where Srivatsa sourced the visuals. Srivatsaâs tweet now stands deleted. à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤° à¤¬à¥à¤°à¥à¤à¤¿à¤à¤ :- à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¥à¤° à¤µà¤¿à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤à¤³ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤¸à¤°à¤¾à¤¤ à¤ªà¥à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¤¾ à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤²à¥ à¤à¤. - à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¥ à¤²à¤¾à¤µà¤£à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤µà¥à¤³à¥à¤¦à¤°à¤®à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨ à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤²à¥ à¤­à¥à¤·à¤£ à¤à¤.- à¤à¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/BrkgqhhXBW— sagar surawase (@sagarsurawase) 158610489000

Header: FAKE ALERT: December 2019 video of Rahul, Priyanka shared claiming they flouted Covid-19 lockdown
Body: A video showing a car in which Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra could be seen travelling being stopped by police is viral with a claim that they flouted Covid-19 lockdown. The message that is being shared along with the video on WhatsApp reads, "Look whose violating Sec 144, while preaching to everyone else in the world (sic)." An alert Times Fact Check reader sent us the video on our WhatsApp number and asked if the claim being made is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral message about lockdown in phases has nothing to do with WHO
Body: A message that is going viral on WhatsApp claims that the World Health Organisation (WHO) has a 'procedure and protocol' for lockdown and that India is only in the second phase of it as of now. Here's what the message says: 'WORLD HEALTH ORGANISATION PROTOCOL&PROCEDURE OF LOCKDOWN PERIODS FOR CONTROLLING ON MOST DANGEROUS VIRUS STEP 1 - 1 DAY. STEP 2- 21 DAYS. AFTER 5 DAYS. STEP 3- 28 DAYS. AFTER 5 DAYS. STEP 4 - 15 DAYS. The same way, our Indian governments are follow: MAR22-1 DAY ( TRIAL LOCKDOWN) MAR24-APR14 - 21 DAYS(FIRST LOCKDOWN) APRIL15- APRIL19 - RELAX FROM LOCKDOWN. APR20 - MAY 18 - 28DAYS(SECOND LOCKDOWN) Incase Covid19 patient ratio is Zero, withdraw the LOCKDOWN. Otherwise, May19 - May 24 - Relax from LOCKDOWN. May 25 - June 10 - 15 days (FINAL LOCKDOWN). NEED TO CHECK OUT ON THIS PROTOCOL, KEEP YOURSELF MENTALLY PREPARED (sic). Many alert Times Fact Check users sent the message to us on our WhatsApp number asking if WHO indeed issued such a protocol.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of undertrial in Maharashtra shared as a Tablighi Jamaat markaz attendee's
Body: A video showing a man spitting on a policeman sitting opposite to him inside what looks like a police van is being shared with a claim that the man in question is a Tablighi Jamaat markaz attendee. Times Fact Check received the video on its WhatsApp number from a few alert readers , who asked us if we could find the truth behind the video and if the claim is indeed true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Report of Amit Shah making Kashmir ‘Hindu majority’ is fake
Body: A screengrab of what looks like a Hindustan Times news report is doing the rounds on social media. It claims that home minister Amit Shah is against Kashmir retaining its Muslim majority and wants to alter its demography. âHow can we allow one state to have Muslim majority population when whole India is Hindu majority, we will change kashmir demography in just 4 years, Amit Shah tells VHP cadre,â reads the headline of the report. The report is dated April 1, 2020. A reader wanted to know the authenticity of the screenshot and shared it with us on our WhatsApp number. We also found tweets having same text as the one in the report. "How can we allow one state to have Muslim majority population when whole India is Hindu majority, we will changeâ¦ https://t.co/ueCzltu4az— Basit (@basit_raja1) 158584839700

Header: FAKE ALERT: News anchor falsely claims Tirupati temple shut after Tablighi fiasco
Body: News anchor Sakshi Joshi, currently with News 24, in a tweet, claimed that Tirupati Tirumala temple âquietly shutâ as a result of the ongoing Tablighi Jamaat fiasco in Nizamuddin, Delhi. Sharing an India Today news report dated March 31, 2020, Joshi claimed now that âTablighi Jamaat is on targetâ, Tirupati Temple (authorities) must have seen that and thus âsecretlyâ closed thinking no one will know. âNow these guys have also done us a big favour by closing,â she said. Joshi also claimed that despite closing the temple, prayers will still go on in âseclusionâ. She wondered why the âpoojaâ has not stopped. à¤à¤²à¥ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¥à¤à¤¨à¥ à¤­à¥ à¤à¤¹à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤° à¤¦à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤à¤¿à¤°à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤®à¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤° à¤¬à¤à¤¦ à¤à¤°à¤à¥ à¥¤ à¤¦à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤à¤¾ #TablighiJamaat à¤à¤¾à¤°à¤à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤° à¤¹à¥à¥¤ à¤¹à¤® à¤à¥à¤ªà¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤¦ à¤à¤°à¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/XlDyFKXG0L— Sakshi Joshi (@sakshijoshii) 1585716135000Responding to a Twitter user, Joshi said that 50 sub-temples in Tirupati, that were still functioning, will also be closed now. @FrustIndian à¤¸à¤®à¤ à¤à¤ à¤¤à¥à¤®à¥à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤ªà¤¢à¤¼à¤¨à¥ à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤¤à¥ à¤à¤¦à¥à¤® à¤¸à¥ à¤­à¥ à¤¨à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤²à¥à¤µà¤² à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤²à¥¤ 31 à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¬à¤° à¤¹à¥à¥¤ 50 subâ¦ https://t.co/g5BmyFfx3U— Sakshi Joshi (@sakshijoshii) 158574784100

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, WhatsApp group admins were not detained for Covid-19 fake news
Body: A message that is being heavily circulated on WhatsApp claimed that administrators of 52 WhatsApp groups were detained at Dadar Cyber Crime police station for spreading misleading news about coronavirus pandemic. The message read, "Beware of the following reason. 52 group admins are now at dadar cyber crime police station. For having misleadingfowards in the group. A case is being registered against every admin. U will get bail at police station but have to fight in criminal court with a jail term from 1 to 5 years. No explanation accepted as Admin I did not see it or did not knew the authenticity, or did not knew it was forwarded. So kindly bear it. (sic)" The message had a second part to it which said, "All honorable members of the group are informed that right now any post related to Corona virus has been declared a punishable offense by the Central Government, only a government agency can post on Corona. In case of wrong post or message, action will be taken against the members of the entire group including the group administrator by registering a lawsuit under the IT Act, so keep in mind be safe! (sic)," and is attributed to one Ravi Nayak, Principal Secretary, Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India. Many Times Fact Check readers got in touch with us on our WhatsApp number asking if the claims made in the message are true.

Header: Pakistan PM Imran Khan claims PM Modi apologised for lockdown, Pak media corrects him
FAKE ALERT: No plan to extend coronavirus lockdown by a week, clarifies Cabinet Secretary
Body: A news report put out by a digital media organisation claimed that the nationwide lockdown Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced to combat the spread of Covid-19 infection could be extended by a week. PM Modi, in an address to the nation, announced a nationwide lockdown on March 24, 2020. The 'Exclusive' report titled, 'Modi govt could extent coronavirus lockdown by a week a migrant exodus triggers alarm', claimed that the possible extension of the lockdown is because 'the migrant exodus from national capital may have partly defeated its purpose'. The report attributed various quotes to multiple officials 'familiar with the situation' without naming them. It said that one of these officials is a member of the Covid-19 task force. The report also said that while one official said that the lockdown could be extended by a week, the other two officials were of the opinion that a two-month lockdown would be needed to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus Covid-19.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Leading digital news portal falsely claims India in Stage 3 of Covid-19
Body: A leading digital news website put out a news report with a claim that India is now in Stage-3 of Covid-19 transmission. Stage-3 is called 'community transmission' when a person who has no travel history contracts the infection through domestic sources. The website made this claim quoting Dr Girdhar Gyani, a man it described as a doctor who is a part of some Covid-19 hospital task force, an initiative by Niti Aayog. Quoting Gyani, the website claimed that the community transmission of coronavirus in India has begun but the government is not making it public. Hereâs the screengrab of he report

Header: FACT CHECK: Media reports claim 40 crore Indians will contract coronavirus
Body: Several media houses (not Times of India) in India carried news reports that claimed that India is set to witness a huge spike in coronavirus cases, with as many as 40 crore Indians contracting the virus eventually. These media portals attributed their claims to a Center for Disease Dynamics, Economics & Policy (CDDEP)-Johns Hopkins University report. Here are screengrabs of some of the reports by these media houses:

Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored bulletin circulated to claim PM Modi ordered internet shutdown
Body: A âBREAKING NEWSâ bulletin, with PM Modiâs image in it, is being shared across social media platforms to claim that he has ordered an internet shutdown in the country owing to rumours regarding coronavirus being circulated on social media. à¤à¤ à¤°à¤¾à¤¤ 12 à¤¬à¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥à¤ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤à¤ à¤¬à¤à¤¦ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤à¤à¤à¥....ðððð à¤à¤¬ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤¨à¤¿à¤ à¤²à¥à¤²à¥ à¤²à¥à¤à¥à¤ https://t.co/lUiSh2FdDr— manish kumar bansal (@Joshila_Manish) 1585243430000The bulletin image, which has ABP News logo on it, is doing the rounds calling the announcement âPM Modiâs message to the nationâ.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored TV headline says Amit Shah in the grip of coronavirus
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are claiming that Home Minister Amit Shah has tested positive for coronavirus using a graphic card that is made to look like a sreengrab taken from a television channel. A screengrab of a Facebook post is being shared widely on WhatsApp. The caption of the post in Hindi translates to, "Modi Ji, tell us this is true," along with a graphic card that comes across as a screengrab taken from Aaj Tak television channel's screen. The screengrab looks like it was taken when a news was breaking saying in Hindi what translates to, "Home Minister Amit Shah in the grip of corona" and "He was in Italy last week, didn't get tested on return, and hence the infection spread more." This graphic card is now being circulated on WhatsApp widely with an insinuation that Shah contracted Covid-19 infection.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video from Pakistan shared as explosion in Delhi petrol pump
Body: Video of a Shell petrol pump going up in flames is being circulated within Delhi WhatsApp circles with an insinuation that it happened in the capital city of India. In the video, a man can be heard narrating the incident, saying it happened at a place called âShahdara Modâ. The video was sent to Times Fact Check on WhatsApp by a reader who wanted to know if this is indeed from Delhi.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Audio clip saying 59 new Covid-19 positive patients in Nagpur fake
Body: An audio clip in which two men could be heard talking to each other, and one of them telling the other that there are 59 new Covid-19 positive patients in Nagpur, is being shared widely on WhatsApp. The man could also be heard saying that out of the 59, three who have tested positive for coronavirus are doctors and one of the doctors has been put on the ventilator. An alert Times Fact Check reader shared the audio clip with us on our WhatsApp number and asked if the claims made by the man in the audio note are true.

Header: Fact Check: Did Indian Army set up a 1000-bed quarantine facility in Barmer?
Body: A message circulating on WhatsApp claims that Indian Army set up a 1000-bed hospital in just two days. The message shares three different pictures to back the claim. A loose translation of the Hindi text in the message reads -- âIndian Army set up a 1000-bed futuristic hospital in Barmer inside two days and handed it over to the Rajasthan government. We salute the passion of our Indian jawans.â The same set of photos is also being posted on Twitter with more or less similar claim of Indian Army readying up a 1000-bed quarantine facility keeping in view the growing number of covid-19 patients in the country. In Barmer 1000 bed hospital constructed and handed over to the government by Indian Army https://t.co/dQnl9ofGvG— Moksha (@Sickular_Bigot) 158488768100

Header: FACT CHECK: This website to get e-pass for travel during curfew is indeed by Delhi government
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users have been sharing a link to a website since this morning saying people engaged in providing essential services can apply for e-passes for travel during curfew in Delhi. The website -- https://epass.jantasamvad.org/epass/relief/english/ -- not only gives option for people to apply for an e-pass for travel during curfew in Delhi, but also has options to seek help with food, ration, Rs 5000 compensation for daily wage workers, and pension amount. Some Times Fact Check readers reached out to us asking if the website is genuine.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Order claiming 4G internet to be restored in Jammu alone is fake
Body: An order claiming 4G internet will be restored in Jammu Division of Jammu and Kashmir Union Territory (UT) is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The document that is being widely shared as the order has been made to appear as if it was issued by the Home Department, Government of Jammu and Kashmir. The content of the order says, "High-speed (4G) mobile internet services will be restored by tonight in all districts of Jammu, whereas 4G internet services suspension will continue in all districts of Kashmir till fresh assessment of the situation. However, any misuse of internet facilities will result in legal action." It also says, "The aforesaid directions shall be effective from 25th March, 2020 and will remain in force, unless modified," and is undersigned by Shaleen Kabra IAS, Principal Secretary to the Government. Here is the order:

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of couple shared as Covid-19-infected Italian doctors
Body: An Instagram page posted a photo of a young couple, with masks undone, at an airport with a claim that they are Italian doctors who contracted coronavirus infection and died. The post said, "They both were doctors from Italy. Both died serving their nation on the 8th day. Before being isolated on 8th day they kissed each other and died after half and hour. God bless their soul." The post, by now, has gotten nearly a 1,00,000 likes on Instagram and is being widely shared. The same image is being shared on Twitter, Facebook and WhatsApp with similar claims.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Saddam Hussein warn about coronavirus 30 years ago?
Body: A video of former Iraq President Saddam Hussein addressing a group of people who appear to be his army commanders is being shared with the claim that he is talking to them about how the US is planning to spread coronavirus in Iraq. A Twitter user shared the video with a caption that reads -- âListen to Saddam Hussein was in a 1990 meeting with his cabinet, telling them how America was threatening Iraq with Corona Virus (sic)â Listen to Saddam Hussein was in a 1990 meeting with his cabinet, telling them how America was threatening Iraq withâ¦ https://t.co/vrNsqShGeu— Vimal Lamic (@juction4love) 1585055833000A trimmed version of the same video is being circulated on WhatsApp with a similar claim about how prophetic Hussein was 30 years ago, since he claimed the US would spread coronavirus in Iraq. On listening to the audio of the video, one can hear Hussein mentioning âcoronavirusâ a couple of times interspersed with some other words spoken in what appears to be a foreign language.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Belgium bans 'non-essential sexual activities' to combat Covid-19? No!
Body: A website that called 'worldnewsdailyreport.com' published an article titled, 'Belgium health minister puts ban on non-essential sexual activities of persons 3 or greater in indoor areas'. The report attributes quotes to Belgium Health Minister Maggie De Block. The article claimed, "Health Minister de Block announced today that, effective immediately, ânon-essentialâ sexual activities of 3 people or more are banned in Belgium to combat the spread of COVID-19," and quoted de Block as saying, âBelgium is the beer-drinking and group sex capital of Europe, if not the world. We, as a nation, must address this situation," in Parliament. The article categorically states, "Health minister De Block did not ban single or two-person sexual practices such as masturbation, anal or oral sex, or even bestiality."

Header: Mumbaikars, Beware! This message is fake, police have not issued any such directions
FAKE ALERT: These photos have nothing to do with coronavirus in Italy
Body: The claim being made with this photo is that it is from Italy where no friends, family members or neighbours would be able to accompany you for your last rites. âThis is a viral pandemic. Before venturing out of your homes, have a close look at this photo. Be responsible!â reads the text imprinted on the photo. TRUTHThe photo is a screengrab taken from 2011-released English film Contagion. It has nothing to do with coronavirus-related deaths in Italy. VERIFICATION AND METHODOLOGYA simple reverse-image search led us to the review of the film Contagion posted on a website named Basement Rejects. The review published on January 14, 2014 carried the same photo as screengrab from the film. The film bears eerie similarities with the current coronavirus outbreak. It is about healthcare professionals, government officials and everyday people finding themselves in the midst of a pandemic. VERDICTTimes Fact Check has found that a screengrab from 2011 film Contagion is being shared with a false claim that it depicts funeral services of coronavirus victims in Italy. Photo 2CLAIMThis photo is being shared on WhatsApp with a claim that it shows unattended dead bodies lying on the streets of Italy. TRUTH

Header: FACT CHECK: Article saying PM Modi likely to declare Financial Emergency in India false
Body: An article published on a website called inventiva.co.in claiming Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to announce Emergency in India under Article 360 -- Financial Emergency -- is being circulated heavily on social media platforms. The article published on March 23, 2020, is titled 'Narendra Modi Likely To Declare A Emergency In India Under Article 360'. The article that begins by explaining what Article 360 is, ends by saying, "If no steps would be of any help to control the economy, Narendra Modi would have no option but to impose the financial emergency in India under Article 360 and the country would go in its worst and most dreaded recession of all times." PM Modi had tweeted earlier today that he will address the nation at 8 PM today 'on vital aspects relating to the menace of COVID-19.' à¤µà¥à¤¶à¥à¤µà¤¿à¤ à¤®à¤¹à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¾ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¤°à¤¸ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¢à¤¼à¤¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤à¥à¤ª à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤à¤¬à¤à¤§ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¥à¤ à¤®à¤¹à¤¤à¥à¤µà¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤£ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤¶à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¿à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤¸à¤¾à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤°à¥à¤à¤à¤¾à¥¤ à¤à¤, 2â¦ https://t.co/0k1JKqZBoq— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1585028047000The article is being circulated even more on social media platforms since PM Modi announced he'd address the nation this evening.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Covid-19 test kits shared as its vaccine
Body: Instant messaging platform WhatsApp is abuzz with a message that claims that US-based âRoche medical companyâ (Roche Diagnostics) has finally readied a coronavirus vaccine. Sharing a photo of pouches with Covid-19 IgM/IgG written on them, WhatsApp users are sharing a message that reads, âGood News for world Great news! Coronavirus vaccine ready. Able to cure patient. Hats off to US scientist. right now Trump announced that Roche medical company will launch the vaccine next Sunday and millions of doses are ready from it!!!! (sic)â Times Fact Check received the message from a number of readers on its WhatsApp number. These readers wanted to know if the message was authentic.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Russia does not have lions roaming the streets to keep people indoors
Body: Many social media users are sharing a graphic card with an image of a lion, that looks like a screen grab from a television news channel, claiming that Russia has unleashed over 500 lions on its streets to ensure people stay indoors in the light of the coronavirus pandemic and the lockdown. The graphic card has text saying, "Russia unleashed more than 500 lions on its streets to ensure that people are staying indoors during this pandemic outbreak. Vladmir Putin released around 500 lions to make people stay indoors (sic)." Some other social media users are sharing the image of the lion alone, without the 'Breaking News' graphics, making similar claims. For instance, Twitter user who goes by the handle '@Mavunya_' tweeted the image of the lion saying, "Russian president Vladimir Putin released 800 lions and tigers across Russia to devour anyone who comes out. Stay home or die hard." Both these images are being shared widely on Facebook and WhatsApp as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this woman is not Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's wife
Body: A video of a woman talking about having contracted Covid-19 is being widely shared with a claim that it is Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's wife Sophie Trudeau. In the video she filmed from inside an Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of a hospital, the woman says, "If anyone is thinking of taking any chances, just take a look at me. I am in the Intensive Care Unit." She urges people who smoke to quit saying,'You need your lungs.' Many Times Fact Check readers sent us the video on our WhatsApp number 85270 01433 along with the message they received with the video saying, "The Canadian PMâs wife. For people who are still not taking it seriously," and asked if the woman in the video is indeed Sophie Trudeau. Many Facebook users are sharing the video claiming the woman in the video is Sophie. The same video is being shared with the same claim on Twitter as well. Sophie Trudeau. (wife of Canada ð¨ð¦ PM ) - Her message https://t.co/K2O0aGdsrJ— Hena sadiq Haider (@HenaSadiq) 158477114100

Header: FAKE ALERT: False News being spread with TOI links
Body: Many WhatsApp users are sharing TOI.in links along with messages that contain false information. One such false message says, "All indian citizens are entitled to Rs 7000 per week to stay at home to avoid the spread of COVID-19 novel choronavirus starting from 16 March 2020. The government grant pay is accessible to all no matter your employment status. Read full article here on how to claim (sic)," along with a link -- https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/thumb/msid-51056656,width-800,height-600,resizemode-4/51056656.jpg -- to make it look like the source of the information is Times of India. Another false message says, "BREAKING NEWS - Modi Govt announces slew of measures to tackle Coronovirus including paid leave, free meals, 25000 rupees per person, Income Taxes and EMIs waived off (sic)," shared along with a link -- https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/thumb/msid-51056656,width-800,height-600,resizemode-4/51056656.jpg -- to give an impression that the source of the false information is a Times of India report. When users click on these links, they are taken to a Times of India web page but one that had an image of comedian Kapil Sharma. This is what users were getting on their screens when they clicked on these links - Fake-news peddlers used a legitimate TOI.in link to a report on Kapil Sharma and redirected the link to an image of him taken from the story titled, '7 things you need to know about Kapil Sharma's new show'. The image seen below is of the main story and the image above was what the fake news-peddlers were linking to. The picture above was part of the main story. TOI has now replaced the Kapil sharma image fake-news peddlers were linking to with the message below to alert readers that they are being fooled

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral audio clip with conversation claiming 'complete lockdown' fake
Body: A 8.34-minute long audio clip, in which two men could be talking to each other and one of them claiming that there will be a 'complete lockdown' of the country in light of the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, is being circulated widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp. In the audio clip, one of the men, who claims to a friend of 'WHO India Director Saurabh', also claims that he got to know from 'Saurabh' that there will be a 'complete lockdown' of the country from April 15 to June 15, 2020, since as per WHO, the coronavirus pandemic situation in India is critical. This audio clip is being shared widely by many WhatsApp users assuming the claims made in it are true. A few Times Fact Check readers got in touch with us on our WhatsApp number, forwarding this audio clip, asking if the claim made about the 'complete lockdown' is true.

Header: FACT CHECK: WHO WhatsApp number being shared widely is genuine
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are sharing a number-- +41798931892 -- and a contact card along with a message saying the number belongs to the World Health Organization and that WHO will send latest updates about on the coronavirus pandemic on your WhatsApp number. The message shared along with the number also urges people to add the number to their contacts and send a 'Hi' to get direct updates from WHO. Many Times Fact Check readers got in touch with us on our WhatsApp number asking if the number indeed belongs to WHO.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Audio clip about coronavirus wrongly attributed to Dr Devi Shetty
Body: An audio note in which a man, presumably a doctor, could be heard speaking about coronavirus, its symptoms, and advising Indians not to get tested until the eighth or ninth day of showing certain symptoms is being widely circulated on WhatsApp. The audio clip is being circulated along with a claim saying, "Devi Prasad Shetty is an Indian cardiac surgeon and entrepreneur. He is chairman and founder of Narayana Health, a chain of 21 medical centers in India." A WhatsApp user reached out to Times Fact Check on our WhatsApp number 85270 01433 to know if it's true. The same is being shared on Facebook as well.   In the audio clip, a man could be heard detailing symptoms Covid-19-infected people may get.

Header: FACT CHECK: This press release is from PMO Malaysia, not India
Body: A press release from National Security Council (NSC), Prime Ministerâs Office (PMO) is being shared widely on WhatsApp by Indian users of the platform, assuming it is from PMO India. The press release dated March 18, 2020, mentions that the government has declared a Restricted Movement Order from March 18 to 31, 2020, in view of the coronavirus pandemic. âTo ensure the effectiveness of the order, the general public is advised to stay home at all times except to fulfill basic needs. Apart from that, please practice social distancing to prevent being infected by COVID-19â mentions the press release. Here are some of the screen grabs of the WhatsApp messages as received by the Times Fact Check and its team members: None of the forwards categorically claim it to be from PMO India, but the header of the document combined with the missing âundersignedâ makes many presume it is from the PMO India.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Hong Kong shared as China clamping down on coronavirus suspects
Body: A video is doing rounds on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that Chinese police are facing a hard time trying to nab coronavirus suspects fleeing from quarantine. The three-minute-long video shows frightening visuals of men in police uniform chasing and apprehending citizens in what appears to be a platform of a metro station. The citizens, visibly panic-stricken, can also be seen running helter-skelter and evading men in uniform. Some are also seen rushing inside the metro coaches, crying and fearing for their lives.   The video is being shared on Facebook with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to -- âWe are sitting here and cracking jokes on WhatsApp and Facebook about coronavirus. But if you want to see the real havoc created by coronavirus, then watch this video from China. Not once, not twice, but watch it thrice and watch carefully. To catch the people trapped in the grip of this pandemic, how many difficulties the police administration is facing.â A Times Fact Check reader shared the same video with the same caption with us on our WhatsApp number. The reader wanted to know if the information was correct.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, people quarantined in Italy did not sing Pakistan's national anthem
Body: American comedian Jeremy McLellan tweeted a video saying, "This is so beautiful. A whole neighborhood in Italy sings the Pakistani National Anthem while theyâre on lockdown." The video McLellan tweeted has CBS News logo on the top-left corner and 'Naples, Italy' written on the top-right corner. This is so beautiful. A whole neighborhood in Italy sings the Pakistani National Anthem while theyâre on lockdown. https://t.co/N4qxkhd8d5— Jeremy McLellan (@JeremyMcLellan) 1584367771000In a subsequent tweet, he shared an article to a Pakistani website that used his tweet to say Pakistan's national anthem was sung by people quarantined in their homes in Italy's Naples due to the coronavirus outbreak, saying, "What have I done". what have i done https://t.co/F28FfOsuMN— Jeremy McLellan (@JeremyMcLellan) 1584449625000It looks like McLellan did not mean what he wrote in the initial tweet.

Header: FACT CHECK: Will banks block accounts of those not having ‘NPR document’?
Body: A photo of what looks like a notice is doing rounds on social media platform Facebook with a claim that from April 1, 2020, banks will seek documents from the National Population Register (NPR) and those not in possession of these documents will have their accounts blocked. The photo that is being widely shared advises depositors to withdraw all their money from banks before March 31, 2020.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Notice declaring holidays in 4 Indian states due to coronavirus is fake
Body: Amid growing fear of coronavirus across the country, a memorandum is doing rounds on WhatsApp under the name of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. According to this memorandum, the government of India has declared holidays in Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim from March 14 to March 21, 2020 to contain the spread of coronavirus disease. The notification says that these holidays are mandatory to all schools, colleges, educational institutes, workplaces having more than 10 employees present at a given time and the statutory and local bodies of the state. The notice undersigned by some Rajendra Kumar (mentioned as union secretary for government of India) warns that a fine of Rs 5000/- per day will be levied on those defying the order. Times Fact Check received the same memorandum on its WhatsApp number 8527001433 from a reader who wanted to know if it was authentic.

Header: FAKE ALERT: These photos of atrocities against Hindus are from Bangladesh, not Bengal
Body: A Facebook user by the name of âChandan Bjpâ shared three different photos to claim that Hindus were under attack from Rohingya immigrants under the rule of Mamata Banerjee-led TMC government in West Bengal. The first photo posted by Chandan showed a desecrated idol of goddess Durga. The second photo showed a commotion outside what appears to be a wrecked house. The last photo showed some wailing women. The photos were shared with a text in Hindi that closely translates to, âThis is the condition of Hindu temples in Bengal. Rohingya people have made life difficult for the Hindu brothers in Bengal. Now it is up to you to think whether youâre with Mamata didi or Modi ji.â   Two of these photos were also posted by a Twitter user with the same claim. à¤¯à¥ à¤¹à¤¾à¤² à¤¹à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤à¤¾à¤² à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤®à¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾à¥¤ à¤°à¥à¤¹à¤¿à¤à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤à¤¾à¤² à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¥à¤¨à¤¾ à¤®à¥à¤¶à¥à¤à¤¿à¤² à¤à¤° à¤°à¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤à¤ªà¤à¥ à¤¹à¥â¦ https://t.co/Hxv7QdIQMz— NationFirst #Saffron (@NationFirst0006) 158393945700

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2015 Khap order against Dalit sisters shared claiming it happened under Yogi government
Body: A Hindi newspaper clipping about a decree from a khap panchayat in Uttar Pradesh (UP) is being shared with a claim that it happened under CM Yogi Adityanathâs watch. The report talks about an incident from Baghpat, UP, where a decree was reportedly issued by a khap panchayat - to rape two Dalit sisters and then parade them naked on streets. A Twitter user by the name of âShahnawaz Ansariâ posted the news clipping to attack Yogi government in UP. Ansari, in his tweet, said, âHearty congratulations to Dalit brothersâ. Hereâs the screengrab of the tweet The tweet now stands deleted but its content was picked by other Twitter users who shared the same news clipping making similar claims. à¤¯à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤°à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤à¤ªà¤¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾à¤ª à¤ªà¤à¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¤ à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤ à¤«à¥à¤¸à¤²à¤¾ à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¹à¥, à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤®à¥ 2 à¤¦à¤²à¤¿à¤¤ à¤¬à¤¹à¤¨à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¥à¤ª à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤° à¤°à¥à¤ª à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦ à¤¨à¤â¦ https://t.co/TCQMIq2ayi— Amita Ambedkar (@ambedkar_amita) 158394018200

Header: FAKE ALERT: Porn video, still image from it, shared claiming it's from Shaheen Bagh
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are sharing a porn video and a still image taken from the video with a claim insinuating that it was shot at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, where people have been protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). For instance: A still image taken from this video is being shared with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "Media won't show you what kind of protest this is. Latest visual from Shaheen Bagh." Times Fact Check is not sharing the link to the video since it is graphic.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leader shares doctored image of Scindia with ‘Operation Lotus’ document in hand
Body: On a day when former Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia resigned from his party, a photo of him wearing saffron-coloured kurta, sporting tilak and holding a âOperation Lotusâ document in his hand started doing rounds on social media. Congress Municipal Councillor Yasmin Kidwai posted the photo, in her bid to attack Scindia for prioritizing personal growth over ideology. Tagging Scindia, Kidwai tweeted, âHow can a congress person join bjp -personal growth is understandable but ideology ? And if u donât have even that then how does it matter where u go Such a disappointment (sic)â. How can a congress person join bjp -personal growth is understandable but ideology ? And if u donât have even thatâ¦ https://t.co/zFQtM8W5MT— Yasmin Kidwai (@YasminKidwai) 1583824484000Lotus being BJPâs election symbol, the tweet was probably made to insinuate that Scindia was insidiously working on his project to topple Congress government in Madhya Pradesh (MP) and replace it with the BJP government.

Header: FAKE ALERT: News of Baba Ramdev overdosing on cow urine to prevent coronavirus is fake
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Raza Pathan posted a photo of Yoga guru Baba Ramdev to claim that he had to be admitted in AIIMS after he overdosed on cow urine to prevent coronavirus.   The photo had a frail-looking Ramdev on a hospital bed, surrounded by a group of doctors. A loose translation of the caption in Hindi that Pathan gave to the photo reads -- âSalwar-fame Baba Ramdev admitted to AIIMS, doctor says that he consumed cow's urine in order to avoid coronavirus.â Several other Facebook users shared the same photo with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: News of Muslim girl gangraped by Hindu mobs in Delhi fake
Body: A news website by the name of Republic of Buzz published a report on March 1, 2020 claiming that a 13-year-old Muslim girl Deeba from Jafrabad area of North-East Delhi was raped by Hindu mobs during the recent violence between the two communities. Titled âHindu Mobs Gang Raped 13 Year Old Muslim Girl In Jaffrabad Delhiâ, the report claims that a charged Hindu mob stormed into Deebaâs residential colony, torching homes and rounding up Muslims. As she tried to escape, members of the Hindu mob chased Deeba through out the streets and took her to an abandoned cottage nearby where she was violated, gang-raped by at-least seven men. The Hindu men also forced her for oral sex and sodomy, the report mentions. Among many Indian Twitter users sharing the same news report was Asaduddin Owaisiâs AIMIM member Zuber Memon, who tweeted the report on March 1 itself. Hindu Mobs Gang Raped 13 Year Old Muslim Girl In Jaffrabad Delhi https://t.co/BUDtmCw8Nq #WorldAgainstDelhiPogrom— Zuber Memon (@ZuberMemonAIMIM) 1583063983000The report carried a face-blurred photo of a woman wearing abaya and hija

Header: FAKE ALERT: Taliban suicide bomber's photo used in context of Delhi violence
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Tiku Sahu' posted a photo of a man donning what looks like a suicide vest with a long caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "It's not for nothing that Doval was exploring lanes and bylanes when you and I were sleeping. Yesterday, National Investigation Agency (NIA), with the help of Delhi Police and Uttar Pradesh Police, raided Delhi's Seelampur and UP's Amroha and arrested 16 people. One among them was an engineering student, some were welders, and some auto-rickshaw drivers. In the raid, a rocket launcher was recovered from Seelampur, and from other regions, some 25 kilo of explosives, 150 phones, 300 SIM cards, 200 alarm clocks, iron pipes, along with Rs 8 lakh in cash were recovered. Big welding machines were being used to make pipe bombs. Suicide vests and time bombs were also found. Auto drivers were delivering these raw materials. The gang's leader said their handler is in Dubai. If you consider these 'just riots', you are very naive. This is war!" Here is the Facebook post that has already been shared over a thousand times. The post was made on March 2, 2020. The caption places the photo of the suicide bomber and a raid conducted by NIA with the help of Delhi Police and UP Police in the context of the violence that ensued in northeast Delhi from February 23, 2020. The photo is being widely shared on WhatsApp as well, along with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This teenager has nothing to do with Tahir Hussain, his supporters and Delhi violence
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are sharing a photo of a teenager with a claim that suspended Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Councillor Tahir Hussain's supporters raped and murdered her during the violence that ensued in some parts of Delhi starting February 23, 2020. A Twitter user with handle '@SANJITS14267598' shared a graphic card with a photo of a school girl saying, "India's home minister will answer why hindu girls in delhi are not safe? Will Jyoti Patidar's soul can ever get any judged ahead? The people of India always notice this. Thanks (sic)." @AmitShah#India's home minister will answer why hindu girls in delhi are not safe? Will Jyoti Patidar's soul can evâ¦ https://t.co/o2EyPJkYZx— SANJIT SARKAR. (@SANJITS14267598) 1583127876000The graphic card the user tweeted carried a photo of the teenager, identifying her as Jyoti Patidar, along with text saying, "brutally raped and rend to piece and than dumped in the canal By Tahir-Hussain goons and henchman. This is the Hindu adolescent girl on whom mayhem was unleashed by these jehadis that lead to such tormenting which is beyond repair. I am totally devastated. (sic)" An archived version of the tweet is here.The photo of the teenager is being widely circulated on social media platforms and WhatsApp with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Madhu Kishwar tweets old video from Bangladesh with ambiguous claim
Body: Author Madhu Kishwar shared a 45-second video showing many people wearing skull caps running around with sticks and hitting a few others with an ambiguous claim. Tweeting the video, she said, "Thanks to camera equipped phones in every second hand &thanks to CCTVs all over the city, we now have means to know the anatomy of riots as they happen (sic)." Thanks to camera equipped phones in every second hand &thanks to CCTVs all over the city, we now have means to knowâ¦ https://t.co/cYSVWnBHq4— MadhuPurnima Kishwar (@madhukishwar) 1583200519000An archived version of the tweet is here.Kishwar's claim comes at a time when Delhi is recovering from violence that broke out between Hindus and Muslims last week and hints that this video was shot during Delhi violence.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Rescue operations by Delhi Police falsely shared claiming cops planted petrol bombs at Tahir Hussain’s residence
Body: A photo of Delhi Police personnel helping people stuck on terraces climb down using ladders is being shared with a claim that Delhi cops made rioters climb to the terrace of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Councillor Tahir Hussainâs house to wrongly frame him for rioting. A Twitter user by the name of Afzal Raj shared the photo with a text in Hindi that loosely translates to, âDelhi police helping rioters climb to the roof Councilor Tahir Hussain's house by putting a ladder so that he can be trapped. Petrol bombs, slingshots, stones, etc are being placed on the roof to frame Hussain. Letâs all come on Twitter today at 5 pm to trend #WeSupportTahirHussain hashtag.â à¤¦à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤²à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤¦à¤à¤à¤¾à¤à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤·à¤¦ à¤¤à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤° à¤¹à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤à¤° à¤à¥ à¤à¤¤ à¤ªà¤° à¤à¤¢à¤¼à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤²à¤¿à¤¯à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤¢à¤¼à¥ à¤²à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¤à¤¾à¤à¤¿ à¤ªà¥à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤² à¤¬à¥à¤®à¥à¤¬,à¤à¥à¤²à¥à¤²,â¦ https://t.co/P55t1C0zeQ— Afzal Raj (@AfzalRaj4) 1582878169000Another Twitter user Nadeem Malik made a similar claim. #WeSupportTahirHussain Delhi Police Tahir hussain ko phasane ke liye ladder se Dangaiyo ko chat par chadate hue ,â¦ https://t.co/Lsw88PQCBf— Nadeem Malikð®ð³ð®ð³ (@nadeem_malik884) 158289759300

Header: FACT CHECK: Photo from Syria shared as one from Delhi violence; this kid is not IB officer Ankit Sharma’s son
Body: 1Several Twitter users are sharing a photo of a woman hugging and comforting three kids with an insinuation that it is from Delhi, where violence broke out between Hindus and Muslims recently. These Twitter users used this photo to attack Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The photo is being tweeted with a caption that reads, âThis will remain my permanent memory of what Narendra Modi has done to my country.â This will remain my permanent memory of what Butcher @narendramodi has done to my country... #DelhiRiots2020â¦ https://t.co/04JRRzNeVT— Rajeev Jain @gallerygrandeur (@RajeevJ37171644) 1582951596000TRUTHThe photo is from Syrian conflict and was taken on May 14, 2014. It has nothing to do with Delhi violence. VERIFICATION AND METHODOLOGYUsing reverse-image search function on Google, we found the original image posted by Getty Images. The photo is credited to ZEIN AL-RIFAI/AFP via Getty Images. âA Syrian woman comforts her children after their house in the Sahour neighbourhood of the northern Syrian city of Aleppo was bombed on May 14, 2014. Once home to some 2.5 million residents and considered Syria's economic powerhouse, Aleppo has been divided between government and opposition control since shortly after fighting there began in mid-2012,â reads the caption given to the photo by Getty Images. VERDICTTimes Fact Check has found that a photo from Syria is being shared insinuating that the photo was clicked after the violence that broke out in Delhi last week. The claim is hence false. CLAIM 2A photo showing a kid sobbing, staring at a body in front of him, is being shared with a claim that the kid is the son of the Intelligence Bureau officer Ankit Sharma, who was murdered in Delhi during the violence. A translation of the Hindi text given to the photo reads, âWhat would have this kidâs mind and heart gone through, whose father was stabbed over 400 times. My blood boils looking at this,â along with #AnkitSharma. @khanumarfa @thewire_in à¤à¤¸ à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤® à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¬à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤¶à¤°à¥à¤° à¤ªà¤° 400 à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤à¥à¤à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¨à¤¿à¤¶à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¹â¦ https://t.co/uKm84wGRJK— à¤®à¤¯à¥à¤° à¤à¥à¤¬à¥ (@MayoorBhartiya) 158294154700

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FAKE ALERT: Photo showing cop wielding lathi at kid is from Bangladesh
Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo showing a policeman swinging a lathi at a terrified child with a claim that it shows Delhi Police brutality on kids. A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Anil Kumar Yadav' shared the photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Delhi Police thrashing a big terrorist." At the time of writing this report, this post has been shared over 32,000 times. Congress leader Dr Udit Raj shared the same photo from his verified Twitter account with a caption in Hindi suggesting Delhi Police brutality on kids, but without directly saying it.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Hindus did not bury Muslim woman, child alive
Body: Nazir Ahemd, a Pakistan-origin British Member of Parliament, tweeted a disturbing video showing a woman and child being exhumed saying it is a horrific video of a mother and child buried alive in India by 'fascists'. The tweet said, "Warring: horrific video of a mother and Child buried alive in India by Facist. Thank God they are recovered (sic)." The tweet, now deleted, was retweeted more than 3,500 times and the video was viewed more than 70,000 times. The same video was tweeted by retired Pakistan Army Major Muhammad Arif saying, "Muslims are being buried alive in India." This tweet, still intact, has been retweeted over 3,100 times and the video has already been viewed over 84,000 times. Times Fact Check is not sharing the video because of its disturbing visuals.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of stone-pelting on Gujarat Police shared as one from Delhi
Body: BJP member and former Indian army officer Major Surendra Poonia shared a video in which a violent mob can be seen pelting stones at police vehicles. He claimed that the video is from Delhi. à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤¶à¥à¤®à¥à¤° à¤à¥ à¤¦à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤²à¥ à¤²à¥ à¤à¤¯à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤¤à¥à¤¥à¤° à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤«à¥à¤à¤ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¯à¥ à¤¬à¤²à¥à¤à¤¿ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤¡à¤¼ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ ..à¤¯à¤¹ à¤¸à¤¬ à¤¬à¤°à¤à¤¾,à¤°à¤µà¤¿à¤¶,à¤¡à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¼à¤¾, à¤°à¤¾à¤â¦ https://t.co/PcgZvWHNL7— Major Surendra Poonia (@MajorPoonia) 1582738171000Taking to Twitter, Poonia posted the video and tweeted -- âThey have brought Kashmir to Delhi. They are not just throwing stones but they are breaking India. All this will not be shown by the likes of Barkha, Ravish, D'Souza, Rajdeep, Wire, Quint, BBC, Scroll, Rana Ayub, Arfa, NDTV. This is not anti-CAA movement but terrorism and its control room is in Rawalpindi!â Hereâs the archived version of the tweet.

Header: FACT CHECK: Ankit Sharma’s brother denies saying his brother was killed by those chanting ‘Jai Shri Ram’
FAKE ALERT: 'Anurag Mishra' not the gunman who fired during Delhi violence
Body: Many social media users have been sharing photos of one Anurag Mishra, and screenshots of his Facebook profile, along with one photo of the shooter who fired several rounds in Delhi's Jafrabad area when violence ensued there on February 24, 2020, with a claim that the former is the one who opened fire. Most of the posts making the above claim had a caption written in Hindi that closely translates to, "Shahrukh turned out to be Anurag Mishra. Look at the Islamophobia of police and media. What a propaganda it was!" These photos are being shared widely on WhatsApp as well, along with the same claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Are brahmins in Australia selling beef under Brahman pies brand?
Body: A video posted by BR Ambdekar's great-grandson Rajratna, on his official Facebook page, claims that brahmins in Australia slaughter cows and sell beef under the brand 'Brahman Pies'. Rajratna claims that while cow is worshipped as deity by Indian brahmins, the scenario is exactly opposite in Australia.   Captioned 'Cow is India's mother, look who's eating it in Australia?', the video, over six-minute-long, posted by Rajratna has him chatting with an accomplice outside a 'Brahman Pies' outlet. They both claim that the brand was owned by brahmins of Australia and were responsible for selling many non-vegetarian food items. The video has gone viral on Facebook and many are circulating it on WhatsApp. Times Fact Check received the video from a reader, who wanted to know if the claims made in it were true.

Header: FACT CHECK: IIT Madras servers were under ransomware attack?
Body: On February 20, 2020, media houses reported that IIT-Madras came under a ransomware attack that brought down several systems, including an internal e-mail service, for two days. The institute, however, issued a statement saying, âThe email server at IIT Madras went down and the cause is being investigated. The institute has a backup for the email system and will restore it soon,â without any mention of a ransomware attack. The verified Facebook page of IIT-M made a post on February 21, 2020, saying, "One of the email servers at IIT Madras was down temporarily and has since been restored. All emails on this server were backed up and no mails were lost. No other services of the institute were affected. The cause is under investigation." The post did not mention any ransomware attack either.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Posts claiming Shahdara DCP's death are false
Body: Amit Sharma, Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), Shahdara, Delhi, was injured in the violence that ensued in parts of northeast Delhi. Many social media users are sharing posts and tweets claiming Sharma succumbed to injuries. Most of the posts are being shared with text in Hindi that closely translates to, "Sad news. After constable Ratan Lal, DCP Amit Sharma, also, is no more." For instance: Sharma's photo is being circulated widely on WhatsApp as well, with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Ratan Tata did not say Tata Group will not recruit from JNU
Body: A graphic card with Ratan Tata's photo, and text attributing an announcement to him, is viral on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The text says, "Big announcement by Ratan Tata sahab: From now on, Tata Group of companies not to recruit any of the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) students," and "Those who can't be faithful to the country, how can we expect them to be faithful to the company (sic)." Here is a tweet made on February 22, 2020, with the graphic card in question. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Kazakhstan man shared as of Indian saint who took ‘samadhi’ 300 years ago
Body: A graphic video is being circulated widely on WhatsApp with a claim that the man seen in the video is a saint who was recently evacuated, 300 years after he took samadhi in Chennai. A loose translation of the Hindi text describing the video goes -- âSiddha Yogi who took samadhi 300 years ago in Chennaiâs Velayur Temple. The saint was found alive during the recent excavation works at the temple." A reader sent the video along with this claim to Times Fact Check on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 to know if such an incident happened.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No government advisory on purchase of Chinese products during Holi
Body: A graphic card with text in Hindi that loosely translates to, "One of the biggest Indian festivals -- Holi -- is nearing. In our India, a lot of colours, masks and other materials come from China. These things you buy considering they are cheap and attractive use certain raw materials of 'polymer'. Let us inform that these raw materials are made in China's Hunei, that has been hit by the coronavirus outbreak. We appeal to all of you not to use products imported from China." The card attributes the message to the World Health Organisation and the Indian government. Here's the graphic card - An alert reader reached out to Times Fact Check on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 with the graphic card to know if the government has indeed issued any such advisory.

Header: FAKE ALERT: AAP worker shares fake photo of man urinating on Modi-Trump graffiti
Body: A picture of a man urinating on a newly-made graffiti of PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump on a wall in a street in Ahmedabad is doing the rounds on Twitter. Aam Aadmi Partyâs social media team incharge Aishwary Verma tweeted the photo asking his followers to suggest captions for the image. Caption please ðð #TrumpVisitIndia https://t.co/NHJ4uyvuca— Aishwary Verma (@AishwaryVerma9) 1582172564000An archived version of his tweet is here. Similarly, a Twitter user who goes by the name âZishan Khanâ shared the same photo with the caption âNew Indiaâ. @AishwaryVerma9 New India https://t.co/0d9qR1NTrJ— Er Zishan khan (@Being_zishan) 158217261000

Header: FAKE ALERT: This man being thrashed by mob is not Kanhaiya Kumar
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Rajesh Singh Tomar' shared a video showing a man being thrashed by a mob, and the man being rescued and taken away by police, with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Kanhaiya Kumar getting 'azaadi'. Deepika Padukone should certainly see this video." The caption gives an impression that the man being beaten up by the mob is CPI(M) leader Kanhaiya Kumar who made headlines with 'azaadi' sloganeering at protests since the time he was a PhD student and students' union president at Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). When Bollywood actor Deepika Padukone visited JNU, standing in solidarity with students in the university post the violence unleashed in the campus by masked goons, Kumar was present there, leading the protest with 'azaadi' slogans. Many other Facebook users shared the same video with more or less similar claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Photo of an Indian man standing on Indian flag is real
Body: Photo of a man wrapped in Pakistan flag and disrespecting Indian flag by standing on it and pointing a gun towards it is being circulated on WhatsApp. A Times Fact Check reader shared the photo with us asking if the photo is indeed real or doctored. The photo shared by the reader had a Tamil text on it that asks people to share the picture to the maximum so that the concerned person disparaging Indian flag gets arrested.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo shared claiming condoms found in Shaheen Bagh
Body: People have been protesting in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC) for over two months now. Since February 18, 2020, a photo showing condoms dumped in a ditch is being widely circulated by many social media users with a claim that sanitation workers found it in a drain in Shaheen Bagh. A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Prabhu Sagar' shared the photo yesterday with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "If you want proof, comment, I'll send you proof. Sanitation workers saw this in a drain behind Shaheen Bagh." The post, at the time of writing this report, has been shared over 1,600 times. The same photo was tweeted by a user with handle 'Gautam__Rajput' with more of less the same claim. à¤¨à¤à¤° à¤ªà¤¾à¤²à¤¿à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤°à¥à¤®à¤à¤¾à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤«à¤¾à¤ à¤à¤°à¤¤à¥ à¤¸à¤®à¤¯ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤¨à¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¯à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤¶à¥à¤¯ à¤¦à¥à¤à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤®à¤¿à¤²à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¥¤â¦ https://t.co/8WTYW0kHUi— É Î±ÂµÆ­Î±É± à«¨Î±ÊÏÂµÆ­ ãà¸£Î±É³á§Î±à¸£à¹ã (@Gautam___Rajput) 1582081451000The photo is being widely circulated on WhatsApp as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo of Aamir Khan with Turkish President shared claiming they met recently
Body: A photo showing Bollywood actor Aamir Khan shaking hands with Turkey President Recep Tayyip ErdoÄan is being shared widely on social media platforms with a claim that Khan went to Turkey and met Erdogan. Many Facebook users have been sharing the photo, criticizing Khan for meeting a person who is anti-India and pro-Pakistan. A close translation of the Hindi text many have been using along with the photo reads - âFilm actor Aamir Khan went to Turkey to meet its president Erdogan. Turkeyâs anti-India stance and love for Pakistan is not hidden from anyone. Shameful!â The photo assumes importance because Erdogan has criticized and opposed India on various occasions ever since the Indian government abrogated Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. He has been very vocal about his support to Pakistan on the Kashmir issue. Former BJP MP Tarun Vijay, quoted a tweet with the photo in question, made by the official Twitter account of the Turkish President to attack Khan over boycotting a meeting with âIndiaâs friendâ Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu but traveling to Turkey to meet âIndiaâs enemyâ. Isn't it true they boycotted meeting #Netanyahu in Mumbai, though #Israel is India's best, most trusted friend. Butâ¦ https://t.co/Vp7fvughEo— Tarun Vijay à®¤à®°à¯à®£à¯ à®µà®¿à®à®¯à¯ (@Tarunvijay) 158196590200

Header: FAKE ALERT: Sikh procession from Punjab shared as one supporting Shaheen Bagh
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Mohammed Javed posted a video showing huge procession of Sikhs and claimed that Sikh community marched towards Shaheen Bagh in Delhi to show their support to Muslims. âSikh brothers reached Shaheen Bagh to say we are with our Muslim brothers over their demand for No CAA and No NRC,â read a loose translation of the caption in Hindi given by Javed to the video.

Header: FACT CHECK: Lord Shiva temple inside Kashi-Mahakal Express permanent?
Jamia videos: Facts as they are
FAKE ALERT: Donald Trump makes fake claim of him having more likes on Facebook than PM Modi
Body: Ahead of his first official visit to India, US president Donald Trump took to Twitter to claim that he was ânumber 1â on Facebook (in terms of page likes), where as PM Modi was ânumber 2â. Trump quoted Facebook co-founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg to make this claim. âGreat honor, I think? Mark Zuckerberg recently stated that âDonald J. Trump is Number 1 on Facebook. Number 2 is Prime Minister Modi of India.â Actually, I am going to India in two weeks. Looking forward to it! (sic)â Trump tweeted. Great honor, I think? Mark Zuckerberg recently stated that âDonald J. Trump is Number 1 on Facebook. Number 2 is Pâ¦ https://t.co/KCu2oXV5pz— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) 158172351500

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Kejriwal did not attack Shiv Sena for allying with Congress
Body: A screengrab of a tweet that makes it look like the tweet was made from the verified account of Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal is being shared by many on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The content of the tweet seen in the screenshot shows Kejriwal dismissing appreciation from Shiv Sena and taunting the saffron party for allying with Congress in Maharashtra. Here is a loose translation of the tweet made in Hindi - âWe donât need any praise from Shiv Sena. They must be helpless to ally with the Congress. They may side with the BJP again. We, on the other hand, are fighting alone and will continue to do so.â The tweet also tags a Twitter handle by the name of @uddhavthackeray. Hereâs one of the viral Facebook posts sharing the screengrab of the tweet.

Header: FACT CHECK: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide indicate mass cremations in China?
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle â@inteldotwavâ, in a series of tweets made on February 9, 2020, said that data from a website called windy.com showed massive release of sulphur dioxide from China's Wuhan and Chongqing, two places most affected by the deadly Covid-19 coronavirus. The user suggested three distinct possibilities to explain this massive release of sulphur dioxide - a power plant releasing the gas, the local authorities burning municipal trash and contaminated animal carcasses, or because of mass cremations of those who died of coronavirus infection in the outskirts of these cities. This assumption is based on the fact that sulphur dioxide is released when bodies are burned. Data from https://t.co/oDMad8pquE shows a massive release of sulfur dioxide gas from the outskirts of Wuhan, commonâ¦ https://t.co/JJb1F2kbvX— ï¼©ï¼®ï¼´ï¼¥ï¼¬ï¼·ï¼¡ï¼¶ï¼¥ð (@inteldotwav) 1581199949000By now, the tweet has been retweeted over 12,200 times and liked by over 15,800 users. By the next day, February 10, 2020, many news organisations published reports, some mentioning the Twitter thread above, some crediting 'social media users who have probed the maps', directly linking the apparent rise in sulphur dioxide in Wuhan and Chongqing to mass cremations there For instance, The Sun published a report with the title 'BURNING THE EVIDENCE: China accused of major coronavirus cover-up as chilling satellite pics âshow extent of corpse burning in Wuhanâ', with the exact same image the Twitter user posted. The Daily Mail published a report titled, 'Does this satellite image show the scale of China's coronavirus cremations? Sulphur dioxide emissions which are produced when bodies are burned reach alarming levels in Wuhan', with the same image shared by the Twitter user. Metro published a report titled 'Cloud of sulphur dioxide hints at scale of Chinaâs coronavirus cremations', again, with the same image shared on Twitter. Express (UK) published a report posing a question - 'Coronavirus satellite image: Does THIS image show REAL scale of virus cremations?', using the same image.

Header: FAKE ALERT: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan did not say 'Islam will win across India'
Body: A screenshot of a tweet that makes it look like Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Okhla Amanatullah Khan made the tweet from his verified account is being circulated widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The screenshot that shows content in Hindi loosely translates to, "I am leading by 72000 votes after the 13 rounds of counting. Today, Shaheen Bagh won, today Islam has won. Insha Allah, soon enough, Islam will win across India. I thank all my Muslim brothers and sisters. We all, together, showed our strength. Keep up the unity. We will certainly repeat history." An alert Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 with the screenshot and asked if the tweet was indeed made by Khan.

Header: Fact Check: Did BJP in Delhi lose 8 seats by margin of less than 100 votes?
Body: A message going viral across social media platforms claims that BJP lost a total of 8 seats by a margin of less than 100 votes, 19 seats by less than 1000 votes and 9 seats by less than 2000 votes, in the just concluded Delhi assembly elections. The message claims that had there been 3% more voter turnout, the entire âgameâ would have changed in favour of BJP and it would have ended up bagging 44 seats out of 70. The message is also being circulated in the form of a graphic card across Twitter and WhatsApp.

Header: FACT CHECK: Are these Wuhan residents screaming and begging for their lives?
Body: Journalist Brajesh Misra posted a video on Twitter in which high-rises can be seen and screams of people can be heard. Misra claimed that the video is from Wuhan where people are crying and begging for their lives after being locked up in homes. âPeople of Chinese city Wuhan are screaming from their homes, begging for life. Instead of treating them, providing them with help, they have been locked in homes. These screams will haunt the world community for centuries to come. Coronavirus will soon reach its peak. India must prepare itself immediately to tackle the virus,â Misra tweeted along with the video. à¤à¤¿à¤à¤¦à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤­à¥à¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤à¤à¤¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤µà¥à¤¹à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¶à¤¹à¤° à¤à¥ à¤¯à¥ à¤²à¥à¤ à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤à¤°à¥à¤ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¥à¤à¤à¤° à¤à¤¿à¤¡à¤¼à¤à¤¿à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤. à¤à¤²à¤¾à¤, à¤®à¤¦à¤¦ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤¾à¤¯ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤°à¥à¤â¦ https://t.co/EiHhrha1CM— Brajesh Misra (@brajeshlive) 1581095844000It should be noted that Wuhan is the epicenter of the coronavirus outbreak.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Amit Shah distributing pamphlets saying ‘Aayega toh Kejriwal hi’ is fake
Body: Photo of Home Minister Amit Shah distributing pamphlets with âAayega toh Kejriwal hiâ (Only Kejriwal will come for the second term) written on it is being circulated on instant-messaging platform WhatsApp. The insinuation is that even Shah has resigned to the possibility that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will return to power in the capital. Times Fact Check received the image from a reader on its WhatsApp number 8527001433. The reader wanted to know if it was real.

Header: FAKE ALERT: PM Modi attributes fake quote from satirical article to Omar Abdullah
Body: Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi addressed the Lok Sabha on February 6, 2020. While speaking on the motion of thanks on the President's address in Parliament, Modi attributed a quote to former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abullah. Modi said, "Omar Abdullah said abrogation of Article 370 will bring an earthquake that will separate Kashmir from India." The video of the speech is available on the official YouTube channel of PMO. The above mentioned portion is from 1:08:20 to 1:08:35. The verified Twitter account of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on February 6, 2020, tweeted quoting PM Modi as saying, "Omar Abdullah had said that the abrogation of Article 370 would bring a massive earthquake and will divide Kashmir from India. Farukh Abdullah had said the removal of Article 370 will strengthen the road of freedom for Kashmiris," along with #PMInLokSabha. Omar Abdullah had said that the abrogation of Article 370 would bring a massive earthquake and will divide Kashmirâ¦ https://t.co/KiQasQ2FU0— BJP (@BJP4India) 158097761600

Header: China seeking court approval to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients?
FAKE ALERT: Video from Jammu shared as Hindu women beaten in Sindh area of Pakistan
Body: A disturbing video of two women being brutally beaten by a man wielding a stick is being circulated on WhatsApp with a claim that they were Hindus from Sindh state of Pakistan and were beaten after they complained to the police about the atrocities against them. The graphic video shows two women screaming for help while a man mercilessly attacks them with a lathi. A Times Fact Check reader shared the video along with a screenshot of the viral claim with us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433. He wanted to know if the claim made is true. A loose translation of the claim made in Hindi, shared with the video, reads, âThe only mistake of these Hindu women from Sindh area of Pakistan is that they registered a complaint with police against atrocities committed on them. Now the 'seculars' and liberals of India must understand why Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019 is needed in Indiaâ.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Chinese President, PM did not visit any mosque to pray post Coronavirus outbreak
Body: A video with Associated Press (AP) logo, showing a leader visiting a mosque, is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that the video is of Chinese President Xi Jinping/current Chinese Prime Minister (the head of government, formally referred to as the Premier) Li Keqiang visiting a mosque to pray that the country is saved from the deadly Coronavirus outbreak. For instance, a Facebook user who goes by the name 'Shameem Choudhary Sakras' shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Chinese prime minister reached a mosque for namaz and prayed", along with #Coronavirus. The video has already been viewed over 64,000 times and the post has been shared over 7,500 times. A Twitter handle '@Syeda_Nasreen_' shared the same video with almost the same claim. à¤à¥à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨ à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ à¤à¤¼à¥à¤¦ à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¦ à¤ªà¤¹à¥à¤à¤à¥ à¤¨à¤®à¤¾à¤à¤¼ à¤ªà¤¢à¤¼à¥ à¤à¤± à¤¦à¥à¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤à¤à¥,,ð¤²ð¤²ð¤²ð¤² #à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¨à¤¾ à¤µà¤¾à¤¯à¤°à¤¸.... à¤¯à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¾à¤® à¤§à¤°à¥à¤® ð¢ð¢ð¢ð¢ https://t.co/Izso365k9a— Syeda_Nasreen ( 73,K) Follow (@Syeda_Nasreen__) 1580799356000Meanwhile, another Twitter user who goes by the handle '@1rfanG' shared the same video with a tweet in Urdu that loosely translates to, "Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a mosque and prayed for Muslims in the current crisis in country. We need your help," along with #WorldWakeUp4Kashmir.
