Header: FACT CHECK: Has Arvind Kejriwal made U-turns in the run-up to Delhi elections?
Body: 1 âNever called Modi deshdrohiâ Fact Check : I never called PM Deshdrohi. https://t.co/CPkVBSYsj6— Political Kida (@PoliticalKida) 1580799014000Kejriwal, while giving an interview to ABP News, expressed displeasure at being labelled a âterroristâ by some BJP leaders. The journalist, Dibang, reminded Kejriwal of the time he called Prime Minister Narendra Modi âAnti-nationalâ. Kejriwal immediately denied and said he never called Modi that. At 14:35, one can hear Kejriwalâs denial. In a related question, he also denied ever demanding a probe against Delhi Police in the controversial Batla House encounter. TRUTHKejriwal indeed called Modi a âDeshdrohiâ a few months back. His denial to accept that, is a lie. Using âKejriwal Modi deshdrohiâ as keywords on YouTube, we found a video uploaded by a channel called âCity First Newsâ on May 7, 2019. In the video, Kejriwal, addressing a rally, says, âModiâs nationalism is fake and he is dangerous for India. Modi colludes with Pakistanis and terroristsâ. From 1:08, Kejriwal can be heard saying âThereâs no bigger âdeshdrohiâ than Modi in Indiaâ Kejriwal had also, in the past, expressed doubts over the Batla House encounter. Using âKejriwal Batla Houseâ as keywords on YouTube, we found a video uploaded by BHTV on September 18, 2017, in which Kejriwal made those remarks. CLAIM 2 âNever insulted people from Bihar and Purvanchalâ Another blatant lie by @ArvindKejriwal. Does he really think people have forgotten how he insult people of bihar fâ¦ https://t.co/kx0vl6YvqR— Political Kida (@PoliticalKida) 1580798006000In the same interview to ABP News, at 4:29, Dibang asks Kejriwal about the anti-Bihari remarks he has made in the past. Kejriwal denied and said that accusation leveled by Modi in his speech against him of insulting Biharis and Purvanchalis is a complete lie. TRUTHIt turns out it was yet another U-turn by Kejriwal. In September last year, he accused Biharis of coming to Delhi, infiltrating its hospitals and enjoying free medical facilities worth Rs 5 lakh. Using âKejriwal anti-Bihari remarkâ as keywords on YouTube, we found a video uploaded by NDTV India on September 30, 2019. At 0:20, Kejriwal can be heard making these remarks, which he is denying now. CLAIM 3 âNever promised installing 15 lakh CCTV cameras in Delhiâ Biggest U-turn of @ArvindKejriwal till date. This video should reach every Citizen across Delhi. https://t.co/aIKnmSTrzR— Political Kida (@PoliticalKida) 1580632152000In a recent episode of Aap Ki Adalat show, hosted by anchor Rajat Sharma on India TV, Kejriwal claimed he never promised installing 15 lakh CCTV cameras in Delhi. At 17:15, Sharma asks Kejriwal about his unfulfilled promise of installing 10-15 lakh CCTV cameras. Kejriwal says this figure was a lie concocted by BJP. TRUTH

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Muslim women dancing shared claiming it's from Shaheen Bagh
Body: A video showing a group of burqa-clad, Muslim women dancing is being circulated widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp, with a claim that the video was shot during an 'entertaining programme' at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh protest site. Many people have been protesting at Shaheen Bagh for over 50 days now against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). A Facebook user who goes by the name of 'Thakur Sunil Singh' posted the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "The 'entertaining programme' arranged at Shaheen Bagh, at night." A Bhojpuri song that praises PM Narendra Modi and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has been superimposed on the video. The video has been viewed over 1,39,000 times and the post has been shared more than 4,700 times. The same video is being circulated widely on WhatsApp as well, along with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2019 video of woman being thrashed by relatives shared with false claim
Body: A disturbing video showing a group of men mercilessly thrashing a woman is being widely circulated on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that the 'Dalit woman' was beaten up for relieving herself in a Brahmin-owned farm. A Times Fact Check reader sent us a screenshot of one of his contacts forwarding the video, on our WhatsApp number 8527001433, along with the above claim. This reader wanted to know if the claim made is indeed true. On running searches on Facebook and Twitter using some relevant keywords picked from the message that is being shared along with the video, we saw that the video is being shared widely on social media platforms along with the same claim. We also found that the same video was shared with the same claim six months ago as well.

Header: FACT CHECK: Jamia shooter’s CBSE mark sheet authentic?
FACT CHECK: Image of Ashok Chakra replaced by Islamic Shahada in Indian Tricolor during anti-CAA march is real
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Rajat Rajan posted an image on January 30, 2020 showing a huge crowd marching on a street. Using that image, Rajan claimed that in an anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 protest in Hyderabad, Ashoka Chakra in the Indian flag was replaced with 'La ilaha illallah', an Islamic Shahada which means âthereâs no other god but Allahâ.   âA Rudra Hanuman poster puts secularism in danger. But this doesn't put secularism in danger,â Rajan rued. A Times Fact Check reader shared Rajanâs post with us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433, wanting to know the veracity of the image and the claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Who is this burqa-clad woman raising slogans against opposition leaders?
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Arya Deepa Malik' shared a video showing a burqa-clad woman leading a protest by raising 'azaadi' slogans against opposition leaders like Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Mamata Banerjee, Sheila Dixit, Mayawati, Lalu Prasad Yadav and Arvind Kejriwal. The user shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Now a new thing has happened. These people need 'azaadi' from Rahul Gandhi. Please help them." The caption gives an impression that the group seen in the video are a part of those who are protesting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). The video has garnered over 74,000 views and the post has been shared more than 3,400 times. An archived version of the post is here.The same video is beings shared by many individual users and pages with the same caption. The video, with the same caption, is being shared on Twitter as well. à¤à¤¬à¥ à¤¨à¤ à¤à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤ à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤² à¤à¤¾à¤à¤§à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤à¤¾à¤¦à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤ à¤à¤¨ à¤²à¥à¤à¥à¤ à¤à¥ ððð à¤à¤¨à¤à¥ à¤®à¤¦à¤¦ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤ https://t.co/1KC9cSdPVA— vedupanditbjpà¥¤à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯ à¤à¤¨à¤¤à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¾à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤à¤ªà¤¾ à¤à¤à¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤² (@chokidarvedu) 158044312400

Header: FAKE ALERT: Trimmed video of Rahul Gandhi's speech goes viral
Body: A Facebook that goes by the name 'Pushpendra Kulshrestha Fans Club' posted a 6-second-long video clip showing Rahul Gandhi delivering a speech and making a mistake, with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "He's 'high' again." In the video, Gandhi could be seen using the Hindi word that means 'nation' where he should have used the Hindi word that means 'world'. The video has a logo saying 'Political Keeda' on the right-top corner. The same video is being shared on Twitter by many users. A Twitter handle '@Humor_Silly' shared the clip saying, "Hindustan - Desh, dono alag alag hota hai?" which translates to, "India and nation, are these two different from each other?" Hindustan - Desh Dono alag alag hota hai ? ð https://t.co/sCKnU4Klvn— Chowkidar Hardik (@Humor_Silly) 1580201695000An archived version of the tweet is here.The same video is being circulated widely on WhatsApp as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Gujarat shared claiming Hindu women will take on Muslim protesters with swords
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name Gopi Bhardwaj shared a 11-second-long video clip showing many women holding up swords, with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Staunch Hindi Rajputana women standing against Muslim women protesters at Shaheen Bagh and Ghanta Ghar." This post has been shared over 27,000 times and the video has garnered over 8,37,000 views already. The same video is being shared by many individual Facebook users and pages with exactly the same caption. The video is being shared on Twitter as well, along with the same claim. à¤¶à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¾à¤ à¤à¤° à¤à¤à¤à¤¾à¤à¤° à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤® à¤®à¤¹à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤« à¤à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤à¥à¤à¤° à¤¹à¤¿à¤à¤¦à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤ªà¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾ à¤®à¤¹à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤ à¥¤ à¤à¤¯ à¤­à¤µà¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¯â¦ https://t.co/mv4jbOGIrj— à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤à¤à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¤à¤ (@TheUnitedHindu) 1580046625000An archived version of the tweet is here.Protests have been going on in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh and Ghanta Ghar in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and National Register of Citizens (NRC) since many days now and protests at both these places are being spearheaded by Muslim women.

Header: FACT CHECK: Photos of seized counterfeit currency shared claiming it was retrieved from a temple
Body: Photos of counterfeit currency seized by police are being shared on WhatsApp and social media platforms with a claim that these photos were taken after the fake notes were retrieved from one 'Swaminarayan' temple. Here are some of the photos that are being shared - An alert Times Fact Check reader sent these photos, along with a message that said, "Fake notes from Swami Narayan temple (sic)", to us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 asking if the claim made is indeed true. Along with these photos, the reader also forwarded a video   Times Fact Check had already fact-checked   last week.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Irfan Pathan was not at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Bol Ke Lab Azaad Tere Shabnam' shared a 14-second-long video clip showing former cricketer Irfan Pathan on a vehicle with a few others, waving at fans, with a caption written in Hindi that closely translates to, "Another lion has come to Shaheen Bagh, the name is Irfan Pathan". The video has a location tag with 'Shaheen Bagh, Okhla, New Delhi', on it. An archived version of this post is here.The same video is being shared by many users with the exact same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this is not the footage of helicopter crash that killed Kobe Bryant
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@OfficialKito' tweeted a video showing a helicopter crash saying, "Kobe Bryant helicopter crash live footage". #KobeBryant helicopter crash live footage https://t.co/4iXWUkCCga— Kito$tunna ð (@OfficialKito) 1580077873000The tweet has been retweeted over 1,000 times and liked by over 2,132 users. An archived version of the tweet is here.A search on social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook with keywords 'Kobe Bryant helicopter crash live footage' shows that the same video has been shared by many users with the exact same claim. A Facebook post by the name of 'NBA Highlights' shared the same video yesterday with the title, "VIDEO FOOTAGE: Kobe Bryant's Daughter Gianna, 13, Dead Alongside Father in Calabasas Helicopter Crash. The NBA legend and his daughter were both onboard the private helicopter." This post has been shared over 41,000 times and has garnered over 9,88,000 views already. The same video, with the same claim, is garnering a lot of views on YouTube as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared claiming anti-CAA protesters take money to agitate
Body: A video showing a man paying women, some of them holding placards, is being shared with a claim that protesters at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh take money to agitate against the Narendra Modi-led NDA government over the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019. Many women who are seen taking money seem to be Muslims. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's voice could be heard in the background. The video is being shared widely on social media platforms with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "Muslim women while going to protest at Shaheen Bagh." The video, with Gandhi's voice in the background, and Muslim women seen taking money from a man, gives an impression that the Congress Party is paying women at Shaheen Bagh to agitate against CAA, 2019. A Facebook user by the name 'Dhananjay Tiwari' shared the video uploaded by another user by the name 'Sudhir Kumar' to a page that goes by the name 'Dr Sambit Patra Fans Club', with the caption above. The video uploaded by Kumar has been shared over 65,000 times and has garnered over 1.7 million views. Many individual Facebook users and pages have been sharing the same video making similar claims.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Bengaluru anti-CAA protest passed off as Indore lawyers’ agitation against the Act
Body: A Twitter handle named @Anti__Modi shared an aerial-view photo of a massive gathering, claiming that Indore High Court lawyers protested against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizenship (NRC). The handle claimed that these advocates promised to fight cases (if any) filed by police against Indore protestors, pro bono. Advocates of the High Court of Indore today supported the protest against caa, nrc running at Barwali outpost Indorâ¦ https://t.co/NV1JLkAqUS— Ham Le Ke Rahenge...... Aazadi (@Anti__Modi) 1579707140000An archived version of the tweet is here.Several other Twitter users shared the same image with more or less similar claims about Indore High Court advocates protesting against CAA/NRC. Advocates of the High Court of Indore today supported the protest against caa, nrc running at Barwali outpost Indorâ¦ https://t.co/acIZMUYQob— Mahir Khan ÙØ§ÛÛØ± Ø®Ø§Ù (@iammahirkhan) 1579693472000Advocates of the High Court of Indore today supported the protest against caa, nrc running at Barwali outpost Indorâ¦ https://t.co/29HbTzgG5q— dilSedesh Burning Constitu #IndiaDoesNotSupportCAA (@4Nahal) 157969085300

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this man in RSS uniform is not the Mangaluru airport bomb suspect
Body: Photo of two men posing together wearing the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) uniform is doing the rounds on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that one of them is Adithya Rao, who surrendered before the police for planting a bomb at Mangaluruâs Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) over frustration of not getting a job as a security manager there. A Twitter user by the name of Syed Abdahu Kashaf posted the photo mocking RSS, alleging that the organisation is involved in terrorism. Terrorist Adithya Rao from Manipal who placed the explosives at Mangaluru airport on Monday is seen in RSS Chaddi wâ¦ https://t.co/jXZomrk40V— Syed Abdahu Kashaf (@syedKashaf95) 1579690984000âTerrorist Adithya Rao from Manipal who placed the explosives at Mangaluru airport on Monday is seen in RSS Chaddi with his wing commander in Syria (sic),â Syed wrote. Another Twitter user Aziz Bikaner posted one more photo of the same man (in RSS uniform), this time posing with Bengaluru MP Tejasvi Surya. #Mangaluru airport me bomb Rakhne wala dehshat gard aditya RSS ke National leader prabhakar bhat Aur MP Tejasvi suâ¦ https://t.co/CivyUpVkIj— aziZ bikaner (@aziz_bikaner) 1579712035000Aziz claimed that the man posing with Surya is an RSS member who planted the bomb at KIA. Times Fact Check also received the photo above from a reader on our WhatsApp number 8527001433. The reader wanted to know if the man in the photo was indeed the suspect.

Header: FACT CHECK: Whose photo is this? Pran, Indira Gandhi or Amrita Pritam?
Body: Many social media users have been sharing a photo with a claim that it is of legendary actor Pran disguised as a woman. A Times Fact Check reader reached out to us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 with the photo and the text he received along with the photo, asking us to verify if it's indeed Pran in the photo.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did police recover fake currency notes from a Gujarat temple?
Body: A two-minute-long video received by Times Fact Check on its WhatsApp number 8527001433 from a reader showed what looked like a news report about fake currency notes with a face value of over Rs 1 crore being seized from an under-construction temple in Gujarat. The video, bearing the logo of One India, had visuals of five people apparently apprehended by police for printing and keeping fake currency notes of Rs 2000 denomination. The voiceover in the video claims that of one of the five people nabbed, one was Swami Radharaman, priest of one Swaminarayan Mandir in Gujarat. Later, Rahul Patel, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Crime Branch, can be seen confirming the development to the press. The reader wanted to know if such an incident indeed happened.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2018 video of a group burning Constitution shared with claim that RSS workers did it
Body: A video showing a group of men burning a copy of the Constitution of India, while raising slogans against the Constitution, Dr BR Ambedkar, and caste-based reservation in the country, is being shared with a claim that Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) workers were behind it. A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@IncKinju' shared the video with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "That day RSS has been waiting for eagerly has come and it was this India's soul had always felt threatened about. RSS showed its ugly face and sloganeered against Ambedkar in public and burnt the Constitution of India. This way, they declared 'Manuwaad Zindabad'." à¤à¤à¤¼à¤¿à¤° à¤¯à¤¹ à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨ à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤à¤¾ RSS à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤¬à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¬à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤à¤¤à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤° à¤°à¤¹à¤¾ à¤¥à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤¦à¥à¤¶ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¤à¥à¤®à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤¬à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤à¤¼à¤¤à¤°à¤¾â¦ https://t.co/5qcgcogD9q— Kinju_inc (@IncKinju) 1579572927000An archived version of the tweet is here.The same video is being shared widely on Facebook as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Gadkari felicitating female bodybuilders viral with false claim
Body: Photos of Union Minister Nitin Gadkari felicitating two bikini-clad women are being shared to target him and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). It is being alleged that the BJP doesnât respect women and its senior ministers like to disrobe them. A Facebook page by the name of âCongressâ shared the photo with text in Hindi that loosely translates to âUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari's idea of honouring women! He is a top leader of a big party. You can see his morals here.â   The text written on the photo loosely translates to âIs this how the BJP respects women? Women must be honoured with shawls as a mark of Indian values and not disrobed. This is what Nitin Gadkari did at a Nagpur event.â

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2015 photo used to claim burqa-clad man went to Shaheen Bagh pretending to be a woman
Body: A photo of a man donning a burqa is being shared on Twitter with a claim that he masqueraded as a Muslim woman to protest at Shaheen Bagh against Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019. à¤¶à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¾à¤ à¤®à¥ à¤¸à¤²à¤®à¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤¬à¥à¤°à¤à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¹à¤¨à¤à¤° à¤¬à¤²à¤®à¤¾ à¤­à¥ à¤ªà¤¹à¥à¤à¤ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥, à¤¬à¤¿à¤°à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤° 500 à¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¤µà¤¾à¤² à¤¹à¥!à¤­à¤ð¤ https://t.co/7qx0av75sZ— Dà¤à¤à¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤«à¥à¤¨ à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ð¯ (@Nationalist_Dee) 1579367887000âAt Shaheen Bagh, Balma (read: men) are protesting wearing Salmaâs burqa to earn Rs 500 and a plate of biryani,â read a loose translation of caption in Hindi given to the photo by a Twitter user. The caption seems to have taken cue from social media claims that claimed that Muslim women were being paid Rs 500 each daily to protest at Shaheen Bagh.

Header: RSS denies publishing 16-page booklet detailing new Constitution for India
West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FACT CHECK: No police 'crackdown' at Shaheen Bagh protest site
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of 'Feku Zee' went live on Facebook with a video on January 15, 2020. The caption of the video, written in Hindi, loosely translates to, "Police came to Shaheen Bagh like thieves at an odd hour, but what happened next forced them to retreat." The video has been viewed more than 1.2 million times, and shared nearly 60,000 times. The same video has been shared by many others as Facebook 'Watch Party', Facebook lives and otherwise with more or less the same claim that Delhi Police attempted a 'crackdown' at Shaheen Bagh protest site in the wee hours of January 15, 2o20.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress leader shares old video of assault on AAP MLA with false claim
Body: Congress politician Salman Nizami tweeted a minute-long, audio-less video that shows a mob assaulting a man while policemen try to rescue him. Nizami claimed that Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Pankaj Pushkar was beaten and kicked by the people of his constituency for remaining inaccessible and absent for five years.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Kerala shared saying anti-CAA protester was slapped by mother
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video showing a middle-aged woman slapping a girl, just after a group of youngsters finish what looks like a 'flash mob', with a claim that gives an impression that an anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) protester was slapped by her mother for taking part in the protests. A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Mohan Vishwa' posted the video along with a caption saying, "When anti-CAA protester meets her mom," along with a laughing emoji. The video has been viewed over 81,000 times and shared over 3,300 times. Many other social media users are sharing the same video with the exact same claim. The video is also being shared widely on WhatsApp.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Tarek Fatah tweets video of Pakistani movie shoot claiming woman refuses Polio drops for her kid
Body: Author Tarek Fatah tweeted a video showing a woman holding a kid telling Polio volunteers she won't allow her kids to take the drops. The woman could be heard saying she'd never allow her kid to take Polio drops since it will trigger diarrhoea. In the video, the woman could also be heard saying that she doesn't want to spend money treating her kid and asks the volunteer to give ration worth the money of the drops. Tweeting the video, Fatah said, "Pakistani mother slams the door shut in the face of Polio workers. Screams at the two female volunteers: "I will never ever allow my children to take these drops. Never never will my kids drink these drops. Never." Pakistani mother slams the door shut in the face of Polio workers. Screams at the two female volunteers: "I will nâ¦ https://t.co/dmUU4IWWXU— Tarek Fatah (@TarekFatah) 1579040349000An archived version of the tweet is here.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photos of PM Modi doing ‘Shastra Puja’ viral saying he worships guns at RSS headquarters
Body: Three different photos of PM Narendra Modi that give an impression that he was performing âpujaâ in front of/on guns are doing rounds on WhatsApp with a claim that he recently performed âgun pujaâ (worshipping guns) at the RSS headquarters. A Times Fact Check reader sent us those photos on our WhatsApp number . He wanted to know if the claim made with photos is indeed correct.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Aparna Sen shares digitally-altered photos to give an impression cops joined anti-CAA protests
Body: Acclaimed actor and director Aparna Sen tweeted a collage with three photos. Two of the three photos showed policemen in uniform holding placards against the newly passed Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 (previously Citizenship Amendment Bill (CAB), 2019) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). The collage Sen tweeted has what translates to, "I won't say anything", written in Hindi above the photos. Sen did not make any outright claim while tweeting the collage, but the impression it gives is that policemen joined anti-CAA, NRC protests, holding placards.

Header: FACT CHECK: Indira Gandhi didn't force Sitaram Yechury to resign as JNUSU president, make him apologise
Body: Former Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai tweeted a graphic card that claims that in 1975, former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi entered the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) with Delhi Police and forced then JNU Students' Union (JNUSU) President Sitaram Yechury to resign from the post and made him apologise for protesting against Emergency. Yechury is now CPM general secretary. The graphic card Pai tweeted says the incident happened in 1975 during Emergency in India and carries a photo showing Yechury reading out something in front of a crowd, standing beside Gandhi. We found many social media users sharing both the graphic card, and the photo used in it individually, with more or less the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Durex India is not behind the meme mocking Delhi Police
Body: A couple of graphic cards bearing the official logo of condom-manufacturing brand Durex India are being shared by many Twitter users. The graphic card imitates the design and format of Durex Indiaâs social media ads. The text in one of the graphic cards makes a sharp attack on Delhi Policeâs conduct in handling the violence unleashed in the JNU campus last Sunday. âBetter protection than Delhi Police,â read the text on the card. On the left bottom corner of the card #ShameOnDelhiPolice is also written. A Twitter user by the name of Sania Ahmed shared the graphic card with hashtag #Ded. #Ded https://t.co/fRYjKtWb26— Sania Ahmad (@SaniaAhmad1111) 1578483381000In a subsequent tweet, she wrote a disclaimer saying it is not a Durex-released ad. A Twitter user by the name of Khadija Shoaib tagged the official Twitter handle of Durex India, commending it. Taking a swipe at the BJP, Khadija said the partyâs IT cell would now readily get AIDS by trending hashtags boycotting Durex. @DurexIndia ðª it in this ad! #BJPITCell ready to get AIDS and to start trending boycott hashtags for Durex in theâ¦ https://t.co/VbEaG2MTxE— Khadija Shoaib (@AlchemyPens) 1578486122000Another Twitter user Natasha shared the card admiring the audacity of ad agency handling Durex for pulling this off. I don't know how Durex's agency managed to convince them to pull this off since they play safe (pun intended), butâ¦ https://t.co/ffAF5pkupK— Natashað (@NutAshes) 1578480793000

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2018 photos of Akshay Kumar shared to claim he sided with ABVP in ongoing JNU row
Body: Photos of Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar waving an Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) flag are being circulated with a claim that the actor sided with ABVP amidst the ongoing JNU row. âOur lone warrior is enough to counter all Bollywood sold outs coming out in support of JNU students,â reads a loose translation of the Hindi text given to these pictures by a Facebook user called Aditya Kumar Gond.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of BJP critic passed off as BJP-RSS supporter threatening protesters
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@goslowlpls' tweeted a video showing a man threatening all those who are protesting against the Narendra Modi-led NDA government and its policies, including the Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019. The man could also be seen talking about the police crackdown on students of Jamia Milia Islamia (JMI) University and Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). Tweeting the video, the user said, "Sanghi proudly and openly admits it was orders from Shah and Modi to beat students (sic)." 'Sanghi' is an internet slang used for those who support the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).  In the video, the man could be heard talking in first person, as if he represents the BJP. This video is now being shared widely on social media platforms and on WhatsApp. A reader reached out to us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Rajasthan shared as attack on Hindu women in Pakistan
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@voice_for_india' shared a video showing two women being brutally thrashed with a claim that it shows some Muslims in Pakistan assaulting a woman and her daughter and that the young girl was later abducted. Sharing the video, this user said, "This video is horrifying what's happening in Pakistan today. These Muslims beat the hell out of this young Hindu girl & her mother & was forcefully taken away. Please I beg of everyone opposing the #CAA please re-think, in 1951 there were 12.9% Hindus in Pakistan & now only 1.6%." This video is horrifying what's happening in Pakistan today. These Muslims beat the hell out of this young Hindu giâ¦ https://t.co/T5l8UmvUAJ— Renee Lynn (@Voice_For_India) 1578358394000A lot of social media users, on Facebook and Twitter, are sharing the same video with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Random, old photos of sex toys, condoms shared claiming these were found in JNU girls' hostel
Body: Many social media users are sharing two photos showing sex toys and condoms scattered on the floor with a claim that these were found inside a girls' hostel in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus post the violence that ensued there on January 5, 2020. A Twitter user who goes by the handle 'MaheshNayak221' shared the two photos with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "Stuff scattered inside girls' hostel after vandalism in JNU. Students here are great. Feeling very sad seeing their torn books." We found the same two photos being shared by many other users, both on Facebook and Twitter, with the exact same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Kumbh Mela shared as naga sadhus rallying in support of CAA
Body: A video showing a large number of naga sadhus descending on the streets and chanting âHar Har Mahadevaâ is being shared with the claim that naga sadhus took out a rally in support of Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019.   âLarge number of naga sadhus came on street in Prayagraj to show their support for CAA,â read a loose translation of Hindi caption given to the video.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This child was not beaten by UP Police, she’s from Pakistan
Body: A photo of a Muslim woman holding a visibly-injured child is being circulated on social media with a claim that the kid was beaten by Uttar Pradesh (UP) Police during their crackdown against the Anti-Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019 protesters in the state. Facebook user Mohsin Rafi Khan shared the picture with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, âThe goons of UP police did not even spare a child. The Yogi government in the state is a living example of hawkishness.â We also received the same message on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 from a Times Fact Check reader who wanted to know if the claim is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, people were not picked from homes in Assam after implementation of NRC
Body: A video in which police personnel can be seen detaining many men and women is going viral on social media with a claim that since NRC has been implemented in Assam, people are being picked from their homes. The video shows a group of men being put into a van by policemen, and the former lot resisting amid chants of âNara-e-Takbir and Allah hu Akbarâ. The same video also has women police personnel detaining Muslim women in another bus. The video is going viral on Facebook, with several users sharing it with the same claim. A Times Fact Check reader also sent the same video with the same claim to us on our WhatsApp number 85270 01433 and wanted to know if the claim is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral news of Jamia student killed in police action is false
Body: A photo-message being circulated on Facebook and WhatsApp claims that a student of Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI), injured in police action during protests against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), succumbed to his injuries. The message claims the name of the student to be Ubaid Ur Rehman. A loose translation of the text in Hindi shared along with the photo reads, âJamia Millia Islamia student Ubaid Ur Rehman was injured in the protests against CAA. His treatment was going on at JP Hospital where he passed away at 2 am today. He hails from Banjarahwa village in Dumriaganj. His funeral prayer will be performed at 10 am on January 2, 2020. So I request everyone to join the funeral prayers. May allah bless him and grant patience to his family members. Amen.â One of the readers of the Times Fact Check forwarded the same message to us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 and asked if the information is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Shah Rukh Khan wasn't arrested in London over anti-CAA protest
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users are sharing a photo of Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan with a claim that he was arrested at London's Heathrow Airport where he arrived to take part in a protest against the recently passed Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Jabab Chahiye' posted Khan's photo with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "Breaking: Shah Rukh Khan, who arrived at London's Heathrow Airport to take part in the (anti) CAA protests happening there, was arrested. Main opposition parties in India said this is a matter of shame to India and said the whole thing is an outcome of a conspiracy between the RSS and the new government of Britain." The caption ends with a question, "Will you still watch his movies, Hindus?" A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@ShooterVartika' also tweeted the same photo with almost the same caption. An archived version of the tweet is here.The same photo and caption are being shared widely on WhatsApp as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: CCTV footage from Sri Lanka jail shared claiming Muslims were beaten in Assam detention centre
Body: A video showing police officers beating up people who appear to be inmates of a prison was shared with Times Fact Check by a reader on our WhatsApp number 8527001433. The alert user also sent us the claim that was made along with the video - that Muslims were beaten up in a detention centre in Assam. Hereâs the screengrab of the message we received from the reader who wanted to know the authenticity of the video and the claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Police thrashed youngsters in public over stone pelting?
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Vikash Dhaka Hindu' posted a video showing police brutally thrashing some men and making some of them do sit ups as a mark of seeking apology. Along with the post, the user has written a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "This video is for those who have been saying, "This is just the beginning of stone pelting". This is what will happen to stone pelters." The video has been viewed over 5,62,000 times, has been shared more than 22,000 times and the post has received over 4,100 comments. The Facebook user who shared the video did not outrightly claim that the video is in anyway related to the ongoing protests against the new Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 and the National Register of Citizens (NRC), but many Facebook users seem to have assumed that the video is from Uttar Pradesh (UP) and the caption was directed at the anti-CAA-NRC protesters, who, at different places, have been accused of pelting stones at the police. For instance:

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Bangladeshi refugees vandalise railway station in Kolkata?
Body: A video sent to Times Fact Check by a reader on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 shows a Muslim mob vandalising a railway station using sticks and other weapons. The reader shared the video with a claim that Bangladeshi refugees resorted to violence at a railway station in Kolkata. The text along with the video warned that if these refugees were granted citizenship in India, violent scenes like these would be an everyday affair. The reader wanted to know if there was any truth in the claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Muslim festivals not mentioned in NPR manual 2020?
FAKE ALERT: Photo of TikTok stars from Nepal shared as new women ministers in Finland
Body: An image of four young women posing together is being shared on social media with a claim that these are the new women ministers in the newly formed cabinet of Finland government. âMeet the new government of Finland. From left to right: Minister of Education Li Andersson (32), Minister of Finance Katri Kulmuni (32), Prime Minister Sanna Marin (34) and Minister of Internal Affairs Maria Ohisalo (34),â reads the text being tweeted along with the photo. The women in the picture are being compared with women ministers in India, where the latter are being mocked for their looks. Meet the new Govt. of Finland. From left to right: Minister of Edu. Li Andersson(32) Minister of Finance Katri Kuâ¦ https://t.co/6pq2yqjXLK— Quamar Danish (@290492hashmi) 1577099968000Meet the new Govt of Finland. Header: FACT CHECK: Chidambaram linked NPR to NRC during UPA 2?
FAKE ALERT: Parineeti Chopra wasn’t sacked as ‘Beti Bachao’ ambassador for supporting CAA dissenters
Body: Many news reports have been doing rounds claiming that Bollywood actress Parineeti Chopra was removed as the brand ambassador of âBeti Bachao Beto Badhoâ scheme by Haryana government after she criticized âpolice brutalityâ against those who were dissenting against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019. Chopra had on December 17, 2019 expressed displeasure at the way âinnocent human beingsâ were handled by authorities for protesting against CAA. She tweeted saying, "We shouldnât call our country democracy anymore," if dissenters have to face violent crackdowns and called the same âbarbaricâ. If this is whatâs gonna happen everytime a citizen expresses their view, forget #CAB, we should pass a bill and notâ¦ https://t.co/pX6YapJ48I— Parineeti Chopra (@ParineetiChopra) 1576553552000Following her tweet, many news reports surfaced claiming she was dropped as the face of âBeti Bachao Beti Badhaoâ programme, by the Haryana government, because of her views on CAA protests. Haryana drops Parineeti Chopra as Beti Bachao face after her âbarbaricâ comment on police ThePrint'sâ¦ https://t.co/6H3Sj2bk4q— Shekhar Gupta (@ShekharGupta) 157685199700

Header: FACT CHECK: No poster saying India should be a Muslim nation at anti-CAA protest Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attended
Body: A photo from an anti-Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), 2019 protest Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attended on December 16, 2019 is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The photo shows one of the protesters holding a placard that says in Hindi what closely translates to, "Repeal CAB, make this nation a Muslim rashtra." Here is the photo: An alert Times Fact Check reader reached out to us on WhatsApp asking if the above photo is indeed real.

Header: FAKE ALERT: AAP MP shares cropped video to claim Amit Shah endorses violence
Body: Aam Aadmi Partyâs Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh shared a short video clip that had a byte of Home Minister Amit Shah with a claim that the latter makes lotus (BJPâs election symbol) bloom through violence. In the video shared by Singh, Shah can be heard saying what can be loosely translated to âThe more violence spreads, the more lotus bloomsâ. Singh later deleted the video. The video was shared by many others, including a Youth Congress leader Aman Dubey, with similar claims. Dubey tweeted the video with hashtags #ResignAmitShah #JamiaProtest, to make it look like Shah was reacting to those Anti Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) protests that turned violent. à¤à¤¿à¤¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¹à¤¿à¤à¤¸à¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¥à¤à¤¡à¤¼ à¤¹à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤à¤à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤®à¤² à¤à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤à¤¾... #ResignAmitShah #JamiaProtest https://t.co/OtmzoUgLIw— Aman Dubey (@AmanDubey_) 157647914400

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mahila Congress secretary calls BJP leader Hukumdev ‘rape guru’, shames Smriti
Body: Congress member and national secretary of Mahila Congress Indrani Mishra tweeted a photo of BJP MP Smriti Irani, shaming her for folding hands in front of someone who she addressed as a ârape guruâ. Tagging Irani, Mishra called her a âshameless personâ who bows down in front of a "rape guru" but asks Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to apologize over his ârape in Indiaâ remark. Mishra asked Irani, âDid shame leave you or you left shame?â. Hereâs the archived version of this tweet.

Header: FACT CHECK: This man in police gear is neither a civilian nor an ABVP member
Body: A photo of a man wearing police gear over civilian clothes is being shared by many social media users with a claim that he is a member of Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), named Bharat Sharma. These social media users, especially on Twitter, are also claiming that this man, who they claim to be Sharma, was among the many Delhi Police personnel who were seen beating a student near Jamia Milia Islamia (JMI) University. This is another photo social media users are sharing while making the above claims about the man. Meanwhile, some Twitter users have also been posting the photo of the man in police gear, wearing civilian clothes, asking Delhi Police why he is not in uniform and if he really is a police personnel. Other than this, there is a photo of another man, again in police gear over civilian clothes, that is doing the rounds on social media with users claiming that he is not a Delhi Police personnel.

Header: FACT CHECK: 2012 photo of Muslim youngsters vandalizing Amar Jawan Memorial shared in connection with CAA
Body: A photo of two Muslim youngsters desecrating Amar Jawan Jyoti memorial in Mumbai is being shared in connection with ongoing protests against Citizenship Ammendment Act (CAA) across the country. âThe country should know how many traitors are hidden in our country. This bill (CAB) has opened the eyes of many Indian citizens,â read a loose translation of text in Hindi shared along with the picture.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this toddler was not injured in anti-CAA protest in West Bengal
Body: Two photos of a little girl, one in which she could be seen bleeding from her head, and the other in which her head is bandaged, are being shared by many social media users with a claim that she was injured during a protest in West Bengal against the new Citizenship Amendment Act. In West Bengal, there have been widespread violence, and buses, trains were   torched.  A Facebook user who goes by the name Jayavardhan Bohara Shandilya shared the photos with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Thank you Indian Muslims. This is a little girl who was on that train. Now don't say anything for this girl, else your brotherhood will be affected." A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@kavita_tewari' posted the same two photos saying, "She is not a Shia girl spilling blood in a Muharram procession, neither she splattered blood to support Gaza, she is an innocent Hindu child who, while travelling in a train, received plethora of love from peacefuls in West Bengal. Bengal is burning, thanks to the witch in white."

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, the woman giving a speech on cows is not Hyderabad rape victim
Body: A Twitter user by the name of Shailen Pratap shared a video of a woman delivering a speech along with a claim that it is an old video of the Hyderbad gangrape victim addressing the issue of cow slaughter. Pratap also claimed that there were eight rapists involved in raping and murdering the 26-year-old veterinary doctor, out of which four were let-off by police at behest of a âwell known politicianâ who plotted the entire rape and murder. Hereâs the archived link of tweet. One of our readers tagged us on Twitter wanting to know if the claims were true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Woman being beaten up in this video from Pakistan is not a Hindu
Body: A video showing a woman being mercilessly beaten up by a group of men is being widely shared on Facebook with a claim that the woman is a Hindu. âThis is how women are treated in Pakistan,â reads the caption given to the video. The caption also says that the only crime committed by the women is that sheâs a Hindu living in the âpeacefulâ nation of Pakistan.   The video has been massively shared and viewed.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Hyderabad rapist shot dead by Telangana Police not Asaduddin Owaisi's nephew
Body: A video going viral on YouTube and WhatsApp makes some controversial claims about the Hyderabad rape and murder case where a 26-year-old veterinary doctor was set ablaze after being brutally gang-raped. Here are the claims made in the video: 1) The main rape accused (who was shot dead in a police encounter) Mohammad Pasha is AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi's nephew. 2) The Hyderabad gangrape victim was an activist who worked against cow smuggling and had gotten many Muslim cow smugglers arrested. 3) This angered Owaisi and he plotted revenge against the victim by conspiring with Pasha and decided to get her raped and murdered.

Header: Fact Check: Was a rapist in Saudi Arabia shot dead within 5 minutes of being caught?
Body: Video of a man being executed publicly is being shared with a claim that in Saudi Arabia, the rapist of a 5-year-old girl was shot dead within five minutes of being caught, and that he was then hanged at a busy intersection. A loose translation of the Hindi text given by a user who posted the video is, "Rapist of 5-year-old girl in Saudi Arabia was shot dead in public within 5 minutes. Send this post to as many people that it opens eyes of Indian government.â Hereâs a screengrab of the tweet: Note: The visuals of the 45-second-long video are quite disturbing to be reproduced here.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo of sandalwood smugglers' encounter shared as that of Hyderabad rape accused
Body: Photo of dead men surrounded by police officials is being shared on Twitter as that of four accused in the gang rape and murder of a veterinary doctor, who were gunned down by Cyberabad police in an encounter in the wee hours of Friday. There can be no Human Rights for rapists , traitors and terrorists.ð Shame on people talking about Human Rights todâ¦ https://t.co/ERTGeTd6KM— Adarsh singhð®ð³ (@AdarshRo45) 1575606358000This action was necessary for some people of india who always think that they can do anything with women or girls iâ¦ https://t.co/NWHoDwj5KX— @sidhujot (@sidhujot6) 1575606848000The image is being used by many on Twitter to express their opinions about the encounter that took place at the same spot where the doctor was set ablaze after being brutally raped and murdered.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Modi government pass a new law that allows women to kill rapists?
Body: A message going viral across social media platforms claims that Narendra Modi government recently passed a new law one which gives women the right to kill or harm someone who tries to rape them. The message says that under Section 233 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) a woman won't be punished if she killed the man who raped her. Finally a New law passed by @narendramodi_in @narendramodi IPC 233 ð https://t.co/SdmyJz6Pd7— Kaushal_Patilâ¢ (@Kupatil143) 1575464954000âFinally a new law passed by Modi govt today. As per Indian Penal Code 233. If a girl is suspected to be raped or getting raped, then she has the supreme right to kill the man, injure his sexual part or harm that person as dangerously and girl won't be blamed for murder,â read the message being circulated.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2017 image from Bangladesh shared as Dalit boy tortured in Pune
Body: Picture of a young boy wearing a garland of slippers is being circulated with a claim that he was festooned and paraded by âManuwadi peopleâ in Pune after he mentioned BR Ambedkar in his schoolâs assembly prayer. In the image being shared, a large group of school girls can be seen in the background as the boy wearing garland of slippers is paraded in front of them. A Facebook user by the name of Maina Lakhani posted the image with a long text in Hindi. A loose translation of what she wrote reads, âThis is not an ordinary photo but is the reason behind suicides that happen. People from Manuwadi mindset did this to a boy who mentioned two words about Babasaheb Bhim ji in schoolâs morning prayer. It is too early to confirm this but if anything of this sort happened, it is condemnable. It happened in Pune district.â The same photo with more or less similar captions was shared by many other Facebook and Twitter users.

Header: FACT CHECK: Was Hyderabad rape accused publicly beaten by police?
Body: A video going viral on Facebook shows policemen welding sticks on a man who tries his best to evade the thrashing. The video is being shared with the claim that police officers publicly beat up the main accused of Hyderabad gangrape and murder case. A loose translation of the Bengali caption given to video goes, âHyderabad rape case accused beaten by police. We want death penalty as punishment.â   Same video is being shared with more or less similar captions by many other Facebook users

Header: FACT CHECK: Does Shiv Sena Bhavan have a poster of Sonia Gandhi?
Body: An image being circulated on Facebook shows a life-size portrait of interim Congress President Sonia Gandhi on the exterior of Shiv Sena Bhavan, headquarter of the Shiv Sena in Mumbai. The image is being shared with an insinuation that Shiv Sena put up the poster after it allied with Congress and NCP to form government in Maharashtra. âOnly this was left to be witnessedâ, was the text shared along with the image posted by one Bhushan Deodhar on Facebook.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old tweet from PM Modi shared to claim he expressed grief post Fadnavis’ resignation
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Sarvesh Nayak posted a collage containing screengrabs of two different tweets attributed to Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modiâs official Twitter handle. The tweets were juxtaposed in way to claim that Modiâs joy turned into sorrow after Devendra Fadnavisâ second term in Maharashtra lasted only three days. The first tweet had Modi congratulating Fadnavis and NCPâs Ajit Pawar for taking oath as Maharashtraâs CM and deputy CM respectively. The second tweet had PM stating that his âImmense joy turned into immense sadness." Nayak, while sharing this collage, wrote, âFirst reaction of PM Modi after Fadnavisâ resignationâ.   Same collage was posted by other Facebook users with similar claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Son who returned to his Mumbai home found mother's skeleton there?
Body: Many Facebook users are sharing a photo of a decayed body on a couch with a claim that it is of a Mumbai woman, a millionaire, who died inside her apartment worth Rs 7 crore, and that her body remained there for almost 10 months, without anyone noticing. In the long caption shared along with the photo, it is also being claimed that the woman's son found her decayed body when he returned from America, and that the last time they spoke was over a one-and-a-half years ago. Facebook user Manoj Saini posted the picture along with the long caption in which he said that the woman's name was Asha Sahni and her son's name was Rituraj. The caption said that Rituraj doesn't know how his mother died. Sahni used to live alone in her apartment on 10th floor as per the post and her husband died in 2013. An archived version of the post is here.As of now, the post has been shared over 16,000 times, it has got more than 14,000 likes and has over 10,000 comments. Many Facebook users have been sharing the same post with the same caption in the last two days.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo of Baba Ramdev with cancer patient shared to project him as a womanizer
Body: A photo of yoga guru Baba Ramdev with a woman is being shared with sleazy connotations in a bid to portray him as a womanizer. A Twitter user by the name of Naushad Ali Ansari shared the photo with a crass and insensitive caption in Hindi. We have blurred the text as it is too vile to reproduce. On Facebook, a user named Zameer Khan shared screengrab of a tweet with similar claim.   The photo has been in circulation for the past few years with different sleazy captions. Two years ago, it was shared to claim that Ramdev would be next in line to get caught in sex scandal.   In 2015, the same image was tweeted with a claim that Ramdev posed with his girlfriend. Baba ramdev's personal girlfriend. Ask @yogrishiramdev who is she. @ndtv http://t.co/LKUmi72tOp— Desi Leak (@desileak) 142113890100

Header: FACT CHECK: This is not Tukaram Omble martyred during 26/11 Mumbai Terror Attacks
Body: Many social media users paid tributes to martyrs of the 26/11 Mumbai Terror Attacks yesterday, the day that marked 11 years of the horrific attacks that happened on November 26, 2008. As many as 166 people died in the attack and over 300 were injured. In the counter-terror operations, many security officials were martyred. Tukaram Omble, ASI, Mumbai Police, was one among the brave officials involved in the operations. It was Omble who threw himself at terrorist Ajmal Kasab, while taking many bullets from Kasab's AK-47, and tackled him to the ground. Many social media users who paid tributes to Omble, however, have been sharing a photo assuming the man seen in the photo is Omble. Among them is BJP MP Shobha Karandlaje who tweeted an image with two photos, one of Omble and one of another man, assuming that's Omble. This tweet has already been retweeted 6,000 time and liked more than 21,000 times. Actor Amitabh Bachchan, too, quote-tweeted a tweet that used this particular image saying, "Salute.. in the sacrifice and the honour." salute .. in the sacrifice and the honour .. ððð https://t.co/aAHAxB1epl— Amitabh Bachchan (@SrBachchan) 1574745953000The photo is being shared by many on Facebook as well. For instance:

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2016 photo shared claiming JNU student was brutally thrashed
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Pankaj Chawda' shared a photo of a young man with injuries on his back. The text on the image Chawda shared was a caption in Hindi. Here's a loose translation of the text: "What have they done to JNU! Kids go there to secure education for a good career. But now, they have started realising the rights and wrongs. And they raise their voice against Manuvadi policies. This is why they are in this state." This particular post has been shared over 3,400 times. Students of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) have been protesting a recent hike in fees. The caption on the image Chawda shared implied that a JNU student was brutally thrashed for protesting.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of an old man being shared saying he's a JNU student
Body: A photo showing an old man standing next to a youngster is being shared by many social media users along with false claims. In the caption given along with the photo that is being shared, these social media users claim that the youngster is a policeman and that he found his lost uncle when Delhi Police lathicharged students of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), protesting against a recent fee hike. They also claim that the old man is a student of JNU. The photo that is being shared widely is also digitally altered. The attempt was to make it appear as if the youngster is wearing a police hat, implying he is a cop. A Facebook user who goes by the name Shastra Veer posted a graphic card that had the photo in question along with text that said, "Cop finds his lost uncle studying in JNU campus during a brawl between PhD students", with a caption saying, "Free loaders knows where free food/free stay will be available-free loaders will jump there. 70yr Moinuddin coming from JNU after completing his PhD." Many other Facebook users shared the same image along with the same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Attendance system in Pakistan school shared as one installed in Delhi
Body: Many social media users, especially Facebook users, have been sharing a video that shows kids marking attendance on a system that looks like an ATM machine using their ID cards. Sharing the video, a Facebook user who goes by the name 'Khan Atikur Rahman' shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "See how Kejriwal has changed schools in Delhi, that the entire universe is coming to witness it. Parents will get a message when kids mark their attendance in school." This post has been shared more than 4,800 times. We also noticed that the same video was shared by a Facebook user who goes by the name 'Mohammad Shamim Munna' three months ago with the exact same caption. This post has been shared more than 68,000 times and the video has been viewed over 2.3 million times. In the comments, thousands of people are hailing Kejriwal for installing this system, thinking the video is actually from a school in Delhi.

Header: FACT CHECK: Video from Bihar showing cop slapping e-rickshaw driver shared as one from UP
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video that shows a policeman in uniform thrashing an e-rickshaw driver. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'VAN News' shared the video with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "Police keep thrashing the poor. His fault was that he asked the cop to pay for the ride." They even mentioned the name of the reporter who reported the news for them. A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@bV0emyyRtgH4Hd' shared a YouTube link to the same video saying, in Hindi, what loosely translates to, "Please take cognizance of the matter and initiate legal action," and tagged Uttar Pradesh DGP and the verified Twitter handle of UP Police. This implied that the incident was shot in UP. The YouTube video was published on November 19, 2019. A Times Fact Check reader also sent us the YouTube video shared by the above Twitter user saying the incident is from UP.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Gambhir say commentary is more important than meetings?
Body: A short video clip of East Delhi MP and former Indian opener Gautam Gambhir is being shared to claim that he said âDoing commentary is more important than attending meetings to discuss pollution crisisâ. A Twitter user by the name of Aarti shared the clip from her verified handle with the same claim and cautioned people against voting for celebrities in elections. ÃÃ Next time, beâ¦ https://t.co/EalGCWVz6l— Aarti (@aartic02) 1574069268000In the 8-second-long clip shared by Aarti, one can hear a news reporter telling Gambhir that he didnât attend the pollution meet for which he was invited. Gambhir retorts, âWhat is more important, work or meetings?â The same clip was shared on Facebook by Vikas Yogi, national media coordinator of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), along with a caption saying, âFor Gambhir, his work is more important than attending meetings to tackle pollutionâ.   Another AAP leader Sunny Upadhyay shared the clip accusing Gambhir of becoming an MP only to attack Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This photo shows Delhi Police thrashing JNU students? No!
Body: A photo showing a police official hitting a young woman is being shared to imply that it was clicked when a Delhi policeman was beating a JNU student for protesting against a recent hostel fee hike. A Twitter user shared the photo by taking a jibe at Modi governmentâs pro-women schemes. âNew India. Welcome to new India. âDaughters can grow only when they are lathichargedâ, is the new slogan. Header: FAKE ALERT: Old, unrelated images shared as that of 'JNU students'
Body: Many social media users are sharing two photos showing middle-aged women being taken away by police personnel with a claim that these women are students of Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), protesting against a recent hostel fee hike. A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@happyappy83' posted two photos along with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "It's not okay to torture little girls studying in JNU. If they don't finish their studies at such a young age, how will they make a career and how will they get married? Poor girls." The same two photos are being shared by other users as well, with captions that make more or less similar claims. For instance:

Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FAKE ALERT: Seeing is believing? Truth behind UP cop wielding lathi on ‘unconscious farmer’
Body: Many Twitter users have been sharing a video showing a policeman wielding lathi on a man lying on the ground. The video is being shared with a claim that a farmer from Unnao, protesting to seek compensation for his land, was brutally beaten up by the police to an extent he became unconscious. Kanchan Srivastava, an independent journalist with a verified Twitter account, shared the video taking a jibe at the Uttar Pradesh (UP) administration. âCan anyone believe this video is from Ram Rajya and the man being served by so many officers is the Annadata?â Srivastava tweeted while sharing the video. Can anyone believe this video is from Ram Rajya & the man being served by so many officers is the Annadata? Unnaoâ¦ https://t.co/YoFiaj1i6H— Kanchan Srivastava (@Ms_Aflatoon) 1573981553000Her tweet was retweeted and quoted extensively. The video was also shared by many other Twitter users with similar claims and words targeting the UP government. This man brutalized by cops is a #Unnao farmer in BJP ruled UP whose lands govt acquired without due compensation,â¦ https://t.co/u4WP8ZSuX2— Samar (@Samar_Anarya) 157410338700

Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake news spread under #StopIsraeliTerror hashtag on Twitter
Body: 1Hashtag #StopIsraeliTerror was trending on top on Twitter in India yesterday. Tweeting under this hashtag, a Twitter user by the name of âMo.Riyazâ shared an image of an injured baby to imply that the infant was injured by the Israel Army, recently. #StopIsraeliTerror Peace Loving bhakts stand with terrorist https://t.co/9ukVA7RTl9— Mo.riyaz (@Moriyaz59955459) 1573744131000TRUTH AND VERIFICATIONThe claim is false. The baby in this picture was not injured by the Israeli Army. The image is of an injured infant from Mosul, Iraq and is over two years old. Using reverse-image search on Google, we found a tweet dated April 24, 2017, from the verified handle of MSF (MÃ©decins Sans FrontiÃ¨res) India which posted the same image saying that this baby, severely injured, was rescued from Mosul and that she was the only surviving member of her family. #Iraq: This baby, rescued from west Mosul, was the only surviving member of her family. She received medical aid atâ¦ https://t.co/3OgknMjFGT— MSF INDIA (@MSF_Ind) 1493033579000The image was also used in a report titled âAfter the battle: The unfolding of a disasterâ published by msf.org on July 11, 2018. The report talks about military offensive led by an alliance of the Iraqi security forces and an international coalition to retake Mosul, Iraqâs second biggest city. In this article, the image is shared and credited to some Javier Rius Trigueros. VERDICTTimes Fact Check has found that image of an injured baby from Mosul is being falsely shared as one injured by Israeli Army recently. CLAIM 2A Twitter user by the name of âMohammad Naboutâ posted an image under hashtag #IsraeliCrimes. In the photo, a man can be seen pointing a gun at two youngsters, a man and a woman. A Zionist settler aiming his gun at a Palestinian student, The Europeans and Americans calls this settler an "Israâ¦ https://t.co/m9EQ1hETER— Mohammad Nabout (@MohammadNaboutt) 1573242942000Referring to the man with the gun as âZionist settlerâ, Mohammad claimed that the man with the gun was aiming at two Palestine students.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, former US President Barack Obama is not working in a hotel now
Body: A Facebook user who goes the name 'Pradeep Sharma' shared a video claiming that the former president of the United States of America, Barack Obama, now works in a hotel. Sharma shared the video along with a caption written in Hindi. Here is a close translation of his post - "This is former US President Barack Obama, who now works in a hotel. But here in India, even ward councilors consider themselves landlords. Even today, Obama enjoys three times the number of followers on Twitter than Modi and six times the number of followers than Trump. Leaders in India and around the world should learn from Obama. In India, MLAs or ministers don't even vacate their bungalows."   The post made on November 13, 2019, has been shared over 23,000 times already. The video has been viewed over 7,10,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Nehru’s picture with niece shared saying he was trying to kiss British woman
Body: A picture of Indiaâs first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru in which a woman can be seen kissing him is being shared to malign him and portray him as a womanizer. The picture is being shared with the claim that Nehru couldnât come out of the clutches of Britishers, thereby implying that he exchanged a kiss with a British woman. A Twitter user shared the image with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, âNehru was at the peak of freedom struggle, but the Britishers kept him captive via crooked means. Even after trying hard, Nehru couldnât resist freeing himself. Hereâs a photo that symbolizes his struggle.â à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ #à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¤°à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¾à¤¦à¥ à¤à¥ à¤²à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾à¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¤°à¤® à¤ªà¤° à¤¥à¥ à¤à¤¿ à¤à¤à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¥à¤à¤¿à¤²à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¥ à¤¦à¤¬à¥à¤ à¤²à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤²à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥à¤¶à¤¿à¤¶ à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦ à¤­à¥ à¤µà¥â¦ https://t.co/zU3QxiuV6I— Akhandanand Tripathi / Kaleen Bhaiya (@godoftrolls1) 157369887900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Bihar shared saying 'Kashmiri Muslim child' lynched
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle 'SuhaibSaqib1' and name 'Suhaib Saqib' shared a disturbing video showing a man being brutally thrashed by a few people in the presence of a policeman claiming that a few members of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) tortured a 'Kashmiri Muslim child' to death. Tweeting the video, Saqib said, "A Kashmiri Muslim child has just been tortured to death by RSS Hindutva Nazi goons. My question to western leaders: would you allow this to happen to your children & silently spectate? Can any sane mind justify this?" and used #100DaysOfKashmirSiege in his tweet. Here is the tweet: DISCLAIMER: VIOLENT VIDEO. VIEWER'S DISCRETION ADVISEDA Kashmiri Muslim child has just been tortured to death by RSS Hindutva Nazi goons. My question to western leaders:â¦ https://t.co/l35oXKZnHV— Suhaib Saqib (@SuhaibSaqib1) 1573561083000The same video was found to be shared by some Pakistani Twitter handles as well, along with the same claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did cops manhandle this woman over traffic challan?
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name âShivanker Negiâ posted a video in which some policemen can be seen behaving indecently with a woman while she tries to rescue another man held captive by cops. The video is shared with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, âGovernment has turned police officials into goons by increasing traffic fine. A man is beaten in front of his innocent child. Share this message so that the administration wakes up.â The intent behind posting the video is to show that a woman and her family was harassed by cops over a traffic challan.   The video has been viewed over 13 million times and shared close to 250 thousand times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Indian, Pakistani soldiers dancing together viral again
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of 'Harbhajan Singh' shared a video showing soldiers of the Indian Army and the Pakistan Army dancing together with a caption that said, "Indian and pak army solders dancing together at kartarpur corridor (sic)." The same video is being shared by many Facebook users along with the same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Sidhu wrongly quotes Sikh population as 14 crores
Body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu projected himself as a representative of 14 crore Sikhs several times during his speech at Kartarpur corridor inauguration across international border. During the course of his speech where Sidhu heaped praises on Pakistan PM Imran Khan, he also thanked him on behalf of â14 crore Sikhsâ. At one point, Sidhu can be heard as saying, âAlexander the Great had conquered the world with brute force but you, Imran Khan, you have won the hearts of 14 crore Sikhs and the entire world with love.â Hereâs a short clip, at one of the occasion during his speech where he quotes Sikh population as 14 crore: Sidhu @sherryontopp expressing the love and adulation of 14 crore Sikhs for PM @ImranKhanPTI asâ¦ https://t.co/cz3ysi7QU6— Jawad (@WoShakhs) 1573296753000Several Twitter users reacted with astonishment and disbelief to the figure quoted by Sidhu. In Pakistani, during address, Sidhu says he represents 14 crore Sikhs. Is it so ? He may not be even representing hâ¦ https://t.co/1IfS1JceM0— Reshi (@ReshiScorpion) 157344241600

Header: FAKE ALERT: Claims of illegal social media surveillance after Ayodhya verdict false
Body: A message going viral on social media platform Facebook and instant-messaging application WhatsApp claims that new surveillance rules will come into place after the Ayodhya verdict. As per the message cum advisory, all calls will be recorded and every social media activity will be tracked. The message also claims that all devices will be connected to a system in a ministry. Times Fact Check received this message on WhatsApp from a reader who wanted to know the truth. Similar messages could be found circulating on Facebook.

Header: FACT CHECK: Viral video of man reading namaz, blocking street is real and from Belgium
Body: A video going viral on Twitter shows a man blocking a busy street to read namaz. Judging from the area, the videos seems to have been shot in a foreign nation. The video has been shared by many prominent Twitter users. Here are some of the tweets: "Oh Namazi it's your duty to make everyone's life miserable" Hayya-Al-Assalah !! https://t.co/3FsytRgnVf— Anis Farooqui (@anis_farooqui) 1572976347000@RanaAyyub Coming soon to a neighbourhood near you ð¤£ð¤£ð¤£ https://t.co/QpLngu2c5I— AlkaSingh (@ThAlkaSingh) 1573050022000BelÃ§ika'da cami olmadÄ±ÄÄ± iÃ§in yol ortasÄ±nda kaza namazÄ± kÄ±lan BelÃ§ika mÃ¼cahidi ðð https://t.co/4MtWZ9QRa3— Gavur DaÄlÄ± (@gavuruncocu) 1573029399000We were tagged by a Twitter user who wanted us to check the veracity of the video.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra alleges assault on Dalits in UP, police denies
Body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, in a tweet, alleged assault on Dalits in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. Quoting a tweet made by the official, verified handle of the Congress party, Vadra said, in Hindi, what loosely translates to, "In Uttar Pradesh, goons brutally assaulted Dalit brothers for testifying against them. The BJP government is played a mute spectator. Every single day, Dalits and Adivasis are being openly assaulted by goons. Such law-and-order situation and assault on Dalit-Adivasis will not be tolerated." An archived version of the tweet is here.The Congress tweeted a 2-minute-4-second-long video clip of a news broadcast and in this, one can see that a man is being brutally thrashed by a few people. The reporter could be heard saying that the video is of goons beating up a person who testified against them. à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¹à¤° à¤¤à¤°à¤« à¤¸à¤¿à¤° à¤à¤¢à¤¼à¤à¤° à¤¬à¥à¤² à¤°à¤¹à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤à¤à¤²à¤°à¤¾à¤à¥¤ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¡à¤¼ à¤°à¤¹à¤¾ à¤®à¤à¥à¤², à¤«à¥à¤² à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤à¤¯ à¤¬à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¾à¤à¥¤à¥¤ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¹à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤¨à¤¿à¤°à¥â¦ https://t.co/Zer9FHHkKv— Congress (@INCIndia) 1573052501000An archived version of the tweet is here.Journalist Anil Kataria also tweeted this video with the same claim. à¤®à¥à¤¨à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¦à¤²à¤¿à¤¤ à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤° à¤ªà¤° à¤¦à¤¬à¤à¤à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¹à¤° à¤ªà¤°à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤° à¤à¥ à¤à¤° à¤¸à¥ à¤à¥à¤à¤-à¤à¥à¤à¤ à¤à¤° à¤²à¤¾à¤ à¥ à¤¡à¤à¤¡à¥à¤ à¤¸à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤à¤à¤° à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤§à¤®à¤°à¤¾ à¤¤à¤¾à¤²à¤¿à¤¬à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤à¤¦à¤¾à¤â¦ https://t.co/GMH1lqQJae— Anil Katariya (JOURNALIST) (@anil_NEWS18) 1573031623000An archived version of his tweet is here

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of bus accident in Meghalaya shared as Indian soldiers killed by Pakistan Army
Body: A Twitter handle by the name of âFast Newsâ posted a 2-minute-17-second-long video claiming Pakistani army blew up a bus full of Indian soldiers in response to âceasefire violations by Indian Armyâ in Pakistani territory. The user claimed that the firing by the Indian Army had killed one civilian, and that the Pakistan Army was responding to that. #Indian FAUJ KI #LOC PAR #Pakistani HADOOD ME FIRING SE 1 SHEHRI SHAHEED. #PakArmy KI JAWABI KARWAI. #IndianArmy KIâ¦ https://t.co/nsDdxVgujg— FAST NEWS (@FASTNEWSKHI007) 1572787291000The video shows a bus in a capsized position and a number of men in uniform on the ground, grievously injured. A reassuring voice telling everyone that an ambulance was on the way could be heard too.

Header: FACT CHECK: Was this photo of Amit Shah clicked after lawyers and Delhi Police clashed in Tis Hazari Court?
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@rishikeshlaw' and name 'Rishikesh Yadav' tweeted a photo showing Home Minister Amit Shah and Lieutenant Governor of Delhi Anil Baijal meeting a police officer. Yadav, a Supreme Court lawyer as per his Twitter bio, shared the photo with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "Wow! You are meeting and getting explanations from those who shot us, Amit Shah, but you did not come to enquire about the state of our brother who was shot. You side with those the media side with, but listen carefully, until those who shot us are punished we won't stop, and we won't surrender." à¤µà¤¾à¤¹ à¤à¥ @AmitShah à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¨à¥ à¤¹à¤®à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¥ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¤«à¤¼à¤¾à¤ à¤­à¥ à¤²à¥ à¤°à¤¹à¥,à¤¹à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¥ à¤²à¤à¥ à¤à¤¸à¤à¤¾ à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¤¾à¤² à¤­à¥ à¤¨à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¯à¥à¥¤â¦ https://t.co/W1ZBryBQfH— RishiKesh Yadav (@rishikeshlaw) 1573009489000An archived version of the tweet is here.On Noevember 2, 2019, a violent clash broke out between Delhi Police personnel and a group of lawyers at Tis Hazari court. The violence broke out after a policeman allegedly opened fire at a lawyer after engaging in a heated argument over parking space at the court. A group of lawyers then set ablaze a police jeep and blocked traffic demanding the arrest of the policeman.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Image of Golden Temple from 1984 shared to compare it with Kartarpur Darbar Sahib
Body: A Twitter handle by the name of Younis Baloch tweeted two images to compare the âconditionâ of Gurdwara Darbar Sahib at Kartarpur Complex in Pakistan with the Golden Temple in Punjabâs Amritsar. He claimed the first image to be of Kartarpur gurdwara in Pakistan and claimed that the second image to be of Indiaâs Golden Temple. Pakistan Kartarpur 1 India Golden temple 2 https://t.co/vHvC4SJ3Gr— Younis Baloch (@Youniis_Baloch_) 157276962400

Header: FACT CHECK: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari burst firecrackers despite pollution in Delhi?
Body: A photo showing Delhi BJP chief and Lok Sabha MP Manoj Tiwari burning a firework is being shared with a claim that despite rising pollution in Delhi, Tiwari indulged in burning fireworks. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'I.T & Social Media Cell Congress' shared the photo with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "This is Manoj Tiwari, MP Northeast Delhi. He's busy burning firecrackers. Despite Delhi's current situation, he has no mercy. We feel ashamed that the people of Delhi chose him as an MP." Below the photo showing Tiwari burning what looks like a firework known popularly as 'Fountain' is a screengrab of a tweet made by Tiwari from his verified Twitter handle. The tweet, in Hindi, translates to, "My eyes are burning in Delhi today. Yours?" Journalist Shahbaz Ansar tweeted two photos of Tiwari. The first one shows Tiwari wearing a pollution mask and the second one is the same one showing him burning a firework. Sharing these two photos, Ansar said what translates to, "On one hand, Manoj Tiwari observes a fast against pollution, and on the other hand, his twin brother could be seen bursting crackers. May no one get such a useless brother." The tweet has been liked by over 3,100 Twitter users.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video showing beggar tricking people into believing he's disabled is not from India
Body: A video showing a beggar, initially crawling alongside those who come across as his wife and kids, and later walking normally is being shared on Facebook with a claim that it was shot in Delhi. A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Sudhir Joshi' shared the video along with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Allah's miracle in the capital city of Delhi. A disabled youngster who begged on the streets got his legs fixed." The same video is being shared by many other Facebook users as well.

VIEWER'S DISCRETION ADVISED   Some Twitter users are sharing the video with a claim that the man is a forest official in Bengal and that he should be jailed. DISTURBING VISUALS.
