Not aware whether this is new or old one! Pls take actioâ¦ https://t.co/YB74Bgnktn— Anil Kumar M (@AniltheMatrix) 1572238921000An alert Times Fact Check reader shared the video with us on our WhatsApp number asking if the video is from India.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old photo of Aditya Thackeray shared claiming he visited Ajmer Sharif after Maharashtra polls
Body: A picture of Shiv Sena MLA Aditya Thackeray is being shared with a claim that the young leader visited Ajmer Sharif Dargah to pray that he gets the chief ministerâs (CM) post in Maharashtra. In the photo, Thackeray has his head covered with an orange-coloured âpagriâ and he is surrounded by police officials and public. Twitter user Gaurav Pradhan posted the image tagging the official handle of Shiv Sena. The image was shared with a text saying, âBala Saheb died again today. Well done Shiv Sena!â Bala Saheb died again today Well done @ShivSena https://t.co/wriJtBzCZc— #GauravPradhan ð®ð³ (@DrGPradhan) 1572113789000A close translation of the Hindi text on the image Pradhan tweeted read âShiv Senaâs Rahul Gandhi Aditya Thackeray went to Ajmer Sharif Dargah today to make a wish that he becomes Maharashtra CM. Bal Thackeray (his grandfather) would have again died todayâ.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored image of PM Modi wearing Arab headgear goes viral
Body: An image of Prime Minister Narendra Modi donning Keffiyeh, a traditional Arab headdress is being shared to attack âBhaktsâ (an internet slang used to describe Modiâs admirers). A Facebook page that goes by the name of âI.T & Social Media Cell Congressâ shared the image taking a dig at âbhaktsâ. The text along with the image read, âBhakton, you can boycott Muslims but your father.....â View the post here. Twitter handle @MyFellowIndians shared this image with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Money is not God, but it is not any less than god either, especially when you have become a beggar." The tweet also said that âHindu Hriday Samratâ Modi wore the headgear to get investment for âeconomy destroyed by himâ. âBhakts please donât mind,â the tweet said. Paisa bhagwan nahi hota, lekin Ya Khuda, bhagwan se kam bhi nahi hota, (specially jab aap bhikari ban chuke ho)-â¦ https://t.co/W2MT7LpYee— My Fellow Indians (@MyFellowIndians) 157240673500

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, PM Modi and Russian President Putin are not attending Jallikattu in Madurai
Body: A lot of social media users have been making Facebook posts and tweets claiming that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin will be attending a Jallikattu event in Tamil Nadu's Madurai in January, 2020. Jallikattu is a traditional bull-taming event conducted in different parts of Tamil Nadu as part of Pongal celebrations. Sample some of the tweets and Facebook posts making the claim:Russian President Vladimir Putin is to witness bull taming bravery #Jallikkattu on January 11 ,2020 in #TamilNadu.â¦ https://t.co/UR73L8HjSh— R. RAJAGOPALAN (@RAJAGOPALAN1951) 1572337499000Russian President Vladimir Putin and PM @narendramodi are set to visit Madurai in January 2020 to witness the Jallikattu.— Pinky Rajpurohit (ABP News) ð®ð³ (@Madrassan_Pinky) 1572329989000Modi is putting tamil nadu and it's culture on the world stage Wonder what some idiot tamilians who hate him willâ¦ https://t.co/XyizSYGe5K— The Communal DentistÂ©ð®ð³ (@dr_bharathsn) 1572361817000There have been a few media reports that speculated about Modi and Putin attending Jallikattu in Madurai during Pongal celebrations in January next year.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2017 video viral with claim that toddler Sujith, who fell into a borewell, has been rescued
Body: A video showing a toddler being rescued from inside a borewell is being shared widely on WhatsApp with a claim that the video is of people rescuing the two-and-a-half-year-old boy -- Sujith Wilson -- from Tamil Nadu's Tiruchirappalli district who fell into a borewell on October 25, 2019. One of the messages, written in Malayalam, that is being shared along with the video translates to, "Visuals of rescuing the 2-year-old girl who fell into a borewell two days ago." Another message, written in Malayalam, that is being shared with the same video translates to, "Rescue workers saving the kid who fell into a borewell". The same video is also being shared on WhatsApp along with a caption written in English. The message says, "Two-year-old boy rescued from borewell near Trichy, Tamil Nadu. Big salute to the personnel engaged in this (sic) operations."

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Pankaja Munde 'crying' not taken after loss in Maharashtra polls
Body: A photo of Maharashtra BJP leader Pankaja Munde, that makes it looks like she was crying, is being shared by many social media users with a claim that she broke down after she lost Parli seat to her cousin Dhananjay Munde in Maharashtra polls. A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@purohitvaibhav' and name 'Vaibhav Purohit' tweeted the image saying, "Pankaja Munde breaks down after her shock (sic) defeat from Parli," along with #MaharashtraAssemblyPolls Pankaja Munde breaks down after her shock defeat from Parli #MaharashtraAssemblyPolls https://t.co/l5A5cawh54— Vaibhav Purohit (@purohitvaibhav) 1571914115000An archived version of the tweet is here.#MaharashtraAssemblyPolls Pankaja Munde cries inconsolably after her defeat https://t.co/f4S4TMNuNA— RKHuria (@rkhuria) 1571913929000In a while, news agency IANS made a tweet with the same photo saying, "BJP's heavyweight and Maharashtra minister Pankaja Munde weeps inconsolably after her shock defeat in Parli (Beed) seat by her estranged cousin, NCP Leader of Opposition in Legislative Council Dhananjay Munde." Then, some Twitter users tweeted the same photo with the same caption, pointing to IANS as the source. For instance: BJP's heavyweight and Maharashtra minister #PankajaMunde weeps inconsolably after her shock defeat in Parli (Beed)â¦ https://t.co/tOBRp2XWFj— Rofl Republic ðð¶ (@i_theindian) 1571911899000After IANS tweeted Munde's image with the caption above, many news outlets carried stories saying Munde broke down hearing about her defeat in Parli assembly constituency. For instance:

Header: FAKE ALERT: Image from 2016 Naxal attack shared as Indian soldiers martyred by Pakistan
Body: Twitter user by the name of âZahid Siddiquieâ, a serial fake-news peddler who says heâs a Pakistani national in his Twitter bio, shared a graphic image showing bodies of Indian soldiers with a caption that they were the ânine Indian soldiers dispatched to hell by the brave Pakistani armyâ. Hereâs the tweet: GRAPHIC IMAGE. VIEWERâS DISCRETION ADVISEDIn today's clash, the brave army of Pakistan sent nine Indian soldiers to hell. Don't Mess With The Best âï¸â¦ https://t.co/r8enABfo7M— Zahid Siddique (@ZahidSiddique_) 1571578244000The tweet also carried a screengrab of a bulletin from Pakistani news channel Ary News. It basically said, âPakistan responds and kills 9 soldiers of Indian Army- DG ISPRâ. This text was superimposed on this tweet by Director-General of Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), spokesperson of Pakistan Armed Forces. Indian unprovoked CFVs in Jura, shahkot & Nousehri Sectors deliberately targeting civilians. Effectively responded.â¦ https://t.co/ItdNOQDiii— DG ISPR (@OfficialDGISPR) 1571557676000An archived version of Siddiquieâs tweet is here. Times Fact Check busted another false claim made by the same Twitter handle just yesterday. Hereâs the link to that report.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this is not an Indian soldier getting a bullet removed from his forehead
Body: A video showing a bullet being removed from a man's forehead is being shared widely on social media with a claim that the man shot in the head is an Indian soldier. In the video, the bullet could be seen being removed using just a pair of pliers. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Sanatani aur Modiji ka Chowkidar' shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "This is how the soldiers of our country are. Shot in the head but still has a smile on the face. Live long brother. Jai Hind."   The video has been shared over 7,100 times and viewed over 4,17,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Asaduddin Owaisi did not 'dance' to celebrate Kamlesh Tiwari's murder
Body: Suresh Chavhanke, chairman, managing director and editor-in-chief of Sudarshan News, on October 20, 2019, tweeted a video in which he could be seen saying that All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) President Asaduddin Owaisi 'danced' after the Hindu Samaj Party leader Kamlesh Tiwari's murder made headlines. à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¤à¤à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¥ à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤® à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¤¾ à¤à¤µà¥à¤¸à¥ #à¤à¤®à¤²à¥à¤¶_à¤¤à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤²à¤¿à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦ à¤à¥à¤® à¤à¤° à¤¨à¤¾à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤²à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¿ à¤à¥à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤¸à¤à¤¾â¦ https://t.co/4IHBkqY7ZE— Suresh Chavhanke âSudarshan Newsâ (@SureshChavhanke) 1571548615000In the video, Chavhanke could be heard saying that Owaisi 'danced' "after the news of Kamlesh Tiwari's murder" and then asks if Owaisi was celebrating Tiwari's murder. Chavhanke could also be heard calling Owaisi a 'traitor'. The tweet has, by now, been retweeted over 3,100 times and liked by over 6,600 users. The video has been viewed over 25,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This video shows Pakistan Army raising white flag at LOC, not Indian Army
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@ZahidSiddique_' and name 'Zahid Siddique', a Pakistani as per his bio, shared a video saying, "Indian Army hoists white flag to collect the dead bodies of their soldiers who were killed by the Pakistan Army at the Line of Control clashes," and "Pakistan Army Zindabad". A white flag is raised by the side seeking a truce or signalling surrender. The video shows some soldiers raising a white flag as a gesture of calling for peace, in this case, requesting the other side not to fire until they retrieve the bodies of their soldiers. The video also shows soldiers carrying what looks like bodies of fellow soldiers. #IndianArmy hoists white flag to collect the dead bodies of their soldiers who were killed by the Pakistan Army atâ¦ https://t.co/SJOyH6s4Zy— Zahid Siddique (@ZahidSiddique_) 1571575393000An archived version of the tweet is here.The tweet made on October 20, 2019, that is yesterday, has been retweeted over 1,200 times, liked over 2,700 times and viewed over 68,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: New Rs 1000 note? No, just an artist's imagination
Body: Many social media users have been sharing two images claiming it to be of new Rs 1000 notes the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is going to release in January, 2020. A rumour that RBI will release new Rs 1000 note has been doing the rounds on social media for a couple of years now. In February 2017, current RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das, who was then Union Economic Affairs Secretary, tweeted, "No plans to introduce Rs 1000 notes. Focus is on production and supply of Rs 500 and lower denomination notes," when a similar false claim went viral in 2017. No plans to introduce â¹1000 notes. Focus is on production and supply of â¹500 and lower denomination notes.— Shaktikanta Das (@DasShaktikanta) 1487739477000Now, the rumour is back along with two images social media users are claiming to be of new Rs 1000 note RBI is planning to release in January, 2020. A Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us on WhatsApp asking us to verify if this is true.

Header: FACT CHECK: Couple set a car ablaze over Rs 35000 challan?
Body: Many Facebook users are sharing a video showing some policemen trying to control a man and a woman creating ruckus on the streets with a claim that the the couple was enraged over the police issuing a challan of Rs 35000 to them. The Facebook users sharing the video also claimed that the man set his own car ablaze in protest, gave a pistol to his 'wife' and made her sit on the street with 'their' kids. The video shows a car on fire. Here's the screengrab of a post made by a Facebook user who goes the name 'Sumit Sareen' with the above claim. His post got over 5 lakh views and it was shared more than 15,000 times. A Facebook page that goes by the name of 'Bharat Halchal' shared the same video with exactly the same claim. This post has been shared over 3,300 times and got over 1,36,000 views.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, PM Modi isn’t bowing down in front of Adani’s wife
Body: A photo of PM Narendra Modi bowing down in front of a woman is going viral with the claim that he bowed down in front of industrialist Gautam Adaniâs wife Priti Adani. The photo is being shared with this claim by several Facebook and Twitter users for quite some time now.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2017 video showing men molesting 2 women shared as one from West Bengal
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Pandit Ambrish Tiwari District President Bhadohi' shared a video showing men molesting two women in broad daylight with a caption in Hindi saying, "Bengal has become Pakistan", and asking "Hindus to take up arms to protect themselves since the Mamata Banerjee government won't do anything to save them." The video posted on October 15, 2019 has already been viewed more than a lakh times and has been shared over 1,700 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, it’s not Nusrat Jahan doing dhunuchi dance in this video
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of âSandeep Yadavâ posted a 3-minute-long clip claiming that the woman seen dancing in the video is Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Nusrat Jahan. The video has a woman performing dhunuchi nritya (dance), a prominent Durga Puja custom and one of the most awaited activities during the evening Durga aarti. This devotional dance is performed holding a dhunuchi -- an earthen pot -- containing burning coconut husk and fragrant dhuno.   The video has received close to one million views.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Rahul Gandhi did not say he wants to leave India and settle in London
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Sanjay Swaroop Srivastava' shared a video showing former Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying that he will go to London leaving India, that his kids will study in the United States of America, that he's nothing to do with India whatsoever, that he's a lot of money, and that he can leave India whenever he pleases. The video Srivastava shared has text on it written in Hindi that loosely translates to, "Rahul Gandhi to settle in London with his family." Srivastava shared this 11-second-long video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "BJP's star campaigner back on field after Thai massage." The video has been viewed over 2,96,000 times and the post has been shared more than 10,000 times already.   The same video is being shared by many Facebook users. The same video is being shared on Twitter as well, with more or less the same caption. à¤­à¤¾à¤à¤ªà¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¤¬à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤à¤¾à¤°à¤ à¤¬à¥à¤à¤à¤à¥à¤ à¤¸à¥ à¤¥à¤¾à¤ à¤®à¤¸à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦ à¤®à¥à¤¦à¤¾à¤¨ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ à¤à¤¯à¤¾à¥¤ ðð¤£ð¤­ð¤ðâð https://t.co/zLi2T5PkDn— Surendra Nagar (@Surendr60858831) 1571043696000Priti Gandhi, National Incharge of Social Media, BJP Mahila Morcha, shared the same video saying, "Namaste London!" Namaste London!! ;)) https://t.co/467zWGfRHz— Priti Gandhi (@MrsGandhi) 1570976548000Akali Dal MLA Manjinder S Sirsa tweeted the exact same video saying what closely translates to, "This is why the people of India don't like you Rahul Gandhi." à¤¬à¤¸ à¤à¤¸à¤²à¤¿à¤ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¨à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤® à¤ªà¤¸à¤à¤¦ à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥ @RahulGandhi https://t.co/FrDzc22JiO— Manjinder S Sirsa (@mssirsa) 157098496400

Header: FACT CHECK: Unrelated images shared with photos of PM Modi plogging at Mamallapuram beach
Body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a video of him picking up trash on a beach in Tamil Naduâs Mamallapuram, sending across a strong message to the nation about the importance of keeping surroundings clean, and highlighting the Swacch Bharat Mission, an ambitious initiative of the Modi government towards a cleaner India. Plogging at a beach in Mamallapuram this morning. It lasted for over 30 minutes. Also handed over my âcollectionââ¦ https://t.co/WkkhE6Iy4j— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1570851684000Soon after the video went viral and made headlines, many social media users shared old, unrelated photos, one showing a crew shooting on a beach and another showing a bomb squad scanning an area on a beach, along with the photos of PM Modi plogging on the beach, to imply that the entire exercise was staged. Congress MP from Tamil Naduâs Sivaganga and former Union Minister P Chidambaramâs son Karti Chidambaram, too, tweeted three photos saying, âJai Shree Ramâ. The first photo showed a crew shooting on a beach, the second photo showed Modi picking up trash on a beach, and the third was a photo of Modi with the trash he collected from the beach. Jai Shree Ram! https://t.co/tGrYcdxOXE— Karti P Chidambaram (@KartiPC) 1570895792000An archived version of the tweet is here.The first photo Karti tweeted is being shared by many social media users claiming that Modiâs plogging exercise was staged. For instance: Facebook user 'Kunal Sharma' shared the photo with a caption saying, âOne section of the crew of 25, to film Modi's beach cleaning nautanki (drama)..." The same photo was tweeted by Supreme Court lawyer and Congress spokesperson Brijesh Kalappa, with more or less the same caption. This is one section of the 25 member crew that shot PM Modi cleaning the five star beach this morning. Good job guyâ¦ https://t.co/0cYi6zpRxX— Brijesh Kalappa (@brijeshkalappa) 1570905400000An archived version of Kalappa's tweet is here.A Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us via email with a collage, which had both the images above, asking if the exercise was staged. We found the same four photos shared with the same captions on Twitter by a user who goes by the handle â@i_theindianâ. How PM Modi's #Plogging scene was shot: ðSecurity scans the entire beach ðPlastic wastes are strategically placeâ¦ https://t.co/Zcs3bBX0yk— Rofl Republic (@i_theindian) 1570893865000An archived version of the tweet above is here

Header: FAKE ALERT: Self immolation incident falsely shared as Christian couple set on fire by RSS workers
Body: A video is being shared with a claim that âRSS Hindu radicalsâ set a Christian couple on fire after the wife-husband resisted forcible occupation of their land in Uttar Pradesh (UP). In the 45-second-long video posted by a Twitter user who goes by the name of Rani Mukerji, one can see two people on the ground with burn injuries, while people around them try to douse flames on their bodies with a blanket. One can also hear wailing cries of a young boy in the background. âChristian couple was set on fire by RSS Hindu radicals after the man resisted forcible occupation of his land in UP. Son kept sobbing. This is horrifying!! World has turned a blind eye to what is happening in India. #India #HindutvaTerroristIndiaâ tweeted Mukerji while sharing the video. The tweet was later taken off but not before it was viewed over a lakh times. Hereâs the screenshot of the tweet: However, the same video with the same text was shared by multiple other Twitter accounts. Christian couple was set on fire by RSS Hindu radicals after the man resisted forcible occupation of his land in UPâ¦ https://t.co/9id1KarrHP— Ali (@IamAliIjaz) 157083149600

Header: FAKE ALERT: Viral message claiming RBI will discontinue Rs 2000 currency notes fake
Body: A message going viral across social media platforms claims that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will withdraw all Rs 2000 currency notes from circulation. The message claims that consumers will not be able to exchange Rs 2000 notes after October 10, 2019. It also says that people can only exchange Rs.50,000/- in 10 days. The message further advises everyone to âstart changing your 2000/- notes immediatelyâ. Times Fact Check received the message on its WhatsApp number from a reader who wanted to know the truth.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of policeman trying to locate lost child's parents is not from India
Body: A video showing a policeman carrying a lost child in his arms, appealing to the girl's parents to get in touch with the police, is being shared with a claim that the video was shot in Maharashtra's Nagpur and the child seen in the video was found at 'Nagpur station' and that she can speak only Tamil. The video is being shared widely on social media platforms, YouTube and WhatsApp. Here's a Facebook post by a user who goes by the name ''Gayathri Sharma' with a caption saying, "This baby in Nagpur station she can speak only Tamil. Just forward to best of your known people. It may reach appropriate person." The post has already been shared over 5,200 times and the video has been viewed more than 79,000 times. We found the same video on YouTube with the same caption.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Shehla Rashid wear a saree with Pakistan flag on it?
Body: On a day the former JNU student leader Shehla Rashid announced her decision to quit electoral politics, an image of her was being shared with the claim that she wore a saree with Pakistan flag imprinted on it. Twitter user Oxomiya Jiyori, tweeted an image which had Rashid in two different attires. In one attire, Rashid has her head covered with a scarf, while in the other attire, she can be seen wearing a saree that has Pakistan flag on it. Jiyori claimed that Rashid covers her head while sheâs in India. But when she travels abroad, she wears a dress that has Pakistan flag on it. âNew drama. Rashid quits politics. When was she in politics? She was just a sidekick of all anti-nationals,â she tweeted. New drama .... #shehlarashid .....quits politics, when was she in Politics ?? She was just side kick of all ant Naâ¦ https://t.co/N5EchyoUFL— Oxomiya Jiyorið®ð³ (@SouleFacts) 1570635906000The same claim was made using the same image by others on Facebook as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Doctored image of PM Modi with Chhota Rajan viral
Body: A Facebook user by the name of âDevender Waderaâ shared an old picture of PM Narendra Modi with a claim that he has given an election ticket to his âold friendâ Chhota Rajanâs brother.   Wadera also claimed Modi was standing with Rajan and that the person giving them company was Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis. Hereâs a loose translation of the caption Wadera gave to this photo: âModiji showed large-heartedness. For the upcoming legislative assembly elections, he gave an election ticket to his poor old friend Chhota Rajanâs brother. May the friendship of Krishna and Sudama prosper.â

Header: FACT CHECK: Is this PM Modi's mother dancing to a Gujarati song?
Body: A video showing an old woman dancing to a Gujarati song is being shared with a claim that she is Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Hiraben. A Facebook page that goes by the name of 'Sushma Swaraj Ji Rashtrapati Ho' shared the video on October 5, 2019 with a caption in Hindi that translates to, "PM Narendra Modi's mother Hiraben." The post has already been shared over a 1,000 times. The video has been watched more than 57,000 times already. We have noticed that social media users circulate this video during Navrati every year with the same claim. Over the years, the same video has been uploaded to many YouTube channels with different claims. While some channels claim that the woman is Modi's mother and 97 years old, some channels claim that she is 100 years old.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mock drill video from Madhya Pradesh shared claiming terrorists captured
Body: A video showing Madhya Pradesh (MP) policemen capturing four men is being shared widely on Facebook with a claim that they are 'terrorists' who attacked the Vidisha district collectorate building that is under construction. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Mera Bharat' posted the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Four terrorists entered the Vidisha district collectorate building that is under construction today. However, Vidisha Police managed to capture them alive." The post has already been shared over 4,200 times and the video has been viewed more than 6,46,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Movie clip shared as Swami Vivekananda’s 1893 speech at Chicago
Body: A Facebook user by the name of Sachin Kumar posted a video claiming it was the original video of speech given by Swami Vivekananda at Chicago. He claimed that the speech was delivered on September 13, 1893.   Hereâs a loose translation of the caption Kumar gave to his video post in Hindi: âRare original video. So many of my brothers have not seen Hindu Hriday Samrat Shri Swami Vivekananda. He revived a drowning Sanatana Dharma. Listen to this rare video of speech delivered by Swami ji in Chicago on September 13, 1893â. This post had been shared over 12,000 times.

Header: FACT CHECK: Old photos from Jammu and Kashmir shared as recent
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@dograjournalist' and name 'Ashish Kohli' shared three photos of different places in Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) saying he clicked it on October 3, 2019. A journalist as per his bio, the Twitter user said, "3 pictures clicked today from Kashmir as a reply to your fake tweets and anti-India Propaganda @arjunsethi81". 3 Pictures clicked today from #Kashmir as a reply to your fake tweets and Anti India Propaganda @arjunsethi81 Havâ¦ https://t.co/KfuMKVrdvZ— Ashish Kohli ð®ð³ (@dograjournalist) 1570090620000An archived version of his tweet is here

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Shivraj Singh Chouhan fake injury on his hand?
Body: Two photos of former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan are being shared with a claim that he faked an injury on his hand. In one of the pictures being shared, we can see Chouhan with a plaster on his right hand, while in the other picture, the plaster is on his left hand. A Twitter user by the name of âPappu Singh INCâ shared the photos saying what loosely translates to, âBJP leaders should work in films. What a miracle! In the morning, Chouhanâs right hand is plastered where as in the evening, his left hand is plastered. Hope god cures both his hands.â à¤­à¤¾à¤à¤ªà¤¾ à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¥ à¤«à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤® à¤à¤à¤¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¤¾à¤® à¤à¤°à¤¨à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤à¥¤ à¤à¤¸à¤¾ à¤à¤®à¤¤à¥à¤à¤¾à¤°, à¤¸à¥à¤¬à¤¹ à¤à¤¸ à¤¹à¤¾à¤¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤à¤°, à¤¶à¤¾à¤® à¤à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤¸à¤°à¥ à¤¹à¤¾à¤¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¾â¦ https://t.co/elRppLnp01— Pappu Singh INC (@Pappu30003) 1569986791000The archived link of this tweet can be viewed here. Times Fact Check received the same photos on WhatsApp with a similar claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this is not a photo clicked right after Mahatma Gandhi's assassination
Body: Many social media users and WhatsApp users have been sharing a photo with a claim that it shows the moment right after Mahatma Gandhi's assassination. A Times Fact Check reader shared the image with us along with the caption he got with the message asking if we could help find the truth behind the photo. We then searched with some keywords to find that this photo has been in circulation on social media platforms for quite some time now. For instance, here's a Facebook post that has an elaborate caption with the same photo. The initial part of the caption says, "A rare picture of Mahatma Gandhi's Murder â Hindu extremist RSS worker Nathuram Godse, the man who killed Gandhi was held by two Hindus while dead body of Gandhi is lying on the floor. (January 30, 1948). RSS was immediately banned by Indian Authorities." The above post is from September 30. Here is a tweet that was made on October 1 with a similar claim: Footage of Mahatma Gandhi's exact time of assassination Gandhi on the ground in the dead Killer Nathu Ram RSS arrâ¦ https://t.co/KTHhTs5HEZ— Rhythmic Boy (@Rhythmicboy737) 156994595600

Header: FACT CHECK: People in Houston gathered exclusively for martyred Sikh cop Sandeep Dhaliwal’s memorial service?
Body: Former Indian ambassador to Iran KC Singh tweeted a 31-second-long video shot at NRG stadium in Houston, US. The video shows huge crowd gathered in the stadium with the giant LED screen showing the photo of slain Texas Sikh police officer Sandeep Dhaliwal. Tweeting the clip, Singh claimed that it was a memorial service for Dhaliwal. In the same tweet, he also took a swipe at the 'HowdyModiâ event which was held in the same stadium last week. The intent behind the tweet being that people gathered in large numbers at NRG stadium to pay homage to Dhaliwal and hence, the huge turnout for Modiâs event is not a big deal after all. âMemorial for Sikh police officer Sandeep Dhaliwal killed in the line of duty in Texas in the same stadium where âHowdyModiâ was held. Itâs a packed stadium,â tweeted Singh. Memorial for Sikh police officer Sandeep Dhaliwal killed in line of duty in Texas in same stadium where âHowdyModiââ¦ https://t.co/Oil4ejsVRD— K. C. Singh (@ambkcsingh) 156984937100

Header: FACT CHECK: These photos aren't proof of Sri Krishna's Dwarka in Gujarat
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@jiks' shared four photos, three of them showing ruins underwater and one showing a structure that looks like a temple tower, with a claim that these images prove the existence of what's believed to be Lord Sri Krishna's birthplace in Gujarat's Dwarka. Tweeting the photos, the Twitter user said, "Shri Kishnaâs (sic) Dwarka, The sunken city in Gujarat. As described in the Mahabharata. It is real yet the Christian world says there is no proof!" Shri Kishnaâs Dwarka, The sunken city in Gujarat. As described in the Mahabharata. It is real yet the Christian worâ¦ https://t.co/c4zfW5DN8S— JIXSA (@jiks) 1569836135000The tweet has been retweeted over 1,300 times already and liked by over 2,700 Twitter users. An archived version of this tweet is here.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old image doctored to show Imran Khan flanked by global leaders
Body: A photograph of Pakistan PM Imran Khan is going viral in which he is surrounded by global political leaders US President Donald Trump, President of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdogan among others. In this picture, Khan can be seen sitting in a chair, while other leaders look at him in awe. Many Twitter users are sharing this image saying, âPicture of the year. Proud moment for every Pakistaniâ. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of woman trying to swim in floodwater not from Bihar
Body: A video showing a woman trying to swim in the floodwater that entered a building, possibly her house, is being widely shared on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that the video was shot in Bihar's Patna, a state that is reeling from floods now. Watch the video here:   In the video, the woman's husband could be seen helping her swim in the floodwater. A Times Fact Check reader sent the video to us asking if we could verify if it's indeed from Patna. Meanwhile, a Twitter user who goes by the handle '@KarunaGopal1' tweeted the same video claiming it was shot in Hyderabad. Swim to reach your home ! Hyderabad the Global City https://t.co/6UFRDBMjYM— Karuna Gopal (@KarunaGopal1) 1569479358000An archived version of this tweet is here

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video showing police retrieving arms and ammunition from bike is not from Kashmir
Body: A video showing policemen retrieving firearms from the seat of a bike is being shared widely with a claim that the incident is from Jammu and Kashmir. The caption in Hindi that is being shared with the video closely translates to, "Police Jammu and Kashmir. People say police stop their vehicles intentionally, now what would you say about this?" The 4-minute-18-second video shows policemen retrieving firearms and ammunition from the seat of a bike. The video is being shared on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp with the same claim. For instance: à¤²à¥à¤ à¤à¤¹à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¬à¥à¤à¤à¤° à¤à¤¾à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤°à¥à¤à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¬ à¤à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤¹à¥à¤à¤à¥ à¤à¤¨à¤¤à¤¾ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤à¤®à¥à¤®à¥ à¤à¤¶à¥à¤®à¥à¤° à¥¤ https://t.co/sIMaSH5fmI— à¤¬à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤¬à¤¾ à¤à¥, ð©ð©ð®ð³ð©ð© (@Babajee1123) 1569417363000The video is still being shared. About an hour ago, a Facebook user who goes by the name 'Sandip Shukla' shared the video with a caption that closely translates to, "People say Jammu and Kashmir Police stop vehicles intentionally. Now, seeing this, what will they say? Such animals should be killed in encounters." A Times Fact Check reader sent us the video on WhatsApp with the caption he received it with, asking if it's true. The Indian government revoked the special status of Jammu and Kashmir in the first week of August this year.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Manmohan Singh take permission from Rahul Gandhi to cut his birthday cake?
Body: Former Prime Minister of India Manmohan Singh celebrated his 87th birthday on September 26, 2019. On the same day, a Twitter user, Shefali Vaidya, shared a video tweeted by another Twitter user who goes by the name âRishi Bagreeâ, in which Singh and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi can be seen cutting a cake. Taking a dig at Singh, Vaidya claimed that he did not even have the authority to cut his own birthday cake. Tagging Gandhi, she said that he led Singhâs hand to cut the cake. In her tweet, she also said, âImagine how he âranâ the government for 10 years!â Hmmm, MMS doesnât even have the authority to cut his own birthday cake before @RahulGandhi leads his hand! Imagineâ¦ https://t.co/VXGZxjU0g9— Shefali Vaidya à®·à¯à®à®ªà®¾à®²à®¿ à®µà¯à®¤à¯à®¯à®¾ à¤¶à¥à¤«à¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤µà¥à¤¦à¥à¤¯ (@ShefVaidya) 1569478139000Hereâs the archived version of Vaidyaâs tweet.

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant

Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FAKE ALERT: Old video of AAP protest shared as people marching towards PM’s residence over economic slowdown
Body: A 17-minute-long video is being shared with the claim that people protested against Prime Minister (PM) Narendra Modi over issues like economic slowdown, inflation, new Motor Vehicles Act etc..   The caption given to the video reads, âPeople of our nation are at their PMâs residence. Countryâs falling economy, price rise, strict traffic rules, increasing prices of petrol-diesel and gas have all led to a massive protest by common man against Modi. However, the media will never show you these visuals.â The video shows a large number of people on the streets with different placards in their hands sloganeering against PM Modi. The video is being shared with the same claim by many on Facebook.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Shashi Tharoor tweets photo from Nehru-Indira's USSR visit as one from USA
Body: Senior Congress Leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted a photo showing former prime ministers of the country, Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi, in a car amid huge crowds with a claim that the photo was taken when they visited the United States of America (USA) in 1954. Tweeting the photo, Tharoor said, "Nehru and India (sic) Gandhi in the US in 1954. Look at the hugely enthusiastic spontaneous turnout of the American public, without any special PR campaign, NRI crowd management or hyped-up media publicity." The tweet has already gotten over 3,400 retweets and more than 15,000 likes. Tharoor's tweet is a dig at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who attended an Indian-American community event named 'Howdy, Modi!' at the NRG Stadium in Texas' Houston on September 22, 2019. Among the 50,000 people present at the venue of the mega event was United States President Donald Trump. The same image was tweeted by Congress leader and former MP Kamal Kishor with more or less the same caption. Nehru ji & Smt. Indira Gandhi in the US in 1954. Look at the hugely enthusiastic spontaneous turnout of the Americaâ¦ https://t.co/N7UAK09uCL— Kamal Kishor Commando (@KamalKishor_INC) 1569259392000The image was also posted on Facebook by Indian Youth Congress' online magazine Yuva Desh with a caption in Hindi that translates to what Tharoor tweeted.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Mamata Banerjee accept Ramayan from Amit Shah?
Body: A picture of Home Minister Amit Shah and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is being shared with a claim that the Trinamool Congress supremo accepted book of Ramayan from the BJP president. The picture shows Shah and Banerjee posing for the camera holding a piece of paper that has âJai Shri Ramâ written over it. Twitter user P Shashi shared this picture saying, âAfter initially opposing âJai Shri Ramâ Banerjee is now scared of âlionâ Shah." @MamataOfficial Mamata Banerjee opposed Chanting JAI SHREE RAM in Bengal and now you can see her accepting RAMAYANâ¦ https://t.co/xi2oaHY0Ju— P Shashi (@srp071262) 1569086460000Same picture could be found on Facebook as well with more or less a similar claim. Moloy Burman, a Facebook user, while sharing the picture wrote in Bengali, âHypocrite Mamata went to listen to Jai Shri Ram slogans and held a poster of the same. There is no bigger RSS person in Bengal than herâ.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistan minister shares 2018 video from Himachal Pradesh as one from Kashmir
Body: Pakistan's Minister of Human Rights Shireen Mazari tweeted a video showing men in police uniform felling what appears to be apple trees saying, "Indian occupation forces can't even bare to see fruit trees live in IOJK - lest the Muslim Kashmiris eat the fruit. Such is the barbarism of the Rogue Modi Govt's fascist hate-filled mindset," along with #Kashmir. Indian occupation forces can't even bare to see fruit trees live in IOJK - lest the Muslim Kashmiris eat the fruit.â¦ https://t.co/MCtQ9wHCNA— Shireen Mazari (@ShireenMazari1) 1568539914000Mazari claimed that Indian security forces, after the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir, have been cutting down apple trees in Kashmir.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this video isn’t of the latest skirmish between Indian and Chinese soldiers
Body: A Twitter user by the name of âEva Zhengâ posted a GIF on September 13, 2019, to claim that Indian troops infiltrated and patrolled an entire area under the jurisdiction of China on September 11 this year. Zheng claimed that Indian soldiers didnât pay heed to objections made by Chinaâs Peopleâs Liberation Army (PLA) and allegedly continued to patrol northern bank of lake Pangong, which she called Chinaâs territory. In an apparent reference to the Indian Air Forceâs Vir Chakra Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman, Zheng warned that PLA doesnât offer tea to âinvadersâ. The GIF posted by Zheng shows a man kicking another man. The tweet was retweeted and liked by many. Sept 11 Indian soldiers again patrolled to the area entirely located in China's territory and under China's effectiâ¦ https://t.co/BAfcJctwgS— Eva Zheng éæ¡æ Ø¹Ø§Ø¦Ø´Ø© (@evazhengll) 1568375462000The archive link of the tweet can be found here. Similar tweets with same claims were found on Twitter. Sept 11 Indian soldiers again patrolled to the area entirely located in China's territory and under China's effectiâ¦ https://t.co/bOQIlJjQq5— adnan Abdullah (@adnanabdullah32) 156840835900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Mexico gas plant explosion shared as that of Saudi Aramco attack
Body: Oil facilities of Saudi Arabia's state-run Saudi Arambo oil company faced a deadly drone attack in the early hours of September 14, 2019. The attack instantly crippled the country's global supply of crude. Yemen's Houthi rebel group claimed responsibility of the attack. Many social media and WhatsApp users in India have been sharing a video showing a massive explosion with a claim that it is of the drone attack on the Aramco oil facilities. Sample these:

Header: Fake Alert: No, Smriti Irani didn’t call goddess Durga a ‘sex worker’
Body: A highly derogatory and offensive quote about Hindu goddess Durga is being attributed to Union Minister Smriti Irani. A Facebook user who goes by the name âMohd Talibâ shared a video in which Irani is speaking in Parliament with a claim that she called goddess Durga a âsex workerâ who lured âMahishasurâ into her trap. Talib captioned the video âDurga was a beautiful sex workerâ. In the video, Irani is reading out a paper while making following remarks, âDurga Puja is the most controversial, racial festival where a fair-skinned, beautiful goddess Durga is depicted brutally killing a dark-skinned native called Mahishasur. Mahishasur, a brave, self-respecting leader tricked into marriage by Aryans, they hired a sex-worker called Durga who entices Mahishasur into marriage and killed him after nine nights of honeymooning during sleep.â   The same video is being shared with similar claims on other social media platforms as well. For instance, itâs being shared on YoutTube And on Twitter à¤¦à¥à¤°à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤ à¤à¥à¤¬à¤¸à¥à¤°à¤¤ à¤µà¥à¤¶à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¥à¥ | Durga was a beautiful Sex Worker. Smriti Irani https://t.co/jdobmmRanM— parivartansandesh (@psandesh) 156880145900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Screenshot of tweet from Akshay Kumar's impostor account shared widely
Body: A Twitter account that goes by the handle '@kumarakshay_1', with name 'Akshay Kumar' written in Hindi and with a photo of actor Akshay Kumar as display picture, made a tweet attributing a quote to the actor. The tweet made in Hindi closely translates to, "I am not saying the Godse assassinating Mahatma Gandhi was right or wrong, but I will definitely say that history books talking about Godse's assassination of Gandhi should also include the former's last statement about why he killed Gandhi. Future generations can decide right or wrong themselves." A screenshot of this tweet was posted on Twitter by a user who goes by the name 'Sohan Lal Sharma'. As of now, the post has been shared over 2,800 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: CJ Werleman tweets old video to claim clashes between Kashmiri locals and security forces
Body: Journalist CJ Werleman, who claims to be an activist against Islamophobia, tweeted a 2-minute-long video accusing Indian mainstream media outlets for not showing the true picture of Kashmir amidst the lockdown post abrogation of Article 370. The video tweeted by Werleman showed a large number of masked men throwing stones at security forces, and the forces, in retaliation, using tear gas to dispel them. Couple of masked men, when interviewed by the cameraperson recording the video, said they were fighting for Sharia (Islamic law) and Khilafat (pan-Islamist political protest). Tweeting this video, Werleman wrote, âIndian mainstream media outlets continue to push Modi's lie about Kashmiris welcoming thousands of more Indian troops and the accompanying lockdown. You make up your mind," thereby implying that Kashmiris were aggressively protesting against Indian governmentâs decision to abrogate Article 370. Werleman later deleted this tweet, but not before it had gone massively viral with many retweets and views running into thousands. His tweet was also picked up by several other Facebook pages, who posted the same video with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Man being thrashed by cops has nothing to do with new Motor Vehicles Act
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Hero Satnami' shared a video showing a man being thrashed by three policemen with a caption that closely translates to, "New films of Modiji's new 'Mission Challan' are coming out. The new rules are enforced only on poor people. This video is from Chhattisgarh's Mungeli. It's shameful that policemen consider themselves kings. Talibani diktat-like rules are being passed. This should be stopped immediately, else policemen will end up killing someone. It's also possible that common people get agitated and the opposite happens." The intent behind sharing this video with such a caption is to direct anger against the new Motor Vehicles Act that came into force on September 1.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Image from Syrian civil war shared as one from Kashmir
Body: #KashmirBleeds_WorldSleeps was trending on Pakistan Twitter recently. An image tweeted under this hashtag shows a woman donning hijab, bleeding from her forehead. The text in the tweet reads, âPicture says everything #KashmirBleeds_WorldSleeps.â The tweet was retweeted several times. Picture says everything. #KashmirBleeds_WorldSleeps https://t.co/g9utFK4G4x— Ø¢Ø¦ÛÙÛ (@look_atmirror) 1568186047000The same image was tweeted by several other Twitter users, who used it in the context of alleged âatrocities on Kashmiris by Indian forcesâ. #Ø¢Ø¤ÚÙÛÚº_ÙØ¸ÙØ±Ø¢Ø¨Ø§Ø¯ It is thought to be the first time in recent decades that civilians in Kashmir have prevented Indiâ¦ https://t.co/OMXDaExr35— True Insafian (@hafeez997m) 156835330800

Header: FACT CHECK: Did this man thrash traffic cops for issuing a challan?
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name of 'Janshakti Samachar' shared a video showing a man attacking two traffic cops in uniform with a caption that closely translates to, "Ruckus after issuance of challan, big fight ensued." The same video is being shared by multiple social media users, and is being circulated on WhatsApp as well, along with the same claim. The intent behind sharing this video is to give an impression that common people are unhappy with the implementation of the new Motor Vehicles Act.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2014 video of Nitin Gadkari riding without helmet shared as recent
Body: A video of Road Transport & Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari is being shared with a claim that he was seen riding a scooter in Nagpur without wearing a helmet. The claim also criticizes the new Motor Vehicles Act, implying that the incident is a recent one. The video shows union minister Gadkari riding a scooter without a helmet. He also has a pillion rider and is seen making his way through a gate. Facebook user Rubi Pathan shared this video saying, âThe man who implements strict rules for common people is himself riding on Nagpur streets without helmet. When a lawmaker breaks rule, then how much should he be fined?â   âThese lawmakers break the laws they introduce and the common man is getting hassled by paying heavy fines of Rs 27,000 for a Rs 12,000 worth two-wheeler,â the caption of the video posted by Pathan read. Many social media users are criticizing the new penalties charged under the Motor Vehicles Act. Many other independent Facebook users and pages too shared the video making the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Dashama idols from Ahmedabad shared to imply Ganpati idols harm environment
Body: Zainab Sikander, who has a weekly show on The Print, tweeted a 108-second-long video on September 7, 2019, asking people to immerse eco-friendly, biodegradable (non-toxic paint) Ganpati idols in natural water bodies. The video shared by Sikander, showed a large number of idols on what appears to be a footpath near a riverfront. Sikander implied that idols seen in the video were Ganpati idols and said she was just voicing her opinion on an environmental issue. At the risk of being called a jihadi terrorist for simply voicing my opinion on an environmental issue, may I pleasâ¦ https://t.co/p0JyzPuWVk— Zainab Sikander (@zainabsikander) 1567861171000The archived version of the tweet can be viewed here.

Header: ALERT: Fake Twitter accounts in the name of ISRO, chief K Sivan on the rise
FAKE ALERT: No, this is not a video of Hurricane Dorian as seen from Florida
Body: A Twitter account that goes by the handle '@OrgPhysics' tweeted a video on September 6, 2019, with a caption saying, "A view of Hurricane Dorian from the coasts of Florida." A view of Hurricane Dorian ðª from the coasts of Florida. https://t.co/1CgHofJ2LG— Physics-astronomy.org (@OrgPhysics) 1567756208000An archived version of the tweet is here.The video, by now, has been viewed over 1.5 million times, been retweeted over 32,000 times and liked by over 68,000 Twitter users. The same video has been doing the rounds on social media platforms with different claims. For instance, the same video was shared on September 2, 2019, saying it shows Hurricane Dorian in Bahamas. #HurricaneDorian2019 in the Bahamas. Category 5 Hurricane hitting the #Bahamas #Dorian #prayforbahamas https://t.co/4mBjJl5CIj— The Leaks Report (@leaksreport) 1567389818000The video in the above tweet was viewed over 13,000 times. Among the many who fell for this fake video is Fawad Hussain, Pakistan's Federal Minister for Science & Technology, who retweeted the tweet made by '@OrgPhysics'.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Rahul Gandhi dining with Pakistan PM Imran Khan is digitally manipulated
Body: A photo showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi dining with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan is being shared on social media platforms with captions in Hindi that loosely translate to, "Look who's having a meal with Imran (Khan)!" Here is an example: The claim is also that Gandhi had 'Chicken Biriyani' with Khan.

Header: ​​FACT CHECK: Did Police beat up retired army man for not wearing helmet?
Body: The new traffic rules that have come into place from September 1 have become a bone of contention with many social media users. A Facebook user named Abhishek Mishr posted a video on September 4, in which police officials are mercilessly lathi-charging common people, including an elderly citizen. Mishr, while sharing the video, wrote, âWho has given these policemen right to thrash people for not wearing helmets? They have not even spared a retired army man. These goons in uniform will now implement law.â The video received over 19,000 shares and 5 lakh views at the time of writing this report. The archived version of the post can be viewed here.

Header: FACT CHECK: No, Tamil actor Surya hasn’t converted to Islam
Body: Some WhatsApp messages doing rounds are claiming that Tamil superstar Suriya has converted to Islam. A 3-minute-long video is being shared along with this claim that shows Suriya wearing skull cap exiting his car and then getting garlanded near a mosque by Muslim religious heads. The actor then goes to a mosque, where red cloth is tied on his head. Post this he prays and leaves. Some tweets are also sharing the video making the same claim. @maithriim Surya ..embraces ..Islam https://t.co/2uD9t6z03C via @YouTube— Naveen Vi Â® (@naveenkvst) 1567304135000Same claim is being made on YouTube as well. Times Fact Check also received the video on WhatsApp from a reader who wanted to know the truth.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this is not a video of protest against revocation of J&K's special status
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Enam Qureshi' shared a video to a group called 'i sport raves kumaar and parsun baajpeyi' with a caption saying, "Save Kashmir". The video showed a protest march with a lot of people participating. The intent is to imply that this march was held to protest the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). The post has been shared over 18,000 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Muslims in Wayanad did not vandalise BR Ambedkar statue
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name 'Pushp Mitr Shung' shared a video with a caption in Hindi that loosely translates to, "People who say 'Insha Allah' vandalising Dr BR Ambedkar's statue in Wayanad". The video has been viewed over 88,000 times and the post has been shared over 3,500 times. The same video is being shared by many other Facebook users and pages with the same caption. The allegation is that Muslims vandalised Dr BR Ambedkar's statue in Wayanad.

Header: FACT CHECK: Were these women victims of 'love jihad' and then sold off?
Body: An image showing several women covering their faces is being shared with the claim that they were victims of 'love jihad' and were sold off by their husbands post marriage. As per the claim, these women were missing since the last seven months and were rescued by Chhattisgarh Police from different states of India. A loose translation of the claim made by Twitter user Pushpendra Kulshrestha reads, âMost of these young women were lured into a trap via love jihad. The jihadis then sold them off for huge sum of money. The matter is still under investigation and some shocking revelations may soon happen.â The caption on the image being shared reads, â46 women ran away from their homes after getting trapped in fake love. When police finally traced them, this was their condition.â It says the photo was taken at Kawardha city in Kabirdham district of Chhattisgarh. à¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¥à¤¸à¤à¤¢à¤¼ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¤¿à¤à¤²à¥ 7 à¤®à¤¾à¤¹ à¤¸à¥ à¤²à¤¾à¤ªà¤¤à¤¾ 46 à¤¯à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤¿à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤²à¤ à¤à¤²à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤¶à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¥à¤ à¤¨à¤¿à¤à¤¾à¤²à¤¾à¥¤ à¤à¤§à¤¿à¤à¤¤à¤° à¤¯à¥à¤µà¤¤à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤® à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¸à¤à¤â¦ https://t.co/EipnU6D3ks— Pushpendra Kulshrestha (@Nationalist_Om) 1566736125000The archived link of this tweet can be viewed here. Similar claim was made by several Facebook users as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this woman wasn’t beaten up by policemen
Body: Images of a woman bleeding from her forehead, with men in police uniform surrounding her, are being circulated widely on social media to target PM Narendra Modi and his âBeti Bachao Beti Padhaoâ initiative. The claim being made along with these pictures is that the woman was beaten up by policemen.   âThis is Modiâ governmentâs âBeti Bachaoâ. Keep sharing it till he gets punished. If Modi canât handle law and order then he must resign and leave the post of PM. Such lawlessness by policemen will not be tolerated anymore,â reads a loose translation of the text on the images.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did this Kashmiri woman ask Rahul Gandhi not to go to Kashmir?
Body: A 30-second-long video of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is going viral on social media platforms Twitter and Facebook. In the video, a woman can be seen talking to Gandhi, who is seated inside a plane. The audio of this particular video clip is not clear, and those sharing it are claiming that the woman asked Gandhi to not foment trouble in Kashmir. As per the text that is being shared along with the video, woman allegedly asks Wayanad MP, âWhen Modi is doing good for Kashmiri people, why are you hell bent on going to Kashmir and increasing their problems? Please go back.â Kashmir people in flight to Rahul: Modi is doing good for us. Why do you want to visit Kashmir and trouble us. Pleaâ¦ https://t.co/f26cBU7K7m— Chowkidar yallaling n (@yallaling_n) 1567050500000Hereâs the archived link of the tweet. The same video is being shared by some Facebook users as well, along with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Imran Khan shared as him losing his cool because of PM Modi
Body: A video of Pakistan Prime Minister (PM) Imran Khan is being shared to imply that he had a hard time pacifying local crowd, thanks to PM Narendra Modi. In the 31-second-long video, we can see Khan sitting with his colleagues Shah Mehmood Qureshi and Sheikh Rasheed Ahmad, losing his cool at people around him, who refused to let him speak. Unable to silence people, Khan can be seen getting up and saying âKhamoshiâ âKhamoshiâ (Silence). Facebook user Anil Jhurani shared the video, which had the logo of Pakistan news channel Samaa TV, with a caption saying, "This is the current condition of PM Imran Khan due to PM Modiâ.

Header: Fake Alert: Hindi TV serial stills shared as Kashmiri journalist beaten by Indian Army
Body: A set of four pictures, in which a youth appears to be beaten by police officials inside a lock up, is being shared with the claim that Indian Army arrested a Kashmiri journalist named Fahad Bhat from his home and then tortured him. Lat night Indian army arrested Kashmiri journalist Fahad bhat from his home. Now they are torturing him. World hasâ¦ https://t.co/Q28ZNwXBVv— Arbaz khan (@arbazkhan158) 1566895865000Twitter user Arbaz Khan, who made this claim, said the incident happened on August 26, 2019, at night. He went on to say that the world is worried about Amazon forests but not Kashmiri people.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video from Meerut shared as that of madrassa teacher killed in Old Delhi
Body: Journalist Samir Abbas tweeted a video showing a Muslim man being thrashed by a mob with a caption in Hindi that said a madrassa teacher was thrashed to death by a mob in front of the Old Delhi Railway Station after an argument over buying a headphone got heated. He also said Delhi Police arrested two men, Lallan and Sarfaraz, suspecting their involvement in the incident. An archived version of the tweet is here.The video Abbas tweeted showed a distinctively Muslim man being thrashed by a mob.

Header: FACT CHECK: Is Japanese government disposing off all microwave ovens?
Body: A long, viral WhatsApp message claims that the Japanese government has decided to dispose of all âmicrowave ovensâ in the country before the end of 2019 and citizens and organizations not obliging would be thrown behind bars. The message says that the reason for a ban on âmicrowaves ovensâ is based on a research by scientists from the University of Hiroshima, where they discovered that âmicrowavesâ cause greater harm to the health of citizens over 20 years. The purported research found microwaves to be more harmful than nuclear bombs USA deployed in September 1945. The message further claims that all the largest manufacturers of microwave ovens in Japan have already been closed. Hereâs the message as received by Times Fact Check on its WhatsApp number from an avid reader.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo from Gaza passed off as one clicked in Kashmir
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Kashmirat' posted a photo showing a woman holding an infant with a bloodied face, saying, "Faces tell the story. Indiaâs brutality has turned Kashmir into a living hell." The same photo is being shared on Twitter as well, with the same caption. Since August 5, the day Home Minister Amit Shah announced India's decision to revoke the special status of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) by the abrogation of Article 370, many social media users have been sharing old photos and videos alleging 'atrocities in Kashmir'.

Header: Fake Alert: Video of Pune woman abusing army shared as Sikh woman kidnapped by Indian Army
Body: An undated video going viral on Twitter shows a young woman using abusive language towards Indian Army. The video was shared by Twitter user Hubaib Yousefzai with the claim that three Indian Army officers tried to kidnap a Sikh girl but she somehow escaped and survived. Yousefzai says that the âbeautiful and brave Sikh girlâ abused Indian Army. âSikh, Muslim, Christians and Dalits are not safe in india. Dirty Indian Army," his tweed read. The video in the tweet was credited to @HatindersinghR.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Haryana shared as police thrashing women in Kashmir
Body: A Facebook page/group that goes by the name of 'MaaZoo' shared a video as a 'Facebook live' with a caption in Urdu that loosely translates to, "Share the video by clicking on it; it's the latest video from Kashmir, share it as much as you can so that the authorities and the nation get ashamed and they become spokespersons of Kashmir." The video has been viewed nearly 5 million times and shared more than 1,17,000 times. The same video is being shared by other Facebook and Twitter users, many of them seeming to be from Pakistan.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Message claiming the government can read WhatsApp chats untrue
Body: A message that is going viral on WhatsApp claims that the government can read WhatsApp chats. The message also spreads misinformation about check marks/ticks on the instant-messaging application. The message claims that WhatsApp displays three blue ticks to indicate the government has noticed a particular message, two blue and one red tick to indicate the government can take action on that particular message, one blue and two red ticks to indicate the government has already initiated action against the sender of that particular message and three red ticks to indicate the government has taken severe action on the sender and a court will summon the individual. The message asks WhatsApp users to be careful about sending messages related to social activities, politics and 'anti-government messages'. A Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us on WhatsApp asking if the information in the message is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2016 video being shared claiming it shows protests in Kashmir
Body: A video showing a large number of people chanting 'Azadi' slogans is being circulated on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that it shows people of Kashmir protesting abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). A Facebook page that goes by the handle @somtkar posted the video with a caption in Bangla that loosely translates to, "Lakhs of people gathered in Kashmir despite Indian Army's presence. Insha Allah Kashmir will win." The video has been viewed more than 1,56,000 times and then post has been shared over 8,700 times. The same video is being shared by many other individuals as well as pages on Facebook, with the same claim. It is being heavily circulated on WhatsApp as well. This video is being circulated with the false claim post Centre's decision to revoke the special status of Jammu and Kashmir.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, AMU students did not put up objectionable poster on PM Modi
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle @AjitKDoval_NSA, with a photo of National Security Advisor Ajit Doval as display picture and 'National Security Advisor fans club' mentioned in the bio, tweeted a photo showing a poster with objectionable content on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The user claimed that as per 'sources', students of Aligarh Muslim Univesity (AMU), in protest against Modi-led NDA government's decision of revoking special status of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K), put up the poster seen in the photo. The poster makes a derogatory reference to PM Modi, calling him 'Dracula of Kashmir'. Several social media users are sharing the same photo with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of luxury hotel in Srinagar shared as Ghulam Nabi Azad’s house
Body: A photo of a gargantuan property with mountains in the backdrop is being shared with the claim that it is former J&K CM and Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azadâs house in Kashmir. This is the house of unemployed Ghulam Nabi Azad in kashmir. See how much loot he has made. @republic @AmitShahâ¦ https://t.co/YiBQM6lOrJ— Manju (@manjprad) 1566114152000âThis is the house of unemployed Ghulam Nabi Azad in kashmir. See how much loot he has made (sic),â tweeted Manju while sharing the image. Among those tweeting the photo with the same claim was NK Sood, who describes himself as a âformer RAW officerâ in his Twitter bio. He has now deleted the tweet.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistan minister tweets manipulated video alleging atrocities in Kashmir
Body: Ali Haider Zaidi, Pakistan's minister of maritime affairs, tweeted a manipulated video implying the security forces in Kashmir are thrashing people in the Valley. Tweeting the manipulated video Zaidi said, "Let the world see what Narendra Modi government is doing in Kashmir." Let the world see what @narendramodi Govt is doing in #Kashmir The #Hitler from the East rises while the world sleeâ¦ https://t.co/1n829Rr0j7— Ali Haider Zaidi (@AliHZaidiPTI) 1566108783000The tweet has been retweeted over 4,800 times and liked over 6,000 times. An archived version of the tweet is here.The first part of the video shows men in khakhi uniform lathicharging both men and women. The second part of the video shows a woman, bleeding from her mouth and carrying a toddler in her hand, crying and trying to revive a burqa-clad woman who seems to be unconscious. After Narendra Modi-led NDA government's decision to abrogate Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir, many people are sharing old videos to claim atrocities in Kashmir.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, UNESCO did not declare Indian national anthem 'best in the world'
Body: JD(U) leader Ajay Alok tweeted that the Indian national anthem has been declared 'best in the world' by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) and revived a hoax that went viral first in 2008. In a tweet made in Hindi, Alok said what closely translates to, "UNESCO has declatred 'Jana Gana Mana', that is, the Indian national anthem, the best in the world recently. Congratulations to all. Hope that a few people won't say that Modi-Shah managed this." à¤à¤­à¥ à¤à¥à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥ UNESCO à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¨ à¤à¤£ à¤®à¤¨ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤¹à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤·à¥à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤¯ à¤à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤µ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥à¤·à¥à¤  à¤à¥à¤·à¤¿à¤¤ à¤à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¬à¤§à¤¾à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¤­à¥ à¤à¥ ðºðºà¤à¤¬ à¤à¥à¤â¦ https://t.co/RnPqsjj0zh— Dr Ajay Alok (@alok_ajay) 1566031218000His tweet has been liked over 25,000 times and retweeted more than 4,700 times already. An archived version of the tweet is here.The same message is being circulated widely on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp. A Times Fact Check reader sent Alok's tweet to us asking if we could find verify if what he claimed is true.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video from Sri Lanka shared as attack on Muslim women in Kashmir
Body: A 30-second-long video was posted by Facebook page âMuslims of 21ST Centuryâ with the claim that it represents current situation of Kashmiri Muslim women in India. The video shows a few burqa-clad women trying to save themselves from men throwing water at them. âThe situation of Muslims women in india right now. Where is Muslim Ummah, where is Peacekeepers. Our sisters are put to disgrace mercilessly, they hurting thier faith #PrayForKashmir #KashmirBleedsUNsleeps #HumanRightsWatch (sic),â reads the caption of the video shared on âMuslims of 21ST Centuryâ Facebook page.   The same video with the same claim is being shared by many independent users on Facebook.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, PM Modi didn’t urge people to use only Indian products during Diwali
Body: An appeal attributed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi that urges people to use only products made in India this Diwali is being shared on WhatsApp. The appeal is made in Hindi and is being circulated in the form of a graphic card with Modiâs signature. Times Fact Check received the graphic card on WhatsApp from a reader who wanted to know if it was real. âMy dear Indians, I request you to buy and use only Indian products to celebrate the upcoming festival of Diwali. I hope youâll listen to me. Such small steps taken by you would ensure that India would be number one nation one day,â reads a loose translation of the appeal purportedly made by PM. The message has been in circulation for the last couple of years across social media platforms.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Is the man in this viral video Mumbai police commissioner?
Body: A video is being circulated across social media platforms in which an old man, speaking Marathi, warns Indians against a possible terror attack from Pakistan-sponsored elements in retaliation to India repealing Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). It is being shared saying the man in the video is the Mumbai Police commissioner. Hereâs the screenshot of the text being shared on WhatsApp. Times Fact Check received this video message on its WhatsApp number from several readers who wanted to know if the Mumbai Police commissioner indeed issued any such warning. The video is being shared with the same claim by many on Twitter and Facebook Mumbai Police Commissioner! ð Total Mumbai On Terrorist's Attack Radar..be Very, Very Careful..all Railway Stationâ¦ https://t.co/Ix4NM56F61— Tarun Sareen (@TarunnSarreen) 1565581654000

Header: FACT CHECK: Photos J&K Police tweeted claiming normalcy are not from Jammu?
Body: The official Twitter handle of Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Police tweeted three photos on August 10, 2019 with a caption saying life is returning to normalcy in Jammu division of J&K in the wake of Narendra Modi-led NDA government's move of abrogating Article 370 in J&K. Life return to Normalcy in Jammu Division. https://t.co/oTV1wiTJ5Y— J&K Police (@JmuKmrPolice) 1565443093000Many Twitter users responded to the tweet above saying J&K Police is trying to paint a false picture of 'normalcy' in the region and pointed out to an SUV seen in the photo that is registered in Bihar. @JmuKmrPolice Bihar Police ko bhi station mil ra kya ab J &K mai https://t.co/hmPcp91f1B— Shubham Amdhare Gandhian (@shubhamdhareINC) 1565451815000@JmuKmrPolice When did number plates of JK police vehicles distributed starting with BR.— Mi(sery)nion (@angie_tribeccaa) 1565604020000Some users also pointed out that people seen in the photos are using phones, asking how they can use phones if there is a total communication shutdown in J&K. @JmuKmrPolice It seems they using phones, ban is over?? https://t.co/EQrVYZRl09— à¤à¤ à¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¤à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ ð¯ (@jita_jagta_insa) 1565544637000Times Fact Check investigated the three photos to see if the photos are indeed of some other place as claimed by many Twitter users or Jammu itself, as claimed by J&K Police.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of man carrying calf is not from Kerala, Bihar or Assam
Body: A photo that shows a man carrying a calf on his shoulder, possibly to save it from flood waters, went viral multiple times in the last few months with different false claims. Now, it is viral again with a new false claim that the photo was clicked in some part of Kerala. Twitter user @manoj_naandi shared the photo saying, "This image is what i want to remember of #keralarains2019. This picture symbolises how we all are interconnected and the latent human spirit of compassion and empathy we all should discover and practice (sic)." This image is what i want to remember of #keralarains2019 This picture symbolises how we all are interconnected anâ¦ https://t.co/IWRVL46ByY— Manoj Kumar (@manoj_naandi) 1565415022000The user implied that the photo was clicked somewhere in Kerala. The tweet has been retweeted over 1,100 times. An archived version of the tweet is here.Responding to this tweet, some Twitter users said that the photo is not from Kerala but from Bihar and a few others said the photo was clicked in Assam. @manoj_naandi Sorry its bihar flood my mistake but not kerala flood https://t.co/ynSrXb9hal— Geethu s vijayan (@vijayan_geethu) 1565529895000@manoj_naandi This is the picture of Assam flood.....i don't know about humbleness of kerlatis but..... I know Assaâ¦ https://t.co/eVEobFisb8— ANURAG SHARMA (@ANURAGS52774071) 1565529822000The same photo went viral when Bihar and Assam were hit by floods, with many social media users claiming that the photo was clicked in these states. Anand Mahindra, Mahindra Group chairman, quote-tweeted @manoj_naandi's tweet saying, "This is indeed an iconic and profoundly moving image. I see it as a message about how we humans need to finally take responsibility for what we have inflicted on the planet and the species that inhabit it. Itâs our job to move the world back to safer ground." Mahindra, however, did not mention or comment on where the photo is from. This is indeed an iconic & profoundly moving image. I see it as a message about how we humans need to finally takeâ¦ https://t.co/hiEZWVqJ9H— anand mahindra (@anandmahindra) 1565528399000This tweet has been retweeted more than 3,200 times and has been liked by over 18,900 Twitter accounts.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared as Kashmiri women protesting abrogation of Article 370
Body: A video showing a lot of women marching is being shared by many social media users, on Facebook and Twitter, with a claim that Kashmiri women came out on the streets in thousands to liberate their homeland from India. The video is being shared to imply that the procession happened after the Indian government repealed Article 370. âDespite total black out on media and internet, this video was sent by one of the patriots, who requested it be spread all over the world,â wrote Twitter user @Rubina55Aziz while sharing the video. Kashmiri's took out to the syreets in Thousands, to liberate their homeland from India; today. Despite total blackâ¦ https://t.co/SPZl1jEt5K— Rubina Aziz (@Rubina55Aziz) 1565191665000It was shared by many on Facebook with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Jammu and Kashmir flag hasn't been removed from civil secretariat in Srinagar yet
Body: A collage with two photos, one showing both the Indian national flag and the Jammu and Kashmir flag atop the civil secretariat in Srinagar, and another one with just the Indian national flag, is being shared on social media platforms and circulated on WhatsApp. A Times Fact Check reader reached out to us on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 with the collage and asked us if it's true. The collage is being shared post the abrogation of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir.

Header: FACT CHECK: Has government taken over mosques in Kashmir?
Body: A few photos are being shared on WhatsApp with a claim that the Narendra Modi-led NDA government has seized custody of all mosques in Kashmir. Times Fact Check received these images from a reader on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 along with a message asking if these were indeed related to any such action from the Centre in Kashmir.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2018 video viral with false claim that Indian Army is burning houses in Kashmir
Body: A Facebook page posted a video on Monday saying, "Indian Army Burns Kashmiri People's Houses In Bandi Pura and world is sleeping." The post has already been shared over 7,000 times and the video has been viewed over 1,28,000 times. A few other Facebook users have been sharing the same video with the same claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Girl who asked UP Police about Unnao rape case not going to school anymore?
Body: Alka Lamba, MLA from Delhi's Chandni Chowk, who said on Sunday that she has decided to resign from Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), had tweeted a newspaper clipping that claimed the schoolgirl who stumped UP Police with her questions related to Unnao rape case is not attending school anymore. On July 31, a video showing one of the students of a school in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki asking police personnel if there was a "guarantee of getting justice and feeling safe" if common citizens protest against crimes committed by people of political and muscle power, had gone viral. Watch the video here:   Sharing the newspaper clipping that spoke about the girl, Lamba tweeted, "If this is true, shame on you Ajay Bisht. You are brokers of power. You rose to power saying 'Beti Bachao', now you are protecting rapists and trying to threaten our daughters who are raising their voice against them." Lamba tagged UP Police's verified Twitter handle asking if they have anything to say. à¤à¤à¤° à¤¯à¤¹ à¤¸à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤¤à¥ à¤²à¤¾à¤¨à¤¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¯ à¤¬à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤ à¤¢à¥à¤à¤à¥.. à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤¦à¤²à¤¾à¤² à¤¹à¥ à¤¤à¥à¤® à¤²à¥à¤, à¤¬à¥à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤¾à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤¨à¤¾à¤°à¤¾ à¤¦à¥à¤à¤° à¤¸à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¤¥à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¬â¦ https://t.co/J7XbEzxhCG— Alka Lamba - à¤à¤²à¤à¤¾ à¤²à¤¾à¤®à¥à¤¬à¤¾ (@LambaAlka) 1564811675000The tweet is archived here.The same newspaper clipping is being shared by many other social media users as well, both on Facebook and Twitter. à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤µ à¤°à¥à¤ª à¤à¤¾à¤à¤¡ à¤ªà¤° à¤¸à¤µà¤¾à¤² à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤à¥à¤² à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¬à¤à¤¦ ! à¤¯à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤¦à¤¹à¤¶à¥à¤¤à¤à¤¿à¤°à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤²à¤® à¥¤ à¤à¥ à¤­à¥ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤à¤¼ à¤à¤ à¤¾à¤à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤à¤¸à¥â¦ https://t.co/o1EnbLsjEO— Dayaram Dewasi (@DAYARAMRABARI) 1564836056000à¤¯à¥ à¤à¥à¤¸à¤¾ #gundaraj à¤¹à¥? à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤µ à¤°à¥à¤ª à¤à¤¾à¤à¤¡ à¤ªà¤° à¤¸à¤µà¤¾à¤² à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¥à¤à¥à¤² à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¬à¤à¤¦ #yogirajgundaraj @priyankagandhiâ¦ https://t.co/qzcDkE9fCw— à¤®à¥à¤à¥à¤¶ à¤à¤²à¤¾à¤¹à¤¾à¤¬à¤¾à¤¦à¥ (@Mukeshyadavinc) 156483047500

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mock drill video shared as terrorist killed in Gujarat temple
Body: A video is being shared on Facebook with a claim that two terrorists entered Maa Ambaji Temple in Gujarat, and that one of them was neutralized by the Gujarat police and the other was taken into custody. In the video, we can see men in uniform dragging the body of a man, apprehending another and then taking out arms and weapons from their bags. Watch the video here.The video was posted with this claim on Facebook group âWe Support Narendra Modiâ by Jaswant Singh.

Header: FAKE ALERT: SMS offering land for sale in Kashmir is a hoax
Body: The screenshot of a text message that offers land for sale in Kashmir is viral on social media. The message reads, "Book your land at kashmir Laal chowk Rd from 11.25 Lacs with GST. KASHMIR 370 removed . Limited Stock! For more details call on 9019292918 (sic)." The message said that land is available for sale in Lal Chowk Road in Kashmir's Srinagar starting from Rs 11.25 lakh. The time mentioned in the above image reads 9.50 AM. Home Minister Amit Shah presented the resolution to revoke Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir in Rajy Sabha only after 11 AM on August 5, 2019.

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
