FAKE ALERT: No, Sunita Williams hasn’t converted to Islam
Body: Facebook page âMakka Madina = à¦®à¦à§à¦à¦¾ à¦®à¦¦à¦¿à¦¨à¦¾â has posted a video claiming that NASA astronaut of Indian origin Sunita Williams has embraced Islam as her faith.   The video contains visuals of Williams along with Mecca-Medina and the voiceover is in Bengali language. The text in the video is also in Bengali. Times Fact Check took help of colleagues from Times Groupâs Ei Samay to get the entire video translated. The text along with the video reads âWhy did Sunita Williams embrace Islam after returning from space?â Per the voice-over from the video âWhen Williams was in space, she saw two stars which left her and her colleagues dumbfounded. When they looked through binoculars, they found that the star-like light was emanating from Mecca-Medina. Her parents are Hindus. At one point in time, she used to loathe Islam but sheâs now proud of it. Sitting in Hill Town hotel, she announced in front of press, that she has now converted to Islma. She even went to Mecca-Medina and said not everybody is lucky to go there.â At the time of writing this report, the video had received over 11,000 shares and more than two lakh views.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of sex racket gang shared as 'Hindu terrorists' caught in Allahabad
Body: An image with a group of people surrounded by police officials is going viral on WhatsApp with the insinuation that 25 âHindu terroristsâ were caught making bombs in the hostel of Allahabad university. A loose translation of the text shared along with the image reads âAllahabad university hostel is the new hub of terrorism. 25 students were caught making bombs. 58 rooms have been sealed but the media will not show you this as they arenât Muslims.â A reader sent us the screenshot of the same claim made by certain Sakib Choudhary on Facebook. Another claim being made using the same image is that a group of 500-2000 Rohingya Muslim men and women are roaming the streets of Madhya Pradesh with weapons. Their aim is to kidnap boys aged between 17-18 from outside schools. This claim is being circulated on WhatsApp as an advisory issued by the Bhopal Police CSP. It was sent to us by a reader on 8527001433.

Body: A certain section of media reportedly claimed that a minor Muslim boy was set on fire in Chanduali district of Uttar Pradesh for refusing to chant âJai Shri Ramâ. Here are screenshots of some of those who made this claim or reported about it with misleading headline Based on these media reports many Twitter users tweeted about it. Ashok Swain called the alleged perpetrators âHindutva beastsâ. Hindutva beasts have set on fire a 15-year old Muslim Boy in UP for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' - Where is this Indâ¦ https://t.co/FONijKtjmq— Ashok Swain (@ashoswai) 1564373633000Prashant Bhusan tweeted about it Teenager set ablaze in UP for refusing to chant Jai Shri Ram. Unnao rape victim of BJP MLA has serious road accidenâ¦ https://t.co/HkMvRVJr9p— Prashant Bhushan (@pbhushan1) 1564375532000Journalist Arfa Khanum Sherwani gave a detailed account of the alleged incident. Teenager was set on fire when he refused to chant "Jai Shri Ram"He gave this statement on the hospital's camera. "Iâ¦ https://t.co/biZWgOGHWP— Arfa Khanum Sherwani (@khanumarfa) 156438671900

Header: FACT CHECK: Has Chandrayaan 2 sent first photographs of Earth?
Body: Some space images of Earth are being shared across social media platforms with the claim that these are the first set of pictures captured by Chandrayaan 2 spacecraft that was launched into the earth's orbit on July 22. These images are being shared on WhatsApp with a caption that reads âFirst photograph of Earth sent by Chandrayaan 2. What an eye-catching visual it is!â Apart from these two images, many more similar images are being shared by some Facebook users with the same claim. Child artist Akshara Kishor shared a video made out of these images on her official Facebook account, making the same claim.   On Twitter too, certain users posted the images making the same claim. First photograph of earth, sent by Chandrayan 2..... What an eye-catching visual it is ð#beautiful #Chandrayaan2 https://t.co/PKC5RMPJ4H— passionately_yogi (@Dopeenough) 1564139321000TRUTHChandrayaan 2 has not sent any photograph so far. The images being shared have nothing to do with the shuttle. Times Fact Check could not find any such photographs on the official Twitter handle of ISRO. On July 26, ISRO took to Twitter to inform about Chandrayaan 2 successfully performing 2nd orbit raising task. Second earth bound orbit raising maneuver for #Chandrayaan2 spacecraft has been performed today (July 26, 2019) atâ¦ https://t.co/crVAiTb3Kl— ISRO (@isro) 1564085657000When we looked through Chandrayaan 2 section on ISROâs website, the latest images that were posted there were from the time the mission was launched. Times Fact Check then reached out to Vivek Singh, ISROâs PR and media director. âISRO hasnât released any image sent by Chandrayaan 2 so far,â he said. Chandrayaan-2 is set to enter the Moon's orbit on August 20 this year.

Header: Fake CLAT website tries to cheat wait-listed aspirants by offering admission
Body: A message asking candidates who appeared for the prestigious Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) to apply online and deposit fee for admission into law colleges reached their inboxes. Most of the wait-listed students from rank 2,500 to 10,000 started receiving mails from openallot@clatconsortiumofnlu.in on Friday afternoon, claiming to provide seats to them. The message asks students to click on a certain link, choose any two colleges and deposit the fee. Hereâs a screenshot of the mail received by one of the students.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Gujarat Police seize weapons from a mosque in the state?
Body: Many social media users are sharing a collage of three photos with the claim that weapons were seized from a mosque in Gujarat by Gujarat Police. For instance, a Facebook user who goes by the name 'Mahakal Bhakt Chaurasya' shared the collage with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Weapons seized from a mosque in Gujarat - what do these Muslims want to do? Will weapons be seized from mosques across the nations if checking is done?" The post made yesterday has been shared over 500 times by now. Another Facebook user who goes by the name 'Sanwer Nath Siddh RIp' made the post yesterday with the same caption above with an addition of what loosely translates to, "The words of politics are black on white papers. Weapons are seized from mosques, but terrorists are saffronists." The same photo is being shared by many social media users, both on Facebook and Twitter, with similar claims. A Times Fact Check reader sent us a screenshot of one of the similar posts made on Facebook on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 asking us to check if the claim made is correct.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake post claiming Baba Ramdev got his knee operated in Germany goes viral
Body: An image in which a feeble looking Baba Ramdev is surrounded by people wearing surgical masks, who are offering him something in a glass, is going viral with the claim that the yoga guru underwent a knee surgery in Germany. A loose translation of the Hindi caption on the photo reads âDo yoga and stay healthy. Baba Ramdev has had a successful knee operation in Germany. Buy swadeshi, this man used to say. Heâd ask us to consume urine and cow dung to get rid of all diseases but he doesnât practice what he preachesâ. The message is being shared across social media platforms. Hereâs the archived link of the same message being shared on Facebook and Twitter. Times Fact Check received it on 8527001433 from a reader who wanted to know the truth behind it.

Header: FACT CHECK: Truth behind video showing Muslim kids enacting suicide bombing
Body: A video is being shared on social media platforms with a claim that Muslim children are trained by their parents to become terrorists right from childhood. The 84-second-long video shows a young kid wearing a black mask bidding farewell to some children before he approaches another group of children and blows himself up like a suicide bomber. Sand is tossed into the air to simulate the detonation and the children could be seen falling to the ground. As the dust settles, the camera pans to the kids, all acting to be dead. A Twitter user shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, âKids from the âpeaceful communityâ have only few things to do when they grow up - either become a puncture fixer or a fruit seller or a terrorist. In this video, kids are practicing how to blow themselves as a suicide bomber. Shame on them.â à¤¶à¤¾à¤à¤¤à¤¿à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯ à¤à¥à¤® à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¤à¥à¤à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤à¤ªà¤¨ à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤ à¤¦à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤¬à¤¡à¤¼à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤° à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤°à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤°à¤¤à¤¾ à¤µà¥ à¤µà¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤¤à¥ à¤à¤¨à¤à¥ à¤¶à¥à¤­à¤¾â¦ https://t.co/z8HKslC5Nr— saffron lion (@ethan_mi7) 1563795233000The video and this tweet was brought to our notice by another Twitter user -- Shakeel Malik -- who wanted to know the truth behind the video. @timesfactcheck à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤°à¥à¤§, à¤à¥à¤ªà¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤¸à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤à¤ à¤à¤°à¥à¤à¥¤ https://t.co/3lSbZC5DPG— Shakeel MalikAAP (@ShakeelMalikAAP) 156379719900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mandsaur school students did not raise 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video that shows a few school students protesting. These users are sharing the video with a claim that these students raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan. Facebook user who goes by the name Bhavani Chouhan shared the video on July 17, 2019 with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "The video is said to be of Anjuman school in Mandsaur. Kids are raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogan as soon as they step out of their school." Facebook user Rakesh Kumar shared the video yesterday with an Islamophobic caption. There are many Facebook accounts that shared this video. A Twitter user shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, âDo you remember how the whole world cried when they saw photo of an innocent Syrian refugee kidâs body found at a beach? Unfortunately, there is no one to shed tears for a child who lost his life in the disastrous floods in Mithila. Even the government has not shown sensitivity towards this kid.â In the video shared by this user, a man holding a fishing net could be seen standing next to the kidâs body. à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦ à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤°à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤¤à¤ à¤ªà¤° à¤¬à¤¹à¤à¤° à¤à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤ à¤®à¤¾à¤¸à¥à¤® à¤¶à¤°à¤£à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤¶à¤µ à¤¦à¥à¤à¤à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤¨à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾ à¤°à¥ à¤à¤ à¥ à¤¥à¥, à¤²à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¨ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¯à¤¦ à¤®à¤¿à¤¥à¤¿à¤²à¤¾ à¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/xVmMBJN6WI— à¤à¤¨à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ à¤¤à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¥ (@VnsAnuTi) 1563378019000Hereâs the archived version of tweet. Header: FAKE ALERT: Prime accused in University College stabbing not a Kerala cop
Body: Facebook user Sadeesh J Manchady has claimed in a post that one of the SFI (Students' Federation of India) leaders arrested for allegedly stabbing a fellow student at University College in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram and one of the policemen on duty at the Sabarimala temple during the protests last year is the same person. Here's a close translation of Sadeesh's post made in Malayalam: "Understood who this is? The same communist thug who got into a police uniform, arranged by the community Vijayan government, to thrash Ayyappa devotees at Sannidhanam. He's the one who crushed devotees under his shoes - SFI leader Siva Renjith, first rank holder in police rank list, the one who stabbed his party colleague." The post has been shared over 354 times and the same is being circulated on WhatsApp as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: BJP MLA’s daughter Sakshi Mishra did not marry a man twice her age
Body: A graphic card with an image of BJP MLAâs daughter Sakshi Mishra and her husband Ajitesh Kumar is going viral with text that claims there is a huge age gap between the two. The card states Sakshiâs age as 19 and Ajiteshâs age as 48. A grammatically correct interpretation of text on the card reads, âDear couple, we definitely support your decision but a question to this brother - how do you impress a girl your daughterâs age?â The same card is being shared by many Facebook users to drive home the point that her father was indeed right in threatening her, as Sakshi claims. One user said that Ajitesh, a Dalit, by eloping with Sakshi, broke the trust of a Brahmin family which treated him as equal.   Another Facebook user went on to say that such a daughter should be killed for the sake of honour. The same user called Ajitesh âan insect worthy of living in a gutterâ. A reader also shared the graphic card with us on 8527001433 to know the truth behind it.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2013 video viral as that of Dongri building collapse captured live
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video that shows a building collapse claiming it to be the live video of the one that collapsed in Mumbai's Dongri yesterday. For instance, Facebook user Mohammed Nisaruddin shared the video yesterday with a caption saying, "Dongri Building Collapse Update 12 dead other injured person shifted to hospital Live video (sic)". As per his bio, Nisaruddin is a sub-editor with a media company that goes by the name of 'A99 News Voice of India'. We searched on Facebook using keywords 'Dongri building collapse live video' and saw that the (unverified) Facebook page of the above mentioned media company ran the video as a Facebook live. The video has been viewed over 66,000 times. Twitter user @arpitajtweets shared the video saying, "Dongri building fall live captured video". Dongri building fall live captured videoððð ðà¥ à¤¶à¤¾à¤à¤¤à¤¿ð #MumbaiBuildingCollapse #MumbaiRains https://t.co/9soJDHnc6B— à¤à¤°à¥à¤ªà¤¿à¤¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾ð®ð³ (@arpitajtweets) 1563289471000A building in Tandel Street in Mumbai's Dongri had collapsed yesterday killing at least 13. Rescue operations are still underway.

Header: Rahul Gandhi uses old photos while tweeting about floods in 5 states
Body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took to Twitter today to urge his party workers to help people in the five flood-affected states of North and North East India. "The flood situation in Assam, Bihar, Tripura, Uttar Pradesh and Mizoram has worsened and the people living in these states have been badly affected. I appeal to all the Congress party workers in these states to immediately take up relief operations," he tweeted in Hindi. Along with this text, he tweeted four different photos of life affected by floods. However, two of those photos used by him, were not recent ones and had nothing to do with current flood situation. In his tweet, Gandhi did not categorically state from when and where he had sourced the images, which gave an impression as if they were recently taken at any of the five states mentioned by him. The tweet now stands deleted.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this video is not of Ivanka Trump visiting a Hyderabad hospital
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video of a woman visiting a hospital with a claim that she is Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump. The woman seen in the video could be heard praising All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Akbaruddin Owaisi, brother of AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi. Facebook user Imran Chohan shared the video on saying, "Donald Trump's daughter herself, saying that we are special Akbaruddin Owaisi Hospital visit to have occurred (sic)." The translation of what is written in Hindi in the caption also has a part that says, "Asaduddin Owaisi is a brand, not just a name". This video has been viewed over 3,700 times. The same video is being shared by some other Facebook users and is being uploaded on a few YouTube channels with the exact same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Study material talking about 'advantages of dowry' is not from Gujarat
Body: Twitter user @kavithalankesh tweeted a page from a study material given to students that talks about 'advantages of dowry' with a claim that it is from a social science book for Gujarat Education Board and saying that it is being taught to 'millions of children across Gujarat'. The tweet has already been retweeted 330 times and is being shared by others. For instance, Twitter user @lovethyyyself quote-tweeted @kavithalankesh's tweet tagging a few Twitter users and saying "Check this, not sure if it's from Gujarat but it's utter rubbish". The page that is being shared glorifies regressive ideas about dowry to an extent that it says dowry increases the status of women in family and that it is a "useful and effective method of attracting good, handsome and sometimes unwilling boys for marriage". It also lists, "The marriage of ugly girls, who otherwise would have gone without a partner, is made possible by offering heavy amount of dowry," as one of the 'important advantages' of dowry. India's Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961, prohibits giving and taking of dowry.

Header: Photo of Hindu woman forced by Muslim in-laws to convert shared with false claims
Body: A photo of a middle-aged woman is being shared with claims that she converted to Islam becuase âHindus drink cow urineâ and "practice untouchability with Dalits". Shared by a website called votergiri.com, a loose translation of the articleâs headline reads, âThey can drink cow urine but canât drink water from the hands of Dalits. That is why I left Hinduism and accepted Islamâ. The article says that the woman, after converting to Islam, changed her name to Mariyam. The story quotes her as claiming that Islam is the best religion for women. âI closely studied Islam and found that it is the most peaceful religion in this world. Unfortunately, its name is always linked to terrorism. But Islam teaches we shouldnât torture or kill anyone,â the article quotes Mariyam as saying. A Times Fact Check reader sent the article published on votergiri.com to our WhatsApp number 85270 01433 asking us to check if the claims made in the article are true.

Header: FACT CHECK: Images of crying photographer have nothing to do with MS Dhoni
Body: Some individual social media users and Facebook pages are sharing a collage made with three different images of a photographer, crying while trying to click pictures, along with a photo of former Indian cricket team captain MS Dhoni, with captions like "Love you, Mahi", "The picture speaks for itself, a thousand words" and "Picture speaks louder than words!" to imply that the photographer was crying seeing Dhoni's wicket falling in the World Cup semi-final match between New Zealand and India. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video from Morocco shared as attack on Muslim woman in India
Body: A video of a burqa-clad woman being attacked by a few men with eggs, bottles and white powder is being shared on Twitter with the claim that the incident happened in India. A loose translation of the caption in Hindi Twitter user Aasif Rizvi tweeted the video with is, âWhat is happening in this country? So much hate against Muslims. Is that how you plan to win their hearts? Is this the new India?â Rizvi tagged PM Narendra Modi, UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Union Minister Muqhtar Abbas Naqvi among others in his tweet. A reader also WhatsApped the video to us on 8527001433 and wanted to know if the said incident took place in India.

Header: FACT CHECK: Who are the petitioners who fought for women's entry into Sabarimala?
Body: Many social media users are claiming that those who filed a petition demanding womenâs entry into Keralaâs Sabarimala temple are Muslims. The posts on social media platforms making this claim increased after the Supreme Court, on Monday, rejected a plea seeking womenâs entry into mosques. Rejecting Akhila Bharatha Hindu Mahasabha's plea seeking entry of Muslim women into mosques, a bench headed by Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi said, "Let a Muslim woman come and challenge it. Then we will consider." A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Rohit Sardana Fans Club' posted an image with text in Hindi that closely translates to, "In the Sabarimala case, the petitioner was a Muslim. Then, the Supreme Court accepted the plea. But when it came to women's entry into mosques, the Supreme Court said that petitioners are Hindus, and hence the plea is rejected." A Twitter user @jpsin1 posted the same claim as a tweet. à¤¸à¤¬à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾à¤²à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤¸ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¯à¤¾à¤à¤¿à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤ à¤®à¥à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤® à¤¨à¥ à¤¦à¤¾à¤¯à¤° à¤à¥ à¤¥à¥ à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤ªà¥à¤°à¥à¤® à¤à¥à¤°à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¥à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤° à¤²à¥ ..à¤²à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¨ à¤®à¤¸à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¦ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤®à¤¹à¤¿à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤â¦ https://t.co/VUCAEApUUU— ð®ð³Jitendra pratap singhð®ð³ (@jpsin1) 1562601006000An archived version of the tweet is here.Messages with the same claim are being circulated on WhatsApp as well.

Header: Fact Check: Muslims in Agra protested against Tabrez Ansari’s lynching chanting “Allah Hu Akbar”?
Body: A video showing a mob wielding swords and sticks is being shared with a claim that it happened in Agra in support of Jharkhand lynching victim Tabrez Ansari. The video is being shared with a claim that the mob said, âIf you wish to live in India, then you will have to say Allah Hu Akbarâ. Watching the video, one can hear the same chant in Urdu âHindustan mein rehna hoga toh Allah hu Akbar kehna hogaâ.Other communally-provocative chants could also be heard. The video was shared by several Facebook users.

Header: FACT CHECK: Misinformation about WhatsApp widely circulated on WhatsApp
Body: Two different messages with various false claims about WhatsApp are being widely circulated on WhatsApp and social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter. First message: "What's app will b off From 11.30pm to 6:00 am daily. Declared by central govt. Message from narendra modi (PM) we have had an over usage of user names on whatsapp Messenger. We are requesting all users to forward this message to their entire contact list. If you do not forward this message, we will take it as your account is invalid and it will be deleted within the next 48 hours. DO NOT ignore my words or whatsapp will no longer recognise your activation. If you wish to re-activate your account after it has been deleted, a charge of 499.00 will be added to your monthly bill. We are also aware of the issue involving the pictures updates not showing. We are working diligently at fixing this problem and it will be and running as soon as possible. Thank you for your cooperation from the modi team. WhatsApp is going to cost you money soon. The only way that it will stay free is if you are a frequent user i.e. you have at least 50 people you are chatting with. To become a frequent user send this message to 10 people who receive it (2 ticks) and your WhatsApp logo will change color. send this to 8 people to activate the new whatsapp.. Saturday morning whatsapp will become chargeable. If you have at least 10 contacts send them this message. In this way we will see that you are an avid user and your logo will become blue and will remain free. (As discussed in the paper today. Whatsapp will cost 0.01â¬ per message. Send this message to 10 people. When you do the light will turn blue otherwise whatsapp will activate billing. ITS TRUE ...... U get blue TICKS" The message falsely attributed to the Narendra Modi-led NDA government makes the following false claims - 1) WhatsApp will be 'off' from 11.30 PM to 6 AM every day. 2) That if the above message is not forwarded to the user's entire contact list, their WhatsApp account will become invalid and deleted within 48 hours. 3) That WhatsApp will charge Rs 499 for reactivation of the account. 4) That WhatsApp will charge money from Saturday morning (no particular date is mentioned). 5) That some 'logo' will become blue. 6) That you will get some 'blue ticks'. Second message:"Good news FINAL NOTICE "Dont ignore please read it carefully" Hello, I. Am VARUN PULYANI director of whatsapp, this message is to inform all of our users that we have sold whatsapp to Mukesh Ambani . Reliance for 19 billion $. WhatsApp is now controlled by mukesh Ambani . If you have at least 10 contacts send this sms and logo of your whatsapp will change to a new icon with facebook's "f" within 24 hours.Forward this message to more than 10 people to activate your new whatsapp with facebook services or else your account will be deleted from new servers. This is the final notice! Hello everyone, it seems that all the warnings were real, the use of WhatsApp cost money from November 2017. If you send this string to 18 different on your list, your icon will be blue and will be free for you. If you do not believe me see tomorrow at 6 pm ending WhatsApp and have to pay to open it, this is by law This message is to inform all of our users, our servers have recently been very congested, so we are asking you to help us solve this problem. We require our active users to forward this message to each of the people in your contact list to confirm our active users using WhatsApp, if you do not send this message to all your contacts WhatsApp will then start to charge you. Your account will remain inactive with the consequence of losing all your contacts. Message from Jim Balsamic (CEO of Whatsapp ) we have had an over usage of user names on whatsapp Messenger. We are requesting all users to forward this message to their entire contact list. If you do not forward this message, we will take it as your account is invalid and it will be deleted within the next 48 hours. Please DO NOT ignore this message or whatsapp will no longer recognise your activation. If you wish to re-activate your account after it has been deleted, a charge of 25.00 will be added to your monthly bill. We are also aware of the issue involving the pictures updates not showing. We are working diligently at fixing this problem and it will be up and running as soon as possible. Thank you for your cooperation from the Whatsapp teamâ WhatsApp is going to cost us money soon. The only way that it will stay free is if you are a frequent user i.e. you have at least 10 people you are chatting with. To become a frequent user send this message to 10 people who receive it (2 ticks) and your WhatsApp logo should turn blue to connect your whatsaap with facebook log in here http://updateyourself.wapka.mobi Forward this message to More than 25 WhatsApp contacts. Company promoting there website. Get Rs.497.54 talktime. Its true. Watch in today Times of India newspaper. Page 7. Check your balance after 10min" The second message that is being widely shared is attributed to the Times of India newspaper and to one 'Varun Pulyani', Director of WhatsApp. This message makes the following false claims apart from the ones made in the first message- 1) That there is someone called Varun Pulyani who is the Director of WhatsApp. 2) That WhatsApp has been sold to Mukesh Ambani. 3) That one 'Jim Balsamic' is WhatsApp CEO. 4) That the Times of India newspaper carried a report stating the above.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, UNESCO has not declared Islam as the world’s most peaceful religion
Body: Several Islamic Facebook pages have been sharing a certificate purportedly from UNESCO that declares Islam as worldâs most peaceful religion. Signed by the former UNESCO Director General Irina Bokova, the certificate titled âCertificate of Peaceâ reads âOn the 4th day of July 2016, we declare that Islam as the most peaceful religion of the worldâ. The certificate also carries a logo of some âInternational Peace Foundationâ. The screenshot was shared by Facebook page Islamic Preach last Saturday.   The certificate was also shared by Facebook page âI love Islamâ, among many others.

Header: Fact Check: Did PM Modi meet Manmohan Singh to discuss GDP?
Body: A video of former PM Manmohan Singh and his wife Gursharan Kaur meeting PM Narendra Modi is being shared with a claim that Modi met Singh to discuss GDP. In the 45-second long video being shared, one can see PM Modi arriving in a car and being welcomed by Mr and Mrs Singh. Khushboo Bhagat, National Delegate of NSUI as per Twitter bio, said âSingh is Kingâ while sharing the video with the above claim. Modi went to meet Manmohan Singh to discuss about GDP . Singh is king. https://t.co/4p5DdRw5M9— Khushboo bhagat (@khushboo_JK) 1561975779000Archived version of this tweet can be found here. Karnataka Congress state spokesperson and national social media coordinator of Mahila Congress Lavanya Ballal quoted Bhagatâs tweet video and claimed âSingh was always a gentlemanâ. Dr.Manmohan Singh has always been a statesman. https://t.co/ZrcH1mUlfo— Lavanya Ballal | à²²à²¾à²µà²£à³à²¯ à²¬à²²à³à²²à²¾à²³à³ (@LavanyaBallal) 1561990552000Archived version of this tweet can be found here.

Header: FACT CHECK: India Gate has names of 61,395 Muslim freedom fighters?
Body: A graphic card with AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's photo, that claims names of 61,395 Muslim freedom fighters are engraved on India Gate, is being widely circulated on social media platforms and WhatsApp. Here is the graphic card: Here's a loose translation of the content on the graphic card: "Delhi's India Gate has names of some 95,300 freedom fighters, Muslims - 61,935, Sikh - 8,050, OBC - 14,480, Dalit - 10,777, Savarna (Upper caste) - 598 and Sanghi - 0. And then, some shameless people call Muslims traitors when their history is that of spying for the British." A Times Fact Check reader got in touch with us via email asking if we could fact check the claim. On searching Facebook with certain words in the content written in Hindi in the above graphic card, we came across a post by a page that goes by the name 'AIMIM Maharashtra' and has Owaisi's photo as the display image. The page is not verified. The post has almost the same content, only slightly different, but the graphic card has journalist Ravish Kumar's image instead of Owaisi's. This post was made on February 11, 2019.

Body: Twitter user '@jayasreevijayan' tweeted a video showing what looks like a gigantic machine producing a large amount of thick white fumes saying, "Rain clouds generator engine developed by NASA. Body: A video showing a group of men, one of them wearing a white skull cap, thrashing another man, is being shared on social media platforms with a claim that the video shows Muslim men lynching a Hindu man. Twitter user who goes by the handle '@nationalist_om' tweeted the video on June 25, 2019 with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Is this not lynching? The one who's dying is a Hindu and those who are thrashing are Muslims. Twitter user Kamran Shahid shared the photo saying, âRahul (Gandhi) using his phone is a problem but Shah sleeping is not,â he tweeted. Body: One of Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's aides, Naeem ul Haque, special assistant to Khan as per his Twitter bio, tweeted a photo on of a cricketer saying, "PM Imran Khan 1969". Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress makes false claim of PM Modi inaugurating a bridge that collapsed
Body: The official Twitter account of West Bengal Congress on Thursday posted a picture of a collapsed bridge, which it called Jamnagar-Junagarh bridge. Using that picture, it claimed that the bridge was planned by PM Narendra Modi when he was Gujaratâs CM and inaugurated by him after becoming PM. Planned by then CM Modi, inaugurated by PM Modi, Jamnagar-Junagarh highway bridge collapsed within 3 months of inauâ¦ https://t.co/5y17y86FC1— West Bengal Congress (@INCWestBengal) 156104076000

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, this is not a photo of Shashi Tharoor with wives of Pakistani cricketers
Body: A photo of senior Congress leader and Party's MP from Thiruvananthapuram Shashi Tharoor is being shared on social media platforms with a false claim. In the photo, Tharoor could be seen posing with a few women. A Times Fact Check reader sent a post made by Facebook user, who goes by the name 'Rahul Singh', to our WhatsApp number, asking us to verify the claim he has made in the post. In the post, Singh has written in Hindi what closely translates to, "When Pakistani cricketers' wives are with Shashi Tharoor, how will they bat?" Here is the post:The same photo is being shared by many social media users with another caption - "There's more to winning a cricket match, than just players hitting a ball. Here's a convincing reason why we won the match - Shashi Tharoor with Pakistan's cricket wives (sic)." The photo is being shared on WhatsApp as well.

Header: FACT CHECK: Has Priyanka Chopra joined RSS?
Body: A photo of actress Priyanka Chopra wearing khaki pleated shorts is being shared with the claim that she has joined the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). The claim is being made by many on Facebook. Incidentally, the most viral ones have been made on the group âWE SUPPORT NARENDRA MODIâ. Claim Exhibit 1Claim Exhibit 2Few Facebook users also created posts making the claim on their own profile.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did this American woman give birth to 17 baby boys at once?
Body: Many social media users, both on Facebook and Twitter, have been sharing three photos -- one showing a pregnant woman with unusually huge belly and two images showing a man in one photo and a woman in another, surrounded by 17 babies -- with a claim that an American woman gave birth to 17 baby boys at once. A Facebook user 'Dolly Modo Ridings' shared the three photos saying, "Catherine Bridge holds the World Record for the most babies in a lone pregnancy by giving birth to 17 babies...," along with a link to an article published on a website that goes by the name 'Women Daily Magazine'. On searching with the same caption on Facebook, we found another user -- Richard Camarinta Dy -- who shared the same three photos with the same caption in a post and that post got shared over 33,000 times. A verified Twitter handle '@Gidi_Traffic' with over 1.6 million followers shared the same photos with the same caption. "@tholuinspire: Catherine Bridge holds the world's record for the most babies in a lone pregnancy by giving birth tâ¦ https://t.co/1mk3Trr4Bt— Ride With GidiCab (@Gidi_Traffic) 1558901052000Another Twitter user '@OfficialKvist' shared the same photos with the same caption, and the tweet got liked over 32,000 times and retweeted over 26,000 times. Catherine Bridge holds the world's record for the most babies in a lone pregnancy by giving birth to 17 babies. ð²â¦ https://t.co/k7awMLo6nL— OlÃºwaseun (@OfficialKvist) 155878441800

Header: Fact Check: Did cars in Saudi Arabia melt due to high temperature?
Body: Several social media users are posting images of melted cars and street lights claiming that it is due to the extreme heat wave in Saudi Arabia and Kuwait. Here are the pictures being shared: Picture 1 Picture 2 A Twitter user shared image of the melted traffic signal saying that the temperature in Kuwait touched 63 degrees and in Saudi, it touched 55 degrees. On Saturday kuwait recorded the highest temperature in the world. Reaching 52.2 degrees Celsius in the shadows andâ¦ https://t.co/kHknqD0X8H— Jacque (@Jacquekourouss) 1560707062000Another user, Pakistani politician Zartaj Gul Wazir, shared photo of the damaged cars saying, â62 degree temperature and lack of plantation in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia is causing thisâ.

Header: Viral video of 'Boston Dynamics' robot attacking humans is a parody
Body: A video showing a robot, that looks exactly like Boston Dynamics' humanoid 'Atlas', resisting attack from humans and fighting back towards the end of the video, is viral on social media. Boston Dynamics, an American robotics design company, is famous for its robots, especially the humanoid they named Atlas. Videos showing Atlas walking in rough terrain, getting up if it tips over, and keeping its balance while performing various tasks, have gone viral in the past. For instance, the video below: Videos produced by Boston Dynamics also have a watermark on the bottom-right corner saying 'Boston Dynamics'. A similar video, of an Atlas-like humanoid being thrashed by humans initially, and towards the end of the video, the humanoid standing up on its feet to defend itself and fight back, is now viral on social media. Here is the video: The video is titled 'Boston Dynamics: New Robots Now Fight Back' is quite similar to the videos Boston Dynamics produce. A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@kocizum' tweeted a portion of the video and many other Twitter users believed it's a video by Boston Dynamics. The video posted by the user is now unavailable because of copyright issues. The user's tweet with the video was retweeted more than 1,09,000 times and liked over 2,41,000 times. https://t.co/gcBnaFbGm4— ÑÑÐ¿Ð¾ÑÐ¼Ð°Ðº Ð¸ ÐºÐ¾Ð¼Ð±Ð¸ÐºÐ¾ÑÐ¼ (@kocizum) 1560540545000This will be used as propaganda when the robot uprising comes. https://t.co/2BTXJP3hQc— Rita Panahi (@RitaPanahi) 1560559904000@kocizum Not only do humans abuse ourselves and every other creature on earth, we actually create new things to abuse.— Tim Hendricks (@Saltwatertattoo) 156057363400

Header: FACT CHECK: Photo of father, kid shared to claim Islam promotes paedophilia
Body: A Twitter user who goes by the handle '@squintneon' made a tweet on June 9, 2019 saying, "Peacefuls love reacting to pedophilia in such huge number and you are shocked about Twinkle's incident. It's part and parcel of their culture (sic)," and shared four screenshots. The first screenshot was of a photo posted by a Facebook page by the name of âPhotoâs Vatrinaâ that has 2.3 million followers on the platform and one that regularly posts photos of kids. The photo showed a kid beneath a man who is prostrating. The other three screenshots showed Facebook users, all of them seemingly Muslims, who reacted to the photo with a âheartâ on Facebook. The tweet, since then, got retweeted more than 800 times and liked over 1,100 times. On June 10, the same Twitter user posted the photo alone, again, saying, "I am letting you all to decide whether this pic looks anywhere close to pious. What's the first impression you getting? I have personally never seen someone offering namaz like this, did you?" On June 10, another Twitter user who goes by the handle â@khushi2318â tweeted the same four screenshots â@squintneonâ tweeted on June 9, saying, âLook at the reactions on a paedophilia post on Facebook. Religion of peace followers loving paedophilia, it's a part of their culture! Now you can connect this to the mentality of Aligarh monsters like Zahid, Aslam, Hasan etc..â The news of a 2.5-year-old baby girl, brutally murdered in Aligarh, came out earlier this month. In this case, Aligarh Police arrested Zahid, his younger brother Mehdi Hasan, his wife Sabusta Begum and one Aslam.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No Nipah virus outbreak in West Bengal's Siliguri
Body: A message that is being shared widely on WhatsApp claims that there has been a Nipah virus outbreak in West Bengal's Siliguri district and that a lot of people who contracted the virus have been admitted to Siliguri District Hospital. Here's what the message says: "Nipah Virus arrived Siliguri emergency information please note it down seriously Many people are admitted in Siliguri District Hospital with strange sickness. Dr Krishnendu Dey from Siliguri said that the sickness is coming from eating Lechees (lechu). He said that if it is going on like this, thousands of people will die within a week. Please tell the children not to eat lechees. The leeches are eaten by bats and people are getting strange sickness. It is affecting the liver and Dr S. SEN is also affected. He went to various doctors but sickness can't be cured. Dr Dey said that he may die soon due to liver infection (sic). Please forward this message if you want to save people of your area." A Times Fact Check reader forwarded the message to our WhatsApp number asking if it's fake news. We spoke to people from different parts of India like Cochin, Mumbai, Lucknow, Ahmedabad, Chennai, Bangalore and Siliguri to see if they had come across this message and found that it had reached all of them through WhatsApp.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Aamir Khan’s niece used to claim she is Sambit Patra’s daughter
Body: A photo showing three women at a beach is being shared across social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that one of them is BJP spokesperson Sambit Patraâs daughter. The posts shared to defame Patra, read, âThis is the daughter of Sambit Patra, the man who opposes the burqa and lies during TV debates.â The photo has three women, and one of them, encircled in red, is said to be Patraâs daughter. On Twitter, Youth Congress politician Rishav Sharma, made the same claim. à¤¬à¥à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤µà¤¿à¤°à¥à¤§ à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤à¤° à¤à¥à¤µà¥ à¤à¥à¤¨à¤²à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤° à¤¬à¥à¤  à¤à¤° à¤à¥à¤  à¤¬à¥à¤²à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤¸à¤à¤¬à¤¿à¤¤ à¤ªà¤¾à¤¤à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤à¥ @sambitswaraj https://t.co/xnYl89EbAU— Rishav Sharma IYC (@RishavSharmaIyc) 1559700925000Hereâs a sample of the claim made on Facebook:   Times Fact Check also received the same photo and the exact same claim on our WhatsApp number 8527001433 from a reader who wanted to know the truth.

Header: FACT CHECK: Kerala nurse present at the time of Rahul Gandhi's birth was 13 years old then?
Body: Congress President Rahul Gandhi, on the last day of his three-day visit to his parliamentary constituency of Kerala's Wayanad, that is on June 9, met a retired nurse who was present at New Delhi's Holy Family Hospital when he was born 49 years ago. The meeting made headlines and many media houses reported it. A Twitter user who goes by the handle â@muralikrishnaE1â tweeted making a claim that the retired nurse -- Rajamma MK aka Rajamma Vavathil -- who was present at the time of Rahul Gandhi's birth is 62 years of age now and hence, would have been only 13 years of age when Gandhi was born. Quote-tweeting a tweet by news agency ANI that said, "Kozhikode: Congress President Rahul Gandhi met Vavathil, a retired nurse who was present at the time of his birth," the Twitter user said, "Rajamma is 62. Rahul is 49. So when he was born, the nurse was 13 year old (sic)." He also called the meeting a âscamâ. Basically, the Twitter user is claiming that Vavathil is lying about being present when Gandhi was born and that the Congress President met the nurse for a photo-op as part of a PR campaign. Here is the tweet:You can find an archived version of the tweet here.Murali Krishna's tweet, as of now, has been retweeted more than 6,500 times and liked by over 12,000 Twitter users. The screenshot of the tweet is also being widely shared on Facebook and WhatsApp. Gandhi, from his new official, verified Twitter account, tweeted about meeting Vavathil too. As CP @RahulGandhi's third day begins, he shares a light moment with Rajamma, a retired nurse present at the time oâ¦ https://t.co/pcl1pa8lhh— Rahul Gandhi - Wayanad (@RGWayanadOffice) 1560058556000Times Fact Check readers got in touch with us asking if the claim made by the Twitter user is true.

Header: FACT CHECK: This Modi lookalike is neither PM's brother nor are his photos digitally manipulated
Body: The photo of an auto-rickshaw driver with uncanny resemblance to Prime Minister Narendra Modi is being shared widely on social media with a claim that he is Modiâs younger brother. Many individual Facebook users and pages are sharing the photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, âSalutes to the man who is the prime minister of the country but his younger brother is still an auto-rickshaw driverâ. The post above has been shared more than 1,100 times and got over 5,100 reactions. A search on Facebook search bar using the caption in Hindi will lead you to many users and pages sharing the same image with the same claim. The photo of this auto-rickshaw driver went viral for the first time in 2016 with the same claim. Many social media users, since then, have also been claiming that the photo is digitally manipulated.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of Shahnawaz Hussain and Murli Manohar Joshi circulated with false claims
Body: Some Twitter users are sharing photos of BJP leaders Syed Shahnawaz Hussain and Murli Manohar Joshi to claim that Joshiâs daughter married Hussain and that he celebrated Eid with them. The picture also has a woman standing between Hussain and Joshi. Another photo of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh sitting with Hussain and the same woman is also being shared to claim that Singh, too, celebrated Eid with them. Taking a dig at BJPâs ideology, one Twitter user wrote, âThese guys eat seviyan together and make us fight. You must understand that it is not Hindus who are in danger but their political careers.â à¤¹à¤¿à¤¨à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤°à¤¦à¤¯ à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤°à¤¾à¤ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤°à¤²à¥ à¤®à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¤° à¤à¥à¤¶à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤° à¤¦à¤¾à¤®à¤¾à¤¦ à¤¶à¤¹à¤¨à¤µà¤¾à¤ à¤¹à¥à¤¸à¥à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤à¤¦ à¤®à¤¨à¤¾à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤à¥¤ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨â¦ https://t.co/knetYRpi31— Asma ð®ð³ Ø¢Ø³ÙØ§ (@Asmaparveen77) 1559848550000Same photos with similar claims are being shared by many on Twitter as well as Facebook.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Farooq Abdullah chant 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after Amit Shah became home minister?
Body: A video showing former Jammu and Kashmir chief minister and chairman of J&K National Conference Farooq Abdullah chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that he did so after Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) President Amit Shah was appointed as the home minister in the newly-constituted Narendra Modi Cabinet. Twitter user @intolerantmano2 shared the video with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Farooq Abdullah, as soon as Amit Shah became the home minister." à¤à¤®à¤¿à¤¤à¤¶à¤¾à¤¹ à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤¹à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ à¤¬à¤¨à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤«à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤ à¤à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥à¤²à¥à¤²à¤¾ ððð¤£ https://t.co/PXftV5yala— Gabbar Singh ( à¤°à¤¾à¤®à¤à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ ) (@IntolerantMano2) 1559369469000Here is an archived version of the tweet. In the video, Abdullah could be heard saying what closely translates to, "Raise your voice and say 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', 'Jai Hind'." The camera then pans to the audience. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP President and current Home Minister Amit Shah, current Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad could be seen in the audience. Facebook user Jitendra Jain shared the same video with a claim that basically means, "As soon as Amit Shah became the home minister, everyone will have to say 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Jai Hind'."

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Hyderabad Police claim soft drinks contain Ebola virus?
Body: A viral message on WhatsApp claims that Hyderabad Police warned the public against consuming any âsoft drinkâ because an employee working for one of these companies added his blood contaminated by Ebola virus to the product. Such messages have been doing the rounds since 2014. The name of the soft drink, however, keeps changing. To support the claim, those who send the message also forwards a set of pictures and a video. While two of those pictures show many dead bodies, others show two men inspecting two bottles with Coca Cola bottles lying on floor. The video shows a middle-aged woman, with a kid in her arms, wailing. Another old woman could be seen on the floor in an unconscious state. The message further claims that the incident was âshown on NDTVâ the previous day. Hereâs a screengrab of the message circulated on WhatsApp. And here are the pictures being shared: Image 1 Image 2 Image 3 Image 4 Video

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, IPS officer D Roopa did not refuse any award by Modi government
Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo of IPS officer D Roopa Moudgil with a false claim that she refused to accept an award given by the Narendra Modi-led NDA government. Sample these: Those who are spreading this false claim also attributed a fake quote to Roopa. With captions written in Hindi along with Roopa's photo or as text content in graphic cards placed alongside the photo, these posts basically say -"IPS officer Roopa Yadav refused to accept an award given by Modi government," and quotes her as saying, "My conscience doesn't allow me to accept an award given by the Party that has a newly-elected MP who insulted Gallantry-award winning martyr Hemant Karkare." In these posts, Roopa is referred to as Roopa Yadav. Roopa's photo is being shared by many Twitter users as well, with the same false claim.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Barack Obama watch PM Modi’s swearing-in ceremony?
Body: A photo showing former US President Barack Obama watching Prime Minister Narendra Modiâs swearing-in ceremony is making the rounds on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The intent is to make people believe that Obama was watching the ceremony. âThis is the power of Modi. In the USA, Obama is listening to his swearing-in ceremony,â reads the caption of a post made in Hindi by a Facebook user.   Similarly, on Twitter, another user shared the same image with the same claim in English. Barak Obama Watching Swearing Ceremony ð @narendramodi This Is Modi Powerð¥ #ModiSarkar2 #ModiSwearingIn https://t.co/8tbkDGq94G— Manasi Sutarð®ð³ (@Manasisutar1999) 1559227206000We cannot say for sure that Obama did not watch the swearing-in ceremony but the photo used above to make that claim is a fake. Apart from this image, a video showing a crowd in a bar going berserk watching Modi swearing in as the prime minister for the second consecutive term is also going viral. The video was shared by Vikas Bhadauria, a journalist. He wrote, âAn image that makes you feel you have not seen it enough times. It still touches my heart.â à¤¯à¥ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¥à¤° à¤à¤¿à¤¤à¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤° à¤¦à¥à¤à¥, à¤à¤® à¤²à¤à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥... à¤®à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¹ à¤²à¥à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¤¾ à¤µà¥à¤¡à¤¿à¤¯à¥ #ModiSarkar2 https://t.co/rG91coVjRO— Vikas Bhadauria (ABP News) (@vikasbha) 155932256900

Header: FACT CHECK: Old photos passed off as ones from slain militant Zakir Musa's funeral
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of 'Jawad Tariq' shared a photo with a caption saying, "Funeral of Zakir Musa Shaheed. Curfew, Rain, Check-posts and all blockages. Indian Occupied Kashmir." The same photo was shared by a blog that goes by the name of 'The Kashmiriyat" in an article with the headline, "Tral Flooded by People- People from As Far as Kupwara Reach to Offer Funeral to Zakir Musa". They also tweeted the link to that article. Another Facebook user, 'Rafeeq Ahmad Mir' copy-pasted the content published on the blog mentioned above along with two photos. Here is one of the photos he posted with an intent to make it appear as if it was clicked at Zakir Musa's funeral: Zakir Musa, Jammu and Kashmir's most wanted militant, was   shot dead   by security forces in Dadsara village of Tral in J&K's Pulwama district on May 23.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This woman is not an Indian soldier on duty in Rajasthan
Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo of a woman, seen in military uniform, with a claim that she is an Indian soldier on duty in a desert in Rajasthan. The caption in Hindi given by most users sharing the image, both on Facebook and Twitter, closely translates to, "An Indian soldier on guard duty in the scorching heat in a desert in Rajasthan." Sample these posts: If you search on Twitter with the same caption, you can see users tweeting the woman's image with the same claim. à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤¤à¤ªà¤¤à¥ à¤°à¥à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¨ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ªà¤¹à¤°à¤¾ à¤¦à¥à¤¤à¥ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¥à¤¯ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤¯ à¤¹à¤¿à¤à¤¦ à¤à¤¯ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤ https://t.co/2tze9ls5jw— Rampal Bhai (@bhai_rampal) 155920227100

Header: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee injured in Nandigram, says was 'attacked by 4-5 men'
Gauahar slams report suggesting that she is pregnant
Shruti Haasan opens up about battle with anxiety
BJP rubbishes attack on Mamata Banerjee, says 'she did drama for sympathy'
Tirath Singh Rawat takes oath as Uttarakhand chief minister
FACT CHECK: Did people in Balochistan celebrate BJP election win?
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video showing a lot of people, distinctively Muslim, waving the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) flags and cheering for the Party, with a claim that the video is of people in Balochistan celebrating the landslide victory in the Lok Sabha Election, 2019. A Facebook page by the name of 'Achhe Din' posted the video in question on May 28, 2019,with a caption that closely translates to, "BJP has opened its first branch in Pakistan. In India, Indian traitors often wave Pakistani flags, but today, seeing these visuals, I feel happy." The video has, by now, been viewed more than 2,07,000 times and the post has been shared over 6,900 times. A search on Facebook search bar with the Hindi caption makes it clear that a lot of pages and individual users have been sharing this video since the election results. The same video is being tweeted by many users with the same caption.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did an Indian millionaire shower dollars to celebrate Narendra Modi’s victory?
Body: A video is doing the rounds on social media along with a claim that an Indian millionaire flung bills worth $1,00,000 in Diamond Market area of New York after Narendra Modi-led NDA got elected for the second term. In the video, a man can be seen showering dollar notes and many rushing to grab what they can. Times Fact Check received the video on our WhatsApp number 8527001433. We also found that the video is being shared by several users with the same claim on social networking platforms like Facebook and Twitter. Many users have also uploaded the video on YouTube. Verified Twitter user Rajiv Malhotra, who has close to 2 lakh followers, shared the video: New York man giving $100,000 to celebrate Modi win https://t.co/rWQkDR7ZnI— Rajiv Malhotra (@RajivMessage) 1558737440000On YouTube On Facebook, a number of users shared the video with the same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: BJP MP from Karnataka tweets fake news about death of teenager
Body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP from Karnataka's Udupi-Chikmagalur constituency Shobha Karandlaje tweeted a collage with three images of 19-year-old Shivkumar Balram Uppar aka Shivu Uppar, a teenager from Karnataka's Belagavi who committed suicide on May 26, 2019, saying he was murdered and hanged for protecting cows from cow smugglers. In her tweet, Karandlaje said, "Shivu Uppar, a 19-year-old boy was murdered & hanged in Bagewadi Bus stand in Belagavi. He was hacked to death just for protecting cows from cow smugglers; that was the only mistake he did. I demand CM to deal this sternly & arrest the culprits," along with #OmShanthi and #JusticeForShivuUppar. Times Fact Check is not putting up the tweet or the screenshot of it owing to disturbing images. An archived version of Karandlaje's tweet is here.The tweet has been retweeted more than 2,300 times now and liked by over 3,200 users, by now.

Header: FAKE ALERT: News about Sanath Jayasuriya's death is a hoax
Body: A website that goes by the name CBTV published an article with a headline saying, "Man knocked down by vehicle in Toronto identified as former Sri Lankan cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya," along with Sri Lankan cricketer, and former captain of the team, Sanath Jayasuriya's photo. As per the report, a man who was knocked down by a car in Canada died yesterday while undergoing treatment in a hospital there. The report claims that the Sri Lankan Embassy in Canada confirmed the identity of the 49-year-old Jayasuriya, confirming they were aware of his visit to Toronto. Actor Arshad Warsi fell for the death hoax and tweeted the article saying, âThis news is so shocking & sadâ¦â Indian cricketer Ashwin Ravichandran tweeted, âIs the news on Sanath Jayasuriya true? I got a news update on WhatsApp but see nothing here on Twitter!â

Header: FACT CHECK: Rahul Gandhi won Wayanad constituency with a lead of 8,54,297 votes?
Body: Many social media users are claiming that Congress President Rahul Gandhi made up for the election loss in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi constituency by ensuring a 'historic win' in Kerala's Wayanad constituency. The claim is that Gandhi won Wayanad by securing a lead of 8,54,297 votes. A Facebook page that goes by the name 'Ramesh Sharma, Sanganer', apparently the official Facebook page for the politician, shared a post claiming Gandhi won Wayanad with a lead of 8,54,297 votes, making him the candidate who won highest number of votes in the Lok Sabha Election 2019. Here is a close translation of the post in Hindi, "Congress President Rahul Gandhi Ji has won in Wayanad with a record number of 8 lakh 54 thousand 297 votes. Biggest win in all of 542 seats." Another Facebook page that goes by the name 'I.T and Social Media Cell Congress' shared the same post. This page, however, is not the official page of the Congress IT Cell.

Header: FACT CHECK: Man crying inconsolably over getting 5 votes is wrong about it
FACT CHECK: Did Navjot Sidhu say he'll quit politics if Rahul Gandhi loses Amethi?
Body: Many social media users are calling for Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu's resignation after Congress President Rahul Gandhi lost Amethi Lok Sabha seat to Bharatiya Janata Party's Smriti Irani. Sidhu is currently a minister in the Punjab Cabinet. 'Navjot Singh Sidhu' is also trending on Twitter for the same reason. There are calls for Congressâ Navjot Singh Sidhu to resign after Smriti Irani won in Amethi against Rahul Gandhi. https://t.co/aEKcIR6k8N— Twitter Moments India (@MomentsIndia) 1558620922000Some social media users are sharing a screenshot of an Economic Times report with a headline that quotes Sidhu as saying, "I will will quit politics if Gandhi loses Amethi". Times Fact Check got a query from a reader on our WhatsApp number asking if Sidhu really made this announcement. The reader shared the same screenshot with us. Since social media is full of memes today, it is possible that a few thought a fake quote was attributed to Sidhu.

Header: FACT CHECK: Men with laptops were arrested from EVM strongroom in Chhattisgarh?
Body: Many social media users are citing an undated newspaper clipping with an intent to give an impression that three men with laptops were arrested from an EVM strongroom in Chhattisgarh's Bastar during Lok Sabha Election 2019. Here is the newspaper clipping: The newspaper clipping's headline translates to, "3 men who entered EVM strongroom with laptops arrested". It says that three men, all of them Reliance Jio employees, entered an EVM strongroom in Chhattisgarh's Bastar with laptops and were arrested from there. The incident happened in Government Mahila Polytechnic College in Bastar's Jagdalpur. The news report also says that two guards were suspended. Those who are sharing this newspaper clipping are doing so without giving any context or details about when the news is from.

Body: Tweets doing rounds on Twitter claim that Anil Ambani's Reliance Group has withdrawn Rs 5,000 crore civil defamation suit only against former Congress spokesperson Priyanka Chaturvedi, who recently joined the Shiv Sena. One Twitter user claimed that âfake news was being spread that defamation suit against Congress has been withdrawn when in reality Reliance withdrew case only against Chaturvedi, who once was with Congressâ. To make this claim, he posted an image of a letter purportedly issued by Rasesh Parikh, Reliance Groupâs lawyer, to Chaturvedi. FACT CHECK: Did Kejriwal tweet that he wants to kill his PSO?
Body: Screenshot of a tweet made from the verified handle of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is being shared on social media. It shows Kejriwal quoting a tweet by BJP leader Vijay Goel and saying that he wants to kill his PSO (Personal Security Officer) and not PM Modi. For the uninitiated, Kejriwalâs PSO reports to Delhi Police which comes under the central government. FAKE ALERT: Video of Mamata Banerjee reciting Islamic verses is clipped
Body: A video showing West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee reciting Islamic verses is being shared on social media platforms and WhatsApp by many. This 12-second-long video clip has been doing the rounds on social media for a while now. Writer Madhu Kishwar tweeted this clip from her verified Twitter account on May 19, 2019 saying, "Time for Jehadi Mamta to move to Saudi Arabia or Pakistan." Time for #JehadiMamta to move to Saudi Arabia or Pakistan. https://t.co/JqIXejlanr— MadhuPurnima Kishwar (@madhukishwar) 1558274741000An archived version of her tweet could be found here.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did the flyover inaugurated by PM Modi get a pothole?
Body: Last year PM Narendra Modi had inaugurated initial phase of Indiaâs first 14-lane expressway connecting Delhi and Meerut. Now claims are being made that within one year, the expressway has a pothole. Some pictures are being shared along with this claim. A message shared on instant messaging app WhatsApp reads â90 km long Delhi-Meerut expressway which was made at a cost of Rs 841 crore, which was inaugurated by PM Modi and UP CM Yogi Adityanath, has brought to fore the evil deeds of these two within one year.â Same pictures are being shared on Facebook with similar message.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Shivraj Singh tweets misleading video to claim Rahul Gandhi forgot MP CM’s name
Body: Former Madhya Pradesh (MP) CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday tweeted a video of Congress President Rahul Gandhi. The video gives an impression that Gandhi said Bhupesh Baghel was MPâs CM and not Kamal Nath. A loose translation of what Chouhan wrote while sharing the video reads âWhat is this Rahul ji? Glad that at least in your speech, on the issue of not waiving off farmer loans on time, you finally changed the CM of MP? Itâs great leaders like you who do such big things in a whisker.â à¤à¤°à¥! à¤¯à¥ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾? à¤°à¤¾à¤¹à¥à¤² à¤à¥, à¤­à¤¾à¤·à¤£ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤¸à¤¹à¥, à¤¸à¤®à¤¯ à¤ªà¤° à¤à¤¿à¤¸à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤¼à¤°à¥à¤à¤¼ à¤®à¤¾à¤«à¤¼à¥ à¤¨ à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤à¤à¤¿à¤°à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤®à¤§à¥à¤¯à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤¶ à¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤à¥à¤¯à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥â¦ https://t.co/KIqsxglzlp— Chowkidar Shivraj Singh Chouhan (@ChouhanShivraj) 1557984298000The archived version on this tweet can be found here.This tweet has been retweeted close to 6000 times. While sharing the video, Twitter user @irishabhbankar said âA new show was launched yesterday in Neemuch. He doesnât even know the name of MP CM.â The video found its way on to Facebook as well with many users sharing it with similar claims.

Body: A short video clip of PM Narendra Modi is being shared by many Twitter users on micro-blogging platform with the claim that he talked about development of monkeys. In the 29-second clipping shared to make the claim, Modi can be heard saying âsince the time we have been given the opportunity to work in Indian government, we have given a lot of attention towards 'bandaron ka vikas'...we also want to do 'bandar based vikas'...we want to make a kind of infrastructure that connects âbandarâ to rail, road and airwaysâ. Claiming that Modi is talking about monkeys in his speech, a Twitter user shared the clip saying Mani Shankar Aiyar was right in his âneech aadmiâ remarks directed towards Modi. âNow comes the best of Modi. An administration under Narendra Modi spent millions to develop infrastructure for monkeys in Gujarat. I don't want to start a hashtag #BandarModi, but want to add that Mani Shankar Aiyar was prophetic about his #NeechAadmi comments (sic)â the tweet read. Now comes the best of #Modi. Header: FAKE ALERT: Is this PM Modi with Indira Gandhi in this photo?
Body: In a photo going viral on Facebook, one can see PM Narendra Modi with former PM Indira Gandhi. On a pro Rahul Gandhi page, a user posted this image with caption âSaheb turned out to be a Congressi, what would bhakts say now?â The same image is being shared by many other Facebook users with the same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Shivraj Singh’s wife was not arrested at Dubai Airport with gold worth Rs 5 crore
Body: Some social media posts shared on Facebook claim that the wife of former Madhya Pradesh (MP) CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Sadhna Singh, was arrested at Dubai Airport with Rs 5 crore worth of gold. These posts are accompanied with a notice purported to be on Dubai Customs' letterhead. The notice dated February 12, 2019 mentions that 'Sedhna Singh', a resident of Krishna Nagar in Bhopal evaded customs duty on a gold parcel. It warns of issuing a non-bailable warrant against Singh and handing over the matter to Interpol if she fails to cough up the duty. One of the users sharing the post along with the notice says that Sadhna was caught after she tried to âhide the stolen goldâ. Another Facebook user Zaheer Abbas made the claim with a comment âBJP stands with thieves and corrupt peopleâ. Many other users shared the post with similar claim and remarks.

Header: Female polling officer's photos viral with false claims
Body: Many social media users are sharing photos of a female polling officer along with many false claims. Most users and Facebook pages are sharing the photos with a claim that this officer ensured 100 per cent polling in the booth she was in charge of. While some say she was in-charge of a booth in Mumbai, others say she was photographed at a polling booth in Jaipur.
