The woman's photos went viral on many social media platforms and instant messaging applications like WhatsApp.

Header: FACT CHECK: Rajnath Singh visited madrassa to secure votes?
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name of 'Kamalnath Congress' shared a photo of Home Minister Rajnath Singh having snacks with a group of men, some of them wearing skull caps, with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "These are the same people who say terrorists are nurtured in madrassas. Today, they visit the same madrassas for votes and eat." The same photo is being shared by many social media users with the exact same caption. Some Twitter users are also tweeting the photo with the same caption. à¤¯à¥ à¤µà¤¹à¥ à¤²à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¹à¤¤à¥ à¤¥à¥ à¤à¤¿ à¤®à¤¦à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¤¤à¤à¤à¥ à¤ªà¤²à¤¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤ à¤¯à¥ à¤²à¥à¤ à¤µà¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤²à¤¿à¤ à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¥ à¤®à¤¦à¤°à¤¸à¥à¤ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤ à¥à¤¸ à¤ à¥à¤¸ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤à¥¤ https://t.co/hsiTBJGWSv— Geet Kar Nasrul Bihari (@kar_geet) 155741941200

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Rahul Gandhi was not beaten up in Amethi
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of 'Nidhi Sharma' posted a photo of Rahul Gandhi to various groups on Facebook with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Rahul Gandhi got a wonderful welcome at Amethi today. He was thrashed quite brutally." The photo the user shared showed Gandhi with his left eye injured, with a black eye, and it is clear from the caption that the intent is to portray that Gandhi was beaten up in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi, his Lok Sabha constituency. Sharma made the posts on May 7, 2019. Here are some samples:Since then, a lot of Facebook users have been sharing this photo with the exact same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video shared with false claim that Gujarat Police prevented Muslims from voting
Body: A video is being circulated on WhatsApp with the claim that Gujarat Police was deployed to stop Muslims from voting in the ongoing Lok Sabha Election. The 84-second long video shows police lathi-charging some civilians and trying to disperse the crowds. A loose translation of the text shared along with this video reads âIn Gujarat, Muslims were not allowed to vote by the use of police force.â A Times Fact Check reader shared the video on our WhatsApp number asking if itâs true. The reader sent the video with the same claim as above. @timesfactcheck is this true? *à¤¤à¤¾à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤¬à¤° :-à¤à¥à¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¤ à¤®à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤¨à¥ à¤®à¥à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤µà¥à¤ à¤¨à¤¹à¥ à¤¡à¤¾à¤²à¤¨à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤¸à¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤¯à¤¹ à¤µà¥à¤¡à¤¿à¤¯à¥* Gâ¦ https://t.co/t6Gx5tqCcX— Chowkidar Pankaj Sule (@pankajsule) 155723861000

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Modi, claiming he spends Rs 80 lakh on makeup artist, is from his Madame Tussauds sitting
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name of "Lukman Ramiz" shared a video of Prime Minister Narendra Modi with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "This is the son of a poor man; getting makeup done. An RTI revealed that Rs 80 lakh is spent on Modi's makeup artist every month." Here is the post: On searching Facebook with the same caption, we found that a user "Alok Tewari" shared the same video with the exact same caption a month ago. His post has, by now, gotten shared more than 16,000 times and the video has garnered over 3,75,000 views.

Header: FACT CHECK: Is this the person who slapped Arvind Kejriwal?
Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo with a claim that one of the persons seen in the photo is the man who slapped Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during a roadshow in Delhi's Moti Nagar area on Saturday. Facebook user Arvind Kumar Gupta shared a photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "The man who slapped Kejriwal turned out to be someone who works for his party. All this is a part of Kejriwal's drama to gain votes." Here the post:This photo is now being shared on social media platforms and WhatsApp.

Header: FACT CHECK: 'Teacher' hit 'Hindu' girls for not wearing hijab?
Body: A video showing a man hitting some of the kids walking in front of him is being shared widely across social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that the man is a 'teacher' who is hitting 'Hindu' girls for not wearing a hijab. The video is also being shared with a similar claim, that the 'teacher' hit only those girls who were not wearing a hijab. A Times Fact Check reader alerted us about this video by sending a message to our Facebook account.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Amit Shah saying 'Don't vote for Meenakshi Lekhi' is clipped
Body: Congress leader Ajay Maken, who is also the Party's candidate from New Delhi constituency in the Lok Sabha Election, tweeted a video that makes it look like Amit Shah, Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president, asked people not to vote for BJP's parliamentary candidates Meenakshi Lekhi and Ramesh Bidhuri. Makan tweeted, "It's very strange-BJP President Sh Amit Shah himself says that do not vote for Meenakshi Lekhi! Then why should anyone vote for Lekhi ji?" He also mentioned that Vishal Kundra, ex-state convenor of Congress IT Cell, sent him the video. The text on the video, written in Hindi, translates to, "BJP president Amit Shah has a message for the people of Delhi and this is his direction to all BJP workers." The video also has a logo that says "Vishal Kundra" and links to his Facebook and Twitter accounts. It is clear that Kundra made the video. Here is the tweet: Its very strange-BJP President Sh Amit Shah himself says that do not vote for Meenakshi Lekhi! Then why should anyâ¦ https://t.co/yBxI9tcXNR— Ajay Maken (@ajaymaken) 155681946000

Header: FAKE ALERT: Barack Obama did not endorse Akhilesh Yadav as India’s next PM
Body: A graphic card doing rounds on Facebook claims that former US president Barack Obama tweeted in support of Samajwadi Party president and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav. The graphic card is being shared widely at a time the Lok Sabha Election is ongoing. It claims that Obama tweeted that if India has to progress, it needs a prime minister like Yadav. The graphic card carries an image of Yadav and Obama shaking hands, with a text imprinted on it that makes the claim stated above. It was shared on Facebook Page â Lucknow ki Baatâ. The page later regretted the post.   It was also posted on Akhilesh Yadav fan club Facebook group, in which the user posting it quipped that even âObama knows the difference between right and wrongâ. It is interesting to note that these posts do not have a screenshot of the tweet Obama apparently made in support of Yadav.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Sadhvi Pragya did not say ‘Parrikar died because he allowed beef in Goa’
Body: Many social media posts going viral are attributing a controversial statement to the BJP candidate from Bhopal, Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur. These posts claim that Sadhvi made disdainful remarks about late former Defence Minister and Goa CM Manohar Parrikar. As per these posts, Sadhvi said that Parrikar died of cancer because he allowed consumption of beef in Goa. âWe will totally ban beef in Goa, North-East & South India, if BJP comes to power. Manohar Parrikar died of cancer because he allowed the consumption of beef in Goa: BJP Candidate Pragya Singh Thakurâ reads the text on this viral Facebook post shared by News Today Channel. The post further quotes Sadhvi as saying that Parrikar died because he disrespected gau mata (Mother cow), where as she was cured of cancer as she regularly consumed gau-mutra (cow urine).   Some Twitter users who shared the same remarks based it on a report published on notorious fake news website indiascoops.com. As per this report dated April 26, 2019, Sadhvi made these remarks during an election campaign in Madhya Pradeshâs Sehore. Pragya Thakur: "Parrikar (Ex CM OF GOA) died of cancer because he allowed the consumption of beef in Goa". The conâ¦ https://t.co/Dwg0Eh50oR— â­ Comrade â­ Of FEKOSLOVAKIA (@Comrade_ind) 1556585439000So according to BJP's terrorist Candidate Pragya Singh Thakur @arunjaitley ji must also suffering from cancer due tâ¦ https://t.co/0AkVgbTq09— Think2ReasonIt (@think2reasonit) 1556528715000Journalist Swati Chaturvedi also quoted a tweet carrying this story and said âThis terror accused needs help for her lunacyâ. Her tweet now stands deleted.

Header: Kids abuse PM Modi in front of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, 2 versions of the incident viral
FACT CHECK: New law by Modi government allows shooting of adivasis?
Body: Rahul Gandhi, while speaking at an election rally, said that the Narendra Modi-led NDA government has made a new law that allows officers to shoot adivasis. Gandhi made the statement while speaking at a rally in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol on April 23. Here's a portion of the video of the speech in which Gandhi made the statement: à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤¨à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤¬à¤¨à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¸à¤®à¥à¤ à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤¨ à¤²à¤¿à¤à¥ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¿ à¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤µà¤¾à¤¸à¤¿à¤¯à¥à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤²à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤¾ à¤¸à¤à¥à¤à¤¾à¥¤ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤²à¤¿à¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ à¤à¤¿ à¤à¤¦à¤¿â¦ https://t.co/j5YwwNOwKz— Akhilesh Sharma à¤à¤à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤¶ à¤¶à¤°à¥à¤®à¤¾ (@akhileshsharma1) 1556358407000Gandhi could be heard saying, "Ab Narendra Modi ne kya kanoon banaya? Adivasiyon ke liye ek naya kanoon banaya usme ek line likhi hai. Ki adivasiyon ko goli se maara ja sakega. Kanoon mai likha hai ki adivasiyon par akraman hoga. Aapki zameen cheenthe hai, jungle lete hain, jal lete hain, aur phir kehte hain ki adivasiyon ko goli maar di ja sakti hai," which closely translates to, "Now see what law Narendra Modi has made. There's a new law made for adivasis and there's a line written in it, that it will be allowed to shoot at adivasis. It's written in the law that adivasis will be attacked. They snatch your land, jungle and water and then it's said that adviasis could be shot at." Here is the full video of Gandhi's speech: Amit Malviya, in-charge of Bharatiya Janata Party's national information and technology, tweeted a video of Gandhi making the statement saying, "Rahul Gandhi is a congenital LIAR! Can you imagine anyone else speaking such lies and getting away with it? No fact check on Rahul Gandhiâs speeches, no outrage either... This subservience to the family is frankly worrying. But trust the people of India to reject such bigotry (sic)." Rahul Gandhi is a congenital LIAR! Can you imagine anyone else speaking such lies and getting away with it? No factâ¦ https://t.co/n8TwQ94qg2— Chowkidar Amit Malviya (@amitmalviya) 1556337448000Text written on the video translates to, "See the level to which Rahul Gandhi can stoop to; such a big lie for a few votes".

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress's Divya Spandana tweets digitally-manipulated photo of Adolf Hitler
Body: Former Congress MP Divya Spandana, who currently handles the social media operations and digital communications of the Congress Party, tweeted an image with two photos placed side by side- one of Nazi leader Adolf Hitler and the other of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, making it appear as if both of them interact with kids in a similar way, by pulling their ears while posing for photos. Divya tweeted the image saying, "What are your thoughts?" What are your thoughts? https://t.co/b8GcgKL2ih— Divya Spandana/Ramya (@divyaspandana) 1556520435000Here is an archived version of her tweet. This is not the first time these photos are being shared on social media. On July 25, 2018, a Facebook page by the name of "With INC" shared the image with a caption saying, "Hitler Modi Bhai Bhai". The same day, former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt posted the image saying, "Spot the difference". Spot the difference. https://t.co/yI1fyIOdos— Sanjiv Bhatt (IPS) (@sanjivbhatt) 153249233700

Header: FACT CHECK: Terror attack threat in south Indian states?
Body: A fax message sent by Karnataka police chief DG-IGP Neelimani N Raju to the state police chiefs of Tami Nadu, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Puducherry, Goa and Maharashtra, informing them of possible terror attacks in major cities in the states, is now being shared widely on WhatsApp. While some are receiving the image of the letter without any particular claim along with it, some are getting a message saying "Please be careful when you go out..." along with the image. Times Fact Check received the same image on WhatsApp from three different readers, eager to know if itâs a hoax or not. Karnataka DG-IGPâs letter informed her counterparts in the above mentioned states of a phone call Bengaluru City Police received from a person who claimed to be a lorry driver by the name of Swamy Sundar Murthy, and who claimed to have âinformation to the effect thatâ major cities in these states will be hit by terror attacks.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Rahul Gandhi claim some UP women give birth to 52 children in a year?
Body: A 10-second video clip of Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying that some women in Uttar Pradesh (UP) give birth every week, and that there are some women who give birth to 52 children in a year is being shared widely across social media platforms and WhatsApp. The video clip is being shared with a caption that begins with "Mega breaking news" or "Breaking news" and then quoting Gandhi as saying, "There are some women in Uttar Pradesh who give birth to a child every week, and some who give birth to 52 children in a year." Here are a few examples:The same video is being shared by many individual Facebook users as well as Facebook pages, with similar captions. Times Fact Check readers are getting in touch with us on WhatsApp asking if the video is a trimmed portion of a longer video.

Header: FAKE ALERT: PM Modi’s mother doesn’t have a portrait of Jawaharlal Nehru in her house
Body: A photo shared on a Facebook page by the name of âI support Punya Prasun Bajpaiâ shows PM Narendra Modi bowing to touch his mother Heeraben Modiâs feet. In this photo, on the wall, a portrait of Jawaharlal Nehru can be seen. The photo which has now gone viral is shared with a caption that says, âNehru is present in Heerabenâs room. Saheb criticizes Nehru but also keeps him in his home.â Archived version of the Facebook post can be viewed here.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Mamata Banerjee ask people to vote for BJP?
Body: West Bengal (WB) unit of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) tweeted a 19-second video of WB Chief Minister Mamata Banejee from its verified Twitter account. It has been shared with the claim that Mamata, while speaking at a rally, made an appeal to the crowd to vote for the BJP. Tagging the official Twitter account of Banerjee, the BJP Bengal handle wrote, "The impact of Modi tsunami. Mamata appeals everyone to vote for BJP! The first time she's made any sense during this election campaign! Thanks a ton didi! (sic)". The impact of MODI TSUNAMI - @mamataofficial appeals everyone to vote for BJP! The first time she's made any senseâ¦ https://t.co/5ga8TVUu6x— BJP Bengal (@BJP4Bengal) 1556033731000In the video, speaking in Bengali, Banerjee could be seen saying "Vote for BJP" repeatedly. Here's the archived version of BJP Bengal's tweet.

Body: A graphic card made to appear as if it's a screen grab taken from a news channel's broadcast, with the content quoting Union Minister Smriti Irani as saying she will commit suicide if Prime Minister Narendra Modi loses from Varanasi in the Lok Sabha elections of 2019, is being shared widely by many social media users. Header: FACT CHECK: Did women beat up BJP MLA with shoes in Himachal Pradesh?
Body: A video posted on a Facebook page that goes by the name of âThe Lion of Porbandarâ claimed that some women beat up a Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) MLA with their footwear. The 32-second-long video shows two women trying to step closer to a man under the pretext of garlanding him and one of them removing her slipper and thrashing him with it. These women are then heckled and pushed away by other men at the scene.   A close translation of the text shared on the video reads âBJP MLA welcomed with shoes in Hamirpur. Now do more jumlebaazi (political sloganeering)â. The post has been shared over 700 times so far. On searching about the video more, we found that it has been shared widely multiple times before. The same video was shared with the same claim in September last year by the president of the Block Congress Committee at Kailaras in Madhya Pradesh, Rajendra Shukla, and notched up more than one lakh views and close to seven thousand shares.

Header: FACT CHECK: Indira Gandhi invited Kiran Bedi for lunch after she towed away PMO car?
Body: A photo of former prime minister Indira Gandhi dining with Kiran Bedi, the first woman to join the Indian Police Service (IPS), is going viral on social media again. The photo that has gone viral multiple times in the past is now being shared widely with a claim that Gandhi invited Bedi for lunch to honour the courage she displayed in towing away a car that belonged to the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) in 1982. A Twitter handle @AIMCHistory that goes by the name of "Know Legacy of All India Mahila Congress" tweeted the photo on April 21 saying, "Rare to find leaders like Indira Gandhi. When Kiran Bedi booked a challan on PM's vehicle for wrong parking, Indira ji invited her for lunch personally at PMO to honor her fearless commitment towards duty (sic)." Rare to find leaders like Indira Gandhi When Kiran Bedi booked a challan on PM's vehicle for wrong parking, Indiraâ¦ https://t.co/nTf3yUQKpU— Know Legacy of All India Mahila Congress (@AIMCHistory) 1555824925000The photo is being pushed with this new narrative, that Gandhi rewarded a government employee for displaying 'fearless commitment to duty' to draw a parallel with Prime Minister Narendra Modi after   reports   of an Election Commission general observer -- Mohammed Mohsin -- being suspended for checking Modi's helicopter in Odisha's Sambalpur in violation of norms for dealing with SPG protectees came to light. Mohsin, a 1996 batch IAS officer of Karnataka cadre, was suspended for violating the Election Commission's instructions that SPG protectees should not be checked. He has now been attached with the chief electoral officer of Karnataka. Professor Ashok Swain quote-tweeted @AIMCHistory's tweet from his verified handle saying, "India Gandhi had even invited obnoxious Kiran Bedi for lunch after she had fined a PM's car, but Modi first suspended Mohammed Mohsin for checking his car & now he has been taken off from election duty in Odisha & transferred back to office of Karnataka Chief Electoral Officer (sic)." India Gandhi had even invited obnoxious Kiran Bedi for lunch after she had fined a PM's car, but Modi first suspendâ¦ https://t.co/7AxJiDJlYP— Ashok Swain (@ashoswai) 1555880761000Dr Anand Rai, Vyapam whistle-blower, shared the same photo with a similar claim. His tweet in Hindi closely translates to, "Indira Gandhi not only invited Kiran Bedi, the IPS officer who challaned her vehicle, to her residence to dine with her but also gave her an award. On the other hand, Modi suspended the IAS officer Mohsin who checked the PM's helicopter. This is the difference between Nehru government and RSS government." à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ à¤à¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤à¤§à¤¾à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤²à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤°à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¤° IPS à¤à¤¿à¤°à¤¨ à¤¬à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤¦à¤¿à¤°à¤¾ à¤¨à¥ à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¿à¤°à¥à¤« à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤à¤° à¤ªà¤° à¤¬à¥à¤²à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤­à¥à¤à¤¨â¦ https://t.co/vmSnILT0Ay— Dr.ANAND RAI (@anandrai177) 1555753484000The same narrative is being pushed as memes as well. For instance:

Header: FACT CHECK: Did PM Modi abuse while speaking at a rally in Gujarat’s Patan?
FACT CHECK: Did Yogi Adityanath make a casteist remark against Akhilesh Yadav?
Body: Some Twitter users and media houses have claimed that Uttar Pradesh (UP) chief minister (CM) Yogi Adityanath made casteist remarks against Samajwadi Party (SP) president Akhilesh Yadav. Independent journalist Prashant Kanojia, in a tweet made on Saturday, quoted Adityanath as saying âHad there been no Constitution in India, Akhilesh would have been pasturing buffaloes at some landowner (zamindar)â. Calling Adityanath a âroadside goonâ, Kanojia said that the UP CM âhates people from Bahujan communityâ and âpromotes atrocities against them.'' He also said that no journalist had the guts to call out Yogiâs casteist remark. Hindi news portal Amar Ujala too ran a story with a headline that closely translates to, âYogi launches an attack on Mahagathbandhan (grand alliance), says Akhilesh would have been feeding buffaloes for some Safai-based landowner.â

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo from Morocco’s Tangier shared as Uttarakhand’s Char Dham expressway
Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo of a road by the sea with a caption in Hindi that translates closely to, "This is the 'new' and 'wonderful' road for Uttarakhand's Char Dham trip. If Modi is there, then it's possible." Sample these: A Twitter user shared the same photo with the same claim. à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤à¤¡ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤§à¤¾à¤® à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤µà¤¾à¤²à¥ à¤®à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¤¾ à¤¨à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¦à¥à¤­à¥à¤¤ à¤¸à¥à¤µà¤°à¥à¤ª à¤¹à¥, à¤à¥ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥ à¤¨à¤°à¥à¤à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¤­à¤¿à¤¯à¤¾à¤¨ à¤¸à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¥à¤ à¤°à¤¹à¤¾â¦ https://t.co/2uqx9SC8QF— Chowkidar Victor Talukdar (@iVictorTalukdar) 155560344700

Header: FACT CHECK: Did BSE run a ticker that read ‘Don’t vote for Modi’?
Body: An image circulating on social media platforms shows the iconic Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) building in Mumbai with the stock ticker reading âDonât Vote for Modiâ. On Twitter BSE stock exchange is displaying don't vote for Modi.... Zoom pic... https://t.co/blKM4U5bWa— sun (@majoris2300) 1555693245000On Facebook  The text on a viral Facebook post, which has been shared more than 14,000 times, reads âNow even Mumbaiâs share market has asked not to vote for Modiâ.   The image was initially tweeted by comedian Kunal Kamra in a series of memes targeting PM Narendra Modi. These photos are as real as Modiji's promises... https://t.co/zEBOUxyLKJ— Kunal Kamra (@kunalkamra88) 1555220125000âThese photos are as real as Modijiâs promises,â the tweet resaid. Apart from the iconic Phiroze Jeejeebhoy Towers, the signature BSE building, the set of four photos shared by Kamra included one of the recently captured first-ever photo of the black hole, which was digitally-manipulated to look like it read, "Don't vote for Modi." Another meme Kamra shared had the historic image of a 1929 demonstration in Madras calling for a boycott of the Simon Commission digitally altered. The placards the demonstrators carried, with the slogan âSimon Go Backâ written on it, was now replaced with âDonât Vote for Modiâ.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did angry mob burn EVMs because every vote was going to BJP?
Body: A video and some pictures of a mob smashing and burning electronic voting machines (EVMs) is being shared with the claim that it happened during the first phase of the ongoing Lok Sabha polls. The video is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that the mob got furious because irrespective of the button chosen by the voters on EVMs, the vote was going to the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). âThe first phase of polling is taking place in India today. As per poll officials, if you press any button on the EVM, the vote goes to the BJP. People got angry over this and damaged the EVMâ reads a loose translation of one such post in Hindi. Another Facebook user sharing the video said âWhile burning the EVMs, mob said that democracy was being murdered at the hands of the Elections Commissionâ.   The post is archived here. The video was also shared on YouTube with similar claim. It should be noted that the location of the incident is unspecified by claimers.

Header: FAKE ALERT: These aren’t ‘fake fingers’ made to cast votes in Indian elections
Body: Many social media users on Facebook and Twitter are sharing a couple of photos showing prosthetic fingers with a claim that these were made to cast bogus votes when there are elections in the country. It is going viral now because the Lok Sabha elections are ongoing. Sample these: Fake fingers being made for casting votes, I donât know where we are going? https://t.co/smDFyiC4GW— TARUNKUMAR G.SINGHAL (@tarunsinghal_ca) 1555394683000Beware of fake fingers being manufactured for voting. https://t.co/dejv4jWbGm— Chowkidar Sachin Agrawal (@SachinA39043103) 1554812220000Times Fact Check also got the same set of images from a reader, along with a text card with a description written in Hindi. It closely translates to, âAttention officers! Try pulling the fingers and keep in mind that fake fingers are coming. New method to steal votes."

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of PM Modi dining with Pak PM Imran Khan is doctored
Body: A photo showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi dining with Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan is being widely shared on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp. In the photo, Modi is shown as wearing a green skull cap. Some are sharing the photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "The 'mualana' wearing green skull cap looks familiar". Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh not campaigning for the BJP
Body: A photo of Bollywood actors Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh, who got married last November, wearing saffron stoles with "Vote for BJP" and "Vote for BJP N Modi (sic)" written on it, is being widely shared on social media with captions that claim that the actors are campaigning for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). A Facebook page by the name of 'Anuj Saini BJP' posted the photo with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "Wearing saffron stoles, Ranveer and Deepika are seeking votes for the BJP." Here is the post: A Facebook user Raghavendra Shukla posted the same photo on his profile along with caption "Bharat Mata ki Jai" and his post was shared more than 3,600 times. The image is being widely shared on Twitter and WhatsApp as well with the same claim that the couple is campaigning for the BJP.

Header: FAKE: Viral photo of PM Modi touching Sonia Gandhi’s feet
Body: A photo going viral across social media platforms shows PM Narendra Modi touching former Congress president Sonia Gandhiâs feet. The texts accompanying this image range from being derisive of Modi to mocking him for âjumlasâ. One such caption is constructed so as to make it sound like Modi is begging Sonia to go easy on him. âPlease tell your son to not talk about Rs 72,000 and 22 lakh jobs otherwise I might have to go back to Gujarat where people donât buy my jumlas anymore,â reads a loose translation of one of the captions being shared with the photo. This is how it is being shared: On Whatsapp On Twitter à¤à¤ªà¤¨à¥ à¤¬à¥à¤à¥ à¤¸à¥ à¤à¤¹à¥ 72 à¤¹à¤à¤¾à¤° à¤à¤° 22 à¤²à¤¾à¤ à¤¨à¥à¤à¤°à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¨à¤¾ à¤¬à¥à¤²à¥ à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¤à¥ à¤®à¥à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤¹à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤à¥à¤à¤°à¤¾à¤¤ à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¤¾ à¤ªà¤¡à¤¼à¥à¤à¤¾ à¤µà¤¹à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥ à¤à¤¨â¦ https://t.co/WlEYnDVCwg— neha kumari chowkidar chor hai (@SheikhMdTajUdd1) 1554283997000On Facebook, it was shared on 'I support Punya Prasoon Bajpai' page.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Burqa-clad man tried to vote in Muzaffarnagar posing as a woman?
Body: A Facebook user by the name of 'Indresh Mishra Sonu' posted a collage of two photos showing a burqa-clad man being held by a few other men. Along with the collage, Sonu posted a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "In Muzaffarnagar, 'Saddam', wearing a burqa, went to vote as 'Shabnam'. Sanjeev Balyan, BJP contestant from the constituency, had alleged such "fake" voting there, now the photos have come out." Another Facebook user Tanmay Tiwari posted the same collage in a public group by the name of 'BJP: Mission 2019' with a similar caption. Tiwari's caption in Hindi closely translates to, "Sanjeev Balyan had raised the right issue in Muzaffarnagar. burqa is facilitating 'vote Jihad'. Proper identification of women wearing burqa should be mandatory in polling booths. Those who wish for '72 virgins' maybe going [to the polling booths] wearing burqa, posing as 'virgins'. Such 'virgins trapped in burqa' were caught in many places." Twitter user @LalitChauhan259 tweeted the same collage with exactly the same caption Tiwari used. Sonu's post made an hour ago has been shared 240 times, Tiwari's post made two hours ago has been shared over 1,100 times and Chauhan's tweet has been retweeted 56 times already. These posts come the same day Sanjeev Balyan, BJP lawmaker from Muzaffarnagar, alleged "fake" voting in his town. Balyan told reporters today that he will demand a re-poll if "Faces of women in burqa are not being checked". "There were no women constables. If there is such a long queue of women voters and there is no woman official in the polling party, then male officials should check," he said. However, Uttar Pradesh Chief Electoral Officer L Venkateshwarlu told PTI today that district magistrates have deployed women officials to ascertain the identity of female voters and that women poll officials are posted to ascertain their identity wherever there are burqa-clad women voters.

Header: FACT CHECK: Who secured the 53rd rank in UPSC exam 2018?
Body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) announced the final results for the Civil Services Examination 2018 on April 5, 2019 on its official website. Since then, other than news reports on the toppers, one particular news has been carried by many media outlets and that is of the person who secured the 53rd rank. Many news outlets, including news agency IANS, reported that Sumit Kumar Vishwakarma, the person who secured the 53rd rank in the UPSC 2018 exam, is a mason. Most of these reports came with photographs of Vishwakarma. Out of the many, one clicked while he was laying bricks went viral. The IANS report said that this photo was viral in Madhya Pradesh along with a message in Hindi that closely translates to, "From mason to Collector!" A prominent media outlet had a video interview of Vishwakarma. The video stands deleted now. The reports on Vishwakarma, the mason who worked hard during the day and studied for the Civil Services Examination during the night, carried by most digital media outlets, have now been taken down.

Header: Fact Check: Did Shabana Azmi refuse to own up to her remarks on Durga Ashtami?
Body: A quote in Hindi attributed to veteran actress Shabana Azmi has been doing the rounds on social media. It quotes Azmi as saying, âThis Navratri, I pray to Allah that Lakshmi doesnât have to beg for money, Durga doesnât get aborted, Parvati doesnât have to pay dowry, Saraswati doesnât end up being an illiterate without schooling and Kali doesnât need âFair and Lovelyâ cream. Insha Allah.â The quote is being shared in a graphic card with Azmiâs photo juxtaposed next to it. The last line of the graphic card reads âWill Azmi ever speak against practices of Triple Talaq, Polygamy, compulsory Burqa, Nikah-Halala and population explosion?â Azmi, however, denied having ever made such a remark. She tweeted, âI have never said this. It is disgusting what trolls will stoop to polarize and communalize an already charged atmosphere. I work for all women irrespective of their religion.â I have NEVER said this . It is DISGUSTING what trolls will stoop to polarise and communalise an already charged atmâ¦ https://t.co/olMoLgGHy7— Azmi Shabana (@AzmiShabana) 155478717500

Header: Fact Check: Did crowd chant ‘Modi-Modi’ when asked to say ‘Rahul Gandhi Zindabad’ in Congress rally?
Body: Some users on social media are claiming that in a Congress rally, people raised pro-Modi slogans. These claims are accompanied with a now viral 41-second long clip, in which Gujarat Congress leader Alpesh Thakor can be seen urging the crowd in a rally to say âZindabadâ after he says âRahul Gandhiâ. However, when he says Rahul Gandhi, the crowd shouts back âModi-Modiâ. IN RAHUL GANDHI'S RALLY , THE CONGRESS ORGANISER REQUESTS THAT WHEN HE WILL SHOUT RAHUL.GANDHI ..CROWD SHOULD SHOâ¦ https://t.co/OEozAfaDXv— Visheshar Jaspal (@VishesharJaspal) 1553792797000In the same clip, as crowd allegedly raises Modi chants, the camera pans on to the Congress president who facepalms for a moment. The second half of the video shows Thakor intimidating the crowd into silence as if to stop people from raising pro-Modi slogans.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, your vehicle won't explode if fuel tank is full in summer
Body: An image of an advisory attributed to Indian Oil, warning people about possible explosion in fuel tanks of vehicles on filling fuel to the brim in summer, is being widely shared on WhatsApp. The photo is of an advisory with Indian Oil's branding and text in Hindi. The content warns people about possible vehicle explosion in case they choose to fill the fuel tanks to the maximum possible limit in summer and directs them to open the fuel tank once during the day to 'let the gas escape'. Here is the photo:The rumour that fuel inside a vehicle's fuel tank will self-ignite and explode has been doing the rounds on the internet for years now.

Header: FAKE ALERT: 2018 video of EVMs in a bus shared as recent to claim BJP rigging elections
Body: A video going viral on WhatsApp shows a school bus which has many Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) inside it. Several people who are shouting what translates to âMurder of democracyâ could be seen in the video. This video is being used to claim that PM Modi and BJP president Amit Shah have colluded with the Election Commision of India (ECI) to rig the upcoming Lok Sabha elections and that is why the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is so confident of winning. The message in Hindi that is being shared with video closely translates to: âA school bus with no number plates and three Bolero jeeps carrying EVMs were caught transferring the machines to strong rooms at Madhya Pradeshâs (MP) Bina Bazar. None from the concerned authorities are able to explain what is happening. Probably, that is why Modi-Shah are so confident of forming the government again.â âFriends share this video as much as you can so that the voters are made aware of Modiâs reality, and we can save our democracy,â the message makes an appeal. In the 3-minute-long video that is being shared, one can see people using mobile cameras to capture what was going on at the scene. One can also hear a man scream âThe minister is murdering our democracyâ, while others around him wonder why so many EVMs are inside the bus. This is the video being shared:

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, judge who acquitted Aseemanand has not joined the BJP
Body: A Facebook page by the name of 'Mangalore Voice' made a post yesterday with a caption that said, "Meet the NIA judge Ravindra Reddy joining BJP who acquitted RSS leader - Swamy Aseemanand in Mecca Majid bomb blast (sic)," along with a photo in which Amit Shah could be seen with former Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh and two others. The post is still intact. Here is the post: Saurav Datta, a journalist as per his Twitter bio, shared a screengrab of the post by the 'Mangalore Voice' page from his Facebook and Twitter handles saying, "Ravindra Reddy, the judge who acquitted Aseemanand in the Mecca Masjid blasts case, joins the BJP." Many prominent journalists quote-tweeted Datta's tweet saying the news is 'shocking if true.' Senior lawyer Sanjay Hegde tweeted the same screengrab along with a poem by Faiz Ahmad Faiz, and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MP Sanjay Singh quote-tweeted Hegde's tweet saying what closely translates to, "Isn't this making a mockery of our justice system? The judge who acquitted Aseemanand joins the BJP."

Body: Many social media users are sharing a photo of cricketer Chris Gayle with a claim that he has reached India to campaign for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) ahead of the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Sample these:A similar claim was made last year in April, that Chris Gayle has joined the BJP. This claim was made using several digitally-manipulated photos of the cricketer before the Karnataka Assembly elections. For instance: The posts claiming that Chris Gayle, by then called Krishna Goyal as a joke, joined BJP were shared as a meme initially, but social media users starting sharing it as authentic news soon after. Header: FACT CHECK: Did Mukesh Ambani ‘use’ armed forces in his son Akash’s wedding?
Body: Some posts going viral on social media claim that business tycoon Mukesh Ambani and wife Nita employed armed forces for security at the wedding ceremony of their son Akash and daughter-in-law Shloka Mehta. The claim is being made based on a photo where Nita can be seen in the same frame as several officers in uniform. The post holds RSS-BJP combine responsible for this. The text written on the graphic card that is being shared widely reads: âCongratulations India! India is now officially a banana republic. Our armed forces are used in Mukesh Ambaniâs sonâs marriage.In 5 years of BJP/RSS rule, this is where we have come. Shame!â   One of the posts making this claim also reads: âOur Armed Forces are used in private ceremony of a rich man. India has become a joke and world will laugh at us!â   Not just on Facebook, similar insinuations were made on Twitter as well. Arey! Chalo Bhai We need a desperate change of Government. Header: FAKE ALERT: People posing as officials from 'Department of Home Affairs' looting homes?
Body: A message that is doing the rounds on WhatsApp and social media platforms like Facebook warns people about a group of people, posing as officials from the 'Department of Home Affairs' looting homes. The message that is being shared widely on WhatsApp now claims that the impostors have documents with the letterhead of the âDepartment of Home Affairsâ, and that they pretend to be officials from the Department visiting to confirm that people have valid ID cards ahead of upcoming Lok Sabha elections. Here is the message:âSecurity Alert: Be warned, there is a group going to homes and pretending to be officials from home affairs. They have documents with the letterhead Department of Home Affairs and claim to be confirming that everyone has a valid ID for the upcoming elections. They are robbing homes. Take note there is no initiative like that from the government. Send this on your neighborhood group chat. They are everywhere and they look presentable.â It is interesting to note that while some Facebook users from India posted this message in November, 2018, a Facebook user from United Kingdom's Birmingham (as per the bio) posted the same message just 22 hours ago.

Header: Fact Check: AK Antony splurged Rs 28 crore of government’s money to buy wife’s paintings?
Body: A WhatsApp forward doing the rounds claims that former defence minister under UPA tenure -- AK Antony -- used Rs 28 crore of governmentâs money to buy his wife Elizabethâs paintings. The message claims that he used the painting to adorn his office walls. The WhatsApp message is being shared along with a photo of Elizabeth, posing in front of a painting. âThis painting costs only Rs 28 crore. Former defence minister AK Antony, during his tenure, bought this using the governmentâs money. Now it is important to know that the artist who spent her entire life to make this amazingly matchless and magical painting is none other than Elizabeth Antony, wife of AK Antony,â the message, with a tint of sarcasm says. âThis shameless minister did not have money to buy weapons for our military but had the audacity to swindle Rs 28 crore of government money on a painting made in his own house that he then used to hang in his office. And then foolish people call Modi âChorâ,â reads a loose translation of the message originally in Hindi. On other social media platforms like Twitter, we found more such claims from 2018. Header: FAKE ALERT: Manufactured tweet from Tej Pratap Yadav's verified Twitter handle
Body: A Facebook user âKundan Rajâ shared a post saying what translates to, âThis is Tej Pratapâs painâ, along with an image that is made to look as if itâs a screenshot of a tweet made from former Bihar minister and Lalu Prasad Yadavâs elder son Tej Pratap Yadavâs official, verified Twitter account. The content of the tweet Raj posted was in Hindi. It closely translates to, âI appeal to the people of Chhapra not to vote for my father-in-law Chandrika Rai. His daughter calls me 'impotent' and she left me. This was Chandrika Rai's conspiracy to get a ticket. Aishwarya and my brother Tejashwi also work hand-in-glove. They are getting married post elections. They're conspiring to send me to a mental asylum." Here is the post: Here are two other Facebook posts with the same image:

Header: Facebook post with US-based Imam's photo claims Congress member said 'Muslims will rule India'
Body: A Facebook post with the photo of a US-based Imam, made to look as if the communication came from the Congress party, claims that the person in the photo is associated with the Party and that he said that India will be ruled by Muslims. Facebook user 'Deepak Sharma' made the post on March 17 without any caption. The image he posted, however, had three elements - photo of a person who looks like a Muslim cleric, text written in Hindi and the Congress party's logo. Here's a close translation of the text: "Hindus stay in their limits. We will crush them if they show too much 'Hindugiri'. Now, we are in power in Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh, not Modi. India will be ruled by Muslims - Muslim organisation, Congress". Here is the Facebook post:

Header: Fact Check: Were ‘Modi-Modi’ chants raised at Rahul’s rally?
Body: A video posted on Facebook page âWe Support Narendra Modiâ shows pro-Modi slogans being raised at a rally addressed by Congress President Rahul Gandhi. The video is shared with a caption âModi-Modi chants at Rahulâs Ujjain rally. So enjoyable!â. The text on the 12-second long video reads âEven in Rahulâs rally, one can hear Modiâs nameâ. The video shows âModi-Modiâ chants followed by Gandhi requesting crowd to let him speak. The post has received more than 11 thousand shares so far. Many other Facebook users shared the same post on their timeline.

Body: The verified Twitter handle of the Congress Party tweeted a photo showing a truck that carries a board with a message written in Hindi, that closely translates to, "Please do not honk, Modi government is sleeping". The tweet said, "If you're awake this ones for you, sadly Modi won't be reading this (sic)," and used #WorldSleepDay. If youâre awake this ones for you, sadly Modi wonât be reading this. #WorldSleepDay https://t.co/qJqwsrJ2ns— Congress (@INCIndia) 155264641800

Header: Fact Check: Do paracetamol tablets contain ‘machupo’ virus?
Body: A viral message on WhatsApp advises readers against consuming paracetamol tablets with âP-500â written on them. The message claims that the tablets contain a deadly virus named âMachupoâ, which gets transmitted to the person consuming the pill. The Englsh version of the message reads: âBe careful not to take the paracetamol that comes written P/500. It is a new, very white and shiny paracetamol, doctors prove to contain âMachupoâ virus, considered one of the most dangerous viruses in the world. And with high mortality rate. Please share this message, for all people and family â(sic)â. The message is being shared with photos of a woman and a man, both of whom have red rashes on their backs. The message is also being shared in Hindi with similar claims. There are also tweets and Facebook posts warning people against using this over-the-counter painkiller. Stay away from this paracetamol below. Quickly pass this information to save life https://t.co/jmlaF1onr4— OLAWOYIN Edris Busayo,anipr (@Olawoyin4u) 148830784600

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old wreckage from Arizona being shared as Indian spy drone shot down by Pakistan
Body: Tariq Naqash, a Pakistani Journalist affiliated to media house Dawn, shared an image of a drone wreckage on Twitter. He claimed it to be an Indian spy drone shot down by Pakistan Army. Quoting locals, the Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) based journalist claimed that the incident happened in Kot Kotehra village along the Line of Control in Khuiratta sector of âAzad Kashmirâsâ Kotli district. Soon the image, along with the text, was lifted by several pro-Pakistan Twitter handles and was shared widely. Another Indian spy drone downed by #Pakistan army in Kot Kotehra village of the Khoiratta sector in Kotli districtâ¦ https://t.co/0EBrunCEHd— Jalaluddin Mughal (@Jalalmughal) 1552290511000Another #Indian spy drone downed by #PakistanARMY in Kot Kotehra village of the Khoiratta sector in Kotli districtâ¦ https://t.co/4Nvit6pmEW— M Jawad Shahid (@PAK_MJS) 1552293913000It also found its way on to Facebook.   However, Naqash deleted his tweet with the image of the drone wreckage and made another tweet saying he âRealised a wrong picture got attachedâ, and that he stands by the content of his tweet.

Header: FAKE ALERT: This video was NOT shot inside crashed Ethiopian Airlines plane
Body: A video showing passengers inside an aircraft is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim that it is one shot inside the Ethiopian Airlines flight that crashed on Sunday, March 10, in Addis Ababa, killing all 157 aboard. Facebook page 'Nyamilepedia' shared the 1.02-minute video on March 11, a day after the crash, saying, "Exclusive heart-breaking video showing last minutes of Ethiopian airliner before crash". The video has been viewed over 5,07,000 times. Here is the post:The same video is being shared on WhatsApp along with a message that reads, âEthiopian airlines staff sent video to relatives before the crash RIPâ. Watch the video here:

Header: FAKE: Manufactured tweet made to look as if it’s from TOI verified account claims HUL faced Rs 10 crore loss
Body: A Facebook page called âThe Right Directionâ made a post saying, âOnly 10 crores? Let's make it 100 crores! Boycott Surf Excel! Boycott Hindustan Unilever Limited!â along with an image of a tweet made to look as if it was made the official, verified Twitter account of Times of India. This fake tweet has been doing the rounds on social media platforms and WhatsApp. The manufactured tweet said, âAs a result of massive boycott by the hurt Hindu community because of a Hindu shaming derogatory ad by Surf Excel, the company has already faced loss amounting close to Rs 10 crores which is expected to rise further (sic).â Here is the post:The tweet comes at a time Surf Excel, a detergent brand, and its parent company Hindustan Unilevel Limited (HUL), are facing backlash on social media after many social media users called for a boycott of the product and the company saying a new advert of Surf Excel hurt religious sentiments of the Hindu community, even as many others defended it.

Fact Check: Did these Muslim women celebrate Mahashivratri?
Body: Several Facebook posts going viral on the social media platform claim that Muslim women in Indore carried Kanwar (holy water) on the occasion of Mahashivratri. The images accompanying these posts show a number of burqa-clad women lifting earthen pots.   The text of the post (originally in Hindi) when translated to English reads, âIn Indore, during the festival of Mahashivratri, Muslim sisters and mothers lifted Kanwar wearing burqa. They wrote âOm Namah Shivayâ to celebrate the occasion.â The same claim with more or less similar text and images is being shared widely on Facebook by different users.

Header: Fake Alert: No, Kuwait man did not sing a song about Ram Mandir construction
Body: A Facebook post going viral after being posted to a group named âEk Kadam Hindu Rashtra ki Aurâ claims that during External Affairs minister Sushma Swarajâs visit to Kuwait, a Sheikh named Mubarak Al-Rashed surprised everyone by rendering a song about Ram Mandir construction. The post that comes with a caption saying âListen in to the sweet voice of this Sheikhâ, has a video where Rashed is singing a song while Swaraj could be seen cheering and appreciating the man. The opening stanza of the song Rashed appears to sing goes âJo Ram ka nahin, mere kaam ka nahin. Bolo Ram Mandir kab banegaâ¦,â which loosely translates to âThe one who cannot be of Lord Rama is useless to me. Tell me when will the Ram Mandir get built!â Watch it here. The post has been shared over 20,000 times already. Itâs still being shared.

Header: FAKE: Wing Commander Abhinandan features in Pakistani tea advert
Body: The video of a Pakistani tea brand television commercial, that seems to be featuring Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman, is being widely shared across social media platforms and WhatsApp. Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman was captured and detained for two days by the Pakistani Army after a dogfight between the Indian Air Force and the Pakistan Air Force. Abhinandan returned to India on March 1. The video that appears to be a brand commercial of Tapal tea, that is based in Pakistan's Karachi, shows Abhinandan sipping tea and saying, "The tea is fantastic, thank you," in the end. Many Twitter users have been sharing the video. Sample these: Tapal Tea is a tea brand based in Karachi, Pakistan. Header: FACT CHECK: Did Arvind Kejriwal offer WC Abhinandan a Lok Sabha ticket?
Body: Many Facebook users are sharing an image of a tweet that makes it look as if it was made from Delhi chief minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal's verified Twitter account. The content in the image of the tweet reads, "If Wing Commander Abhinandan takes VRS from services we are ready to offer him Lok Sabha Ticker from any constituency he wishes to contest from (sic)". Sample these

Header: Fake Twitter handle peddles misinformation on casualties of Indian forces in J&K's Rajouri
Body: A Twitter user â@Dr_Rajiv288â, who posed as the Medical Superintendent (MS) of the Government District Hospital in Jammu and Kashmirâs Rajouri district, tweeted about casualties of Indian armed forces on March 2, 2019. One of the tweets from the fake handle -- which now stands suspended -- said, "Updat from District Hospital Rajori. So far we have received 8 bodies of soldiers including 1 Captain & 32 injured who belongs to military & para military forces (sic)." The tweet had the handle of Farhan Jeffery, Deputy Director & Head of South Asia Desk (Pakistan) of Islamic Theology of Counter Terrorism (ITCT), a counter terrorism think tank, tagged in it. Subsequent tweets from the account said, "We are not allowed to share the accurate details of dead bodies," and that "Media is not allowed to enter in the hospital (sic)". Soon enough, Pakistani Twitter handles started quoting the (mis)information shared from the fake Twitter handle and Pakistani media used it in its reports too. Header: FAKE ALERT: Video from Sri Lankan university shared with claims that it's from India
Body: A video showing some men throwing buckets of water on burkha-clad women is being shared by many Twitter users with a claim that the incident if from India. While some of those who are sharing the video intend to create a false narrative that Muslim women are not safe in India, especially in Delhi, others are trying to hint that this incident occurred after Wing Commander Abhinandan was arrested and detained by the Pakistani Army. Zaid Hamid, "veteran of Soviet-Afghan war" as per his Twitter bio, who has over 2,24,000 followers on Twitter, shared the video saying, "This is a normal day in India". The video he tweeted got more than 1,33,000 views. An archived version of his tweet is here. Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Wing Commander Abhinandan's sister did not write this viral poem
Body: A poem about Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman, who will return to India any minute today after being detained in Pakistan for two days, has gone viral on social media platforms and WhatsApp. While some users have credited the poem to its real author, many social media users are posting the poem crediting it to one "Adhiti", apparently Abhinandan's sister. Times Fact Check got the poem first on WhatsApp, along with a Hindi translation. The poem titled "My Brother With a Bloodied Nose" was shared saying, "A Poem written by Adhiti- Abhinandanâs sister".

Header: FAKE ALERT: Woman in viral video is not Wing Commander Abhinandan's wife
Body: A video showing a woman, who introduces herself as an Indian Army officer's wife, requesting fellow Indians and politicians not to politicise the sacrifice of soldiers, is going viral with a claim that she is Wing Commander Abhinandan's wife. The video is being shared widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp with the claim. The video has gone viral at a time when the nation is rejoicing the news that Abhinandan is returning to India today. In the video, the woman is saying: "Hello everyone. I am wife of an army officer. On behalf of all the families of all the armed forces, I request my fellow Indians, especially the political leaders, the political leaders... not to politicise the sacrifice of our soldiers. It takes so much to be a soldier. And just imagine the kind of tension, the kind of pain, the family of Abhinandan is going through right now. So please, till the time the tension is eased at Indo-Pak border, stop your political rallies and donât you dare, I am repeating again, donât you dare to snatch away the credit of our soldiers. Please, please stop counting your tickets and stop doing your politics here. You have enough times to play your politics but not at this time and not at the cost of our soldiers' sacrifice. It is my humble request to all political leaders, especially the BJP political leaders.â Dinesh Singta, who "works at" the National Students' Union of India (NSUI), the student wing of of the Congress Party, as per his Facebook bio, shared the video yesterday with a caption that closely translates to, "Wing Commander Abhinandan ji's wife's message that the BJP shouldn't politicise soldiers' sacrifice." You can find an archived version of the post here. The video he posted has gotten more than 2,39,000 views and was shared over 14,000 times since yesterday. The verified Twitter account of Yuva Desh, Indian Youth Congress' online magazine, tweeted the same video, but this one with a yellow bar with text saying, "Humble request to BJP don't count your seats at the cost of soldiers sacrifice (sic)." Header: FACT CHECK: Did these female pilots carry out IAF air strike in Pakistan's Balakot?
Body: Photos of two different female pilots are being circulated widely on social media platforms and WhatsApp with claims that these women are behind the Indian Air Force air strike on one of the biggest terror camps of terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed on February 26. A Facebook user named Venkatachary Ananthachary posted the photo of a female pilot to a Facebook page that goes by the name of "Dr Sambit Patra Fans Club" saying what closely translates to, "The only female pilot who took part in today's surgical strike. Jai Hind! Proud of the nation's daughter." This particular post, on February 26, was shared more than 3,200 times. A lot of other users made the same claim with the same image. Meanwhile, on WhatsApp, photo of another female pilot was being heavily circulated. The message along with the photo read, "Proud to inform you that the pilot of today's air strike is a girl Urvisha Jariwala from Bhulka Bhavan school of Surat".

Header: FACT CHECK: Viral WhatsApp message about 'Army Welfare Fund' is NOT a hoax
Body: A long message informing people about a dedicated bank account created by the Indian Army to accept donation for the families of Battle Casualties is being widely shared on WhatsApp. In this era of fake news, many readers raised doubts about the authenticity of this particular message. Times Fact Check has found the truth. Here's what the message says: "Pay only Rs 1/- (Rupee one only). Like never before, the Modi government has started a new scheme exclusively for the Indian Army Battle Casualties and Weapon Purchase. The government has opened a bank account where people can donate funds directly to the Army Welfare Account which will be used for purchasing weapons for the Indian Army and providing facilities for war casualties. People had suggested to the government to open a bank account to collect funds exclusively for battle casualties and purchasing weapons for the army, the Modi government has accepted the suggestion and opened an account in Syndicate Bank, New Delhi for the same. The most attractive feature of this scheme is that people can donate the smallest amount of one rupee. Master Stroke by the Modi government. Our countryâs population is 130 crore, even if 100 crore people (70%) deposit one rupee each, the ministry will get Rs 100 crore/day, Rs 3000 crore/month and Rs 36000 crore/year. Rs 36,000 Crore is greater than Pakistanâs total defence expenditure. We spend hundreds and thousands of rupees on many unnecessary things, if we can spend one rupee for the Army, it can surely make India a super power. The money will directly reach the Defence Ministry for the Army's benefit and war casualties. This is a unique idea to help our Army jawans who have lost their life in battle fields. Come together, show solidarity with our defence forces, para military forces, and CRPF. Join the mission to make India a super power. Bank Details : BANK : SYNDICATE BANK BRANCH : SOUTH EXTENSION, NEW DELHI. A/C NAME : ARMY WELFARE FUND BATTLE CASUALTIESA/C NO : 90552010165915 IFSC CODE : SYNB0009055 Please circulate as much as you can."

Header: Images of destruction caused by earthquake in Balakot shared as IAF air strike impact
Body: In the early hours of February 26, Indian Air Force jets struck one of the biggest terror camps of terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed in a "non-military", "pre-emptive" strike in Pakistan's Balakot. Since then, Pakistani media and social media users have been spreading misinformation and fake news, trying to pass off old photos and videos as recent ones. However, misinformation about IAF air strike in Balakot is being spread on WhatsApp groups in India and by many social media users and pages as well. A set of images, some showing massive destruction to infrastructure and some showing dead bodies, are being widely shared on WhatsApp along with messages that claim that these images show the impact of the IAF air strike. One of the messages that is being shared along with these photos read, "Yesterday's Balakot ops by India". Sample this: The same set of images are being shared on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter as well.

Body: A video showing a lot of people being shot down and buildings being destroyed by missiles by a fighter plane is being heavily shared on WhatsApp. The message along with the video says, "More than 300 terrorist killed by Indian Air Force. Jai Hind!" Here is the video:   In the early hours of February 26, the Indian Air Force (IAF) jets targeted one of the biggest terror camps of Jaish-e-Mohammed in a "non-military", "pre-emptive" air strike in Pakistan's Balakot, the government said.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistan Army DID NOT mistakenly shoot down its own aircraft
Body: A Facebook page called âModiNamaâ, which has over 22,79,000 followers made a post yesterday, on February 22, with a caption in Hindi basically saying what closely translates to, "Out of fear, the Pakistani Army shot down its own aircraft thinking it's an Indian Army aircraft. At this point of time, the fear in Pakistanis is so much that they (Pakistani Army) shot down their own fighter plane thinking it's of India." The page used an image of what looks like a news report, highlighting the headline that said, "Out of fear, Pakistan army mistakenly shoots down its own aircraft." This post has been shared more than 2,000 times, and 3,000 users have liked it. The text in the image posted by the page reads, "After the Pulwama terror attack, Pakistan is constantly living in the fear of Indiaâs revenge. The country is under a tremendous panic mode and that is evident from its actions. Imran Khan claims that heâs ready for war and that Pakistan shall retaliate in case India attacks them, which clearly shows that both Imran Khan and the Pakistan Army is a spending sleepless nights. However, the fact that Pakistan is panicking got further established when the Pakistan Army shot down an aircraft, which was its own." The same image is being shared on Twitter as well. Header: Congress, BJP trade charges on PM Modi shooting for film at Corbett 3 hours after Pulwama attack
FACT CHECK: Photo showing PM Modi with Islamic flag is fake
Body: A photo showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi holding an Islamic flag is being shared widely on social media platforms, especially Facebook. A Facebook page that goes by the name "Bhashan Ya Rashan" shared a photo of PM Modi in which he could be seen standing with an Islamic flag, a green flag with a crescent moon and a star. The text written above the image in Hindi closely translates to, "He has come to show his true colours. Bhakts, go somewhere and die." The post which is still intact has been shared over 1,400 times by now.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Imam Tawhidi being shared as Saudi crown prince talking about Kashmir
Body: Many social media users are sharing a 1.03-minute video of Imam Tawhidi saying that Kashmir is 'Hindu land' with titles and captions that claim that the video is of Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman talking about Kashmir. If you search Facebook and Twitter with keywords, "Opinion of Saudi prince on Kashmir", you can see that a lot of Facebook users, pages and Twitter users have tweeted the same video with the same title. For instance: While most of the users and pages have used the caption or video title that said, "Opinion of Saudi prince in Kashmir issue, see how beautifully he expressed his opinion," some users went a step ahead and made the caption / title, "Here you listen to this brilliant opinion of the honourable Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman on the Kashmir issue - see how beautifully and logically he expressed his opinion." The same video is being shared on Twitter too, with similar captions. Header: After Pulwama terror attack, Indian Army now subjected to fake news
FAKE ALERT: AAP shares post saying martyred CRPF jawans' families won't get pension
Body: A post made by the verified Facebook page of the Aam Aadmi Party said that families of 75% of the CRPF jawans martyred in the deadly Pulwama terror attack of February 14 will not be eligible for pension. The graphic card AAP posted had a photo of some policemen carrying a coffin and some text. The text, written in Hindi, closely translates to, "Do you know that families of more than 75% of the CRPF jawans martyred in the Pulwama terror attack will not be eligible for pension because they joined the force after 2004?" The card also carries a post script requesting people not to see the post as one made to politicise the issue. Similar messages are being circulated widely on WhatsApp and social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Yogi Adityanath laugh in front of martyr’s coffin?
Body: A video being shared on social media shows Uttar Pradesh (UP) Chief Minister (CM) Yogi Adityanath and his ministers laughing heartily in front of a coffin wrapped in Tricolour. The coffin is being claimed as that of a martyred Indian soldier. âPseudo-nationalists paying tributes to a martyred jawan wrapped in Indian flag,â reads the title of the video shared by a Facebook page named âRahul Gandhi for PMâ.   Many other individual social media accounts are sharing the same video with similar captions.

Header: FACT CHECK: Has WhatsApp warned users of ISIS misusing their profile photos?
Body: A message being circulated on WhatsApp asks users to change their display pictures (DP) as ISIS intends to misuse it for terror activities. The message is signed off by one AK Mittal, designated as Commissioner of Delhi and an IPS officer. A mobile number is also shared, apparently of Mittal. The message warns users of ISIS terrorists and some hackers having access to their numbers, who would make use of their profile photos for nefarious activities. The message also claims that WhatsApp CEO has urged everyone to remove personal images for the next 20-25 days. âWhatsApp engineers are trying their best to keep your app safe,â the message quotes WhatsApp CEO as saying. The Hindi version of the message implores users to share the message among their contacts, especially women.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, these are not videos of Kashmiri people being beaten up
Body: ONESome social media users are sharing random videos claiming it shows Kashmiri people being beaten up. One such claim was made by Twitter user @rimsha_mengal. The user tweeted a video saying, "In Video: People of Kashmir / Muslims being badly beaten by Hindus in Chandigarh, India. Properties have been destroyed. After yesterday's attack on Indian military, Muslims in India are not safe." TRUTHThe video the Twitter user shared is of a brawl at a five-start hotel in Delhi's Janakpuri during a wedding. This video had gone viral last week and had made headlines. We found a news report on TOI about the incident which also carried the same video. The report said that the incident happened after an alleged argument broke out over serving of stale food during the wedding function on Saturday, February 9. WATCH THE VIDEO HERE:  CLAIM TWOMany social media users are sharing a video with a caption written in Hindi that closely translates to, "This man was firing at soldiers. See what happened." For instance: The caption doesn't have any direct reference to the deadly Pulwama attack on February 14 or Kashmiri people being harassed, but the comments below this video suggests that people are linking these incidents to the video. The vague caption is misleading. Some users are making minor edits to the caption to make it appear as if it's a video of Indian Army soldiers. The video is being shared by many users and pages: TRUTHA reverse-image search on the thumbnail of the links we get in the search result above led us to a Facebook page called "Policiales" that had uploaded the same video five months ago and garnered more than 20 million views. The post has been shared more than a lakh times. From the comments, we could gather that this was some sort of demonstration, but we couldn't authenticate where the video is originally from. The quality of the video is not great but we can make out that the men seen in the video have Asian features and the language is foreign. The video ends with a slide containing two words - "Terima Kasih". We did a search on this and figured that it means "Thank you" in Indonesian. It is clear that the video has nothing to do with the Indian Army. CLAIM THREEA video showing a truck driver, bleeding profusely, is being shared with a claim that the driver is a Kashmiri man and that he was thrashed by locals in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur post the Pulwama terror attack. The caption of the video that is being shared reads, "Udhampor update. Kashmiri driver beaten by doogri (sic)." In some other posts, the caption said that the driver was beaten up by Dogras. The video is being shared widely since February 16, two days after the deadly terror attack in Pulwama district that killed at least 40 CRPF jawans.

Fact Check: Did Rahul Gandhi use his mobile phone during the mourning of Pulwama martyrs?
Body: Several social media users, including the BJP MP and Bollywood actor Paresh Rawal, claimed that Congress President Rahul Gandhi used his mobile phone while paying tributes to mortal remains of CRPF martyrs at Delhi airport. Using a still image showing Gandhi looking into his mobile, Rawal claimed that Gandhi cannot even pay respects to the slain CRPF men properly. https://t.co/H8k4S4QNOh— Paresh Rawal (@SirPareshRawal) 1550249130000âOne one side the entire nation is shedding tears over the martyrdom of our brave soldiers, on the other side Rahul is busy using his mobile phone during the wreath-laying ceremonyâ read the text in the image that Rawal tweeted. Making a comparison video between PM Modi and Gandhi, Facebook page Bharat Positive claimed that the difference between both the leaders is crystal clear. One half of the video showed Gandhi using his mobile, the other half showed Modi paying respects to martyrs.   Several social media users responded to Rawalâs tweet and called it fake. Some of them used extremely derogatory and vile language to attack the BJP leader. We have omitted such tweets. Misleading! He stood there and paid tributes for more than 5 mins before walking. Even BJP supporters are sharing mâ¦ https://t.co/Rzbf1q2OiZ— Zoo Bear (@zoo_bear) 155025213300

Header: FAKE ALERT: Rahul Gandhi's photo with Pulwama suicide bomber
Body: A photo of Congress President Rahul Gandhi made to appear as if he is standing next to Adil Ahmad Dar, the 22-year-old terrorist who killed at least 38 CRPF jawans in a deadly IED blast yesterday, on February 14, in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district, is being shared widely on social media platforms. The caption written in Hindi, posted along with the digitally-manipulated photo, closely translates to, "The one who attacked Indian Army turns out to be Rahul Gandhi's close aide. Is Congress behind the attack?" Facebook user who goes by the name "Nidhi Pathania" posted a set of three photos to a public group named "I am with PM Modi and you?", out of which the first one is a photo of Gandhi, seen wearing a skull cap, made to look as if he is standing next to the Pulwama suicide bomber, the second one is a photo of Gandhi sitting next to former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah and the third one is a photo of Dar, the suicide bomber. This post has already been shared over 3,200 times. This is the fake photo:The same post was made by several users on Facebook.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of CRPF jawan shared saying he was martyred in Pulwama attack
Body: A photo of a CRPF jawan is being shared on social media platforms and WhatsApp along with a message claiming he is one of the 38 martyrs of the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district. At least 38 CRPF jawans were killed yesterday in what is considered the worst-ever terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir. Terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed claimed responsibility for the attack. The message that is being shared on WhatsApp reads, "Salute to Mijing Basumatary from Assam & all other bravehearts who lost their lives in the line of duty. Heartfelt condolences to the bereaved families & prayers for injured ones. This gruesome act of cowardice is strongly condemnable." We searched with keywords "Salute to Mijing Basumatary" on Facebook and Twitter to find that a lot of users have shared Basumatary's image along with messages saluting him for the ultimate sacrifice. Salute to brave hearts from #Assam Mijing Basumatary #PulwanaAttack . #RIP #PulwamaAttack https://t.co/vaEWnmxha0— Amit Badwaik(AB)ð®ð³ (@AmitBadwaikAB) 1550220165000Salute to brave hearts from #Assam Mijing Basumatary #PulwanaAttack . RIP https://t.co/yT14DMEkHY— Gati News (@gati_news) 155021268600

Header: Fact Check: Has China opened 880 km highway linking their country to Pakistan?
Body: A video going viral on social media claims that China has opened an 880 km-long highway which connects their country directly to Pakistan. Almost four minute long, the video shows an aerial view of a swanky elevated corridor, with several vehicles passing through it. The âhighwayâ passes through several terrains, right from mountains laden with snow to a river beneath it. The video has received close to two million views.

Header: Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev, Rajguru were not hanged on February 14
Body: Every year around February 14, the day celebrated across the world as the Valentine's Day, messages claiming that revolutionary freedom fighters Bhagat Singh, Sukhdev and Rajguru were hanged on this date in the year 1931 are circulated heavily. If the messages, that come along with graphic tiles carrying the images of these three revered freedom fighters, do not claim they were hanged on February 14, claim would be that the order of execution was issued on February 14, 1931. Sample these:Today 14th feb celebrated as Valentine â¤ day. We are celebrating this day with full excitement but the thing to knoâ¦ https://t.co/z4TDEhdHTL— Yogesh Gola (@Yogip9879) 1550121244000These messages are widely circulated on social media platforms and especially on WhatsApp with a plea to observe this day as "Black Day" rather than as Valentine's Day. A news report published in The Hindu on February 16, 2011 titled "Bhagat Singh page âvandalised' on Wikipedia" said, "The Wikipedia page on Bhagat Singh underwent many editing changes on February 13 and 14, Valentine's Day, and a Wikipedia administrator called it online âvandalism"." The report said the Wikipedia page on Bhagat Singh was changed more than 30 times and quoted a Wikipedia 'administrator' Philp Tinu Cherian as saying, "People kept on changing and reverting the date between February 14, 1931 and March 23 as the day Bhagat Singh's hanging," and "I wonder if it is a conspiracy to divert attention from Valentine's Day.â

Header: FAKE: Pakistani child artist projected as son of martyred Indian Army officer
Body: A video showing a young boy singing in front of a large crowd is being shared with the claim that the boyâs father was an Indian Army officer who died in an operation against militants. The post making this claim goes on to say that the boyâs mother died too, not able to take the shock of the news of her husbandâs death. The post said that the orphaned boy now studies in Army Public School. The post, while urging viewers to control their emotions, says that PM Modi was also present in the programme.   Many Facebook and Twitter users shared the same video with similar claims.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, 'Sanghi mob' did not lynch Muslim man in Assam's Karimganj
Body: A Facebook user who goes by the name "Nadeem Khan" posted a 25-second video that shows a bleeding man along with a caption that read, "One more lynching in Karimganj, Assam. Abdul Mateen lynched by 'Sanghi mob'," on January 20. This post was shared nearly 300 times. The same video was tweeted by some users too with the same claim. Sample these:

Header: Fact Check: Did Hardik Patel’s father blast him and praise Modi in this viral video?
Body: A video going viral on social media platforms shows a man lambasting Gujarat Patidar leader Hardik Patel and heaping praises on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Speaking in Gujarati, the man targets Congress leader Alpesh Thakor and Dalit leader Jignesh Mevani along with Patel. The video is being shared by many Facebook users as well.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Tweet from Priyanka Gandhi's impostor account goes viral
Body: A Twitter account that posed as that of Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra used "@priyankagaINC" as the Twitter handle and had "Priyanka Gandhi INC" as the account name. A tweet made from this handle in Hindi, that closely translates to, "India is a country of fools where the government will spend crores of rupees on "Shahi Snan" for fake people rather than spending on drinking water," is going viral on social media as a statement made by Gandhi. The Facebook post below, made by a user who goes by the name "Srinivas Pothraju", is just one example of how the tweet is question is being shared widely on social media platforms.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Kapil Sibal move UK court against Vijay Mallya's extradition?
Body: A Facebook page that goes by the name "NAMO" posted a graphic tile with a screenshot of an article published on what looks like a news website with an intent to make people believe that senior Congress leader and lawyer Kapil Sibal has moved a petition in a UK court to stop liquor baron Vijay Mallya's extradition. The headline of the article shared by "NAMO" Facebook page closely translates to, "Don't let Mallya come to India now, it will affect elections, says Kapil Sibal's petition in London court," and the content visible in the graphic tile explains how Mallya's extradition now has one more hurdle in the form of Sibal's petition at the London High Court. Here is the post:"NAMO" Facebook page has over 4.5 million followers and the post in question has been shared over 13,000 times. There's a seal on the tile that reads, "Vikram Sharma" and the same name is written once again within inverted commas at the end of the tile. This could possibly be the admin of the page. The same message is being spread on Twitter as well. For instance, Unreal News: Congress leader Kapil Sibal asks SC to intervene and postpone Extradition of #VijayMallya till 2019.â¦ https://t.co/iB4sYlMyFP— Manoj Goenka ð®ð³ (@iam_manojgoenka) 154937121800

Header: FACT CHECK: AAP’s Ankit Lal shares partial information to target Modi government on corruption
Body: Ankit Lal, social media strategist of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) shared incomplete information from the Central Vigilance Commission (CVC) report of 2017 to attack Modi-led NDA government on corruption. Lal tweeted a graphic card that said that as per the CVC report, corruption cases increased by a whopping 67% in the central government departments. He labeled Modi government âa complete failureâ as it fulfilled no promises.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did India declare holiday, host street parade during Philippines president’s visit?
Body: A number of Facebook posts doing rounds on social media claim that India declared a national holiday in honor of Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte who was visiting India. Addressing Duterte as âlegendâ, the posts use two photos to substantiate the claims. In the first photo, Duterte can be seen deboarding a black car at Rajpath, where Indian PM Narendra Modi could be seen waiting to welcome him. Huge crowd could be seen in the backdrop. The second photo is just an aerial view of Rajpath with live parade taking place, surrounded by a sea of viewers on both sides. Duterte is not seen in the photo. The postâs caption, when translated to English, reads: âPresident Rody Duterte is in India. Thereâs not just red carpet but also a street party in his welcome. India even declared holiday in his honour. Heâs a legend. Proud to be Filipino.â   One of the viral Facebook posts, which now stands deleted, can be seen in archived form here.

Header: FACT CHECK: Amitabh Bachchan says this image is photoshopped. Is it?
Body: A picture going viral on social media shows five kids enacting posing for a selfie, with one of them using slippers in place of a smartphone, pretending as if he clicking a photo. The photo was also shared by Atul Kasbekar, famous fashion photographer.
