In his argument, he pointed out how the kid's hand holding the slipper appears to be much larger than his other hand. Kasbekar, after consulting three post-production experts, claimed that the photo was not digitally manipulated. @SrBachchan Amit ji ðð½ Nice to hear from u Checked wt 3 post prod experts independently - Doo Creative, Hyd - Khuâ¦ https://t.co/5FxEk2G16Q— atul kasbekar (@atulkasbekar) 1549264233000"The hand with the chappal looking enlarged is a matter of perspective distortion standard on smartphones," he argued.

Body: Social media posts claiming that PM Modi renamed Train 18 as âVande Mataram Expressâ have been doing rounds for past few days. As per these posts, this renaming exercise was done to ensure 'traitors' of the nation are left with no choice but to say âVande Mataramâ. With this one move, 'Modi has incapacitated traitors', claim social media users. âAll hail PM Modi. Since traitors had issue with saying âVande Mataramâ, Modi change the name of Train 18 to âVande Mataram Expressâ. Now even fathers of traitors will be forced to say âVande Mataramâ reads loose translation of one such Facebook post in Hindi.   These posts have gone viral with more five thousand shares combined. Similar claims are being made on Twitter. Body: Hindu Mahasabha national secretary Puja Shakun Pandey on Wednesday shot at an effigy of Mahatma Gandhi with a toy gun to mark his death anniversary and celebrated the day as âShaurya Divasâ in Aligarh. And for those who donât know, this is a sister organisation of the BJP. https://t.co/t8ieWS9quG— Sameer Nagarajan (@sameern66) 1548888978000Few also blamed Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).

Header: FACT CHECK: Did PM Narendra Modi claim rapists are hanged within days?
Body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a gathering in Surat yesterday, on January 30. Answering a question asked by an audience member Modi spoke about how strict action is being taken against rapists. News agency ANI, in a tweet from its verified Twitter account, quoted Modi as saying, âThere used to be rapes in this country earlier too, it is a shame that we still hear about such cases. Now, culprits are hanged within 3 days, 7 days, 11 days & a month. Steps are being taken continuously to get daughters justice & results are evident (sic).â Soon, Twitter users started responding to the tweet saying how the prime minister is lying. Lawyer Karuna Nundy responded to the tweet saying that the prime minister cannot possibly know facts about this since the National Crime Records Bureau has not published any data post 2016, and saying,"Not a single culprit has been hanged within 3 days, 11 days or a month of his rape." @ANI The PM can't possibly know this, there has been no NCRB data since 2016. Aside from the fact that hanging doesâ¦ https://t.co/KL5Llg8PzZ— Karuna Nundy (@karunanundy) 1548870090000Nundy is right. The National Crime Records Bureau has not published "Crime In India" data post 2016 and not a single culprit, convicted for rape or other crimes, have been hanged in three, seven, 11 days or in a month in India. The only person executed in India since the Modi-led NDA government came to power is Yakub Memon and this was in 2015. In the last 13 years, only four people were hanged in India, and only one of them -- Dhananjoy Chatterjee -- was hanged for rape and murder. This was in 2004. BUT WHAT EXACTLY DID PM MODI SAY?Speaking at the New India Youth Conclave 2019 held in Surat, PM Modi said what closely translates to, "Rapes were committed in this country earlier too. This social evil is such that we still hear about such incidents. Head hangs in shame; it hurts. But today, death sentences in three days, in seven days, in eleven days, in a month! We are taking steps to ensure justice to those daughters. And the results are visible. It is this nation's bad luck that TV channels run news about rapes for seven days, but news about the death sentence pronounced is not given prominence." In Hindi, PM Modi said, "Faansi" and it translates to "Death sentence" in English in this context, and not to "Execution". Modi speaks about how TV channels give less prominence to news about death sentences pronounced in rape cases, and it is clear from this that he was indeed talking about death sentences pronounced and not about executions / hangings. News agency ANI made a mistake in translating Modi's speech in Hindi to English. Here's the full video of Modi's speech in Surat. He makes the comment in question starting 21.41 minutes. Euphoric New India Youth Conclave in Surat. Watch the interaction. https://t.co/m5PWVFLBVD— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 154885559800

Header: Fact Check: Were National Bravery Award-winning children excluded from Republic Day parade?
FAKE ALERT: Video showing kid being tortured not from Delhi Public School Kathua
Body: A video showing someone brutally thrashing a kid is being shared widely on WhatsApp groups. The message that is being shared along with the video claims that the incident happened at the Delhi Public School (DPS) in Jammu and Kashmirâs Kathua. Hereâs how the video is being circulated heavily on WhatsApp:Hereâs a close translation of the message that is being shared along with the video: âDo not miss sharing this video to even a single group you are a part of, send it to everyone. This video is from Valsad's DPS school; this is a teacher from Rajbagh, Kathua. Share it till both the teacher and the school come to an end. The video going viral will make a lot of difference. Those who do not feel pity, keep their mouths shut (typing).â In the message, it is being claimed that the video is from a Delhi Public School in Valsad. There is no DPS in Gujaratâs Valsad municipality. The next sentence says that the teacher is from Rajbagh, Kathua. There is a Delhi Public School in Kathua.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mock drill video of AP police shared as terror attack in Tirupati
Body: A video is being shared across social media platforms with claim that a terror attack was averted in Tirumala bypass road of Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh (AP). The video shows a white car coming to a screeching halt just as armed commandos surround it and begin shooting at it. Some social media users are sharing the video with following claims. âThis is power of Modi government in Tirupati Tirumala bypass road Terrorists are trying to enter but operation done with great success. 1 dead & 3 arrested (sic)â, read the description of a YouTube video. It has been viewed over 3,000 times. Hereâs another Youtube post with a similar claim - The same video is being shared on Facebook with slightly different claims. âThree terrorist caught alive today on Tirupati bye pass. NIA already had information about the attack. See the commandos in action,â read the text along with video.   The video was shared by many other Facebook users with similar claim.

Body: A Facebook user Shashikant Awate posted three photos to a public Facebook group by the name of "We Support Narendra Modi Ji" along with a caption in Hindi that closely translates to, "See, you blind followers, Make In India initiative's invention. Modi Ji's miracle is being sent to Australia. Rail coach. Namo again. My PM, my pride. This is the proof of my "pradhan sevak's" success." Here is the Facebook post: On searching Facebook with the content in Awate's post, we found that many other users are sharing the same images with exactly the same claims. Header: Fact Check: Were Hindus forced at gunpoint to attend Mamata’s ‘Mahagathbandhan’ rally?
Body: Several social media users are claiming that Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers forced Hindus of West Bengal (WB) at gunpoint to attend the recently organized mega opposition rally in Kolkata. The users are sharing a video, with India Today Groupâs logo on the top-right corner, showing masked men brandishing pistols and directing people carrying TMC flags towards a certain location. Some Facebook users used this video to claim that Hindus were threatened and forced to attend the rally organized by WB CM Mamata Banerjee. âSee the truth behind Kolkataâs grand alliance rally. TMC men are pointing gun at Hindus and forcing them to attend Mamataâs rally. Have never seen such oppression of common manâ, is a loose translation of the caption shared along with the video, on social media platforms.   The video has gone viral.

Header: 5 times when bogus warnings triggered scare about food quality in India
FACT CHECK: Did Jawaharlal Nehru perform 'Kumbh Snan' in 1954?
Body: The Ardha Kumbh Mela is going on in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Journalist and director Vinod Kapri tweeted a photo of India's first prime minister Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, saying, in Hindi, what closely translates to, "India's first prime minister Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru has performed the 'Snan' during Kumbh, and he could be seen wearing a Janeu." à¤¤à¤¾à¤à¤¿ à¤¸à¤¨à¤¦ à¤°à¤¹à¥ : à¤ªà¤¹à¤²à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤§à¤¾à¤¨à¤®à¤à¤¤à¥à¤°à¥ à¤ªà¤à¤¡à¤¿à¤¤ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¹à¤°à¤²à¤¾à¤² à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¤°à¥ à¤­à¥ à¤à¥à¤à¤­ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤¸à¥à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤° à¤à¥à¤à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¨à¥à¤ à¤­à¥ à¤§à¤¾à¤°à¤£ à¤à¤¿à¤ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥à¤à¥¤â¦ https://t.co/qJj49Z1gjl— Vinod Kapri (@vinodkapri) 1547798314000Kapri's tweet, made on January 17, has by now gotten over 4,000 likes and more than 1,100 retweets. A Twitter user -- @girishs2 -- replied to Kapri saying, "Don't spread lies, Vinod Kapri. This photo is from Illahabad (Prayagraj) clicked when Nehru was there to immerse his father's ashes." Kapri responded to the user saying, "If you want to spread lies, go ahead. It's a fact that Nehru's father Motilal passed in 1931 and then, Nehru was 42 years old. You see a 42-year-old Nehru in this photo? This photo is from 1952 Kumbh (Mela) when Nehru was 65." Twitter user @bhaiyyajispeaks quote-tweeted Kapri's tweet the next day saying, in Hindi, what closely translates to, "There is no need of politicising this photo but this was not clicked during the 1954 Kumbh Mela. This photo was clicked after Jawaharlal Nehru immersed his mother's ashes at Allahabad (Prayagraj, now). This photo is also there at Anand Bhavan (museum) in Prayagraj." à¤¹à¤¾à¤²à¤¾à¤à¤à¤¿ à¤à¤¸à¥ à¤°à¤¾à¤à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¤¿à¤ à¤µà¤¿à¤·à¤¯ à¤¬à¤¨à¤¾à¤¨à¥ à¤à¥ à¤à¥à¤ à¤à¤¼à¤°à¥à¤°à¤¤ à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤¯à¤¹ à¤¤à¤¸à¥à¤µà¥à¤° à¤à¥à¤à¤­ à¤à¥ à¤¨à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¹à¥, à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤µà¤¾à¤¹à¤°à¤²à¤¾à¤² à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¤°à¥ à¤à¥ à¤®à¤¾à¤¤à¤¾à¤à¥ à¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/Ob0ocUAuHJ— Bhaiyyaji (@bhaiyyajispeaks) 1547813147000Times Fact Check found what the truth behind this photo of Nehru is.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Sania Mirza wears hijab when in Pakistan?
Body: An image that is being heavily circulated on WhatsApp has two photos of India's ace tennis player Sania Mirza placed side by side. On the left is a photo of Mirza in a white t-shirt and a pair of ripped jeans with "In India" written over it and on the right is a photo of Mirza wearing a hijab with "In Pakistan" written over it. "Still India is Intolerance, right?" is written on the bottom of the image, possibly to say India, as a country, is tolerant, liberal and does not make wearing hijab mandatory for Muslim women. The image also tries to say that Muslim women in Pakistan always wear a hijab. Here is the image:

Header: Facts of the day: Fake edition of Washington Post, Malayalam paper with misleading photo caption
FACT CHECK: Man carried horse on his back after it was bitten by a snake?
Body: Twitter user @kwilli1046 who, according to his bio, is Co-Host of America Out Loud, âThe Brink of Greatnessâ and contributor to âViewpoint This Sundayâ, shared a video tweeted by Twitter account that goes by the name Island Hopper TV saying, "Man carries his horse on his back for 3 miles after it was bitten by a snake. The horse and the man both survived." Man carries his horse on his back for 3 miles after it was bitten by a snake. The horse and the man both survived. https://t.co/VEBfqFEMr4— Kevin W (@kwilli1046) 1547522330000The tweet made on January 14 went viral with more than 25,000 retweets, over a lakh likes and garnering more than 3.5 million views. The user enjoys a follower base of 1,75,000 and seems to be someone who shares a lot of video content on his timeline.

Header: FACT CHECK: Were 1,000 trees felled to make helipad in Odisha ahead of PM Modi’s visit?
Body: A news report published by the Press Trust of India (PTI) on January 13 titled, âFelling of trees for PM's helipad sparks row in Odishaâ, said âTwo days ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's scheduled visit to Balangir district, a row surfaced on Sunday over alleged cutting of trees to prepare a temporary helipad.â Divisional Forest Officer (DFO), Balangir, Sameer Satpathy said that several trees were felled near the railway station ground in the district to prepare a temporary helipad without obtaining prior, and that an inquiry has been ordered, according to the PTI report. The same PTI report quoted Chief Public Relations Officer (CPRO) of East Coast Railways (ECoR) JP Mishra as saying, âWe are doing our own enquiry on the subject." On January 13 itself, The Hindu published a report titled, "PMâs upcoming visit to Odisha: Over 1,000 trees felled". The report started saying, "Felling of over 1,000 trees for a temporary helipad for the upcoming visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the western Odisha town of Balangir has made green activists see red," but in the second paragraph, said that saplings were planted on 2.25 hectares controlled by the Indian Railways in 2016, and authorities had to clear 1.25 hectares to make vacant land available to build the temporary helipad. The Hindu quoted Balangir DFO Satpathy (spelled as Samir Kumar Satpathy) as saying, "The allegation of tree felling is true. No prior permission was sought from us for it," and as saying, "When we asked the Railway officials, they said the land had been cleared for a helipad. From the security point of view, trees were urgently cut down, we were told." The report also quoted Satpathy as saying, "We are apprehending that trees between 1,000 and 1,200 have been lost." Many publications including India Times,National Herald and The Logical Indian carried reports saying "1,000 trees were felled" in the headline, quoting the report published on The Hindu. India Times, has however, updated the story on January 15 with new details and changed the headline. Indian Express, on January 14, published its own report titled, âModiâs Odisha visit: Hundreds of trees felled to make space for PMâs helipadâ, saying, âhundreds of trees were cut allegedly to open up space for temporary helipads and for security reasons, prompting a blame game among the local forest department unit, railways and public works department.â The report quoted Balangir DFO Satpathy as saying, âAbout a thousand trees have been felled. A notice will be issued to the Railways to explain why they did this and with whose permission.â Publications like Scroll, The Quint published reports based on the Indian Express report. Scroll titled the report, "1,000 trees felled ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modiâs visit to Odisha". The Quint's report said, "Hundreds of trees cut to make helipad space for Modi's Odisha tour." The Quint updated the story on January 15 and changed the headline to, "No Trees Cut for PM Modiâs Helipad During Odisha Visit: Reports". Niranjan Patnaik, President, Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee, tweeted saying, "3500 trees felled in Balangir for His Royal Highness Shri Narendra Modi by his friend @Naveen_Odisha. What a red carpet welcome! The iconic friendship of Shri Narendra Modi and Shri Naveen Patnaik will be remembered for generations." 3500 trees felled in Balangir for His Royal Highness Shri Narendra Modi by his friend @Naveen_Odisha. What a red caâ¦ https://t.co/qaHqJ12QBU— Niranjan Patnaik (@NPatnaikOdisha) 154746938100

Header: Fact Check: Has Anil Kumble joined BJP?
Body: Several social media users from across the country have been making claims on platforms such as Twitter and Facebook that former Indian international cricketer and coach Anil Kumble has joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). The claim is being made using a picture of Kumble with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. In the photo, Modi and Kumble are shaking hands, possibly right after the legendary leg-spinner gifted PM a bouquet. One of the posts made by a Bengali user on Facebook read âAnil Kumble has joined the nationalist party of India BJP. One day lotus will bloom in whole Indiaâ. The post went viral with more than 500 likes and close to 50 shares. Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake news around Rahul Gandhi’s UAE visit
FAKE ALERT: Old video from China zoo spread to trigger tiger scare in Odisha
Body: A rumour has been doing the rounds on WhatsApp for quite sometime now. It says that a bunch of tigers attacked an ongoing picnic party in Odishaâs Daringbada. The message is being circulated with gruesome images and videos. In the video being shared, a man gets surrounded by tigers, and is then brutally attacked. Horrified onlookers could be heard screaming for help and shots fired could be seen. Panic gripped locals after these spine-chilling photos and videos, supposedly of a picnicker being attacked, went viral on WhatsApp.

Header: Fact Check: Does HRD ministry intend to make Hindi compulsory across India?
Body: An Indian Express (IE) news report claimed that HRD ministry plans to make Hindi language mandatory till Class 8 across the country. The news report titled â Hindi must be made mandatory till Class 8, says new policy draftâ said that the key recommendations in the draft report prepared by the nine-member K Kasturirangan committee on the New Education Policy (NEP) proposed strict adherence to the three-language formula with Hindi mandatory till Class 8 across the country. Further, it also recommended a uniform syllabus nationwide for Science and Maths and developing a script in Devanagari for tribal dialects, and promote education based on âhunar (skill)â. Quoting sources, it said that the committee handed over its report to the HRD Ministry last month, before its tenure ended on December 31, 2018. Several Twitter users reacted to the IE report, some in anger, some with sarcasm. Header: FACT CHECK: Viral video showing injured Indian Army men is staged
Body: A Facebook page named âPresident saabâ shared a video showing men dressed as Indian Army soldiers. The men seen in the video could be seen posing as injured Army personnel and one of these men could be seen resting in a trench even. The video shared on January 7 went viral, garnering more than 1.5 million views. The video posted by the page with a caption saying, "Salute to Indian Army" has been shared more than 37,000 times.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Tony Blair say India’s future is safe in the hands of Rahul Gandhi?
Body: Serial fake news purveyor Viral in India, in a post made on its Facebook page, claimed that former British Prime Minister Tony Blair praised Congress president Rahul Gandhi when they both met in Delhi. The meeting happened on the sidelines of âRaisina Dialogueâ, considered India's flagship annual geo-political and geo-strategic conference. Using the photograph showing Blair and Gandhi shaking hands, Viral in Indiaâs Facebook page claimed that the former PM of Britain said that Indiaâs future was safe in Rahul Gandhiâs hands.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Media wrongly labels SP MLA who distributed liquor to minors as BJP leader
Body: Liquor bottles were served in lunch packets to minors at an event organised by Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Nitin Agarwal in Uttar Pradeshâs Hardoi on Sunday. However, while reporting about this incident, several news outlets wrongly branded Nitin as a BJP leader. Some news websites described Nitin as BJP leader Naresh Agarwalâs son, while failing to mention that he is an MLA from SP.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Rahul Gandhi’s image was not displayed on Dubai’s Burj Khalifa
Body: A Facebook page supporting Congress President Rahul Gandhi, that goes by the name of "With Rahul Gandhi", posted a video that showed Dubaiâs Burj Khalifa, one of the world-famous skyscrapers, displaying Rahul Gandhiâs photo on it. The page posted this video yesterday and the post has been shared more than 3,500 times now and viewed over 52,000 times. The part of the caption of the post written in Hindi closely translates to, "Beautiful scene of Rahul Gandhi's photo being displayed on Burj Khalifa ahead of his Dubai tour." The part of the caption written in English read, "Rahul Gandhiâs pic displayed on Burj Khalifa, Dubai". Gandhi is visiting Dubai on January 11 for a two-day trip. Many Facebook users shared the same video with the same caption.

Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Nirmala Sitharaman did not say PM Narendra Modi is a ‘thief’ in Lok Sabha
Body: Defence minister Nirmala Sitharaman replied to a debate over the Rafale deal last Friday, January 4, in the Lok Sabha, and hit back at the Congress Party. Prime Minister Narendra Modi was of the opinion that Sitharaman's two-hour-long reply demolished Congress's lies on the Rafale deal and tweeted the video of Sitharaman's speech saying, "Defence Minister Sitharamanâs speech in the Parliament demolishes the campaign of calumny on Rafale. Must watch!" Many Facebook pages like " With Rahul Gandhi", " Viral Story Insight", however, shared a five-second-long clip of Sitharaman that shows the defence minister saying, "The defence minister is lying; the prime minister is a thief," with a caption that closely translates to, "Today, in Parliament, defence minister Sitharaman said the prime minister is a thief." The clip shared by the page "With Rahul Gandhi" has, by now, been shared more than 1,000 times and garnered over 21,000 views. The same clip is being shared on WhatsApp and by many individual Facebook and Twitter users.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Female army officer seen with Nirmala Sitharaman in viral photo is not her daughter
Body: Many social media users have been sharing a photo of defence minister Nirmala Sitharaman standing next to a female army officer with a claim that the latter is Sitharamanâs daughter. The caption of one of the Facebook posts with this photo says, âdefence minister Nirmala Sitharaman with her daughter serving in the air force. First defence minister, rather first union minister and politician whose serving in the armed forces. This is what is called serving your nation with passion.â The same photo was shared by Facebook pages like âWe Support Narendra Modiâ with huge number of followers. The watermark / stamp on the right-bottom corner of the photo that said âIndian Army Protect Usâ led us to a post made on December 27 by a Facebook page that goes by the same name with the same photo and a caption that said, "Very nice pic. Mother and soldier". This particular post got more than 25,000 likes on Facebook, and was shared more than 5,100 times. Header: Fact Check: Did Kerala students raise IS flags in support of terror outfits?
Body: A local Kerala TV channel Janam TV put out a video and a news report on Friday claiming students of CH Muhammad Koya Memorial College (run by a Muslim trust) in Kerala's Varkala, held a rally of sorts in support of terror groups by raising their flags. Janam TV claimed that students held a road show in support of terror groups like the Al-Qaeda and the Islamic State, and said the management backed the students. The report said the video footage showed students dressed up as Al-Qaeda and ISIS members - with their faces covered and waving flags of the banned organisations. Sloganeering in support of the the terror outfits can also be seen in the video, which has now gone viral.   The reporter covering the incident concluded that it showed the presence of terrorist organisations like Al-Qaeda and ISIS in the campus in Varkala in Thiruvananthapuram district. âAl Qaeda is spreading in Kerala, even in the capital city. Itâs tightening its hold over campuses in Kerala. Keralaâs youth is under the influence of terrorism,â said the TV anchor. Visuals of Osama Bin Ladenâs sketch on college toilet walls were also aired. Based on Janam TVâs video and news report, several mainstream media outlets carried the news quoting Janam TV. One Indiaâs reportDNAâs reportSeveral Twitter users too tweeted about the incident and tweets went viral on micro-blogging platform. Terror modules hoisted ISIS flag in CH Mohd Koya Memorial college, Kerala. Header: FAKE ALERT: Bangladesh video shared saying Muslims attacked Hindus in Rajasthan
Body: Many social media users are sharing a video showing Hindu women narrating how Muslims attacked them and destroyed their property with a claim that the incident happened in Rajasthan after the recent Assembly Elections in the state where the Congress emerged victorious. One of the Facebook posts with the video has a caption that closely translates to, "Right after the Congress government was formed in Rajasthan, houses of Marwadi Hindus were burnt down and two were killed by "peace-loving" Muslims in Darti village in Jaisalmer." The post shared by a Facebook page that goes by the name âKattar Hindu Chhora Jatavâ was shared more than 1,700 times and the video was viewed more than 28,000 times. An identical post was made by a Facebook page that goes by the name âBhagwa Raj, Page like kareâ. The post was shared by more than 7,00 people and garnered more 16,000 views.

Header: Fact Check: Did Turkey declare Modi world’s greatest leader, issue stamp in his honour?
Body: The official Twitter handle of BJP Assam Pradesh posted a tweet claiming that Turkey issued a postage stamp of Prime Minister Narendra Modi for being the âGreatest leader in the world at the momentâ. The tweet read, âTurkey has issued a postage stamp of Indian PM Hon'ble Sir Narendra Modi. This is an honour to our one of the greatest leader of the world (sic)." This text is accompanied with 2.8 Turkish Lira (currency of Turkey) postage stamp bearing image of PM Modi and Indian flag. Below the image (in the stamp) is written âNarendra Modi, Prime Minister of the Republic of Indiaâ. The tweet now stands deleted. The postage stamp is being circulated with similar captions my many users on Twitter. For instance, one of the captions used is: âProud moment.Turkey has issued a postage stamp of Narendra Modi, declaring that this is on honor of the greatest leader of the world at this moment. Every Indian should feel proud about thisâ. Proud moment Turkey has issued a postage stamp of Narendra Modi, declaring that this is on honor of the greatest lâ¦ https://t.co/wgNQKRJ5uD— Ayyappa (@Ayyappa_003) 1545967971000Proud moment Turkey has issued a postage stamp of Narendra Modi, declaring that this is on honor of the greatest lâ¦ https://t.co/9uGLTmVL3K— Ravikant Sharma (@RaviKantCCC1982) 154591136500

Header: 3 Twitter users post same garlic stock photo to claim farmers distressed?
FAKE: Vinod Dua airs doctored video to suggest Gadkari attacked NDA government
Body: Journalist Vinod Dua was caught spreading fake news after he posted an edited video of Union Minister Nitin Gadkari to suggest that he was blaming his own government for stalled projects and NPAs after he took over the charge of ministry of road transport and highways. Dua "used" a doctored interview Gadkari gave to his own employer HW news, and aired it in the episode 7 of his video piece titled The Vinod Dua Show. Dua used the incomplete video to claim that not just Yashwant Sinha, Shatrughan Sinha and Arun Shourie but even RSS swayamsevaks like Gadkari are now at loggerheads with PM Modi and BJP leadership. Making his own inference from Gadkariâs distorted comments, Dua concluded that union minister was dead against Modi being projected as BJPâs prime ministerial face in upcoming Lok Sabha elections if the saffron party harbours any dream of winning them. Instead, Dua claimed, Gadkari wants himself to lead BJP. âThere is a growing wave of dissent within BJP against PM Modi. The latest to join that is Nitin Gadkari,â said Dua. Since the original episode 7 of Duaâs show was pulled down from both HW news website and Youtube after social media backlash, hereâs the portion of the episode (as reproduced by an alert Youtube user) where he makes fake claims:

Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake messages claim RSS and Modi government making Muslim kids impotent through vaccines
Body: Some WhatsApp forwards doing rounds on the instant messaging platform are asking Muslims to refrain from getting their children vaccinated for measles-rubella and smallpox claiming that these vaccines are a devious plan by RSS to make Muslims impotent. The messages further claim that the vaccines being injected into Muslim kids have already been banned in many other countries besides India. But Modi government has allowed the MNC manufacturing these vaccines to inject them to all school children. The message warns that when Muslim kids turn 40, they wouldnât be able to have kids. Further, the vaccine is a slow poison which will not only affect the child vaccinated but also the future generations. IMPACTBased on these WhatsApp forwards, hundreds of madrassas across western Uttar Pradesh have refused permission to health department teams to administer the measles-rubella vaccine to their students exposing lakhs of children to deadly and contagious diseases. In Meerut alone, at least 70 of the 272 seminaries have refused entry to health officials. Madrassas in Bijnor and Moradabad are also opposing the vaccination drive.

Body: A video doing rounds on social media platforms and WhatsApp shows kids reciting verses from Quran in what appears to be a school classroom. Header: FAKE ALERT: Old video of Rahul Gandhi's dargah visit used to suggest he's a Muslim
Body: A video showing Congress President Rahul Gandhi offering prayers, wearing a rounded skull cap that is commonly used by Muslims, is being widely shared on social media platforms with captions that suggest either that he is a Muslim or that he has converted to Islam after the recent Assembly election results. Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad can also be seen in the video. A Facebook page that goes by the name of "Modinama" posted the video with a sarcastic caption that closely translates to, "Janeu-wearing Shri 1008 Rahul Gandhi chanting Shiva hymn". The text on the video, in Hindi, closely translates to, "Janab (Gandhi) has shown his true colours right after elections got over". The same was written in the description field of the video. The video has, by now, been viewed over 1,82,000 times and shared by 7,530 users. On searching Facebook with the text in Hindi that was given in the description, it was found that the video is being shared widely. The same video is being shared with the same caption on Twitter as well. Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress wrongly accuses PM Modi of making Raghuram Rajan resign
Body: Following Urjit Patelâs resignation as the governor of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) last week, Congress posted a video on social media in which it claimed that former RBI governor Raghuram Rajan was made to resign by PM Narendra Modi. Not just Rajan, Congress, in the same video, also claimed that former chief economic adviser (CEA) Arvind Subramanian and vice-chairman of NITI Aayog Arvind Panagariya too were made to resign. Hereâs the video tweet posted by Congressâ official handle. Its getting clearer by the day, PM Modi only wants 'yes' men by his side, its no wonder honest, intelligent & dedicâ¦ https://t.co/qrmQqtxFWc— Congress (@INCIndia) 1544713201000The video begins with criticism of Modi government alleging that it assaulted various institutions in the country. It says, âAs the Modi government continues its assault on our institutions, several individuals have left the sinking ship and left the Modi government.â Post this, the Congress lists many individuals whose âresignationâ, it claims, âshook the nationâ. Mentioning Rajanâs name first, the Party, in its video, claimed that he resigned as RBI governor after refusing to lower interest rates as per governmentâs wishes. With regards to Panagariya, the Congress reasoned that he had to resign abruptly as RSS wasnât happy with his work. For Subramanian, the grand old party claimed that he had to step down after his tenure was mired by disagreements with the Modi-led NDA government. The 78-second-long video ends by concluding that âModi is a failureâ. It says: âThe writing on the wall is as clear as it gets. Modi may try to take control over all institutions but honest men will always find a way to stand up to himâ. The video was also posted on the official page of Congress on Facebook.

Body: A video showing a girl being burnt alive is being circulated heavily on social media with a claim that it is of a Hindu girl who was set on fire, and killed, in Madhya Pradesh (MP) for attending a prayer meeting in a church there. Twitter user @javed655 tweeted the video saying, "Hindu girl burnt alive in Madhya Pradesh because she attended a prayer meeting in a Christian church. Please send this around so that the whole world may see India, the real Hell on planet Earth. Just see the ugliest face of "Incredible India"!!! (sic)". Here's the tweet: DISCLAIMER: VIOLENT VISUALS. Header: FACT CHECK: Did Rahul Gandhi make a U-turn on farm loan-waiver promise?
Body: A mischievously-edited video of Congress President Rahul Gandhi makes it look like he has gone back on his farm loan waiver promise made during the recent election-campaign rallies. The video that is going viral on social media platforms shows Gandhi talking about farm loan waiver at two different instances - one, during an election-campaign rally in Madhya Pradesh, and the other during the press meet he held on the election results day, December 11. In the first video, Gandhi could be seen promising farm loan waiver in Madhya Pradesh if the Congress Party is voted to power. He says, farm loans would be waived off within ten days of formation of the new Congress government. The second video is that of Gandhi speaking at the press meet that was held on December 11. Answering a question on farm loan waiver, Gandhi can be seen saying, âFarm loan waiver is not the solution.â A Facebook page that goes by the name â PMO India : Report Cardâ shared the edited video, which also carries text in Hindi that translates to, âSee how Rahul has changed his colours within 24 hoursâ and with âBefore election winâ and âAfter election winâ written below the respective videos. The video has already been viewed more than 3,40,000 times and shared over 13,000 times.

FAKE ALERT: Congress supporters DID NOT use Pakistan flag while celebrating election win
Body: A video showing a green flag being waved by a man taking part in a rally, shot by someone who could be heard accusing Congress supporters of "shamelessly" waving Pakistan's national flag, is being circulated widely on social media platforms. The video posted by a Facebook page that goes by the name " PoliticsSolitics" has, by now, been viewed 5,73,000 times and shared by more than 21,000 Facebook users. The video carries Hindi text that translates to, âCongress gave Hindus a big gift after BJP's (Assembly election) loss. Now, it's time." In the video, someone could be heard speaking in Hindi, saying that the Congress supporters in Rajasthan's Tiwari are using Pakistan's flag in a rally. Here's a close translation of what the man, who is possibly recording the video, said: "See how Pakistan's flag is being waved at this Congress rally. Look carefully. See how these people are waving Pakistan's flag at this rally. This is your own fault. This is a report from Tiwari / Tihari. Not from anywhere else. I am ashamed to say this to the Hindu brothers in the rally, have some shame. You voted for these people, right?" However, the video was posted with a caption written in Hindi that closely translates to, "Islamic flag being waved after Congress' election win. Naive Hindus will regret in the future." The video was shared by many users and pages with the same caption: The same video is being shared by many Twitter users as well, along with the same false claim that Pakistan's flag was used at this particular rally. Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress workers did not raise ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ slogan in Rajasthan’s Rajsamand
Body: A video that shows some men sloganeering inside a room is being widely circulated on social media with a claim that it is of Congress workers in Rajasthanâs Rajsamand raising âPakistan Zindabadâ slogan during an event. Yash Mancharkar, a Facebook user, shared the video to a group called "Bhajpa (BJP) Mission 2019" on November 30 with a caption that closely translates to, "This is Congress and its history. Pakistan Zindabad slogan in Rajsamand. Get better at least now, Hindus!" On searching "Rajsamand mai Pakistan Zindabad", typed in in Hindi, on Facebook, we found many users sharing the same video with identical claim. The video is still being circulated on Twitter as well. For instance, Twitter user @narendrap85, in a tweet sharing the video, said what translates to, "Have some shame friends, for us Hindustanis, our own country is the favourite. A party that raises "Pakistan Zindabad" slogan could possibly divide the country along with 35 crore people. Because they need money and power. Congress workers in Rajsamand raised "Pakistan Zindabad" slogan." Another user @iVikasPanwar tweeted the video saying, âTill when will we tolerate such nonsense in the name of freedom of speech? In the presence of Rajsamand Congress candidate, "Pakistan Zindabad" slogan was rasised. And everyone kept quiet. Rahul Gandhi, is this your fake Hinduism and nationalism?" Header: FAKE ALERT: Pakistan’s flag NOT hoisted in West Bengal as claimed in viral posts
Body: Many social media users, both on Facebook and Twitter, are sharing photos that show green flags -- with a crescent moon and a star -- apparently hoisted in West Bengalâs Domjur in Horwah, along with different false claims. Some users shared these photos with a claim that that these are "Pakistanâs national flag" used to celebrate the election of Kolkataâs first Muslim mayor Firhad Hakim. One such post written in Hindi closely translates to, "People celebrated Firhad Hakim becoming Kolkata mayor by hoisting Pakistan's flags. This is an hour of threat for Hindus." Same photos were shared on Twitter with exact same caption. For instance: Twitter user @afraoo7, however, had two extra photos and another false claim to add to the above. The user's tweet in Hindi closely translates to, "Pakistan's flags on Kolkata streets and markets, hoisted by people happy about Farid Hakim becoming the mayor. He used to refer to port area as mini Pakistan. Now, he is going to turn the whole of Kolkata into mini Pakistan. He has renamed 'Haldiram' bus stand as 'Hajj house' bus stand." There is another post that is being copy-pasted by many social media users. While the posts in Hindi started circulating in December first week, the posts in Bengali began circulating on social media platforms in November third week itself. The post warns people against voting for the Trinamool Congress (TMC) saying the Party will turn Bengal into âmini Pakistanâ. Hereâs a close translation of the post originally written in Bengali:âPakistan's flag can be seen in Domjur in Howrah in West Bengal. Take a good look at this and think before voting for TMC. If you do, you would be helping to turn your area into a mini Pakistan. Pakistan's flag seen in Domjur. Entire Domjur is covered by Pakistanâs flags. A flag can be seen just in front of the Domjur police station. We strongly condemn the police and the administration for this. We also condemn the Hindu MLA of Domjur. Thank you Mamata Banerjee for providing us with the opportunity to travel to Pakistan for free. Jai Shri Ram.â

FACT CHECK: Viral photo of elephants crossing railway track a fake?
Body: A photo that captured a mother elephant and its calf attempting crossing a railway track went viral last week. The photo clicked by wildlife photographer Biplab Hazra shed light on how human intervention is making survival difficult for elephants. Hazra titled the photo âImpossible Oddsâ. However, there are many users, across platforms, who said that the photo is a fake. Some users even claimed that the photo that won the Sanctuary Asia magazine award was actually two photos merged together. These users who called the photo fake pointed out that there are shadows missing below the mother elephantâs leg and that it looks as if she is suspended in air, and hence, the photo is not original. Times Fact Check found out the truth. The photo, meanwhile, triggered a conversation about the declining population of Indian elephants owing to fatal encounters with trains. Two elephants try to navigate a railway crossingð The Indian population of elephants is rapidly depleting due to faâ¦ https://t.co/qkaqK8ql0y— EarToTheWild (@eartothewildfdn) 1543245168000No safety measures to safe life of #Animal , A elephant with his family crossing railway track , we must work to prâ¦ https://t.co/FQ241fvMhS— Manoj Kumar (@manoj100001) 1543137956000The photo that won a âCertificate of meritâ at the Sanctuary Wildlife Photography Awards 2018 was shared by Sanctuary Asia on its social media handles.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Images of actor MS Narayana’s death in 2015 viral again
Body: Many Facebook users are making posts and tweets mourning the death of veteran Telugu actor MS Narayana. These users who seem to have fallen for a death hoax are expressing shock in Narayana's âsudden demiseâ. Some users are making posts along with photos of Narayana available on Google while others are sharing photos clicked after he passed away in 2015, thinking he died recently. Sample these Facebook posts by users who think Narayana died recently: Some users are sharing posts made in 2015, possibly without checking the date of the post. Facebook user who goes by the name "Santosh tmz" posted a video four days ago, on November 25, of veteran actor Brahmanandam crying inconsolably standing near Narayana's body with the caption, âBrahmanandam breaks down at MS narayana farewell / MS narayana actor death.â In the caption, the user also said, âWe will be missing you,â said that Narayana died of multiple-organ failure in Hyderabad but did not specify the year of death. The video the user posted had gone viral in 2015 and was telecast across television channels. This particular post garnered over 34,000 views on Facebook. Another Facebook user made a comment on the video specifying Narayana died in 2015, but the user who posted the video has not edited his post to include the year of death. Twitter users have, however, managed not to fall for the death hoax.

Header: Fact Check: Did Kerala Police beat up Hindu pilgrim in this photo?
Body: Misleading photos are being used to show a contrast between Uttar Pradesh (UP) Police and Kerala Police when it comes to treating Hindu pilgrims. While the one featuring UP Police shows a police constable comforting an old man by offering him a drink, the one that features Kerala Police, shows an officer kicking a topless man. The intent is to show that both UP Police (where BJP government is in power) and Kerala Police (where Left Democratic Front is ruling) treat Hindu pilgrims differently. It is being claimed that the people being dealt with by respective police forces in the photos are Hindu devotees. The photos with false context were tweeted by @mahesh10816, who implied that BJP has done a lot for Hindus. Difference between the Police forces of UP & Kerala Pic 1 - Uttar Pradesh Police comforting a Pilgrim Pic 2 - Keraâ¦ https://t.co/en39kX49bk— Madhav ð®ð³ (@mahesh10816) 1543298862000The photo of Kerala Police is several other Twitter users, who used it to claim that Kerala Police mistreats Hindu devotees. This is how the Kerala police treats Hindu devoteesð ð  https://t.co/v4yNTMgdDz— Manjeet Bagga (@Goldenthrust) 154261579000

Header: FAKE ALERT: Old images shared to show crowd at VHP's Dharam Sabha in Ayodhya
Body: Suryanarayan, All India co-convenor of Bajrang Dal, who goes by the name 'Suryanarayan Bajrangdal' on Facebook, made a post on November 25 saying, "Ayodhya progrem" and shared four images (he posted the same image twice). Here is the post:Judging by the date he made the post on, and the description, Suryanarayan meant to share these photos as ones clicked during the âDharam Sabhaâ organised by the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) in Uttar Pradeshâs Ayodhya on November 25. These photos are, however, not from 'Dharam Sabha'. A Facebook page that goes by the name âNamo Bharath - Narendra Modi for PM" shared Suryanarayanâs post saying, âThe streets of Ayodhya were filled with sadhus, sants and Hindu karyakartas who had poured in from various parts of the county for a VHP grand âDharam Sabha' on Sunday to push for construction of a Ram temple.â Here is the post: BJP MP Pratap Simha shared the same images on Twitter on November 25 saying, âCaption not neededâ.

FAKE ALERT: Photo of refugees moving from Amritsar to Lahore used to claim RSS killed Muslims in Jammu
Body: A photograph of a Muslim family leaving Amritsar for Lahore post Partition in 1947 has been used by several news websites to claim that Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh (RSS) massacred Muslims in Jammu in November, 1947. Here is the photo: Among those making these claims is Qatar-based media company, Al Jazeera. In a post dated November 6, 2017, author Rifat Fareed used this photo in his article titled â The forgotten massacre that ignited the Kashmir disputeâ. The Al Jazeera article was shared by many, including a Twitter user Muhammad Faysal, who claimed that âRSS killed over 2,00,000 Muslims in Jammu with widespread instances of rapeâ. In November 1947, after Indian Forces entered Kashmir, RSS along with Dogra Army led a pogrom that killed over 200,â¦ https://t.co/YZY5H1MEEo— Muhammad Faysal (@_Faysal) 1541070864000Similarly, several local Kashmiri media outlets used the pic to claim that the Indian Army, along with âHindu hooligansâ, killed lakhs of Muslims in Jammu and Kashmir after partition.

Header: FACT CHECK: Does Rahul Gandhi not know what an election manifesto is?
Body: A 16-second-long video clip showing Congress President Rahul Gandhi speaking at an event is being heavily circulated on social media platforms and WhatsApp with a claim suggesting that he does not know what an election manifesto is. In the video, Gandhi could be seen saying, "You cannot put everything in the manifesto. You understand that. Because the fund is limited, money is limited. But if you put it, we will ensure that it's done. We will give it." "Know what an election manifesto is from Rahul Gandhi. If you could understand, then please make us understand as well," said one of the Twitter users who shared the video. "Know what an election manifesto is from Rahul. What an intelligent man," said another user, sharing the same video. The same video is being circulated widely on Facebook as well. Header: Fact Check: Is BJP man behind chili powder attack on Kejriwal?
Body: Senior leaders of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), and its social media workers, are claiming that Anil Kumar Sharma, the 40-year-old man who smeared chili powder on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwalâs face on Tuesday, is a Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) man. AAPâs social media strategist Ankit Lal shared a Facebook profile, claiming to be that of Sharma, and pointed that display picture used is that of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Lal said that Sharmaâs post on the Facebook profile, end with âBJP Zindabadâ and yet, Delhi Police is âpeddling conspiracy theoriesâ. So, @ArvindKejriwal's attacker has PM Modi as FB profile DP, Has posts abusing the party which ends with 'BJP Zinâ¦ https://t.co/p7wTHyRZGg— Ankit Lal (@AnkitLal) 1542732825000Manish Sisodia, deputy chief minister of Delhi, shared the same Facebook profile in a press conference on Wednesday, pointing to Sharmaâs bio (which reads member of BJP), and accused Delhi Police of acting on BJPâs orders to attack Kejriwal. Sisodia concluded that âSharma was a BJP worker by virtue of him being a neighbour of former BJP MLA Karan Singh MLA, which clearly points to his connection with BJP.â AAP leader Atishi Marlena too echoed Sisodiaâs sentiments. Anil Kumar Sharma who attacked CM @ArvindKejriwal today is neighbour of Karan Singh Tanwar - former BJP MLA and curâ¦ https://t.co/UOvjzNT6WZ— Atishi (@AtishiAAP) 1542717117000Besides Lal and Sisodia, Vikas Yogi (national media coordinator of AAP) and Sudhir Yadav (AAP RTI wing head) too shared the Facebook profile. Vikas said, âBJP exposed againâ Just visit FB Profile of Anil Sharma, who attacked Delhi CM inside the Secretariat ... BJP exposed again.... Hisâ¦ https://t.co/wTnV70Sdl6— Vikas Yogi (@vikaskyogi) 1542733172000Yadav also shared a video of Sharma giving a media byte. So, @ArvindKejriwal's attacker has PM Modi as FB profile DP, Has posts abusing the party which ends with 'BJP Zinâ¦ https://t.co/57ad19e8vI— Sudhir Yadav (@SudhirRTI) 154273349900

Body: Many Facebook and Twitter users are sharing a photo claiming it to be of the grand preparations underway in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj ahead of Kumbh Mela, under the Yogi Adityanath government. The photo, however, is not from Prayagraj but from Saudi Arabia's Mina Valley. Header: Fact Check: Did Mamata order Kolkata Police to lathicharge teachers protesting in city?
Body: Few social media users are sharing pictures of a bleeding man to claim that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee ordered Kolkata Police to beat up para teachers who were protesting in front of the Lenin statue at Kolkataâs Dharmatala. The posts claim that Kolkata Police committed atrocities on protesters, who were holding peaceful demonstrations over their demand of 'equal pay for equal work'. âMamataâs police lathicharged protesters. Shame on her!â was a close translation of one such posts shared in Bengali on Facebook by Gautam Roy, who works for CPIM as per his bio. Another post on Twitter argued that para teachers only wanted regularization and training facility for the teachers in the state as per the Supreme Court order, but Mamata's police attacked them. They only want Equal Pay For Equal Work as per the SC order,want Regularization&Training Facility for the Teachersâ¦ https://t.co/RIdJmW4Xte— dibyendu das (@Dibyendu69) 1542637010000The photo of the bleeding man shared by both Facebook and Twitter users was the same.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Image showing MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan consuming meat
Body: A fake image of Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan made to look as if he is consuming meat is being heavily circulated on social media platforms. Most of the tweets and posts that had the fake image had identical text that said what closely translates to, "Have some shame, Chouhan. You consume meat and chicken, and pretend to be a staunch Hindu in front of the people." Check out these tweets and Facebook posts that propagate the fake image

Header: Fact Check: Did BJP create fake photo of Navjot Singh Sidhu touching Sonia Gandhi’s feet?
Body: Bharatiya Janata Partyâs IT cell is being accused of circulating fake photo of former cricketer and Punjab minister Navjot Singh Sidhu touching feet of former Congress President Sonia Gandhi. One Twitter user claimed that Sidhu never did that and said that the photo was âfakeâ, much like âpromisesâ of the saffron party. @sanit_attri @KAgarwal6 @therajanji @Gyan15292 @sherryontopp @munnnabai @ANI @PMOIndia @TajinderBagga This is whatâ¦ https://t.co/VUVkGl4Jrc— CHAIWALA P.M.ð¦ (@AK4IND) 1542541161000Another Twitter user claimed that it is not Sidhu but Amrinder Singh who is seen touching Gandhiâs feet. @AvinashGoraksha That man touching sonia's feet is not Siddhu he is captain Amrinder Singh, CM of punjab state— Shubham tiwari (@Shubham5841) 1521554388000In the photo that is being labelled as âfakeâ, one can see a man donning a pink turban bowing down in front of Gandhi to touch her feet. Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh is seen sitting next to Gandhi, and the angle of the photo is such that the face of the man bowing down cannot be seen.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Mumbai Congress leader's photo misused to claim she runs prostitution racket
Body: Many pages and individual users on Facebook, and many Twitter users, are posting about one Shabana Sara Ali, apparently a Congress Party leader from Madhya Pradesh, claiming she is running a prostitution racket. These users are, however, (mis)using Mumbai Mahila Congress Vice President Gurpreet Kaur Chadha's photo, taken from her official website, as that of Ali. Sample these -The posts in Hindi closely translate to, "Madhya Pradesh Congress leader Shabana Sara Ali is running a brothel in her own house. She was caught by the police, along with other women. " The same post is still being circulated on social media platforms, despite fact-checking websites busting the claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: AAP MLA tweets 2017 video of EVM malfunction in Meerut as from Chhattisgarh
Body: Praveen Kumar, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Delhi's Jangpura, tweeted a video that shows an Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) malfunctioning, and claimed it to be from Chhattisgarh. In the video, a man can be seen pressing a particular button on the EVM and the light corresponding to another button glowing. Tweeting the video, Kumar said, in Hindi, what closely translates to, "Elections are underway in Chhattisgarh; press any button, vote will go to lotus. See for yourself." Kumar is saying the vote will be recorded for the Bharatiya Janata Party, regardless of which party you vote for. The first phase of assembly poll in Chhattisgarh began on November 12 and the last phase will be on November 20. Kumar tweeted the video, tagging Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, on November 16, and the video has been, by now, retweeted nearly 300 times, and viewed more than 2,500 times.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video showing bodies of kids found in container is from Syria, not Tamil Nadu
Body: A video that shows bodies of many kids is being circulated widely on WhatsApp groups in Kerala along with a message in Malayalam saying these bodies, with their organs removed, were found in a container in Tamil Nadu by the police. Hereâs a close translation of the message: "A container full of bodies of kids were found in Tamil Nadu. Organs were missing in all these bodies. Organs were found removed. Apparently, all the kids were abducted from different states. So, please take care of your kids. Tell them not to take lifts from anyone on the road. Take care of children."

Header: FACT CHECK: Truth behind video of 'women' stripping at Delhi’s Signature Bridge
Body: Twitter user @ajju_tweets tweeted three videos, that showed a group of youngsters stripping, posing nude and creating ruckus, claiming that the incident happened at Delhiâs newly inaugurated Signature Bridge. A lot of Twitter users seemed unsure about the veracity of the claim that the incident actually happened at the Signature Bridge, given the graphic nature of the video. Times Fact Check has found out the truth. In the tweet, @ajju_tweets said, âSignature Bridge was inaugurated few days ago and see what Delhites are making it of it. It seems people have forgotten their moral values. There is a reason Delhi has a bad name in India and in world. See the ruckus people are creating (sic),â with a warning that said âAdult contentâ, and tagging Delhi Police. In the second tweet, the user said, âPeople are behaving like animals and this can be very dangerous for traffic.â In the third tweet, @ajju_tweets said, âNot the govt, not the police, only people of Delhi are responsible for this. How can a family travel and what the kids will learn.â WATCH THE VIDEO HERE:02:05Viral video: Transgenders strip at Delhi's Signature Bridge, cops register cas

Header: Fact Check: Did Rahul Gandhi promise to change direction of sunrise if he becomes the prime minister?
Body: A 6-second-long video clip being circulated on social media shows Congress President Rahul Gandhi saying he would âchange the direction of sunrise if the voters make him the prime ministerâ. The video was posted on Twitter by Mahesh Vikram Hegde, founder of Postcard News, a website that was caught propagating fake news in the past. Shriman Pappu says that he will change the direction of the Sun if he becomes the Prime Minister! But the publicâ¦ https://t.co/A57ZlU6Wq9— Mahesh Vikram Hegde (@mvmeet) 1541956576000Referring to Gandhi as âPappuâ, Hegde opines that the public has âalready decidedâ to ânot makeâ Gandhi the prime minister.

Header: FAKE ALERT: BJP spokesperson tweets photo claiming to be that of Tipu Sultan
Body: Tipu Sultan, a famous ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore, is considered a hero by many and a villain by many others. Whether or not he was a tyrant is debated till date, but the facts that Tipu was born in 1750, to Sultan Hyder Ali, and that he died in 1799, cannot be changed. BJP Spokesperson Ashwini Upadhyay, however, doesn't seem to believe so. If what he is claiming is true, Tipu died at least 27 years later, sometime in 1826 or 1827. We will tell you why. On November 10, as the Karnataka government celebrated Tipu Sultan Jayanti, Upadhyay tweeted a graphic card that shows two photos - a black-and-white photo and what looks like a painting. Here's what he said in the tweet - "Vote the candidates who support: Uniform education, uniform healthcare, Uniform Civil Code, Hinduism and Hindustan, population control law, Ayodhya Kashi Mathura, one nation one Constitution, one nation one name one flag, lifetime imprisonment to corrupts, seizure of 100 per cent Benami properties." Here is the photo Upadhyay tweeted:This is not the first time this particular black-and-white photo is being circulated on social media as that of Tipu Sultan. This happened last year as well, and those tweets and Facebook posts are still intact. Here's a post that was shared more than 3,400 times on Facebook. This year, after Upadhyay's tweet, the false claim has made a comeback.

Body: A viral video of former JNUSU President Kanhaiya Kumar shows him claiming that he is a converted Muslim who chose Islam as it preaches equality compared to older religions, read Hinduism, in which, untouchability is practiced. He is also heard saying that he is an âIndian Muslimâ and âdid not come from Arabâ. He also says, âAllah is very powerful and will protect meâ.   The video is being shared by some Twitter and Facebook users, and many are attacking Kumar for purportedly hiding this âfactâ from media and projecting himself as a âlow-caste Hinduâ. Header: FACT CHECK: White House spokesperson tweets incomplete video to accuse journalist of 'inappropriate behaviour'
Body: Donald Trump, President of the United States of America, held a press conference after the mid-term election results in which the Democratic Party took control of the House of Representatives and the Republican Party managed to keep its majority in the Senate. The presser soon turned chaotic when President Trump lost his cool at different journalists asking him questions. One such journalist present at the press conference -- Jim Acosta -- was accused of "inappropriate behaviour" by White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders and his press pass was revoked.Sanders, in a statement that came in the form of Twitter thread, accused Acosta of "placing his hands on a young woman just trying to do her job as a White House intern," and tweeted a video saying, "We stand by our decision to revoke this individualâs hard pass. We will not tolerate the inappropriate behavior clearly documented in this video." Here's the video Sanders tweeted:We stand by our decision to revoke this individualâs hard pass. We will not tolerate the inappropriate behavior clâ¦ https://t.co/xLP6P2Mm9k— Sarah Sanders (@PressSec) 154164799900

Header: FAKE ALERT: Tarek Fatah tweets doctored photo making false claim about madrassa teacher
Body: Canadian author Tarek Fatah, known for his anti-Islam views, tweeted a photo that shows a Muslim man standing in front of a blackboard. Judging by the content on the board, the idea that one would get from the photo is that the man is teaching the kids how Islam is superior to Hinduism. Tweeting the photo, Fatah said, "No, the Mullah is not playing âknots and crossesâ. He is teaching Muslim girls in an Indian Islamic school the comparative superiority of Islam over Hinduism." The tweet was made five hours ago and has already been retweeted 1,200 times and favourited by over 1,400 Twitter users.

Header: FACT CHECK: Was a pregnant woman in Agra slapped and forced to deliver on road?
Body: Photo of a destitute woman lying on a road, along with an infant in her lap, is being shared on social media to claim that in Uttar Pradesh a pregnant woman was forced to deliver her child on a roadside. The posts claim that the pregnant woman was slapped and thrown away by hospital authorities in Agra, leaving her with no other option but to deliver her child on the road. à¤¬à¤¹à¥à¤¤ à¤¹à¥à¤ à¤¨à¤¾à¤°à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤µà¤¾à¤° à¤à¤¬à¤à¥ à¤¬à¤¾à¤° à¤®à¥à¤¦à¥ à¤¸à¤°à¤à¤¾à¤°! https://t.co/R8yOKDPDAh— à¤à¤à¤¾à¤°à¥à¤¯ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤² #UST ð©ð©ð© (@AacharyaSahiiL) 1541075301000  The photo used in the tweet juxtaposes PM Modiâs image next to the woman, with the text âBahut hua naari par vaar, abki baar Modi sarkaarâ, which loosely translates to âEnough of crimes against women, letâs have a Modi governmentâ. As can be seen in the photo, it seems to have been sourced from a website called onlinehindinews.com. As per details mentioned in the news, a woman in labour had gone to Pinnahat Community Health Center in Agra late in the night where, due to negligence of hospital authorities and absence of night shift doctor, she was refused admission. When she protested, the nurse slapped her and threw her out of the hospital, forcing her to deliver on a roadside. After realizing the blunder they had made, the hospital authorities decided to brush the matter under the carpet by admitting the lady (post delivery) and discharging her the next day.

Body: Celebrated Urdu poet Rahat Indori hails from Indore, as his name suggests. Indori, who has over 3,43,000 followers on Twitter, tweeted a video of Congress President Rahul Gandhi yesterday. The 7-second video clip shows a garland thrown at Gandhi by a supporter in the crowd, landing perfectly around Gandhiâs neck. Sharing the video, Indori said what translates to, âThis is Indoreâs talentâ, suggesting that the incident happened in Indore. FAKE ALERT: Digitally-manipulated photo of ‘Statue of Unity’ being circulated on social media
Body: Days before the inauguration of Sardar Vallabhai Patel's Statue of Unity, the world's tallest statue, a digitally-manipulated image, with a homeless family -- a woman and two children -- cooking food, placed in front of the statue, is being circulated widely on social media platforms, possibly to amplify the news of tribal leaders calling for a boycott of the statue. Here is the fake photo:Many tribal organisations in different villages of Gujarat have passed resolutions saying since land belonging to tribal population was acquired for the construction of the statue of Sardar Patel, members of the tribal communities will not participate in any activity related to the Statue of Unity. Social media users, especially Twitter users, have been sharing this digitally-manipulated image of the Sardar Vallabhai Patel statue dubbed the Statue of Unity, the world's tallest statue, that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate tomorrow, October 31. The Statue of Unity is at Kevadia in Gujarat's Narmada district. Twitter users sharing the fake image seem to be trying to highlight the plight of the members of tribal communities who are protesting against the land acquisition made for the construction of the statue. More than 20 tribal organisations from different regions in Gujarat are protesting against the Statue of Unity. Some sharing this fake image are using #statueofdisplacement. Sample these -An article published on a website that goes by the name Bolta Hindustan titled "Tribals and farmers will protest against Statue of Unity which displaced them" also carried the same fake image.

Header: FAKE: Reports of Rakesh Asthana donating 20 crore to BJP from police fund are fake
Body: Over the last few days, several news websites and Twitter accounts said that CBI Special Director Rakesh Asthana had given away Rs 20 crore from the Police Welfare Fund to the BJP election fund when he was posted as Surat police commissioner, under the watch of then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi. The report was originally carried on October 26 by Divya Bhaskar, Gujarati sister concern of national media house Dainik Bhaskar Group. It was later replicated in Hindi on Dainik Bhaskar. Among other media houses who later made similar claims was also Ahmedabad Mirror, a Times Group publication, which published a report on October 27. It was later carried in Mumbai Mirror. The reports were later picked up by several prominent accounts, including the official handle of CPI(M) and that of the national convener of the Congress party. Shocking Criminal Nexus between corrupt extortionist Police Officer & Modi. Rakesh Asthana transferred Rs 20 croreâ¦ https://t.co/e6lbkgSUjk— CPI (M) (@cpimspeak) 1540626230000Yet another reason why PM Modi is backing Asthana - Asthana transfered Rs. 20 crore from Police Welfare Fund to BJPâ¦ https://t.co/NmEa2zxjOA— Ruchira Chaturvedi (@RuchiraC) 1540564672000It was also shared by independent Twitter users with significant following, which further made it go viral. Modiâs âBlue eyed boyâ in CBI Rakesh Asthana had given away Rs 20 crore from the Police Welfare Fund to the BJP eleâ¦ https://t.co/29KAuqsOXc— Ravi Nair (@t_d_h_nair) 154064175800

Header: FAKE: Video of MP couple beaten by kin being used to defame ‘Hindu Yuva Vahini’
Body: A video going viral on social media accuses âHindu Yuva Vahiniâ, an outfit floated by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath, of âhumiliating and thrashingâ a couple. In the video, a couple can be seen being punched and kicked by a group of men. Some of the attackers have their faces covered.   The video has been shared by many users, including some TV actors, on Twitter as well as Facebook. One of the Twitter users who posted the video claimed that the incident took place âsomewhere in UPâ. The user held Yogiâs âHindu Yuva thugsâ responsible for orchestrating the attack and said their âreign of terrorâ would get much worse if âtheyâ win in 2019. The tweet went viral and was later quoted by TV personalities like Maria Goretti and Shruti Seth who expressed disgust at what was âhappening in the name of religionâ in the country. Header: FAKE: Stephen Hawking’s photo shared saying former CJI Dipak Misra paralysed
FACT CHECK: Curious case of ‘top light’ on train involved in Amritsar tragedy
Body: Abhisar Sharmaâs claimed investigationJournalist Abhisar Sharma , in a video, claimed that one of the main reasons for the Amritsar train tragedy of October 19, where a speeding Jalandhar-Amritsar DMU train mowed down people standing on the railway track killing at least 59 people and injuring over 72, was a "non-functional top light" on the train. The said video that was published on Saturday, October 20, was taken down by the publication, but an article that carried the video is still intact. The article reads, âCould the tragic train accident in Amritsar that claimed nearly 60 lives have been averted if the first train to hit the passengers -- the Jalandhar-Amritsar DMU train -- had a top light?" A clarification was added three days later. It reads,âAbhisar clarifies: The design of the Jalandhar-Amritsar DMU shown in the video is not the latest model but this raises a bigger question that even if the model of this train does not have a top light, it does not augur well for the security of the people on the railway tracks. The DMU involved in the mishap was hauled by a loco that does not have a top light. It has a lookout glass and twin beam headlight below the lookout glass. The people on the track cannot see the train unless it has a top light from a distance.â Showing a video footage of a train he claimed to be that of the Jalandhar-Amritsar DMU train involved in the tragic accident, Sharma said that it was because of the "non-functional top light" that the driver was not able to see the people standing on the railway track, and in a tweet that now stands deleted, described the tragedy as a "shocking tale of negligence". Here's the video of the train Sharma claimed to be the train involved in the accident: Navjot Singh Sidhu claims the train had "non-functional top light"Congress minister from Punjab, Navjot Singh Sidhu, whose wife Navjot Kaur Sidhu was the chief guest at the event at Joda Phatak on October 19 evening, targeted the Indian Railways asking how a âclean-chitâ was given to the driver of the Jalandhar-Amritsar DMU train involved in the tragic accident in âone dayâ. "The train was running at a speed of more than 100 km per hour. Some people say the top light of the train was not working. If top light was not there, you cannot get it out of the yard. If top light was working then you can see three km because train had a glass (window) at the front for view," Sidhu said on Sunday. Railways said the loco-pilot had managed to slow down the train to around 68 kmph from the speed of 91 kmph, which he was assigned to reach.

Header: Fact Check: Has Germany banned meat at official government functions?
Body: Many Indian Twitter users are claiming that Germany has banned consumption of meat at all official government functions. The claims are being made using a screenshot from a website called âwww.riseofthevegan.comâ. Along with the screenshot, Twitter users are also taking a jibe at âsecularsâ and âliberalsâ. For instance, S Gurumurthy, part-time director of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) tweeted saying âThis must be an international conspiracy of RSS through Modiâ and implored liberals to target a âliberal Germanyâ now for the fundamental right of people there to have food of their choice. Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Amritsar-Jalandhar DMU train driver has not committed suicide
Body: Images and videos of a man hanging from a bridge are being circulated on social media to claim that the driver of the DMU train that was involved in the tragic accident in Amritsar has committed suicide. The claim has been made by several social media users, but the user who originally made the claim, has deleted his tweet. Along with the pictures from different angles of a man hanging, a letter narrating the sequence of events by the train driver -- who goes by the name of Arvind Kumar -- is also doing the rounds purportedly as his suicide note. Header: FAKE ALERT: Muslims offering 'Alvida-Namaz' did not hold up train
Body: "If trains could be stopped for Muslims offering namaz, why cannot trains be halted for 'Ravan Dahan' during Dussehra celebrations? "This is the question some people are asking on social media platforms in the context of the Amritsar train tragedy. In a clear attempt to disrupt communal harmony, these people are trying to mislead people into believing that trains are halted for Muslims who are offering namaz on railway tracks. To support this false claim, fake-news purveyors are using photos from 2017 that shows Muslims offering namaz on railway tracks near Delhi's Achchan Mian Masjid. Sample these-TRUTH

Header: FAKE: Rahul Gandhi’s misleading photo used to claim he performed namaz in temple
Body: A photograph of Congress President Rahul Gandhi is being widely circulated with a claim that he offered namaz inside a Temple. The photo was taken during Gandhiâs visit to Achaleshwar Mahadev Temple in Gwalior on Monday. Gandhi was there to offer prayers before kickstarting his roadshow in poll-bound Madhya Pradesh. In the photo that is going viral on social media with a false claim, Rahul can be seen sitting inside a temple with his hands partially overlapping each other, and forming a crescent shape in the process. âCongress sycophants trying to make horse out of a donkey, who doesnât even know how to pray in a temple,â read the post on a Facebook group called âWe support Narendra Modiâ. This post has been shared nearly three thousand times so far. The photo is also being shared on Twitter saying Gandhi prayed inside a Shiv Temple in Islamic style. The photograph showing Gandhi with folded hands, as he was performing namaz in a mandir in MP. The sequence of evenâ¦ https://t.co/s0JZNbBKNJ— TheGiniKhan (@giniromet) 153970368600

Header: FAKE: Misleading video of Ashok Gehlot circulating again on social media and WhatsApp
Body: A video of Congress leader Ashok Gehlot talking at an AICC press conference in May this year is being circulated a second time on social media platforms and instant messaging platform WhatsApp. âThey are building a dam through which they'll generate electricity. And when the current will be taken out of the water, the water will go to the farms. When there will be no current in the water, it will have no energy left and it will not be useful for irrigation,â former Rajasthan CM could be heard saying in the 16-second clip.   The video had gone viral in June the first time, few days after Gehlot made these âabsurdâ remarks. However, with Rajasthan elections approaching, the video is once again in circulation on WhatsApp.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Congress Twitter handles share 2009 photo to say PM Modi’s clean Ganga mission is failing
Body: The verified Twitter account of the Congress Party, on October 12, made two tweets about Prime Minister Narendra Modiâs âClean Ganga Missionâ and said that Modi "focused on lip service rather than getting anything done on cleaning the Ganga". Congress said that the NDA government has an "atrocious" completion rate when it comes to the projects under Clean Ganga Mission. Hereâs a close translation of what the Congress Party said In another tweet in Hindi: âSince the time he became the prime minister, Mother Gangaâs self-proclaimed son turned away from his promises of cleaning the Ganga.â On October 11, the verified Twitter handle of the Delhi Youth Congress tweeted what the Congress Party handle had. The one thing thatâs common in these tweets made by different verified handles of the Congress Party is the usage of the same old photo to support the claim.

FAKE: Top US industrialist’s praise for PM Modi altered to claim he is not good for India’s growth
Body: Headline of a three-month-old news report has been doctored to target PM Narendra Modi. A fake quote attributed to top US industrialist and former chairman of CISCO Systems John Chambers is being circulated a lot. The quote reads, âIndia's "impressive development" will cease to exist if Modi gets a second term as countryâs leader after next yearâs parliamentary election.â The tampered news report was shared by the serial fake page âWe support Ravish Kumarâ on Facebook.   At the time of filing this report, this post had received more than five thousand shares over four thousand likes.

Header: FAKE: Kamal Nath uses image from Bangladesh to malign Shivraj Chauhan
Body: A two-year-old image from Bangladesh was shared by the official Twitter handle of Office of Congress MP Kamal Nath with a misleading claim to take a dig at Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan. The photograph shows a man rolling up a just laid-out road like a carpet as others around him seem baffled. Calling the Bharatiya Janata Party a ârecord-breaking corrupt partyâ, Nath tweeted the picture with a jibe aimed at Chauhan. The text in Nathâs tweet loosely translates to âUnder Mamajiâs rule, corruption in state road construction is on the rise. Header: FAKE: BJP MP wrongly accused of making anti-UP/Bihar remark via fake newspaper clipping
Body: A Hindi newspaper clipping going viral on social media is attributing a controversial remark against people from Uttar Pradesh (UP) and Bihar to BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri. A loose translation of the text from the clipping quotes Bidhuri, who is also an MP from Tughlaqabad in Delhi, as saying "There is only one cure of people from UP and Bihar. Make them do all the work and then send them back to their state by thrashing them." The clipping is being shared by many prominent handles, including that of Rashtriya Janta Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav and Bihar's Madhepura MP Pappu Yadav. Sharing the clipping, Pappu threatened to give such a "treatment" to Bidhuri with the help from UP/Bihar, that the BJP MP is "unable to show his face in the parliament".
