Header: FAKE ALERT: No, Tej Pratap Yadav was not awarded doctorate from 'Takshsila University'
Body: A Facebook page by the name âNarendra Modi - True Indianâ made a post yesterday claiming Tej Pratap Yadav, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad Yadavâs elder son and former health minister of Bihar, received a doctorate from âTakshsila Universityâ. The image that is being widely shared is the screenshot of a Facebook post made by user Shailendra Das on July 5, 2017. The post reads, "I am extremely happy and delighted to inform you that Mr Tej Prasad Yadav (10 fail), son of Lalu Prasad Yadav, received the doctorate degree from Takshsila University, Bihar. It is a matter of great pride for all Indians. Congrats to Dr Tej Prasad Yadav. It happens only in India. Jai Ho." This post has been shared over 2,200 times and over than 1,500 people reacted to it. The same image has been shared by many Twitter users as well. Sample these - This year, on July 5, Das shared the 'Facebook memory' of making this post saying, "Jai Laloo, jai Bihar".

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo from 2013 Congress rally shared saying 25 lakh people attended Rahul Gandhi's Bikaner rally
Body: A photo taken during a 2013 rally organised by the Congress Party and addressed by then Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh hooda is not being widely shared with a claim that 25 lakh people attended Rahul Gandhi's recent rally in Rajasthan's Bikaner. Many Facebook pages that promote Congress agenda have been using the old image with fake claims. For instance, a Facebook page that goes by the name of 'Rahul Gandhi for PM' shared the image from Hooda's rally in 2013 with a caption saying what translates to, "Indira (Gandhi)'s grandson has broken Indira's record" and the photo has text claiming 25 lakh people attended Rahul Gandhi's rally in Bikaner rally, which is five lakh people more than what Indira Gandhi managed to mobilise. This post has, by now, been shared by over 16,600 Facebook users and nearly 10,000 people reacted to it.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Fake newspaper clippings used to accuse Modi and Kejriwal of rape
Body: In two separate newspaper clippings that are being widely circulated on WhatsApp and social media platforms, it is being wrongly claimed that PM Narendra Modi and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal committed rape many years ago. While the one that accuses Kejriwal of rape has been made to look like it is from âThe Telegraphâ, the clipping that accuses PM Modi is from an unknown publication named âThe Indianâ.  The headline in âThe Telegraphâ clipping dated Monday, June 8, 1987 reads âIIT student accused of rapeâ. The report talks about a âshockingâ rape of a local girl by a 19-year-old IIT Kharagpur student named Arvind Kejriwal. @SharmaKhemchand @ArvindKejriwal @narendramodi @Ramlal @AmitShah @YadavAnkes @Kumarashish__ @Akshaysinghelâ¦ https://t.co/vbEC1t8NUE— Thakur Jitesh Singh (@jiteshsingh99) 1538675120000It then states that a case was registered against Kejriwal in Gopalnagar police station, following which he was found hiding in his hostel room and detained by the police. The report uses Times of Indiaâs name to attribute a quote to then hostel warden. The headline of âThe Indianâ report dated Sunday, September 30, 1990 read âRape complaint on rathâ¦â. The report states that on Sunday, September 27, 1990, during an ongoing Ram Rath Yatra in Vadodara, a female cleaner was raped by organizer -- Narendra Modi -- inside a local BJP office. It further mentions that Modi was called for questioning by the police after the woman in question (along with her husband) lodged a police complaint against him.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Video of Kolkata’s Ranaghat station used to claim migrants workers are fleeing Gujarat in fear
Body: Migrants from Uttar Pradesh and Bihar are fleeing Gujarat after reports of attacks on migrant workers in at least six districts in the state. Migrants were attacked after the news of a labourer from Bihar being arrested for raping a 14-month-old girl spread. As Congress Party, and the Bharatiya Janata Party that is in power in Gujarat, are engaged in blame game for the attacks on migrants, fake-news purveyors are ensuring that a video -- that shows hundreds of people struggling to get into a train -- is perceived as that of migrants desperately trying to flee Gujarat. The said video is being shared widely on social media platforms, mostly with a caption that closely translates to - "Due to repeated attacks on migrants from Uttar Pradesh and Bihar in Gujarat, 8,000 migrants fleeing the state is a matter of concern." See the video, see how tensed these people are.â This caption written in Hindi doesn't out-rightly say migrants are fleeing from Gujrat but implies it. These videos, posted on October 7 and October 8, have gotten over 25,000 shares and have been viewed more than 3,00,000 times in total.

Header: Facebook page ‘Yogi Sarkar’ is a factory of fake news
FAKE ALERT: Video of Kerala's Ponnani beach shared widely as that of Rama Setu bridge
Body: A video showing many people walking on a strip of land formed near a beach, with sea on both sides of the strip, is being shared widely with a claim that it is of Rama Setu, the bridge mentioned in the epic Ramayana and which is believed to be built for Lord Rama to reach Ravanaâs Lanka. Ravi Ranjan, âConsultant, Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of Indiaâ, as per his Twitter bio, tweeted the video saying, âSee people standing on Rama Setu in the middle of the seaâ, and thanked BJP MP Subramanian Swamy for moving Supreme Court to declare Rama Setu as a ânational heritage siteâ. Here is Ranjanâs tweet that has, by now, been retweeted over 1,600 times and liked by over 3,000 Twitter users - The video has gotten over 33,000 views till now. Replying to his own tweet, Ranjan said that he got the video on WhatsApp. The same video has been shared by many other Twitter users with the same false claim. Sri Ram Built this wonder ! https://t.co/TCFBPuh53P— Knowledge Is Power (@Subrat_G) 1538488825000The video is being shared on Facebook as well, with the same claim.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Don’t fall for WhatsApp video saying ‘Jatayu’ bird was spotted in Karnataka
Body: A video showing the worldâs biggest flying bird -- Andean Condor -- taking off from a mountain, with many people witnessing the scene, making videos and taking photos, is being widely shared on WhatsApp along with a message claiming that the video is of âJatayuâ mentioned in the epic Ramayana and that the video is from Karnataka. Itâs quite obvious that those who are sharing the video do not mean to say that âJatayuâ from Ramayana was spotted but that a big vulture was found in Karnataka. That the video is from Karnataka is a false claim.

Header: FAKE: Digvijaya Singh calls Yogi Adityanath ‘shameless’ based on image of inoperative ambulances from Andhra Pradesh
Body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh tweeted a photo showing several unused ambulances to target Uttar Pradesh (UP) chief minister Yogi Adityanath. In a tweet bemoaning condition of healthcare in UP, Singh claimed that many 108 and 102 ambulances that were instituted by former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav are now languishing in a dumping ground in the state but to do so, Singh used a photo from Andhra Pradesh (AP) as that from UP. Singh held Adityanath responsible for not making use of those ambulances. Calling the scenario âshamefulâ, Singh said that people are being forced to use handcarts to carry their ill relatives to hospital. à¤¯à¥ à¤à¤¤à¥à¤¤à¤° à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤¶ à¤à¥ à¤¹à¤¾à¤²à¤¤ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤¦à¥ à¤¯à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¨à¥, à¤à¤à¤¿à¤²à¥à¤¶ à¤¯à¤¾à¤¦à¤µ à¤à¥ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤²à¤µà¤¾à¤ à¤à¤ 108,102 à¤à¤®à¥à¤¬à¥à¤²à¥à¤à¤¸ à¤à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤à¤à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥â¦ https://t.co/h2Fvbf7ZbN— digvijaya singh (@digvijaya_28) 1538527387000Singhâs tweet received 245 rewteets and 677 likes at the time of writing this story. Besides Singh, many other social media users shared the same image using similar claims. #pakke_samajwadi à¤¯à¥ à¤®à¥à¤°à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¦à¥à¤¶ à¤à¥ à¤¹à¤¾à¤²à¤¤ à¤à¥à¤¯à¤¾ à¤à¤° à¤¦à¥ à¤¯à¥à¤à¥ à¤à¥ 108 à¤à¤®à¥à¤¬à¥à¤²à¥à¤à¤¸ à¤à¤¡à¤¼à¥ à¤à¤à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥ #badhalupâ¦ https://t.co/EpO0XFRZGc— @iamzuhaib (@Zuhaib03684756) 1538502179000One such user went on to claim that Yogi-led UP government was âsnatching the rights of poor peopleâ in the state by refusing to use services started by the previous Samajwadi Party government. à¤¯à¥à¤ªà¥ à¤®à¥à¤ à¤à¥ 108 à¤¨à¤®à¥à¤¬à¤° à¤à¤®à¥à¤¬à¥à¤²à¥à¤à¤¸ à¤à¥ à¤®à¤°à¥à¤à¤¼à¥à¤ à¤¤à¤ à¤ªà¤¹à¥à¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤¹à¤¿à¤ à¤µà¥ à¤à¤à¤ à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¹à¥à¤, à¤à¤°à¥à¤¬à¥ à¤à¥ à¤¹à¤° à¤¯à¥à¤à¤¨à¤¾ à¤à¥ à¤à¤à¤ à¤²à¤à¤¾ à¤°à¤¹à¥ à¤¯à¥ à¤¸â¦ https://t.co/jV8yqqpxHr— Aakash kumar (@OfficialAaKu) 1538480660000Serial faker âI am with Ravish Kumarâ also posted it on Facebook.

FAKE: Pak journalist Hamid Mir's tweet with video showing man being tortured has nothing to do with Indian Army
Body: Senior Pakistani journalist and anchor Hamid Mir, on September 21, tweeted a video that showed a man being mercilessly thrashed by a few men who look like soldiers. Mir suggested that the video is of the Indian Army torturing a Kashmiri youngster. This is a fake claim. In his tweet, Mir said, âLook at this torture in Kashmir and see who is making this torture? One can understand that why India is not ready for talks with Pakistan? Yes Pakistan will definitely ask about this torture (sic)â. The video Mir tweeted has âKashmir Newsâ written on it. It shows a man, made to lie on his stomach with both his legs tied to the cot and face covered, being brutally thrashed on his buttocks by a few men, using what looks like spades. The head of the man being thrashed could be seen held down by another man wearing a uniform. Two men continuously beat the man, and others question him. The man screaming in pain could be hear, and he requests the men to let him go, and tells them he doesnât have any clue about what they are asking. You can watch the video here:DISCLAIMER: VIOLENT VIDEO. VIEWERâS DISCRETION ADVISEDLook at this torture in Kashmir and see who is making this torture?One can understand that why India is not ready fâ¦ https://t.co/26t2CFsQOI— Hamid Mir (@HamidMirPAK) 1537538678000Mirâs tweet suggests that the Indian government is not ready to hold peace talks with Pakistan since the latter will bring up this video and demand an explanation for such torture. The video Mir tweeted has, by now, been viewed over 2,38,000 times. It has been retweeted by nearly 10,000 Twitter users and âlikeâd by over 13,000. Mirâs tweet also has over 3,100 replies to it.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Tajinder Bagga did not wear T-shirt calling PM Modi a ‘thief’
Body: Former Congress MLA Akhilesh Pratap Singh tweeted a photo of BJP Delhi Spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga wearing a T-shirt that says Prime Minister Narendra Modi is a âthiefâ. In the tweet Singh made on September 23, he said what closely translates to, âEven BJP supporters have started calling âmiddlemanâ Narendra Modi a âthiefâ. The nation is saying the same. Maybe thatâs why BJP supporters also started saying the same. Donât know if they are saying it from the heart or under compulsion.â Here is the tweet Akhilesh Singh made -The tweet has gotten over 1,200 retweets and more than 4,000 likes. Former JNUSU Vice-President Shehla Rashid tweeted the same photo on September 22. Her tweet has, by now, gotten over 3,100 retweets and over 10,000 likes.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Beware of serial fake news peddler ‘Fekunama’ on Facebook
FAKE: Claim that traffic regulation for Manoj Tiwari killed boy in ambulance
Body: A video going viral on social media platforms and WhatsApp claims that the Delhi Police restricted traffic for VIP movement -- for easy passage of BJP MP Manoj Tiwari -- thereby delaying an ambulance carrying a bleeding kid. The claim, that is being shared along with a video, is also that the kid died since the police did not let the ambulance pass. Hereâs the message that is being shared widely on WhatsApp - Here's a close translation of the message above - "Delhi Police stopped an ambulance for BJP MP Manoj Tiwari. There was a child fighting death inside the ambulance. In the end, the child succumbed." The video shows an ambulance stopped by the barricades put up by Delhi Police, people arguing with police men, asking them to let the ambulance pass, and the driver asking who would be held responsible if something happens to the kid because of the delay. The same video is being shared on Facebook and Twitter since last week. Sample these - VERIFICATION AND METHODOLOGYAfter snipping a still from the video that is going viral, Times Fact Check searched the image on Google. In the results, we found a news report from 2017 that had the same video. We then searched on Google using keywords âambulance stop delhi police 2017â and got a report TOI carried last year about the same incident.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Modicare becomes target of fake news peddlers
Body: A message that is going viral on social media these days is spreading misinformation about the world's largest government-funded healthcare programme - Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana. For the uninitiated, this programme is the flagship National Health Protection Scheme of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and is referred to as Modicare. It was launched by PM Modi on August 15 this year and is set to officially roll out from September 25. The fraudulent post about Modicare claims that people will have to pay Rs 1,324 annually in registration charges to avail the benefits of this scheme. VIRALITYThe fake piece of information is being circulated on social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter, and instant messaging applications like WhatsApp. Take a look at these tweets: Ayushmann Bharat August 15, 2018 * 5 lakh rupees of government and private hospitals can be treated free of chargeâ¦ https://t.co/FAfaU0fh5R— à®à®¿.à®ªà®¿.à®à¯à®¨à¯à®¤à®¿à®²à¯à®à¯à®®à®¾à®°à¯ (@senthilcp) 1537343468000Scheme name: Ayushmann Bharat Start Date: August 15, 2018 Benefits: 5 lakh rupees of government and private hospitaâ¦ https://t.co/aZ4JupmvnM— True Hindusthani (@ani30oct) 153733650600

Header: FAKE ALERT: Quote on Kashmir attributed to Arvind Kejriwal is fake news from 2016
FAKE: Doctored image of Vasundhara Raje claiming she was high on alcohol being circulated
Body: A photo of Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje sitting on the floor, with her eyes appearing partially closed, is being shared on social media platforms with a claim that the photo was clicked when she was under the influence of alcohol. Among those making this claim is a man named Jitu Mal Gurjar, who, according to his Facebook bio, is a Congress Party worker from Jaipur. Gurjar, in a Facebook post made on September 17, shared the photo of CM Raje with the claim that the chief minister got drunk while resting after the recently concluded Rajasthan Gaurav Yatra event, and said that the photo was clicked inside a hotel in Rajasthanâs Churu district. Here is a screenshot of the Facebook post made by Gurjar - Here is a close translation of what is written in the post - âVasundhara Raje in Churuâs Hotel Shakti during the Rajasthan Gaurav Yatra, high on alcohol while resting.â The same post was made by another Facebook user, whose Facebook handle goes by the name 'Bajranglal Karwasara', on September 16. The same image made its way to Twitter, but with a different claim. Twitter user @khandecor shared Raje's photo saying, "4,500 government bus drivers are on strike in Rajasthan, but Vasundhara Raje doesn't get free from rallies. In the morning, she attends rallies, at night, she could be seen in Churu's Shaktiman hotel, drunk." Twitter user @khandecor was also found sharing fake quotes attributed to Rahul Gandhi. The same photo was tweeted by another Twitter user, @ramanswall, but not with the same claim. He wonders why Meenakshi Lekhi, BJP spokesperson, and Vasundhara Raje are batting for a 'Hindu rashtra' when they can't even write in Hindi well. This Twitter user has Rahul Gandhi in his Twitter display picture. Gurjarâs post received over 550 likes and more than 350 shares. Karwasara's post got over 450 likes. The tweets with this photo of Raje did not get considerable traction.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Muslim woman, youngsters did not thrash cop for issuing challan, UP Police confirm
Body: A video that shows a policeman in uniform being thrashed by a group of people, including a woman, is being shared with a claim that the cop was beaten up for issuing a challan. The same claim is being copy-pasted by many social media users, and the video is being shared with this, both on Facebook and Twitter. Sample these - Here's a close translation of what is written in the above tweet - "Bareilly Civil Lines news: A group of Muslims thrashed a policeman was issuing them a challan. This a challenge to law-and-order. This video shows what can happen in India in the future, who will be ruling the country and what will be the future of the citizens. Bitter truth is that India has more threats from within than external ones." Watch the video here:à¤¬à¤°à¥à¤²à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤¦à¥à¤µà¤¾à¤°à¤¾ à¤à¤¾à¤²à¤¾à¤¨ à¤à¤¾à¤à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¤° à¤®à¥à¤¸à¥à¤²à¤¿à¤® à¤¸à¤®à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥ à¤²à¥à¤à¥à¤ à¤¨à¥ à¤ªà¥à¤²à¤¿à¤¸ à¤ªà¤¿à¤à¤¾à¤ à¤à¥à¥¤à¤à¥ à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¤¨, à¤ªà¥à¤°à¤¶à¤¾à¤¸à¤¨ à¤à¤° à¤à¤¾à¤¨à¥à¤¨ à¤à¥ à¤¸à¥à¤§à¥ à¤à¥à¤¨à¥à¤¤à¥â¦ https://t.co/2fKfoIlpbn— Tyagraj shekhawat (@TyagrajShekhawt) 1536935936000The same video is being shared by many Facebook users as well. VIRALITYThe video tweeted by @tyagrajshekhawt, who has nearly 44,000 followers on Twitter, was viewed over 1,800 times and was retweeted by 234 Twitter users. The same video tweeted with the same claim by @ruchiqueen008 was viewed more than 6,800 views and was retweeted more than 940 times. On Facebook, the same video tweeted by a user who goes by the name Mahendra Raj Singh last Tuesday garnered over 61,000 views. The video has been doing rounds on social media platforms with this fake claim for some time now.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Hoarding put up by Congress to show Rahul Gandhi’s ‘Shiv Bhakti’ is digitally manipulated
Body: Billboards and cutouts of Congress President Rahul Gandhi were put up in Madhya Pradesh ahead of his roadshow in Bhopal last Sunday, greeting Rahul as a âShiv Bhaktâ or a devotee of Lord Shiva. Take a look at the billboards put up by the Congress Party. These images were tweeted by news agency ANI. Madhya Pradesh: Posters and cutouts of Congress President Rahul Gandhi and other party leaders seen in Bhopal aheadâ¦ https://t.co/x4K7BLqpsu— ANI (@ANI) 1537156416000One of the pictures used in the posters that shows Gandhi performing Shivling puja has been found to be fake.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Surveys declaring PM Modi, Congress corrupt are fake
Body: Mohandas Pai, Manipal Global Education chairman, tweeted an article this morning, published on BBC News Hub, that listed Indian National Congress as one of the 10 most corrupt political parties in the world. Tweeting the article, Pai said, âShocking list! One Indian political part (sic) includedâ. The headline of the article Pai shared reads - âTop 10 List of Most Corrupt Political Party in the World 2018â.Paiâs tweet has gotten more than 600 retweets and 800 likes till now. Many people, like Pai himself, fell for the URL and name of the website -- âbbcnewshub.comâ and BBC News Hub respectively -- and seem to have mistaken the report as one published on the website of the British Broadcasting Corporation, based on a survey done by BBC.

Header: FACT CHECK: Did Modi forbid Muslim women from his event at Saifee mosque?
Body: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared pictures from his address at Saifee Mosque in Indore on the occasion of Ashara Mubaraka, he was targeted by some Twitter users for âignoringâ women. Journalist Saba Naqvi was one of the first ones to react to PM Modiâs tweet and complain about the absence of female faces in a gathering full of âall maleâ Dawoodi Bohra sect of Muslims. Respectfully Sir, i do not see a single woman there and wonder what this all male gathering can do for the uplift oâ¦ https://t.co/q1t7XrhyCS— Saba Naqvi (@_sabanaqvi) 1536928370000Sabaâs tweet got more than 650 retweets (and counting) and 2,500 likes. Some other Twitter users followed suit, and accused Modi of âhating womenâ and treating the fairer sex like âpuppetsâ. Perhaps Modi hates presence of women in gatherings he addresses? FAKE ALERT: No, MS Dhoni did not join Bharat bandh in protest against rising petrol prices
Body: A few photos of former Indian cricket-team captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni sitting at a petrol filling station are being circulated on social media platforms with a claim that he joined the Bharat bandh organised yesterday in protest against rising petrol prices. One such tweet spreading this false claim also attributed a fake quote to Dhoni. The tweet quotes Dhoni as saying, âI stopped playing the helicopter shot because I couldnât afford petrol at Rs 90/litreâ. Sample this - Here are a few other tweets spreading similar claims - Similar posts are being made on Facebook as well. Arun Thakur, who has âSocial media HPCCâ written in his bio, tweeted three photos of MS Dhoni sitting at the petrol filling station with the fake quote mentioned above attributed to Dhoni, in Hindi. He deleted the tweet later. Priyanka Chaturvedi, National Spokesperon of Congress, had retweeted this tweet from Thakur. Now that Thakur has deleted the tweet, the retweet has vanished from Chaturvedi's Twitter field as well. Twitter user @inavaneet tweeted about this - Fake pic shared by official spokesperson of @INCIndia party Ms @priyankac19 on #BharatBandh . https://t.co/uAnoX9LXsJ— Navneet Sharma ð®ð³ (@Inavaneet) 153656953200

Header: FAKE: Old video shared on WhatsApp warning people in Kerala about tiger on the loose
FAKE: Video of criminals beaten by police used with claim that RSS thrashed Dalits
Body: A Facebook page named Bhim Sena shared a video last week claiming it to be of âRSS beating Dalits in Tamil Naduâ. The page claimed that two Dalit men were assaulted by âRSS goonsâ in Tamil Nadu as police haplessly stood witness. The only âfaultâ of the Dalit youths was that they âraised âJai Bhimâ slogans to a hotel ownerâ. The 20-second-long video clip shows a man thrashing two men, both of them tied with ropes, with a lathi. The âassailantâ is surrounded by some men in civilian attire and some policemen. DISCLAIMER: VIOLENT CONTENT. VIEWERâS DISCRETION ADVISED  VIRALITYThe video has received over a lakh views and more than five thousand shares. It was shared by another page called Jai Bhim Sena. It was also shared by Facebook user Dilawar Shaikh, who has a huge follower count.

Header: FAKE: NSUI leader shares 2016 photo claiming to be from Bharat bandh against fuel price hike
Body: Prasenjit Das, NSUI vice president of Tripura and a journalist as per his Twitter bio, made a tweet that suggested that people of northeast India are participating in the Bharat bandh called by the opposition parties and are indulging in violence. Das tweeted a photo that showed a bus set on fire saying, âBharat bandh: INC India holds protest in North Eastâs India (sic) against fuel price hike,â along with #mondaymotivation. #BharathBandh: @INCIndia holds protest in #NorthEast's India against fuel price hike #FuelPriceHikeâ¦ https://t.co/HLAULQouJd— Prasenjit Das (@PrasenjitDas_) 153654368200

FACT CHECK: No, Rahul Gandhi is NOT sharing images from internet as that from his Kailash Mansarovar Yatra
FACT CHECK: Did Aurangzeb defeat China and snatch Kailash Mansarovar from them as a gift to Hindus?
Body: Fake news reports circulating on the Internet and social media claim that Aurangzeb, the sixth Mughal emperor of India, once fought a war with China, defeated it and took control of Hindu pilgrimage Kailash Mansarovar from the Chinese as a gift to Hindus of India. The fraudulent claims have been made by news websites like â nationalspeak.inâ, â theworldnewshindi.comâ etc. The dissemination of the bogus claim coincides with Congress President Rahul Gandhiâs pilgrimage tour to Mansarovar. As per the claims made by writer Mohammad Zahid in one of the news reports, in the year 1680, Aurangzeb wrote a letter to Qing dynasty ruler in China, asking him to hand over the territory of Kailash Mansarovar to then India as it was a matter of religious faith for Hindus.  When Aurangazeb did not get a response even after 45 days from sending the letter, Aurangzeb, the âsecularâ Mughal king invaded China, did a âsurgical strikeâ on them and captured Kailash Mansarovar in just one-and-a-half days. VIRALITYThe fake reports were picked by a number of Twitter and WhatsApp users who made it viral. Kailash Mansarovar won for Hindus by Aurangzeb https://t.co/YDf1vJy5Hb— Rajesh Sinha (@rajeshsinha2009) 1536006119000Kailash Mansarovar was occupoed by Chinese, fought back and restored in India by none other than Aurangzeb to helpâ¦ https://t.co/B0Vfu8CAmE— Adv. Faraz Ø§Ø´Ø±Ù (@wowkeel) 153571531200

Header: Prashant Bhushan's tweet on 'ABVP goons' attacking Gujarat professor is misleading
Body: AND CLAIMEEActivist and senior advocate Prashant Bhushan tweeted a news article yesterday about members of the Akhil Bhartiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) attacking a professor in Gujarat's Kutch University. In the tweet, Bhushan said, "ABVP goons blacken the face of a professor in Gujarat and parade him! This is their way of celebrating teachers day!" Today is September 5, celebrated as Teachers' Day, and such a tweet will mislead people into believing that the incident happened a day before Teachers' Day is celebrated. #ABVPgoons hashtag is being used by many social media users to highlight the instances when members of ABVP, the student-wing affiliated to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), have been violent and disruptive and have been sharing news articles, but without suggesting that the incident happened a day before Teachers' Day. For instance - Twitter user @batriankur, who is the State Social Media Coordinator for NSUI as per his bio, has been sharing other instances when ABVP members have attacked teachers, but again without any mention of when the incident happened. For instance, the incident about which the below user has tweeted is from July 19. Again ABVP preferred beating up the teachers and moral policing,This is ABVP extent of hooliganism in Gorakhpur (U.â¦ https://t.co/bUGj0khe8B— Ankur Batri (@BatriAnkur) 1536076686000Here's another tweet from him about ABVP members attacking a Delhi University professor. This incident is when professor Prasanta Chakravarty was assaulted by the members of ABVP in 2017. ABVP attacks professor of Delhi University for speaking against modi. #ABVPGoons https://t.co/inoBury8kc— Ankur Batri (@BatriAnkur) 1536076581000Such tweets are also misleading. VIRALITYBhushan's tweet has been, by now, retweeted nearly 1,500 times and liked by over 2,400 users.

Header: FAKE ALERT: Photo of tribal girl paraded naked in Assam being used to malign Congress in Bengal
Body: AND CLAIMEEThe location of the incident has been changed to Bengal and the images are being reshared with a caption that reads, âIn Bengal, a Hindu girl was stripped, chased and beaten by Congress party workers just because she raised slogans in favour of the BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a Congress rally. Her only fault was that she said âModi Zindabadâ. Let us share these pictures and expose the true face of Congress to the world.â The fake post was shared by an account named âHindu Akhilesh Guptaâ.   VIRALITYThe fake post spread like wildfire and has been shared over 15 thousand times at the time of filing this report. It also found its way into WhatsApp forwards. TRUTH

Fake Alert: Man caught on camera inside 'temple' in intimate position with woman not a BJP leader
Body: AND CLAIMEEScreenshots and images from a two-year-old CCTV footage from Bihar are being circulated on social media and fake news websites to target the Bhartiya Janta Party (BJP) ahead of Rajasthan assembly elections this year. In the video, a couple can be seen getting intimate with each other in an open compound. Serial fake news websites viralinindia.net and newsfyi.in are claiming that the footage was recently taken from a temple in Barmer district of Rajasthan, wherein a male BJP youth-wing leader was caught indulging in âindecentâ acts with a young female ABVP leader. Fakesters accused the BJP, the RSS and âHindutvaâ leaders of propagating obscenity inside Hindu places of worship. Fake news creators also claimed that the man and woman seen in the video were arrested by the Rajasthan Police after the temple authorities registered a complaint. The article also said that on being questioned by police, the young leaders panicked and lied that they were siblings. Cleverly enough, none of the fakesters named the leaders involved.
